Name: Jan Seva Samiti
Major_Activities1: As the organization was registered in 1997—1998, but has been cariong out his activities for the last several years in the rural and urban areas of district lucknow, deoria, basti, sant kabir nagar & sitapur. This society was established with a basic in to provide social services two all communities, particularly to the weaker section of women youth and children, so they may become self dependent and stand on their own feet to earn their livelihood. The main aim of the society is two provide technical and vocational training to the women / girls. These activities includes training courses of tailoring, embroidery, knitting fashion designing, secretarial practice computer training courses etc. for women, girls and youth of the poor class, backward and S.C /S.T. in addition to it, society is also organized various awareness camps on pollution, envoirment protection, family planning, aids protection and EDV camps etc. Thus the main objective of the society are welfare of human being, educational & socio economic development of water sections youth ( boys & girls ). Aims & objectives of the society have been details in memorandum of association, which is attached here with it is a full pledged unit & is running its own activities of welfare & development with the help of peoples participation & contribution / donation. The society collaborates with state & centre on area of common concern, while supporting infrastructure development, skill development for self employment, income generating program for women & youth, ( boys & girls ) creating of awareness for national programmes & other development activities. The society is running an awareness programme in the block – khairabad of the district sitapur also the society is trying to run a rural development programme for the people of district sitapur with the financial help of ministry of rural development,govt. of india in which the society will provide safe drinking water in all villages of block khairabad, behta, sidhauli, Rampur—mathura. More over the society is willing to provide employment based training to the women / girls of this area, so they may become self – dependent. Over the years the society has been very active in the fields of : a) Rural development with the help of various govt. agencies. b) Women welfare & empowerment activities. c) Rehabilitation of flood affected families. d) Handicapped welfare activities. e) Social forestry. f) Social rehabilitation of S.C. / O.B.C’s g) Stray animal welfare programs. h) Social welfare & awareness for S.C. / S.T. / O.B.C.’s i) Rural sanitation programme. j) Water conservation & management programme. k) Safe & clean drinking water. l) Farmer training programmes. m) Health programmes. the society has been well appreciated and recognized by the public and authorities. The following projects have been executed by the society on its own: 1) Educational programme. 2) Litrecy campaign. 3) Health check up camps. 4) Sanitation campaign. 5) Rehabilitation campaign

Name: MYRADA   Mysore Resettlement and Development Agency
Major_Activities1: 1 LIVELIHOOD Over years of working with the poor in rural communities Myrada has realized that the group approach is more sustainable and relevant for the poor women The affinity within the group members fosters a sense of trust and unified power that endorses any investment in a livelihood strategy for them and their families Therefore building local institutions has become the backbone of most interventions in Myrada and its promoted institutions MPIs in improving livelihoods of the poor and marginalized Broadly 3 category of institutions promoted by Myrada 1 Participatory institutions of the poor at the base 2 Middle level representative People Institutions 3 Technical and supportive institutions for category 1 and 2 2 NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT Today Myrada has covered over 1996166 ha in all its project area Myrada assisting Govt sponsored project like IWDP NWDPRA NABARD DPAP program etc 3 HEALTH Myrada has always been involved in some way or the other in the health sector through creating awareness organising and conducting health camp it took up health a big way with the Avahan HIV AIDS prevention programme from 2003 onwards Since then this sector has expanded to cover issues such as anemia prevention nutrition security primary health care and environmental sanitation Currently its work in the health sector has identified the need to include work with disabilities and push through for environmental sanitation and cost effective hand washing facilities in rural area 4 EDUCATION In the past Myrada had large programs focused on improving infrastructure in Primary School education and supporting the SSA program to strengthen the management functions of teachers in Karnataka Myrada KVK has actively promoted vocational education through its CMRC 5 CAPACITY BUILDING Training, Capacity Building and networking has been a critical part of Myrada approach to improve its interventions and to spread its proven strategies to other parts of the country and abroad without having to plant its flag in these areas Myrada does not directly do any training this is done by 10 independent well equipped Centres for Institutional Development and Organisation Reform and Research CIDORRs located in the project area

Name: Institute for Resource Management and Economic Development
Major_Activities1: Conducting research has been the most important activity of the Institute. It has completed over 70 study projects, the details of which are available on its website. Most of the research projects undertaken have been sponsored by different ministries of Government of India or international agencies. These generally have dealt with national and state policies oriented issues related to management and development of water resources, rural development and poverty alleviation, environmental preservation, disaster management, gender studies and socio-economic development. A majority of the studies have involved conduct of large scale socio-economic field surveys resulting in collection of primary data. Such surveys have been conducted in almost all parts of India. The studies have also enabled the Institute to gain considerable experience of interaction with government machinery at the central, state, district levels and below. The findings and suggestions of these studies are available in the reports submitted to the respective sponsoring agencies. Conducting training programmes for senior government officers has been another activity of the Institute. Several such programmes including those for senior IAS officers have been conducted. Details provided on the Institute’s website. These were one or two weeks programmes dealing mostly with optimum utilization of resources veering around economic and environmental analysis of major development projects. Most of the training programmes have been sponsored by the respective ministries of Government of India. The institute has played an active part in organizing international, national as well as state level seminars and conferences on important policy related issues (Details on its website). The most notable among these has been the International Conference on Sustainable Development of Water Resources, in 2000. These have been organized in Delhi as well as in other parts of the country and have generally been sponsored by different ministries of Government of India, State Governments, International and other agencies. These seminars and conferences have been well attended with the right mix of participation from government, academic institutions and NGOs depending upon the context and have come forward with very useful recommendations. Institution building has also been an important activity specially in the earlier years. The Institute established a spacious office complex of its own with all the requisite facilities such as office and staff rooms, computer rooms, library, seminar hall, computers, LCD projector etc. located in a well connected institutional area and surrounded by a host of public institutions. Allotment of land for the same was got approved by Delhi Development Authority while, the Ministry of Finance, Government of India, agreed to our request to provide a major grant for construction of the office complex. The Institute also succeeded in getting 80G sanctioned by the Income Tax Authorities. The Institute established a rich library which can be used by outside scholars, professionals and students also. Since 2002,the Institute has also set up a study centre for BCA students within its office complex sponsored by Indira Gandhi National Open University (IGNOU). This centre is equipped with 30 desktop computers and other facilities.

Name: gyanodaya information and education society
Major_Activities1: for establishing WOMEN EMPOWERMENT CENTRE to be set up with the help of local government administration to facilitate Un-employed & Un-skilled girl child to generate income and employment & become self- dependent through the SKILL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME and make an individual village as a digital village The need for giving emphasis on the Skill Development, especially for the less educated, poor and out of school girl child has been highlighted by Gyanodaya team because we felt that Earlier it was happen that only one person in a home (ie MUKHIYA) earn in a family and women of that time be in a home and engaged in managing home activities. But now the scenario has been totally changed, Globalization has presented new challenges for the realization of the goal of women’s equality, the gender impact of which has not been systematically evaluated &the expenses& responsibilities has been increased at extreme level and the income of an individual is not sufficient for the survival.Its a time that both men & women work together and make the future of the INDIA because if a single women be educated & skill then she will not only become a earning participant in a family but she also plays a vital role in making her child career by her skills & experience .Women empowerment has a strengthened for prevention of women violence , including sexual harassment at work place and customs like dowry; for the rehabilitation of the victims of violence and for taking effective action against the perpetrators of such violence a women must have to be skilled &self dependent

Name: ASHWAMEGH GRAMIN VIKAS TRUST
Major_Activities1: Largest project handled: Comment briefly on the largest project (financially or man power wise) handled so far, indicating specifically difficulties experienced in the project and any other salient experiences. The organization has implemented financially largest project namely Integrated Watershed Development and Conservation Programme at Shirdhane (Pr. – Ner), Tal. & Dist. Dhule. The project value amounted to Rs. 99.95 lakh covering an area of 2498 ha with integrated watershed development activities benefiting population of 3,575 persons or 638 households in one village. The project was financed by the CAPART under the aegis of Ministry of Rural Areas and Employment, Government of India, New Delhi. The project involves activities leading to increase in ground water table and enabling farmers improve productivity of agriculture through proper water management. The organization did not find any difficulty in implementation of the program as the program has been implemented without any difficulty with positive impact agro – ecological conditions of the environment in the project area with visible changes in socio economic conditions of the people. Works/ Projects related to NRM and Rural Livelihood sector: Please indicate the work done by the organization with special reference to the following activities: a. Soil and water conservation (including watershed programmes, dryland farming systems) The organization has implemented Integrated Watershed Development and Conservation Action Plan with the financial support of CAPART. The project covered an area of 2,489 ha of land area with water and soil conservation measures benefiting 638 numbers of households and population of 3,575 persons in one village namely Shirdhane (Pr – Ner) Tal and Dist Dhule. Organization used participatory methods such as PRA in evolving community based project planning and designing. The Staff facilitated and strengthened Village Watershed Committee (WC) for implementing the programme. More emphasis of laid in capacity building of the Watershed Committee (WC). PRA exercise was helped in understanding immediate and strategic community needs in the project area. To start with the Ashwamegh Sanstha designed, planned and implemented Entry Point Activities (EPA) covering simple and low budget solutions to the immediate community problems. It helped build rapport with the community to evolve more complex program activities including assuring peoples contribution in the execution of area and drainage line treatments such as Continues Contour Trenches on 23 ha., 315 Loose Boulders, 8 Gabian Structures, 3 Farm Ponds / sunken pond, 19 Cement Check Dam, 91 ha. Farm Bunding and 25 ha. Plantation. Also completed formation and strengthening of SHGs. Other activities included entrepreneurs training and linking with bank of all women SHGs, forming federation of women SHGs in to an umbrella organization namely Sanyukta Mahila Samiti (SMS). Exposure visits of members of the Watershed Committee, SMS, UG (Users Group), Farmers and Women were arranged to success stories to build community vision to ensure ultimate impact of the watershed development program. In addition, the organization could promote village level activities that created enabling environment for the development such as total sanitation campaign, Shramdan (Donation of Voluntary Labour for Community Welfare). Maintenance Fund was established by collecting contribution from each family @ Rs.100/- per year & 10% contribution for community work. b. Plantation and horticulture (tree based farming, wadi development, organic farming,) (a) The component of afforestation under the Integrated Watershed Development program was implemented in village Shirdhane. The program comprised of two components: (a) Plantation of Forest tree species. 5454 number of tree species were planted in the upper reaches of the watershed. Some species were also planted along with area treatments such as Continuous Contour Trenches etc. (b) Horticulture: Mango and other horticulture plantation was completed in 7 ha. of land against target of 41 ha of land. (b) Ashwamegh Sanstha has also promoted organic farming and promoted controlled use of chemical fertilizers and pesticides. The technology of worming culture was promoted through demonstration, exposure visits, training, field support and guidance. (c). Forestry activities (Bamboo based farming, energy plantations, wasteland development rehabilitation and management /Community Forest management, pasture development biodiversity conservation) (a) The soil and water conservation program comprised of pasture land development in the ridge area. The soil, topography and land capability / use favoring such pasture land development in more than 25 ha area. The pasture land development includes activities seeding of grass species such as Hamata. The fodder species were planted as part of the Soil and water conservation activities such as CCT, RTC etc. (b) The Joint Forest Management program was also promoted as part of the tree plantation program. An opportunity to mobilize community in forestry conservation was explored and shared with the village communities. (c) Under watershed development programme in Shirdhane, promoted community to observe social discipline of five principles of Nashabandi (Ban on liquor), Charaibandi (Ban of Free Grazing), Nasbandi (Restriction of Family Size), Kurhadbandi (Ban on Tree Felling). These disciplines were strictly adhered to by the community members. The results are visible, more tree and vegetative cover can be seen on the ground now. d. Farming systems management (including livestock and aquaculture resources) Vermicomposting project supported by CAPART, Ahamadbad was implemented in four villages namely Fagane, Balapur, Vani and Shirdhane (Pr Ner) Tal and Dist Dhule. Under the project the farmers were provided training, support, demonstration and input supply for the vermicomposting. e. Climate change adaptation / Clean Development Mechanism (CDM) As mentioned earlier, Ashwamegh has endeavored to check use of chemical fertilizers and pesticides. While doing it has promoted organic farming with much more importance to the Farm Yard Manure, local bio mass and use of wormi compost, tree plantation, and soil and water conservation. All together pushing towards CDM to counter climate change.

Name: Astha Samarpan
Major_Activities1: The aims and objectives for which the Society is established are as under: 1. To work for the educational upliftment of the rural and general public irrespective of caste, sex, creed and religion. 2. To maintain run and construct Basti Vikas Kendra, jansuvidha Parisar road Footpath, Anganwari,, Libraries etc. with the help of concerned Govt. Authorities for giving the education to the student’s social neglected people and children. 3. To open language courses like English, Japanese, Urdu, Arebic, Bulgaria & French etc. so that students and general public who live in state may learn other languages. 4. To provide the weaker section training with the raw material looms and crafts to arrange exhibition and sale of the handicrafts and handlooms products made by artisans & to arrange technical know how on the latest techniques for modernization and for implementation of the same to be used by artisan and to promote develop undertaken assistance and maintain schemes, projects and program’s indulge schemes for individuals artisans and entrepreneurs for the end social development of rural areas. 5. To rehabilitates destitute women like young and old widows, unmarried mothers, victims of addiction and their dependent children through residential care and vocational training. 6. To open found establish, promote, safety and or maintaining and or running charitable dispensaries, maternity homes, child welfare centers, crèches convalescent homes, sanatorium, and other similar institution or centers for rendering or providing medical relief. No profit no loss. 7. To do best efforts for the promotion of research and educational in medical science including surgery by running the various different school colleges and other medical research and or educational institutions. 8. To establish and maintain institutions for the handicapped, blind deaf, dump, poor handicraft, disables, SC/ST, Minorities, Backward classes and other needy people to provide the training of house hold industries, semi-skilled jobs and also to provide them other required facilities like hotels, medical aid Food Clothes Transportation and economic assistance to start new business. 9. The aims and objects of the society shall be purely for charitable purpose which includes relief to the poor, educational, social Medical relief and the advancement of any other objects of general public utility. 10. To accept donations, Grant-in-aid, presents, gifts, and other offerings in the shape of moveable and immovable properties for the attainment of the aims and objects of the society. 11. To start, establish, run or manage and maintain schools with an object to provide sound pre-primary, primary, secondary, senior secondary and College education including vocational, Coaching Classes and technical education to children by seeking recognition and affiliation from the educational department/concerned government authorities. 12. To establish and manage cultural, social, agricultural, research and training institution to introduce and develop professional courses, to promote the study of different Indian and foreign languages, to set up community centers, art, music, song and drama centers, physical training centers etc. with the approval of concerned authorities, if any no profit no loss. 13. To establish and maintain Institutions for the handicapped and for adult education with the consent of concerned authorities. 14. To establish, manage, promote, computer education centers/Institutions in various places for the general public. 15. To open institutions for training in cutting, tailoring, knitting, interior decoration, typing, short hand etc. and seek government approval for the same. 16. To work for the development of rural areas by development activities with the help of concerned authorities to work for the development of women, children and under privileged class of communities. 17. To distribute among poor students free text books, help books, exercise books, dress and other material, provide them other facilities deemed proper from time to time. 18. To establish reading rooms, libraries to the members of the society, students and general public and to offer prices and grant scholarships to deserving students and needy persons. 19. To publish books, charts, illustrations, journals, magazines, periodicals and other publications for the propagation of aims and objects of the society. 20. To make correspondences in lawful manner to arrange meetings, conferences, seminars with the concerned government authorities for the solution of social/civic problems of members of the society and general public. 21. To perform all such acts as may be necessary for the achievement and accomplishment of the above mentioned aims and objects and allied social activities and services. 22. To open hostels and libraries in various places of India for the benefit of students and general public. 23. To train economically weak women widows and men in various income generating skills like cutting, tailoring, knitting, embroidery, fashion designing, baking and such other courses by opening necessary training centers in various places of state. 24. To encourage arts and culture of all kinds and to arrange cultural programmes from time to time. 25. To promote and disseminate art and culture as desirable to musical and art centers for Training and demonstration. 26. To launch sustained campaigns for the relief of people affected by disasters such as flood, earth quake famine cyclone, drought etc. 27. To open orphanages for the old and infirm persons mentally retarded, blind and handicapped children and persons. 28. To foster links between communities, people public bodies, and voluntary agencies through developmental activities. 29. To educate people and make them conscious and concerned about self reliance, social justice and co-operation. So that they may prepared and equipped to work out for themselves. 30. To protect girl child and fight against social evils like dowry system etc and To work for family counseling against drugs, liquors and other narcotic abuses. 31. To open dispensaries and health centers in rural areas for general health care and free medicine distribution to arrange and organize eye and blood donation camp in state 32. To arrange and manage the training institution in Typing, Short Hand, Computer information technology, traditional handicrafts, handlooms Fine Arts, Craft, Music, Painting, Jute goods, Biological for health, Modeling, Beauticulture Cutting and Tailoring, Yoga, Physical Educational and other social activities of Awareness programs, Adult Education Classes, Lectures, Essay Competitions Exhibitions, Symposium, cultural Programs, Press Conference and Seminars. 33. To establish, run, maintain and grant aid in cash or kinds to Advance Technical education including Engineering & Diploma College, G.R.C., Management Education Institute, Computer Science & Engineering Institutes, Teacher Training and Specialized studies & Research Institutes Science and Technology to provide standard and high class education for B.E./B.tech/B.Arc/MBA/B.Ed./M.Ed./N.T.T. courses and other related courses to the student according to Rules and Regulations of A.I.C.T.E., N.C.T.E. and State Government. No profit no loss 34. To educate and provide training to the students, candidates, general public about rapidly increasing harmful environmental purity, preparation for plantation of Trees and plans and to organize camps, seminars, films, shops for environment of protection and to establish environment preservation and pollution centers to restrain the spread pollution as per Govt. Rules. 35. To open, found, establish, promote, set-up, run maintain, assist, support and/or help the various community development programs/activities and also construct and develop the community halls, marriage homes, pio, Dharamshala, Night shelters, old age homes, hostel for Girls Students/Working women, orphanage, health care centers, crèches (day care centers) Charitable dispensaries, mini hospitals, hospitals, schochalaya, Libraries, reading room, play grounds, Stadium (both open and indoor) Yoga training centers, Gymnasium’s, Music and Dance Training Centers, Aanganwari, Balwari, Mahila Ashram, Studios, Drama stage and other building/institution for use of General Public and for Welfare of the General public. 36. To promote the interest of people in Environment, sense of integration, Self employment, family planning, sanitation section by making audio visual, Tele Films, and documentary on various aspects of culture music, crafts environment, health, sports and place of social integration. The society will also organize the stage plays, musical concerts, self help group, seminars and variety programmes on special occasions. 37. To establish and maintain institutions for the handicapped disabled blind, poor, and child labour SC & ST, BC, OBC classes and other needy persons like vacations training in vacations of house hold industries, semi-skilled jobs for self employment and to provide food, clothing, Mid dry meals, medical and transpirations, libraries, laboratories, reading rooms, hotels, playgrounds, swimming pool and other required facilities to the boys/girls and also to the members of the society. 38. To arrange and provide indoor and outdoor sports and games as well as athletics and arranging the usual apparatus for their practices to appear and ready for the competition at different age levels. 39. To provide residential/hostels, accommodation for consideration and to educate trained and assist financially or otherwise in the education and training of teachers, social workers, staff, students and other persons for the purposes of the society, including SC, ST, BC, OBC and other disciplines on different relating education. 40. To promote conscious, educational/welfare and treatment programs to control the HIV, AIDS, Cancer, Diabetes, Leprosy, Tuberculosis, Syphilis, Heart, Skin and other Diseases. 41. To create a forum for Senior Citizens where they can exchange their various views and experiences, which may be, make available to younger generation. 42. To undertake road safety programs and help police and Traffic police, to control vehicles and social evils on the road. 43. To take up effective but reasonable and lawful steps for the eradication of social evils such as Dowry system, Child Marriage (BAL VIVAH), Child labour, wastage of money is the various functions and use of intoxicated drugs/wine/smack etc. 44. To advance, promote, generate, disseminate information or literature on (i) Population education (ii) Productivity education (iii) Environment and Pollution (iv) Safety education (v) Conservation of environment and Pollution (vi) Social Education (VII) Dowry 45. The society will invest its money and funds according to the Section 11(5) of the Income Tax Act,1961. All the incomes, earnings, movable/immovable properties of the Society shall be solely utilized and applied towards the promotion of its aims and objectives only as set forth in the Memorandum of the Society and no profit thereof shall be paid or transferred directly or indirectly by way of dividends, bonus, profits or in any manner whatsoever to the present or past members of the Society or to any person claiming through anyone or more of the present or past members. No member of the Society shall have any personal claim on any movable or immovable properties of the Society or make any profits, whatsoever by virtue of this membership. The Society will invest its money and funds according to the section

Name: Jaintia Hills Development Society
Major_Activities1: Promoting sustainable agriculture of the 15 tribal village of Jaintia hills.First of all through the intervention of People-led development many problems which existed in the villages such Drinking water for the villagers and sanitation and health care were no body’s responsibility. After the formation of the farmers clubs, the members clubs took initiative to bring to the notice of the village community and identified their problems and their difficulties by conducting the meetings and decided the necessity of solving these problems with the guidance of our animators.The PLDA has helped the community to have a collective decision making of the people happened in other villages, as for instance, the problem of land conflict between Mooshot village and Saba village where crops of 67 families was destroyed by Saba people. In this situation, through the initiative of Mooshort FC, they organized a fund raising day whereby amount of 60,000 rupees was collected and distributes to 67 households to buy new seeds, and the people collectively came to replant the crops. Emergency assistance for children in need of care and protection through Childline Jowai was also another major achievement in these past 5 years

Name: Dharithree
Major_Activities1: `Dharithree’ Mother Earth One who endures and cares for her children to the ultimate. We at Dharithree have the same objective-caring for the disabled when they need most and bring about a qualitative change in the lives of mentally and multiply challenged propel. The trust is the outcome of strong desire and appeal of the parents. We try to provide solace and peaceful atmosphere to the parents for their concern and agony about the future of their children in their absence or inability to manage them. Dharithree started in 2003 with 3 children now has 200 children in 4 day care centers and 1 residential home availing all the facilities for a total development from early intervention to rehabilitation with a holistic approach. Within a short span of 13 Years Dharithree has been able to march ahead in facilitating the children behind its capacity. The bird’s eye views of our achievements are • Received National award as Best Intuition by National Trust 2014-15 under ministry of social justice and empowerment govt of India. • Awarded as Best Intuition by govt of Karnataka – Child and Women welfare ministry. • We are registered under FCRA and eligible to receive forging funds -under ministry of home affairs. • We have facility of 35AC under income tax department – govt of India minister of finance. • Vocational training in ecofriendly and rural based programs to make them productive, self dependent and respectable citizens. Dairy, farming, envelops making, candle, phenyl and soap oil manufacturing are taught in this section. We are also training them in Indian breed cow based products like Dantha manjan, Dhoop and Gou muthra arkha. • Our therapeutic services include dance and music therapy, magnetic and acculaser therapy, yoga and pyramid therapy apart from physio and speech therapy. • Our main project site is spread out in 5.1/2 Accor land in saran atmosphere to suit for the development of special need children without hurdles and obstacles for the free movements. • We have 55 staff with commitment and dedication consisting special educators, psychiatrists, therapist and assistants. • Research and development program to prevent disability, resource and information centre for parents and teachers with all information under one umbrella. • Teachers training program, parent counseling and guidance to start special schools and reach the unreached areas. • `Aasara’ a home away from home for special need children to provide total care, love and protection.

Name: jivanjyoti Welfare Association for Mentally and Physically Handicapped
Major_Activities1: Children with mental retardation need to be imparted education like other children, going to school is essential for them to learn not only academic skills but also discipline, social skills and practical lkills for community living. Though a they are slow in learning, research has shown that by the applying the right kind of educational techniques it is possible to import the basic skills of reading, writing and arithmetic to many children with mental retardation according to this. The Jibanjyoti Welare Association for Mentally and Physically Handicapped always drives the goal for the mentally challenged.

Name: All India Central Government Pensioners Association Hq Pune
Major_Activities1: All India central govt pensioners association is the oldest established in oct 1947 and one of the fortythree identified associations by DOPPW. The activities during 2015-2016 are as follows. 1 Publishing quarterly bulletin. We publish quarterly bulleting giving the information about latest govt.orders illustrations on pensionery benefits activities of the association etc.As we have branches in all districts of Maharashtra we publish the brief and illesturtions in marathi. Our bulletin for january 2016 covering highlights,all important paras of 7th CPC recommendations along with illestrutions and special issue in Aug 2016 giving orders of revision of pension by DOPPW and illustrations and also DOTS orders in respect of 78.2IDA for BSNL Pensioners were appreciated by our members and other associations. 2 Participation in the campaign launched by Govt. This year we have given wide publicity of Govt decision to link Adhaar Iendification for submission of digital life certificate and special campaign of adhar card seeding and registration by bankis during 30 May-10th June 2016. We participated in the Swachh Bharat pakhawada during May 16-31.2016 launched by DOPPW by taking oath in AGMS Meeting of the branches and appealed members for participating in the swachhata abhiyan by various agencies 3. Counseling at AGM at district leval. Office bearers represent the Hq in the AGM.We address the members not only latest govt orders,pensioners benefits but also appeal them to participate in the activities for the cause of senior citizens as social responsibilities. 4 Arranging gettogether for counselling newly retired and old pensioners.This year we arranged BSNL Day Mela on 1st oct Snehamelawa for postal pensioners on 18th november , Rms pensioners on 17th Dec 2015 Gettogether for income tax pensioners on 18th Jan2016 ,Anand melawa for Telecom pensioners on 28th Jan 2016 .We address the gathering about the govt latest orders, pensioners benefit, satisfy their queries on spot. We also talk on how to lead active life after retirement by particip-ating in activities of the association. 5 Solving the complaints of the pensioners. We solved nearly 250 long pending complaints of the pensioners interacting with pension sanctioning ,PPO issuing or disbursing authorities.We arrange periodical meetings with the concerned authorieis and discussed the computerisation of pensioners record, delay in revised ppos and authorisitation of family pension in case of 2nd family memers.We also requested to hold pension adalat. 5. Social responsi bility. We donated rs 25,000 thousand for PM Relief fund Rs. 50,000 for Maharashtra Chief Minister relief fund and Rs 1,00,000 for NGOS to work for relief/welfare of poor,rural and downtrodden in the sociaty.

Name: Utter Pradesh Mook Badhir Vidhyalay
Major_Activities1: Activities The major activities of organization are as below To run the special school for the hearing impaired children from primary to upper primary Running pre-primary education program me for young hearing impaired children Providing secondary education to hearing impaired children Developing the speech and language of the children with hearing impairment As per need we support to children individually for their skill development Conducting a special auditory training for their residual hearing development Making ear mould for fitting of hearing aid Guide to parents for the development of their children and facilities available for the disabled person by the Government Placement for education, job, and marriage also The school also provide the vocational training such as in wood craft, tailoring ,drawing trades along with their education The school is helping to parents and their hearing impaired child to get the disability certificate and free hearing aid by the concern authority Outdoor and indoor games is conducting for the children to develop their personality, physical, mental, leadership and self confidence etc. Providing the scholarship and transportation amount to the beneficiaries as per policy of Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment Govt. of India ,New Delhi Conducting the cultural , game and sports ,CBR and public awareness program me To encourage and repaying to the children to participate in various competition conducting by school and others agencies Organizing teacher parents meeting for development of hearing impaired children We are also developing the computer skills in hearing impaired children at secondary level Achievement We feel that the school is involve in education of the hearing impaired children from a long time since establishment 1929 . Since the time and at present we found the following achievement has been obtained by the school such as Thousands of hearing impaired person has been received education. The many of the skill they have been develop along with their education such as listening, speaking , communication, reading and writing , personality ,behavior, self confidence and others aims and objective of education The most of the passed out students of the school have been employed or self employed in Government /Private sectors Many of the children at the primary and pre-primary level have been integrated in general school by develop their skills Not only of State of U.P. ,M.P.,Bihar , Jhorkhand states hearing impaired children are getting the residential facilities along with their education The school management ,teachers, children are always participate /support in any programme which are conducting by the Government authority or other agencies in the programme for disabled The school is creating a good environment for the better rehabilitation of hearing impaired person by the keeping the goal of equal opportunity ,full participant and protection of right of the children It is a historical school of North India which is well known by the person ,public ,social agencies and Government sectors . The school is also popular in other part of the State/Country accept Uttar Pradesh

Name: mizoram social defence  rehabilitation board
Major_Activities1: To take measures for the prevention of substance abuse and to establish treatment, rehabilitation and social re integration of people with substance dependency. To identify, mobilise and assist NGOs, CBOs, FBOs to undertake and rehabilitate people with substance dependency. To monitor, coordinate and evaluate the progress and activities of NGOs working in the above field. To conduct and undertake research and training in the related subjects and field to fulfill the objectives of the Society. Publication of literature so as to generate drug abuse and HIV/AIDS prevention awareness. So far, there are 22 publications targeting the general community, service providers and the drug users community. Consultancy and capacity building with identified Master Trainers. MSD&RB is presently equipped with 50 trained Resource pool specialized in different areas on Demand and Harm Reduction. Preventive education and awareness generation on substance abuse and its related issues for school children and general public. Development of documentary films. These are effective intervention toolkits for drug abuse and HIV/AIDS prevention amongst children and adolescents. Research / studies on different issues of substance abuse and HIV/AIDS to take appropriate action against drug and HIV/AIDS problems in the state. Facilitate the observation of International Day against Drug abuse and illicit trafficking.

Name: Indian Business Chamber
Major_Activities1: IBCHAM is on mission to promote youth focusing women for entrepreneurship though organising various workshops and seminar at different women institutions across country. The purpose of the mission is to enlighten the graduating minds focusing women about the role of young entrepreneurs in the emerging economy and career laid down of youth as entrepreneur. We are also on endeavor not only to encourage the youth particularly women for entrepreneurship but also to support with following complementary services which may help them to make their business success and sustainable: I. registration of firm/company at zero cost. ii. Assistance in making business proposal iii. Business consultancy for market outreach iv. Auditing and ITR filing of the company for first two years v. Free legal business related opinion for first two years at certain extend vi. Assistance in opening current/business account at zero/minimum balance to avoid unnecessary cost vii. Assistance in arranging seed funds from banks/ angel investor/ Venture Capitalist Firms viii. Information about statutory business guidelines/compliances ix. Training session on technology adaptation x. Awareness about various government schemes and helping in attaching its business we have target to establish 100 women entreprenurs at end year 2016. however we reached to 34 as of date and providing free services to them.

Name: Azad Ali Shah Education Society NGO
Major_Activities1: DISTRICT SURVEY FOR BALKAMGAR CHILD LABOUR Organised has done a survey for balkamgar child labour in Aurangabad district were they have found that children from age 7 to 16 are working in Hotels Rasvanti Resturant, Garages and etc. Organization has found that over all above mention most of the Balkamgar childlabour are from Muslim & Minorities community. In addition to it small children working in the above mentioned shops can be given proper education and mould their income generation unit in giving them technical education which can be utilized in their future for their better prospects. BLOOD GROUP TEST/ BLOOD DONATION CAMP This camp is conducted in Aurangabad city for testing various blood groups and donate blood to needy persons. 20 students participated. HEALTH CAMP Health camp held at Aurangabad for Mukbhadir, Mentally retorted, physical handicapped, treatment in various diseases is done every year. INCOME GENERATING UNITS Organized is planning to implementation income generation unties project for women. Organisation has completed various govt. scheme study to implement such scheme for low income class women for courage unit multi activity unit. ADVICE SEMINAR FOR HANDICAPPED Organisation has conducted this seminar for advice of handicapped by calling outside experts to focus handicapped persons problem. Seminar held every year 75 to 80 student benefited.

Name: Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church Medical Mission Hospital
Major_Activities1: The Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church Medical Mission was founded under the auspices of the Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church and was registered as a charitable institution under the Travancore Cochin Literary Scientific and Charitable Societies Registration Act XII of 1955 on 18.2.67. The mission has been rendering service to the public at large with the objective to engage in activities which will result in the development and upliftment of the rural areas and facilities around Kolenchery. The MOSC Medical Mission Hospital commenced providing services on 14th Sept. 1970 with 100 beds and now it has grown to a Medical College with 1100 beds with all preclinical, clinical and superspeciality departments. All activities of the hospital including the medical college are of charitable and philanthropic nature not involving any activity for profit. The hospital including the specialized departments cater to the needs of the public at large at a very subsidized rates for treatment, diagnostic services, dispensing medicines etc. We provide the following social and community services. • An amount of Rs. 3 lakhs per month is allotted for patients who are kept under teaching free cases. • The hospital set aside around Rs.200 lakhs a year under hospital free a/c for the Free Diabetic clinic, Free Ophthal treatment, Free ENT treatment, Free medical clinics at various community centres, Free Tuesday clinics and Concession on final bills of patients • Dept. of Community medicine operates 6 health centres providing outreach clinics, antenatal check up, immunization and blood sugar checking and providing health education. • We have set aside Rs. 200 lakhs every year to give scholarship for eligible students studying in our Medical College. • We are giving free dialysis to 20 patients in our hospital. Annual expense w/off in this account amount to Rs. 29 lakhs (approx.) • One of our major achievements is that we provide free De-addiction treatment with the financial support of MSJE, Govt. of India.
issues_working_db: Health & Family Welfare,

Name: Association For Social Health in India Punjab State Branch
Major_Activities1: In order to propagate Social Health Activities the Association through its District Branches, holds Seminars, Declamation, Lectures, Debates, etc., generally on the topics mentioned below: Empowerment of Women, Evils of dowry, Drug addiction, Importance of Family Planning, Need for Happy Family life, Marital discord, broken homes, Awareness about Aids and its prevention, Immunization, Rights of women, Prevention of Female feticide etc. On International Womens Day (March 8th, 2016) a Free Medical Camp was organized for Dental, Eyes, Skin and Medical ailments etc. and free medicines were also provided. The Medical Camp organized in association with Rotary Club Chandigarh Central at Nari Niketan Building, Sector 55, SAS Nagar (Mohali). International Womens Day was also celebrated by all the district branches of ASHI, and a large number of women and girls participate in the functions. We propose to run Training Centers for Computers, Beautician Course, Stitching Embroidery, Call Center, etc. The District Branches of the Association take keen interest in cases of Marital discord, Behaviour problems, Dowry disputes. District Branches hold seminars for creating general awareness among women and girls against social evils and urge them to fight against social aggression etc. SHORT STAY HOMES: The ASHI Punjab State Branch, Chandigarh has been successful in getting three Short Stay Homes sanctioned from the Govt. of India for helping the destitute women and girls in the State as mentioned below: Sanjeevni at Jalandhar, Savera at Chandigarh, Sahara at Amritsar. At the Short Stay Homes for women in discord and disorganization, emotionally disturbed, unmarried mothers, women of weaker sections requiring shelter and protection etc., are provided accommodation for short stay in these Homes. Here they are provided free Board and Lodging, rehabilitation and medical treatment, protection and help to build future for them through academic, well equipped vocational training, so that they can become economically independent. They are provided facilities of games as well. The inmates are imparted training in various handicrafts such as making leather goods, purses, Dak Pads, Warrian Pappar, Surf etc. and after trained perfectly they are helped find a livelihood. The Association takes special interest in getting them married to suitable persons to enable them to lead honourable life. Grant in aid to run these Homes is given by the Govt. of India, Ministry of Human Resources Development, New Delhi.

Name: BELLARY DIOCESE DEVELOPMENT SOCIETY
Major_Activities1: Mobilized 450 women Self Help Groups SHGs in 78 villages 16 grass root level federations 2 taluk federations More than 4 500 women engaged in I G Activities through internal loan and bank loan With the support of Donor agencies over 2 000 houses were built for Dalits and marginalized families in Raichur Bellary and Koppal districts More than 1250 Janatha Ashraya houses road construction repair in 56 villages public sanitation facility to 52 villages and 310 drinking water structures availed 41 different types of Govt facilities like houses drinking water roads street lights etc availed by SHGs from Government worth Rs 12 crores 48 women from SHGs elected for Gram panchayaths Created awareness on HIV AIDS in 126 villages of Bellary Raichur and Koppal districts 285 HIV infected adults 189 HIV infected children 313 STI RTI cases and 148 TB patients were identified and provided care & support 85% of STI RTI cases and 148 TB patients were treated and cured The PLHIVs and CLHIVs health status improved and helped to lead a normal life 26 VHSCs formed and strengthened to take up the Health issues especially of HIV AIDS 162 PLHIVs linked to District Positives Network 32 PLHIVs are promoted as Positive speakers 15 HIV infected children were transitioned to CLHIVs care homes Communities were helped and trained on Watershed management and methods of soil and water conservation over 75 villages Two check dams were built with people’s participation 17 percolation ponds are built for the community with people participation A village tank was desilted Field bunds are laid in more than 3200 acres of agricultural land 300 youths girls & boys were given skill training through Vocational courses and were helped to be self employed and get employment in well known and leading companies garments Hospitals & Factories Through Rainwater harvesting structures 317000 litrs of potable water is available for more than 2000 school boarding home children During summer there will not be water scarcity During flood 5 temporary shelters were provided to flood victims distributed food grains and cooking vessales and clothes to 1067 families of Bellary Raichur and Koppal districts constructed 80 group houses in 3 villages of Raichur district 50 families were helped with building materials to repair reconstruct their houses in Bellary Through CHILDLINE programme we could reach out to school and college children slum dwellers drivers shop owners general public by awareness Outreach programmes provided Shelter through CWC to children child marriages were stopped child laboure were admitted to school In 4 villages the RO water purification plants are installed and the village community especially the poor and marginalised families are getting the safe and sufficient drinking water in these villages

Name: Apeksha Homoeo Society
Major_Activities1: Apeksha homoeo Society was established in 1980 and has its headquarter at gurukunj mozari and branch offices at teosa, Chandur Rly, Dharni and Murtizapur.It also has a resource and training center at Mozari. The organisation key areas of work are 1. Livelihood Developement 2. Helping farmers and thier families in distress 3. empowering women financially and socially formation and linkages of SHGs 4. Micro financeing 5. Housing 6. Reproductive child health 7. Eradication of child labour and retaining in school 8. Advocacy Year round programmes- 1. Life skill for adolescents - The organisation promotes life skill in Ashram school in dharni tribal block through which the children are equipped with skills and abilities to make informed choices and take charge of thier lives. The major topics covered are Personal hygiene, Environmental awareness, Responsible parenthood, HIV AIDs and gender awareness. 2. Eradication of child labour through education - Due to socio economic condition of the dperived community children they are taken undue advantage by some persons. these children work as cheap labour force in hotels, household agricultural fields and hazardous industries. The organisation address the following issues through education * Providing access to school * Advocating for quality education * Enrollemnt and retention of children * Motivating children to attend school 3. Empowering women through SHGs - With the support of NABARD the organisation is promoting ad linking 150 SHGs 4. Micro finance -In order to improve the financial condition of the weaker section of the society the organisation disburses loan to SHGs and JLGs. Uptil june 2008 total 526 JLGs have been disbursed soft loans. 5. Mother and Child Health - RCH II The organisation is a mother NGO and works for improving the health status of mother and child from the underserved area Dharni which is a tribal block with the support of 3 FNGOs 6. Housing - AHS with the support of Habitat for Humanity provides support for construction and renovation of houses. Till date 728 houses have been constructed from Chandur Rly, Teosa, Achalpur and Nangaon blocks of Amaravati District

Name: Karthika Nair Smarak Samithi
Major_Activities1: DISABILITY SERVICE PROJECT Karthika Nair Memorial Rehabilitation Centre for Orthopaedically Handicapped. People with various disabilities constitute 7-8% of the society. In fact they are the most vulnerable and the least attended segment of the society. Integration of people with disabilities, into the main stream, is the ultimate goal of all disability services. Social and Economic rehabilitation are essential components to achieve integration of the disabled. Here the role of vocational training and rehabilitation is of vital importance. The Karthika Nair Memorial Rehabilitation Centre is established, in 1971, in fulfillment of this objective, as enlisted in the Memorandum of Association. It is situated in the remote village of Vallamkulam in Pathanamthitta District of Kerala State. This institution, managed by Karthika Nair Smarak Samithi, is doing yeoman service in rehabilitating people with various disabilities in the State. The multifarious activities undertaken by the centre help a lot in integrating people with disabilities into the main stream. Objectives of the Rehabilitation Centre. 1. To promote Socio -Economic Rehabilitation of the disabled. 2. To provide Vocational Training Facilities to the disabled. 3. To create Public awareness of and to promote public involvement in the Rehabilitation of the disabled. 4. To provide parental counseling and vocational guidance. 5. To do referral service. 6. To promote placement of the disabled. The following programmes are being undertaken by the Rehabilitation Centre to fulfil the above objectives. Programmes a. Vocational Training b. Placement Service. c. Referral Service. d. Parental Counselling. e. Conduct of Seminars, Workshops, Medical Camps, Study tours and Excursion. Full attention is given to nurture the residual abilities and hidden potentials of the disabled people. They are valued in terms of their abilities rather than their disability. Ofcourse, their disability, physical or otherwise and the handicap resulting from the disability, are given due attention and all possible steps, wherever necessary, are being taken to minimise the handicap. But we never allow their inferiority complex, resulting from disability, to dominate their residual ability. The modus operandi of the Rehabilitation Centre is structured in such a way as to achieve this goal. Catagory Served People with 1. Locomotor Disability 2. Partial Visual Impairment 3. Hearing Impairment 4. Mental Retardation 5. Cerebral Palsy 6. Multiple Disability The various activities of the Rehabilitation Centre are detailed below. Vocational Training of People With Disability This is a major programme of the Rehabilitation Centre. We are preparing the disabled people, of age group 15 - 35, for placement through training in vocations of maximum employment potential, and suitable to their residual capacity. Training is free and duration of the course is two years. All the courses and syllabus are approved by Government of Kerala. Trainees are presented for the Kerala Government Technical Examinations (K G T E) in the respective trades, for Lower Grade examination in the first year and for Higher Grade in the second year. Since 1971, Twenty six batches have successfully completed training in various trades. As per available data, most of the persons, who have successfully completed their courses, are decently rehabilitated in various organisations and also in Government Departments. Courses Offered 1. Printing Technology Group Subjects 1. Compositor’s Work 5. Screen Printing 2. Proof Reader’s Work 6. Offset Printing 3. Machine Work 7. Plate making 4. Book Binding 8. DTP & Photoshop 2. Commerce Group 1. Typewriting - English and Malayalam 2. Accountancy 3. Computer Education D. O. A, P. G. D. C. A D. T. P. ,Tally, Photoshop In stipulation of the directions of Government of India, Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, we are running Senior and Junior Batches. At present, the classes for the 27th senior batch and 28th junior batch are going on. During 2015-16, 3 students are allowed to continue as third year, for preparing the for the Higher grade Kerala Govt. Technical Examination, in their respective subjects.

Name: Indus Integrated Information Management Ltd
Major_Activities1: Company Profile Indus Integrated Information Management LTD ISO 9001-2008 and ISO 14001-2004 Company , launched in July-2003, is a professional skill workforce development & Training organization specialized in skill building , vocational training, software consulting , IT services and skilled IT staffing , course placement with offices in seven states across the Eastern and North Eastern India. Promoter Directors of this Group is having vast business and work experience of working in leading economies of the World, including United States, European Union, Far East countries, not to mention our very own Indian domestic market. Despite being a relatively young company, it has drawn together a rather impressive list of tie-ups, with alliances and collaborations, foraying into uncharted business territory. Guided by competent leaders, in partnership with some of the world’s top Multinational Corporations, the company’s workforce has thus far been successful in helping the organization grow exponentially: both in terms of magnitude as well as the nature of the work done. Mission INDUS Groups’ mission is to implement ground - breaking methodologies and technologies in delivering industry - specific IT / Non IT solutions that answers major business challenges and empower the youth for greater heights tomorrow. INDUS group achieves its mission through enabling paradigm shifts using its technological expertise, a collaborative approach, a passionate team of professionals that are bound to instill a sense of trust in the client/partner, as well as exposure of those in the upper echelons of management to the best industry practices across the globe. What we stand for Our corporate objective is to offer global vision with a personal touch in the education and application service industry, bridging the information gap to enable students / beneficiaries make the wisest decision on future career paths, represent partner institutions’ best interest to deliver quality rather than quantity and facilitate greater public awareness among prospective students, parents, academics and recruiters. We understand that our partner/clients value quality more than quantity and hope to achieve better results, thus our service has been tailored to optimize offer and enrolment conversion rates. Walking the Talk In keeping with this belief, Indus has involved itself in numerous multidimensional projects that have had far-reaching social impacts at the grass root level. With dedicated professionals, INDUS Group has proved itself to be a path breaker in terms of offering new and innovative services leading to mutual profitability. INDUS Group has grown consistently over the past few years and is expected to continue this upward spiral in the coming years as well. The Legacy of Indus group lies in the fact of having skilled more than 6 lakhs students in its presence of a decade. In its network of more than 225 centers across East and NE India, Indus has trained more than 200000 beneficiaries in Job focused vocational streams with an average placement track record of more than 70%. Partnering global Industry leaders like, Microsoft, HP, Siemens, Tata Motors, G4S Securitus, Bourneville College, UK and many more domestic big names like, NISST, Ministry of Steel, GOI; SIS Securities; Floras Beauty, Indus brings on table relevant Industry Certification and job placement through its placement team in more than 127 companies within India. Indus has consistently been adopting policies keeping in mind the fact that the results of the projects should be beneficial to our esteemed clients and partners leading to customer satisfaction by reaching to the ultimate goal of the targeted stake holder. Leverage through various outsourcing models. We Promise You: Complete customer orientation, a responsive attitude to your needs, Better solutions with a faster turnaround time and predictability. Indus guarantees an internationally benchmarked Process Architecture that guarantees quality and consistency

Name: STATE RESOURCE CENTER DISPUR ASSAM
Major_Activities1: The critical focus of SRC Dispur is giving technical and Resource support to the adult education Program . For that, SRC Dispur endeavor to create an environment for non literates to continue their learning in literacy classes. SRC Dispur conduct some basic literacy classes to support SLMA in four SBM Districts. Till date 7000 non literate are adopted by SRC Dispur and made literate and certified by NIOS. During this Financial Year 1580 are enrolled under SRC Dispur. The intervention in SAGY villages are creating awareness, convergence with PRI and to all Voluntary Teachers and preroks of SAGY Villages, timely support of some TLM to learners and constant monitoring and support for 100% literacy. Achieved 68.35% literacy in SAGY Villages. Out of 12384 non literates identified in SAGY, 8465 have declared passed by NIOS upto march 2016 and others are going to appear in the next NIOS to make 100% literacy in SAGY Villages. SRC Dispur has established and strengthen eight AEC as model for others. The prime concern of SRC Dispur is to do some Action research on issues of literacy and it is our great achievement that we have completed two of our action research work during FY 2015-16 named “Identification of Local dialects and possibility of developing special primer on each dialect” and “Role and Responsibilities of PRI functionaries in SBM ( A critical analysis of practical implementation of the concept with special reference to Dhuburi district)”. Another major achievement of SRC Dispur is that development and production of resource books of social issues of witch hunting, women violence, women health. Two graded material of three in each subject named “Health” and “Swatchata”. Translation of Handbooks for preraks on IPMC developed by NLMA was also done during 2015-16 FY A series of training programmes for its functionaries and also for district level and block lever coordinators have been organized to capacitated them in the literacy/empowerment process. Publication of annual report and newsletter one in English and one in Assamese are also regularly publishing by SRC Dispur. Assamese Newsletter is for neo literates to continue learning. Translation of equivalency primer in Bengali medium for open basic literacy is also one of the great achievement of SRC Dispur.

Name: STATE RESOURCE CENTRE UTTAR PRADESH
Major_Activities1: Major Activities - (1) Curriculum & Material Preparation in the area of Literacy and its allign subjects. (2) Training and Orientation of Literacy Functionaries. (3) Research Evaluation and Monitoring of Literacy Programme and other projects, conducts impact studies. (4) Organize general activities like - Financial Literacy, Legal Literacy, Environmental Literacy, etc. Achievements - (1) During 2013-14 SRC, U.P. had been assigned responsibility of organising Island of Success. There were 5 districts namely - Basti, Deoria, Fatehpur, Unnao and Varanasi undertaken. 627 Villages of adopted 5 districts. Initial target was to literate 3,39,936 persons whereas 2,99,990 had been made successfully literate. As an outcome 90% success achieved. (2) During 2014-15 special drive were organised in Pachpedwa Block of District Balrampur and Gilaula Block of District Shravasti. Initial target was 3000 in each Block. As an outcome 100% success had been achieved during 2014-15. (3) SRC, U.P. had initiated an innovative Campaign first time in entire country Suraksha Bandhan Video Rath Yatra. As an outcome 95042 number of persons were covered. (4) Live Video Coverage of Suraksha Bandhan Rath Yatra had been included in the NLMA documentary Suraksha Se Samajik Suraksha included in the NLMA documentary displayed on the occassion of International Literacy Day on 8th September 2015 in Vigyan Bhavan, New Delhi. (5) As per NLMA instruction SRC, U.P. had been assigned to initiate action for 100% Literacy in SAGY Villages. SRC, U.P. had adopted 30 SAGY Villages out of 93 SAGY Villages in entire U.P. during 2015-16. The initial target was 17,718 as an output 14,240 successfully appeared. Highest target was adopted in all SRCs. Outstanding activities like - Training of DC, BC and Preraks of entire 93 SAGY Villages and distribution of publicity material were also given. (6) Puppet Shows, Street Plays, Awareness Rallies, Wall Writing and Coordination meetings were undertaken as a massive campaign to make conducive environment for achieving 100% literacy target. (7) State Literacy Award 2016 was given to 10 Preraks of SRC, U.P. adopted SAGY Villages in the district of Varanasi, Chandauli, Mahoba, Mathura, etc.

Name: jan Shikshan Sansthan Latur
Major_Activities1: JAN SHIKSHAN SANSTHAN LATUR (MH) Jan Shikshan Sansthan is a scheme of Ministry of Human Resources Development. Department of School Education and Literacy. Government of India and continuing in 271 districts of Different States of India. Jan Shikshan Sansthan Latur is Working Since May 2009 under the ages of Shri. Balaji Shikshan Prasarak Mandal Ambajogai Dist Beed establish by Shri. Rajkishor Kantaprasad Modi this Jan Shikshan Sansthan working in Latur District of Marathwada Reason which is one of the most backward area of India. The area of Latur District is about 7157 Sq Km and population is around 2454196 the objective of Jan Shikshan Sansthan Latur is Skill Development and life enrichment education of those who are in the age group of 15-40 year having no of rudimentary levels of education. The target group of Jan Shikshan Sansthan is schedule Castes, Schedule Tribes, Other backward Class and Minorities. Jan Shikshan Sansthan Latur in working in two directions Providing Vocational Courses and 2) Organizing awareness programs in rural areas to aware people on various national and local issues. The Jan Shikshan Sansthan is providing long and short duration vocational training programs in more than 30 different trades in rural areas as per the needs of villagers and as availability of resources of the district. The important long duration courses consist of 6 month and short duration courses consist of 3 or less than 3 months. The important long duration courses are dress making, cutting and tailoring. Fashion disengaging, Beauty Culture, and Healthcare and short duration courses are Jute craft. Hand embroidery, Machine embroidery, Zari Zardozi and ari work, Fabric Painting, etc. Since 2009 Jan Shikshan Sansthan Latur has provided training to more than 15400 rural and urban areas youths including male and female. Most of the youth are self reliant and earning good amount of money under the awareness programs Jan Shikshan Sansthan organized various activities such as Ambedkar Jayanti (14 April), No Tobacco Day (31 may), International Environment Day (5 June), World Population (11 July), International Literacy Day (8 Sept.), Gandhi Jayanti (2nd Oct.), National Youth Day (12Jan.), International Women’s Day ( 8 March ), Personality Development for Resource Persons Ex trainees meet and some other activities related to health, drinking water and sanitation etc. Apart from this Jan Shikshan Sansthan played a significant role to implements programs of Central Government such as Sakshar Bharat, Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana, Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana, and Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojna. Swakshar Bharat Abhiyan, Sansad Adarsh Gram Yojana etc.

Name: Shanti Bhavan Educational Trust
Major_Activities1: Shanti Bhavan is a unique and free residential school of excellence in Tamil Nadu for children from extremely poor backgrounds. Their parents are rag pickers, sewage workers, quarry labourers, house maids and without intervention they will go on to those same careers trapped in a cycle of poverty reinforced by barriers of class, education and geography. Every year we take twelve girls and twelve boys at the age of four for admisssion and our total enrollment is three hundred and fifty students. The Shanti Bhavan Educational Trust offers free high quality education for its students both at its residential school and subsequently at top tier college. we follow the ICSE and ISC curriculum a challenging set of quidelines and examinations usually reserved for elite preparatory schools. Our Students are given the skills and education to compete and excel at the very highest of levels. Shanti Bhavan is more than a school. It is a unique approach for educating poor children. Our commitment goes beyond education. In addition to their academics our children are treated to a program of complete holistic care carefully structured to teach them about arts,sports,leadership and world cultures. we provide complete medical and residential services to each child offering them the kind of environment they need to flourish. In total this is a seventeen to nineteen years of intense intervention per child from age four to twenty three. Our model has shown that by providing children with the tools to succeed at a very high level and by instilling in them the values of civic engagement that they then become change makers themselves going on to help their families,communities and other children in need. It takes just that one generation to break the cycle of poverty for these families. No other model of educational intervention commits the same level of long term and quality investment in the lives of children or holds more promise for their futures and those of their families. All children in the first nine batches of tenth graders passed ICSE examination in first class with majority of them getting distinctions. The seven batches that have graduated from twelfth grade in the ISC examination have also received first class and distinction. These children are studying in colleges of excellence including National law school Bangalore and Kolkata, Christ College, Mount Carmel College, Reva Univeristy, BMS Institute of Technology. Four batches of our students who graduated with Bachelor Degrees are working in multinational companies such as Goldman Sachs, Capgemini, Mercedes Benz, Deloitte, Infosys, Amazon, Yahoo, ANZ Grindlays etc.

Name: Sanjukta Yuba Sangathan
Major_Activities1: Sanjukta Yuba Sangathan (SYS) completing its 24 years of excellence has proved itself as a notable foundation in the state of Odisha itself. Giving focus to the issues like health, women empowerment, education, environment, gender equity, micro finance SYS has reached to the people of every sphere of the society. From its inception it has been working in carrying out with different kinds of government and non-government projects. At present SYS has developed a platform in the name of Shanti Tapoban Ashram which is established in a beautiful natural atmosphere. This stunning atmosphere of Shanti Tapoban Ashram draws its attention to the people from many dimensions. In this campus there are three wings named Matruchhaya (Swadhar Shelter Home), Banaprastha (Old Age Home) and Mahila Talim Pathshala. Matruchhaya since its conception of 2009 has placed itself as a notable foundation for women’s empowerment in this district. As the name reflects to mother’s shade it has proved to be a stage where the women from difficult circumstances are provided with shelter and are rehabilitated successfully. It has drawn its attention to its beautiful environment where the women are engaged with different kinds of developmental activities. Here they are not only provided with shelter and proper care but also they are given different types of trainings like broom making, candle making, paper bag making, tailoring and teaching related to women empowerment, spiritual and moral values, yoga, pranayam etc. In this atmosphere the necessity of a family life which is the bond of love and affection is also taught to the inmates. There is Amar Hendshel Baer-in regional language (kitchen garden) is developed with the active involvement of the inmates where many kinds of vegetables are cropped according to the season. Matruchhaya’s contribution to the field of women empowerment is well acknowledged by the government and other agencies located in the district as well in the state. It has reached to the women living in the stage of distress and showed them the appropriate path for their future betterment. At present 47 numbers of inmates with 5 numbers of children are staying in this shelter home. The depressed individuals who are deserted from their so called civilized offspring are looked after with proper care, love and belongingness in the Banaprastha. SYS has formed a platform for the elderly mass named Baristha Nagarik Sangha which is engaged for the welfare of the elderly. Since 2012 the International Elderly Day is celebrated in the campus of Ashram and created a distinguished set up in the state. Mahila Talim Pathshala is a platform where the girls and women from nearby villages as well as from all over the district are given vocational training. Besides it they are also provided with the teaching related to social service, spirituality (Srimad Bhagbat Geeta), promotion of Ayurveda, women’s security law etc. SYS seeks support from the private donations to run the Banaprastha (Old Age Home) and Mahila Talim Pathshala. The support from the District Red Cross Society to the Mahila Talim Pathshala is one of the notable views in this regard. There are 10 inmates staying in this home and 20 numbers of students are the part of the Mahila Talim Pathshala. Many programs are held in the natural atmosphere of Shanti Tapoban Ashram with gathering of the people from different facets. The program named Jagruti Divas which is organized here in every Sankranti of the month drag attention of the public from different parts of Odisha state. Besides these 18 numbers of festivals including the national events and regional cultural fests are also part of it. Last but not the least Sanjukta Yuba Sangathan (SYS) requires optimum focus from the civilized mass. It needs support from the government for its better functioning.

Name: SHIJA FOUNDATION
Major_Activities1: SMILE TRAIN SHIJA CLEFT PROJECT Providing free operation to patients with cleft lip and palate under the sponsorship of Smile Train Inc., USA, through Shija Hospitals and Research Institute Pvt. Ltd., as sister concern of Shija Health Care and Research Institute (SHCRI). The Smile Train Project started on 9th June 2006 and has successfully operated more than 3500 patients free of cost. We have been working on ensuring that the benefit of the project reaches to the masses of the North-Eastern part of India & even to the extent of Myanmar. Mission Myanmar on 23rd 24th &25th of May 2013 and on 20th 21st 22nd of March 2014. Where in 87 & 27 free cleft surgeries were respectively performed successfully. Various initiatives that have been undertaken till date are listed below: - Mission Barak. - Mission Nagaland. - Mission Ukhrul. - Mission Senapati. - Mission Myanmar. - Mission Churachandpur. SHIJA BLOOD BANK & TRANSFUSION SERVICES Shija Blood Bank & Transfusion Services is the only licensed blood bank accredited by the National Accreditation Board for Hospitals & Healthcare Providers (NABH) in North Eastern states. It is equipped with Nucleic Acid Test (NAT) facility to screen HIV, Hepatitis B & C Virus which is the first installation in the entire Eastern India. SHIJA VITAMIN ANGELS PROJECT It is a project to provide free Vitamin A supplements and Albendazole to all children between 6 months and 5 years of age. Implemented effectively from January 2015. It is a collaborative effort of Shija Health Care and Research Institute (SHCRI) and Vitamin Angels, a US based NGO, and a simple cost effective dose of vitamin A every six months can prevent blindness and reduce under-five child mortality by 24% in at risk populations. Vitamin A Deficiency (VAD) is the most common cause of preventable blindness in children under five and reduction of VAD has a vital role in maintaining eye health and vision, growth, and immune function. Free Vitamin A for children between 6 months and 5 years and Albendazole for children between 1 year and 5 years is distributed in various camps and are also available on all days at Shija Hospitals & Research Institute, HealthCity Langol. SHIJA VITAMIN ANGELS PROJECT has distributed 948 bottles of Vitamin A (100,000 IU) (1 bottle =500 doses), 960 bottles of Vitamin A (200,000 IU) (1 bottle =500 doses) and 858 bottles of Albendazole (400 mg) (1 bottle =500 doses) till date. SHIJA EYE CARE FOUNDATION Founded: Year 2007 Shija Eye Care Foundation has operated more than 20000 cataract surgeries till date. We also conduct various Eye Screening camp on the average of 7 to 8 camps per month in rural and remote areas of Manipur to cater the underserved region. The detected patients for surgeries especially the cataracts are provided transportation to and from base hospital, free stay for two nights . Shija Eye Care Foundation-an initiative (Mission for Vision – Myanmar) held from 25/12/ 2013 to 29/12/ 2013where in 179 cataract surgeries were performed free of cost by a team from Shija Eye Care Foundation at Monywa General Hospital, Sagaing region. Shija Eye Care Foundation has been contributing the 60% to 70% of cataract surgeries from the total 30000 operable cases of Manipur. But the overall backlog is increasing by years as we cannot operate more then 3500-4000 per year. Shija Eye Care Foundation also has been certified for cornea transplantation by Directorate of Health Services Manipur on 22nd April 2016.
