Name: Shroffs Foundation Trust
Major_Activities1: Shroffs Foundation Trust was instituted in 1980 as a result of philanthropic endeavor of Shroff family, leading industrialists from Gujarat. The trust has been actively working in tribal area of Chhota Udepur since 1995 and has implemented various developmental programs related to water and soil conservation, agriculture improvement, health, education, literacy, handicraft development, animal husbandry and various income generation activities in about 1058 villages in Vadodara district and Banni area in Kutch district in Gujarat To achieve its goal of providing self-supporting development benefits in the tribal area, the trust operates out of four centers, Rangpur and Pavijetpur in Chhota Udepur, Ekalbara in Padra in Vadodara district and Banni in Kutch district of Gujarat with its head quarters at Kalali, Vadodara. The trust also believes in institution building and cooperative development. 24 bedded Ramkrishna Paramhans Hospital at Kalali offers quality health services at affordable rate to poor and needy patients since 2004. Sanjeevani Dialysis Unit set up in 2009 with 4 Hemo-Dialysis machines offer dialysis at half the regular rate. Equipped with modern equipment, pathology laboratory, physiotherapy unit, a pharmacy, RKPH treats about 7,000 patients a year through specialists in various fields. Swami Vivekanand Krushi Seva Kendra established to cater to the needs of the farmers, provides technology, guidance and material inputs and supports them on day to day bases through helpline. The objective is to help farmers reduce the agro input cost and aim for higher yield and better quality output, strengthening market linkages to fetch better rates for their products. Since its inception in 1998, so far it has helped about 11,000 farmers. Vivekanand Institute for Self Help founded in 2003 has been training cross section of the society, especially those belonging to rural areas. It functions with the view to build capacities of all the stake holders to maximize the benefits of developmental projects undertaken, by GO/NGOs. So far it has trained about 10,000 people through about 400 training programs in various areas. Shroffs Foundation Trust (SFT) through its various health related projects like HIV, AIDS awareness has reached out to about 1,40,000 youth. It conducted District Situational Analysis in 128 villages of 13 blocks in Vadodara district to identify hot spot villages. Through RCH II program it has reached out to people of about 50 villages covering population of 37,000. SFT imparted capacity building training to 3400 women belonging to Matru Mandals at Anganwadi level in Kutch district. Under Literacy Campaign initiated in 2006, it has so far trained 4050 women. Under various Livelihood Security programs, 2784 women and 72 youth have been trained. Shardadevi Gramudhyog Co-op Society an outcome of SGSY project and Vivekanand Gobar Bank Co-op Society are the typical examples of cooperative movement for income generation.71 families have been provided cooking gas through Bio-gas plant. Safe drinking water has been provided in 147 villages and Water and Sanitation Management programs have been implemented in 61 villages. Rooftop rainwater harvesting was done in 20 schools in Kutch district. Year after year the trust is gaining new grounds through expansion of its infrastructure, covering new areas geographically and introducing much needed services to reach out to more and more people.

Name: kripa foundation
Major_Activities1: Kripa Foundation is the largest Non–Governmental Secular and Indian Organization, under the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment Govt. of India, helping people suffering from Chemical Dependency and HIV Infection. Kripa Foundation offers a non-discriminating, supportive Community Living, helping people to introspect and bring about change in lifestyle. The Organization began in Bandra in 1981 with three patients in residence and a priest, a doctor and a recovering alcoholic as a role model for recovery and sobriety. Since then this Public Charitable Trust has grown to 58 facilities in 11 States in India, namely Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka, Manipur, Meghalaya, Nagaland, West Bengal, Assam, Gujarat, Delhi, U.P. of which Mumbai, Goa, Imphal, Kohima and Shillong are aided through Union Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment MSJE), Government of India grants. The remaining centres are aided by National and International Donors. Kripa Institute of Training is at the forefront in training facilitators in Chemical Dependency and Rehabilitation and offers a broad spectrum of services to the community and facilitates the police, educational institutions and other academic institutions that are involved in Human Services. A major area of work involves interaction with industry in terms of Occupational Health Care Program which is comprehensive and addresses them in confidentiality. Kripa Institute of Research is recognised as a Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation under the Department of Science and Technology. The research work aims at understanding the disease parameters, personality profiles, impact on social mores, family units and industry, therapeutic aspects, intervention methodologies and holistic considerations related to lifestyle change. Although Kripa Foundations first foray into the field of HIVAIDS was in the year 1981, it is now embarking on a vast activity directly related to HIVAIDS care. This activity is in the form of composite replicable projects at various Kripa activity locations. Under Kripa AIDS the first initiative is the formation of the Vasai Region AIDS Control society VRACS. VRACS is sole private sector modelled project y collaboration between organizations. Based on SMART Surveillance Monitoring and care Awareness and Training service. It is steered by the academic backing of University of South Floridas CHART Centre for Health and HIVAIDS research and Training India programme.

Name: Centre for Human Genetics
Major_Activities1: The Centre for Human Genetics is a centre for research, education and training in areas which lie at the interface of modern genetics and medicine. Besides research and teaching, the Centre provides comprehensive clinical services for a range of genetic disorders and inborn errors of metabolism. During the past few years the Centre’s scientists and clinical geneticists have provided diagnostic and counselling services to over 15,000 families with genetic disorders. With generous assistance from the Government of Karnataka, the Centre provides these services free of cost to BPL families seen at the Indira Gandhi Institute of Child Health and other government-funded hospitals. The Centre conducts intensive short-term courses and training programmes in human disease genetics which routinely attract young scientists and clinicians from across the country. The Centre has been assisting medical colleges in several district headquarters in Karnataka to set up their own basic facilities for diagnosis and management of the more common genetic disorders. The Centre’s scientists are also engaged in developing low-cost strategies for diagnosis and therapy suitable for local requirements. Under its ‘Public Engagement with Genetics’ programme, CHG provides assistance to parent support groups for families with genetic disorders. CHG is involved in improving public awareness of the ethical, legal and societal issues surrounding advances in human genome research. The Centre is located in a 20-acre institutional area within a 80-acre Biotech Park being developed by the Government of Karnataka in Electronics City in south Bangalore. IBAB, an institution specializing in Bioinformatics, and a Bio-IT Centre promoted jointly by the Ministry of IT, Government of India and the Government of Karnataka are next door. The Centre for Human Genetics is an academic partner in the Bio-IT Centre, which is equipped with NGS platforms. BBC, the Bangalore Bioinnovation Centre, is located behind CHG’s laboratories. There are two health universities and several major hospitals in south Bangalore, among them NIMHANS, St. Johns and the Indira Gandhi Institute of Child Heath. There is also a “Health City” coming up nearby, which includes Narayana Hrudayalaya and the new Mazumdar-Shaw Cancer Center. CHG’s present location therefore provides obvious advantages for postgraduate teaching and research in Human Genetics. A post-doctoral Fellowship programme in Paediatric Genetics is being conducted by the Centre in collaboration with the Indira Gandhi Institute of Child Health. The Centre offers a two-year Master’s degree programme in Human Disease Genetics under the aegis of Mysore University. The latter is a blend of formal teaching, laboratory exercises, case studies and activity-based learning. It provides hands-on training in human genetics via a combination of cell and molecular biology, genetics and clinical biology, including the use of statistical techniques. This interdisciplinary course has been designed to bridge the gap between clinical and basic biology.

For the school students interactive sessions are applied to energize them and show them the way to understand altruism, compassion and mindfulness. The Foundation has also organized/facilitated seminars, lectures with the participation of eminent scholars, scientists and religious leaders to understand the natural world by way of objective, quantitative measurements using the instrument of technology. The Foundation also organizes talks and discussions on gaining and sharing insights covering various topics viz. development, effects of global warming, caring for patients etc. and activities connected with Peacebuilding, Nonviolence and co-existence, ethics and education.

Name: Bharat Vikas Viklang Nyas
Major_Activities1: Bharat Vikas Viklang Punarvas Kendra & Sanjay Anand Viklang Hospital cum Research Centre, Patna has established in Dec. 1999 by Bharat Vikas Viklang Nyas, registered under Indian Trust Act 1860. It was started with a very small space. After providing services to Divyang, it was decided to enlarge the scope of Divyang-Seva. Foundation was laid in the year 2005 at Mohall- Pahari, (Patna-Gaya Road, Patna) in our land 616 sq. mtr. by the then Governor of Bihar Mahamahim Dr. M. Rama Jois, Es-chief Justice of Punjab & Haryana High Court. This centre started functioning in present building with Prosthesis & Orthosis Dept. in Dec. 2005. The correctional surgery unit for Polio & deformity effected children started functioning in year 2008. Our free of cost seva is targeted to the socially & economically backward & downtrodden. Our Hospital is equipped with state of art techniques under the guidance of super specialists. This hospital provide services in Prosthesis, Orthosis, Hearing impaired (Audiology) Physiotherapy, Occupational Therapy, Correctional Surgery, OPD facility carry out research oriented services. On ever of 17th foundation celebration in the month of Dec. 18th 2016, we have dedicated one world class workshop for manufacturing artificial limbs & support for serving suffering humanity. Under the technical guidance from M/S Ottobock, a German Company & world leader in this field, we have started this. It has inaugurated by Sri Thawar Chand Gehlot, Union Minister for Social Justice & empowerment & Sri Ravishankar Prasad, Minister for Law & Justice & Minister of Information Technology, Govt. of India. Till March 2016 we have provided artificial support to 28893 patients & 6108 patients with corrective, club foot & Polio surgery. Our Hospital is earnestly dedicated to seva with a mission. Our mission is to eradicate orthopaedically handicapped problem from Bihar.

Major_Activities1: Sustainable Livelihood Program Training Program on Terra-cotta funded Council for Advancement of People and Rural Technology (CAPART-A cell of Ministry of Rural Development, Government of India) • Supported by CAPART, Regional cell, Uttar Pradesh (North Zone) of Ministry of Rural Development, Government of India under ARTS scheme. • The program has been being implemented in 4 villages of Block-Chinahat, Uttar Pradesh, India. • The Project Title is “The Enhancement in the Basic Skill of Terra cotta, its Diversification and Decoration” • We started the program initially with 50 Beneficiaries. Training Program on Embroidery (Handicraft) • The organization is working in 2 GPs of Bakshi-Ka-Talab, District-Lucknow and 1 GP of Block-Nindura, District-Barabanki with embroidery artisans to make them more competitive and sustainable. • SRIJANA is working with artisans to assist them in such a way that they become able establish their own unit which will provide self employment. • Women artisans are the main focus of our intervention. • We are doing continuous market research to assist our artisans to become more compatible to get better market accessibility. Natural Resource Management NEAC Program (Climate Change, Household Composting, Plantation and Rural Energy) funded by Indian Environment Society (A Cell under Ministry of Environment and Forest) • Supported by Indian Environment Society (A Cell under Ministry of Environment and Forest). • NEAC program Organized in Baksi Ka Talab covering 4 GPs, Uttar Pradesh, India. • Climate Change, Household Composting, Plantation and Rural Energy have been the major theme of project intervention. • Mass awareness and technology demonstration have been one of our important activities. Sustainable Scientific and Advanced Agriculture Technology Dissemination Program • The organization is working in 6 villages of 3 GPs of Block-Nindura, District-Barabanki in Uttar Pradesh, India. • The Farmers Technology Dissemination Groups have been established in the village for various techniques, training and demonstrations. • Small and Marginal Famers are the major target for project intervention. • To promote the eco-friendly sustainable agriculture with decreasing cost of cultivation and enhancing production etc are the main focus of our intervention. Disaster Management Awareness Program • We are organizing camp, workshop, meeting in our operational area. • We started the Program by analyzing our aims and objectives to the community leader, Gram Pradhans, PRI members, CBOS to prepare the community to fight from these sudden changes being happen in our Environment. Water Harvesting and Water Conservation Program • In order to mitigate the scarcity of water for both the purposes drinking and Irrigation the organization is working in the area of water conservation and water harvesting the organization is working in 2 GPs of Block-Sidhauli, Distirict-Sitapur and 3 GPs of Block-Nindura, District-Barabanki in Uttar Pradesh, India. • The training on techniques being imparted are based on improving the efficiency of water use, and by reducing its loss due to evaporation, we can reduce water demand. Program on Alternative Energy Resources • SRIJANA is working on alternative energy like Biomass, Bio-gas Plant, Solar Power, cultivation of Bio-energy resources to mitigate the scarcity using local resources. • Community sensitization, Technology demonstration and Technology Dissemination are the main focus of our activities. Health Hygiene and Sanitation Protection of Aids Awareness Program • We are rendering our services in the area of awareness generation about STDs/HIV/AIDS, Counseling for improving Couple Relationship, Condom Promotion and distribution of literature etc through One to One and One to Group, Audio visual shows, Street Plays, Panchayat Sensitization Program and various other methods. • SRIJANA has been implementing a comprehensive HIV/AIDS prevention program through targeted interventions with the mobile population of truckers and their families CSWs, MSMs, the transgender population and young people. Promotion of Naturopathy Yoga, Proper Nutrition and Revitalization of Tradition Health System Program • The organization is consistently working in the field Naturopathy, Yoga, Proper Nutrition & Revitalization of Traditional Health System at it registered office and in the operational area. • We are serving the community through organizing camp, workshop, counseling, audio-visual show and distributing literature. • Naturopathy is a system of therapy and treatment which relies exclusively on natural remedies, such as sunlight, air, water, supplemented with diet and therapies such as massage. • The one of the main objectives of our interventions is to strengthen the healing ability. Family Planning and Reproductive Child Health Program • SRIJANA is working with community in its operational area to aware them about various method of contraception for a small, economically and socially sustainable family. • We are working with our community to develop better system of pre and post maternal care. • One of the major objectives of the intervention is to decrease the child mortality and abnormalities. • SRIJANA is mobilizing the community to become more sensitive towards the care of pregnant woman to get a healthy child. Total Sanitation and Rural Hygiene Awareness Program • The organization is working in 2 GPs of Block-Chinhat, District-Lucknow and 2 GPs of Nindura, District-Barabanki on “Total Sanitation Campaign (TSC)”. • SRIJANA emphasizes more on Information, Education and Communication (IEC), capacity development of community and awareness generation. Women and Child Welfare Program Women Empowerment Program • SRIJANA has realized that no change can be brought in until we include women empowerment in our every program. • Women have been major beneficiaries of our interventions those who are disadvantaged, marginalized and in difficult circumstances. • The organization is rendering its services through camps, workshop and training programs. • SRIJANA mobilizing the women community in order to become aware about their rights, economically and socially viable. Integrated Program for Street and Working Children • SRIJANA are working with the children having no homes and family ties, Children living in slums, children of sex workers and children of pavement dwellers. • We support these children for providing shelter, nutrition, health care, sanitation and hygiene, safe drinking water, education and recreational facilities and protection against abuse and exploitation. Other Program Interventions • Integrated Development Program for OBC/SC/ST • Promotion of Culture and Traditional Art • Consumer Awareness Program • Promotion of Youth and Adolescent Activities • Handicapped Welfare Program • Protection of Human Rights

Name: Indian Institute of Cerebral Palsy
Major_Activities1: History, Mission and Vision IICP’s mission is to work for equal rights and opportunities for persons with disabilities, particularly CP, and its vision is to facilitate an inclusive society Focus of IICP’s work IICP’s main focus is on the removal of barriers that prevent persons with CP and other neuro-motor disabilities from participating in all aspects of life and gaining access to human and constitutional rights. Growth, Current Programmes and Accomplishments Since 1974 IICP has pioneered services to cater to the needs of persons with cerebral palsy across all age groups. Starting with a special school for children with cerebral palsy in 1974 when there were none, IICP has pioneered the development of other complementary services, with a life cycle approach. Present Services Centre for Special Education for 165 children with CP, a NIOS offering Open Basic Education, secondary and senior secondary level courses. Early Intervention Clinic for babies under three years of age & Family Services for children aged 3 years +) with medical clinics, emphasizing advice and guidance for home management. Approximately 900 families a year are served through these services including around 225 families with children less than two years of age. Community Based Services Training courses at a degree and certificate level in collaboration with Jadavpur University and Rehabilitation Council of India Vocational Training Centre for adults with disability Adult Day Centre for adults with severe physical and complex communication impairments and those who have associated severe to profound intellectual disability (no upper age limit) Respite services for children (above 10 years of age) and adults with cerebral palsy (there is no upper age limit). ANKUR IICP’s Advocacy Group for adults with disability was formed with the motto, ‘Nothing about us without us” and is committed to active participation in the disability rights movement. State Nodal Agency Centre (SNAC) of the National Trust Jugnu Sishu Vikas Kendra – an afternoon playschool and nutrition programme for 75 children from nearby slums including 10 children with disability Roshni, National Resource Centre for Augmentative and Alternative Communication Information Communication Technology (ICT) for persons with complex communication needs Ongoing - Action research and assistive technology development Ongoing - All services include hydrotherapy, multi-sensory stimulation, physiotherapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy and social service support. Each service model including Community Services and the National Resource Centre for AAC is used for training and demonstration and has been successfully replicated - in essence and philosophy but with regional and environmental variations - in 16 organisations in 11 states. IICP’s input to these affiliates is solely in training and capacity building. Awards Received 2004: Best Institute for Disability – National Award from MSJE 2004: “Outstanding” Training Centre – Accreditation by RCI 2004: Best Respite Service – National Trust 2004: State Award for Best Barrier free Environment 2006: Best SNAC – National Trust 2009: Jeeja Ghosh and Saswati Acharya - Role Model Awards (PwD), State Welfare Department of WB 2010: Sudha Kaul, Vice Chair awarded the Padmashree 2011, 2012: Best Awareness Programme (Badhte Kadam) - National Trust (IICP as SNAC)

Name: Nava karnataka social service Trust
Major_Activities1: Educational Programme: A total number of 1500 children have been enrolled in this programme. Out of the students enrolled about 95% of the students are appearing for their examinations. One of the main features of this programme is that all children are being provided with school uniforms, books, fees and other stationeries free of cost. Value Education: Is a Unique educational programme conducted thrice a week for about 100 children. Classes are conducted separately for primary, middle and high school students. The sessions with a theoretical introduction to values and moral ethics and its practical application after which classes in spoken English, General Knowledge are being taught. Talented children participate in extra curricular activities . One of these students had an opportunity to give a Television Programme at Chennai. The main motive is to educate the children in all aspects. Health Programme: About 4000 people are registered and are benefited. There is regular check up by the Doctor once in a week, free medicines are provided. Regular awareness is given on consumption of nutritious food, hygiene etc. Includes awareness in AIDS (HIV), STD, awareness on T.B. and Medical Checkups for poor are organized. The medical checkups are made as the patient visit the clinic and hospitals and also as and when, with the help of the membership card issued to them. Women Sanghas: There are 50 Women Self Help Groups functioning under NKSST. The women conduct weekly meetings on various aspects like Self-Help Groups SHG). Benefits of SHGs: enhancement of self esteem, community development, health, hygiene, family budgeting and savings. We also Undertake Community Development Activities like • Laying of Roads, • Erecting of electrical poles, • Cleaning of drainages • Regular cleaning and spraying of DDT and • Fixing and repairing of bore wells. Public Awareness: Demonstration of Hygiene to women, youth and children who also took part in a procession organized by us to make the people of the locality understands the importance of cleanliness. We had staged dharna (Protest) for the roads to be laid, proper drainage and waste picking, which enhance public cleanliness. Provisions: In this programme, we provide 5-8 Kgs of Rice for 500 families who are very poor (who cannot afford to their basic food need) and who had acquired the membership card in our Trust. This Rice is provided on the 25th of every month. Issue of Sewing Machines: Since inception NKSST has issued 25 Sewing machines (Tailoring machines) to the underprivileged individuals. The Sewing Machines will be issued every year during the Trust annual day ceremony. Helping the underprivileged for marriages: This Trust is helping the poor who approach us for the marriage of their daughters. This is an unforeseen expense and we need a corpus fund for this purpose. Amount of expenditure is unforeseen and we have arranged corpus funds to met this expenses. Youth Wing: A youth wing is in existence since inception of the Trust to educate, guide, awareness on various activities.

Name: CHAITANYA JYOTHI WELFARE SOCIETY
Major_Activities1: Provision of nutritional support nearly 500 children in 10 Mandals of Nellore District. Mobilization of nutrition support to 300 children through conduction of advocacy activities. Formation of Family Support Groups and Child Support groups in 8 Mandals. Provision of Educational Support, Medical Support to 300 children. Providing of Income Generation Programmes to 150 Members infected and affected with HIV/AIDS. Providing Disaster Preparedness Floating aids material to 600 Task Force Members in 20 Villages of Kota, Vakadu and Chillakur Mandals of Nellore District. We have provided subsidy on Fishing material through conducted advocacy with fisheries departments. Promotion of Income Generative activities and 58 are given in target areas for vegetables business, eggs business, groom stick, rangoli powder, iron shop and other petty traders. Conduction of the PLWHAS family training programme on nutrition food and medical care & personal Hygiene. 179 Children are mainstreamed in the regular school. Sensitization classes on HIV/AIDS and Disability to 280 members. Out Boat Motor Repair Training through Workshop to 60 members in out 5 target villages in two terms Skill up gradation training on Seas Shell Artifacts making to 25 members. Issued Identification Cards to the Sea Shell Trainees by Ministry of Textiles, Govt. of India, New Delhi. 80 adolescent girls are got tailoring training programme under vocational training. 35 beneficiaries received revolving fund amount for fish vending under Livelihoods Sea shell Articraft was started in Anjalapuram and Srinivasa Puram villages. Provided Nutrition food to children aged between 2 ½ to 5 years in our Govindapalli Palem villages of Kota Mandal. 320 adolescent girls have been trained under life skills education 22 pre school children are enrolled in the ECCD center 250 children have become the members in Children clubs and they were supported by sports materials 125 both school going and non school going children got trained in CBDP 60 school children got trained in SBDP 48 preschool children were supported by providing play and educational material 124 school children are benefited by the School Improvement Program (structures, play materials, safe water etc,) 10 school children were supported by Text books under book bank Providing of Computer Training to 35 School Children and 21 Adolescent Children at Thupili Palem Village of Vakadu Mandal of Nellore district. Providing of Village Contingency plan and School Safety Plan in all our target villages Formation of MACTS for fisher folk women in the name of “Chaitanya Mahila Matyakara Paraspara Sahaya Sahakara Parapathi Sangham Ltd” at Duggaraja Patnam. Provision of Revolving fund amount Rs. 3,00,000 to 5 village 1010 Artisans were identified and ID cards were distributed. 10 Languishing handicrafts were identified during survey (i.e.) Wooden Cutlery, Leather Puppetry, Palm leaf craft, Fabric painting, Sea Shell Artifact, lace work, Zeri embroidery work, Wood carving. 85 Self Help Groups were formed 5 Clusters were formed 4 Mutually Aided Cooperative Societies were formed. 1332 artisans were included under JBY scheme. 200 artisan children were identified and provided educational scholarship. 200 Artisan Credit Cards were provided to the 200 artisans. 560 Insurance Coverage through ICICI bank 140 health Claims were provided through ICICI Bank For 10 artisans having Artisan Credit Cards got Rs.20000/- as loan amount from the Government. Under Rajiv Gandhi Janasree Insurance Scheme, 100 artisans were covered. Providing of Loan Revolving fund to 2422 members nearly Rs. 22433000 through HDFC Bank Nellore.

Name: Vudhavi Karangal Boys Home
Major_Activities1: Vudhavi Karangal Samuganala Thodar Kalvi Iyakkam which was started in the year 1991 and has been effectively functioning for the past 25 years committed to the total transformation of the children from their plight full situation to a law abiding citizen. At present our license strength is 125 children (boys), we have 122 boys in the age group of 5 to 18 years. For the boys above 18 years and who have grown up with us, we have after care facility for doing their higher studies in this academic year 2016 – 17 seven boys are pursuing undergraduate programme (two of them in B.E., and five of them in B.com.,) and five boys are studying in technical education. So far we have totally rehabilitated (Education, employment and Marriage) for 12 of our children. The children in the home are given apart from regular education, music lessons, yoga, martial art, dance and drama. We have a science club functioning within the home premises under the banner “Rakesh Sharma Science Club” under the guidance of Pondicherry Science Forum doing science activities and other related activities to motivate children for learning and reasoning science in day to day life. We have a musical troupe under the name “Kalaimagal Iyal Isai Pattarai” giving public performance in classical instrumental fusion with veena, miruthangam and other percussions, which enable the children to exhibit their hidden talents. It also serves as a therapy to soothe their inner stress of the past life. The journal club is being effectively functioning where children of the home contributed their articles, once in a month and a small hand written magazine is being circulated among the boys to improve their writing skills. The bigger boys above 18 years are motivated to play their part as a responsible citizen by organizing a small group of nearly 12 boys and 5 staffs has formed a blood donor’s unit for donating blood on voluntary basis on emergency call whenever necessary all around the clock. Children are taught to care for environment where they are being trained to make art exhibits from waste materials. They taught to make Puppets and give their own puppets show on environmental topics. Children studying IX std above are being trained in carpenter, welding, electrician, plumbering and book binding. This training are carried out during weekends and vacation. This trainings motivate children to know their full potential and it’s easy for the slow learners to choose their carrier in technical field. The children are given balanced diet prepared in hygienic ways, regular health check-up is carried out in the hostel premises with special camps conducted by specialized hospitals and doctors.

Name: Indian Society of Weed Science
Major_Activities1: It has indeed been a privilege and an honour to serve the Society for the last four years. I enjoyed the wonderful opportunity of working with several distinguished and committed persons, whose support and contribution have largely been responsible in steering the society out of woods and to bring the Society to the present level. Organizing the 25th APWSS Conference at Hyderabad during October, 2016 was of course a key achievement and a personal high point in my career. As you are well aware, the 25th APWSS Conference had many firsts to its credit. It brought us much needed credibility and international recognition to ISWS. It was a huge financial success too. The Society today is in a very strong financial position and could be counted among the top few professional societies in agriculture. Thanks to a large number of our sponsors and other stakeholders, who made this happen. The other achievements of the present EC include, introduction of new guidelines for the ISWS Awards, supporting ISWS State units for organizing local events, creating a corpus to provide travel support for students to attend conferences, supporting young scientists for participation at the International conferences held abroad etc. I took personal interest in getting the website redesigned with many unique user-friendly features. One such feature is the online Directory of members. I request members to update their profile periodically to make it more dynamic and useful. The on-going electronic voting for the election of office bearers of the Society for the year 2017-18 is perhaps the first such attempt for any professional society in the country. This saves time, money and more importantly is transparent and prevents bogus voting. I am sure this will find many followers in NARS. Our persistent efforts towards improving the timeliness and the quality of the Journal have given rich dividends. The handsome rating the Indian Journal of Weed Science got recently from NAAS is a testimony to this. Coming at the end of our tenure, this indeed 2 is icing on the cake. I acknowledge the efforts of the Editorial team led by Dr. Sushilkumar for this accomplishment. If there is one person who could be singled out for the overall success, it is undoubtedly Dr. A.R. Sharma, the Secretary of the Society. I applaud him for his selfless and committed service to the Society. I lay down my office as President of ISWS with utmost satisfaction and many happy memories. I am sure the new Team which will take over the reins soon, will do everything at their command to keep the ISWS flag flying high. I wish them all the success.

Name: Jagadguru Sri Shivarathreeshwara University
Major_Activities1: Jagadguru Sri Shivarathreeshwara University, also known as JSS University, is a deemed university located in Mysore, Karnataka. It was established in 2008 under Section 3 of the UGC Act 1956 and is part of JSS Mahavidyapeetha, which runs a variety of educational institutions. Under the leadership and gracious Patronage and blessings of His Holiness Jagadguru Sri Shivarathri Deshikendra Mahaswamiji , the Chancellor of JSS University and Vice Chancellor, Dr.B. Suresh, a noted multifaceted leader in India, this deemed-to-be university is recognized by both MHRD and NAAC at A Grade, has been focusing more on teaching, research and service, from its inception. Teaching: JSS University is focused on medical and health-related studies, and comprises JSS Medical College, JSS Dental College, JSS College of Pharmacy, the Department of Water and Health, Department of Health System Management Studies and Department of Life Sciences. Thus, JSS University cater Medical, Dental and Pharmacy professionals with knowledge, skills and competencies at global standards with imbibed core values of respect, professionalism, leadership and social responsibilities to meet the health care needs of mankind. Renowned as a destination of learning, research and service the reputation of JSS University has become synonymous with quality education in India and abroad. Research: University has a sharp focus on attracting the best researchers and research students, and on providing them with comprehensive support and motivation. The University combines leading medical research and compassionate patient care to face the world’s most pressing medical challenges. Extensive research studies are being carried out which have a wide ranging impact in the area of management of various communicable and non-communicable diseases. Some of the work done are around, Cancer Stem Cells, Cancer Drug Discovery and Pharmacogenomics, Identification of therapeutic targets, Diabetes Mellitus, cardiovascular diseases, and many more. The research outputs have supported high impact publication in premier scientific journals and have contributed new knowledge to the understanding of newer drugs, therapy and treatment through innovations and patent. Service: JSS Hospital is one of the India’s biggest hospitals (1800 beds) catering to the health care needs of Mysore and the surrounding population. It is a non-profit hospital and is dedicated to serve the poor and downtrodden with affordable and quality healthcare. The motto of the hospital is to uphold the value of human life and provide advanced and affordable healthcare to all sections of the society. Achievements: JSS University is recognized by national and international agencies. Currently the University is recognized by (a) MHRD (is a ranking system not a grading system, Provide year of ranking) and NAAC at A Grade; (b) Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE), USA certification for Pharm-D program; and (c) National Board of Accreditation (NBA, NABL) and ISO-9001:2008. Other notable recognitions include: (a) TIFAC-CORE in herbal drugs approved by DST; (b) BA/BE center approved by DCGI; (c) Drug Testing Laboratory approved by State Government; (d) Faculty Training Centre, Industry Institution Interaction Cell, Entrepreneurship Cell approved by AICTE; and (e) Centre for Advanced Drug Research and Testing (CADRAT) approved by Drug Controller General of India

Name: GURU MAGUNI JENA GOIPUA NUTRYA PARISHAD
Major_Activities1: Introduction to Gotipua Gotipua is a traditional dance form in the state of Odisha inIndia and the precursor of Odissi classical dance. It has been performed in Orissa for centuries by young boys, who dress as women to praise Jagannath and Krishna. The dance is executed by a group of boys who perform acrobatic figures inspired by the life of Radha and Krishna. The boys begin to learn the dance at an early age until adolescence, when their androgynous appearance changes. In the Odia language Gotipua, means "single boy”. Long ago, the temples in Orissa had female dancers known as devadasi (or mahari), who were devoted to Lord Jagannath, which gave rise to Mahari dance. Sculptures of dancers on bas-reliefs in temples in Orissa like Konark Sun temple and Jagannath Temples (Puri) demonstrate this ancient tradition. With the decline of mahari dancers around the 15th century during the reign of Rama Chandra Dev (who founded the Bhoi dynasty), boy dancers known as Gotipua in Orissa continued the tradition. Gotipua dance is a Guru Sisya Parampara system. Today Gotipua dance will be performed by “Guru Maguni Jena Nrutya Parisad, Puri” in which Guru Sri Maguni Jena himself will perform along with his disciples. Under the able supervision of Guru Sri Maguni Jena young boys are given education and trained to become Gotipua dancers and taken care with food and shelter in his Gurukula. Guru Sri Maguni Jena is a disciple of Guru Kelucharan Mohapatra , Guru ramachandra barik, and Guru padmanabha das. He is training Gotipua dancers since last 20 years and trained more than 200 gotipua dancers. His “Guru Maguni Jena Nrutya Parisad, Puri” has performed in many occasions inside India and many countries in abroad such as England, Germany, Italy and many others. Guru Sri Maguni Jena will give vocal with harmonium accompanied by Purnachandra Jena in Pakhaja and Bikram Swain in Kartal. The Gotipua dance will be led by Biswanath Jena with other members Krishna Chandra Biswal, Balia Setti, Tiki Baral, Sumanta Sahu and Sanu Bhatt. The sequence of performance by Gotipuas will be 1: Guru vandana 2: Dasavataram and 3: Bandha dance (acrobatics)

Name: GRAMIN VIKAS YUVA SANSTHAN
Major_Activities1: Major Activities/Achievements : 1.VISION -: GVYS envision a society that is self sufficient and empowered enough to take care of its development needs thereby maintaining a fine balance between the human and environment needs, where each member of the society is equipped with leadership traits and enjoy equal opportunity of participations and continuous growth & development. 2. Mission statement(s) • To identify the poor and marginalized population of the area • To keep a close watch on socio- economic disparities and its impact on partner communities • To take necessary action for environmental conservation through involving local communities and better management of common property resources • To involve specific strategies to mainstream the disadvantaged groups such as women, dalits and other marginalized groups, in the development processes 3. Our Strategies • Awareness Generation on issues of common interest • Institutional Building • Capacity Enhancement • Enhancing knowledge Base of local communities • Public Advocacy • Development Action 4. Our Developmental Objectives • To raise socio-economic status of partner communities through facilitating participatory processes for better management of natural resources and building capacities of community to sustain such processes. • To design and implement programs aiming at enhancement of livelihood opportunities. • Facilitating women empowerment processes through gender sensitization and income generation initiatives. • To undertake specific interventions for promotion and protection of common property resources. • To adapt popular knowledge in our thoughts and actions. • Building capacities of local communities to empower them to participate in the initiatives related to management of natural resource management • Providing leadership training and other capacity building inputs to the rural women, for building their capacities in the direction of decision making and self sufficiency • Involve appropriate actions towards raising the educational and health status of women and children so that they are well placed in development processes • To develop community based institutions. Name: NATYA SHODH SANSTHAN
Major_Activities1: On 19th July,1981, Natya Shodh Sansthan began its journey as a theatre archive from 11 Pretoria Street, Kolkata, as a unit of Upchar Trust with Geeta Sen rendition of Bangla theatre songs as the inaugural programme. Theatre lovers of the city and outside were gradually becoming aware of the meaningful job being done there. At Lee Road, Sansthan housed books, magazines, audio and video recordings, photographs, models of outstanding sets, masks, rare books and materials, Seminars, discussions and talks were regularly organized to record various aspects of histrionics on a pan-Indian level. Sansthans journey reached a milestone when the Government of West Bengal leased 9 cottahs of land to Upchar Trust where Sansthan built Natya Bhavan to continue its activities. In 1996,Girish Karnad, the noted playwright and actor laid the foundation stone of Natya Bhavan. Sri Buddhadev Bhattacharjee, the then Deputy Chief Minister, Govt. of West Bengal inaugurated the new building in 2000, constructed with financial aid from Upchar Trust, the Government of India, Government of West Bengal, Ford Foundation, Trusts and individuals. The year 2006 saw the Sansthan celebrating its Silver Jubilee and the institution has since then moved on to gradually become a research and information centre, documenting the growth and present trends of Indian theatre. Sections in the Archive- 1. Library and Cover-file (Records) with reading room facilities, 2. Audio Library, 3. Video Library, 4. Photograph Library, 5. Research and Publication Section. Heritage Library - Sansthan has set up a Heritage Library, based on the premise that theatre-studies need to be located in the broader canvas of the heritage/history of multiple disciplines of Anthropology, Astronomy, Astrology, Archaeology, Architecture, Culture, Geo-politics, Geography History, Literature, Philosophy, Religion, Sociology, the Arts, both visual and performing etc. With cultural-history being regarded as a rich source of understanding the heritage and the cultural tradition of a country, materials stored in an archive may be made use of in the fullest possible way from a spectators point of view. The Sansthan is setting up a Theatre Museum at Natya Bhavan with financial aid from the Ministry of Culture, Government of India, Under the Museum Grant Scheme.

Name: Society For Peoples Action and Rural Development in Himalayan Area
Major_Activities1: SPARDHA- Society for People’s Action and Rural Development in Himalayan Area was formally registered on 19th November 1994 and initially began work in the field of collecting and marketing of Honey. Since the focus was on introduction of Honey production as an income generating activity, gradually the society began to marshal resources and skills to promote production of Honey in the region. It managed to acquire some land in the industrial area of Almora and constructed a building with its own resources giving enough space to open office and set up a Honey processing plant, which happens to be first of its kind in the entire Uttarakhand with processing capacity of 250 Kg honey per shift. It was designed by Mr Deep Chandra Bisht, the founder of the organization. Actually, he replicated the design, which he saw in Perth, Australia during his Navy days. He was so fascinated by the design that he was determined to replicate it in Almora. Gradually, Society started giving training to the villagers especially women on bee keeping and has successfully trained thousands of people in the region. They are practicing bee keeping and producing honey which is significantly adding to their income leading to socio-economic development of the region. Now with the continuous efforts the society has diversified in different fields like formation and promotion of Self Help Groups, formation of Farmers clubs, formation of Joint Liability groups with the kind support of NABARD etc. Society has become partner of National Institute for Entrepreneurship and Small Business Development and for last 4-5 years has been conducting Entrepreneurship Skill Development Programmes based on different trades like computer hardware and software, Food Processing, Fruit Preservation, carpentry, Fashion Designing, Beautician and Cosmetology etc. Hundreds of unemployed people have been trained on such skills and as a result many of them have taken up entrepreneurship as their career option. Society is providing them help and guidance to set up their enterprise and is all set to coordinate with different departments for providing the potential entrepreneurs know how about schemes meant for self-employment/ entrepreneurship. It has well established links with Khadi Village and Industries Commission (KVIC), the nodal agency for Prime Minister Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP); District Industries Centre (DIC); Khadi and Village Industries Board and different nationalized banks. Society has formed Farmer Clubs comprising progressive farmers of the different development blocks of district Almora, Uttarakhand, with the kind support from National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD). Through farmer clubs many activities like rain water harvesting, organic farming, wild fire extinguishing, awareness programmes on soil health, personal hygiene, sanitation, garbage management and against child marriage, child abuse, sexual harassment of children, human trafficking, child labour etc are being taken up. The society is determined to act on innovative ideas. The region was known for honey production in ancient time but the bees were reared in wall hives not in modern boxes. The Society always wants to preserve the traditional way of bee keeping, as it was developed over centuries keeping in view the climatic conditions of the region by the local people by trial and error method, and was most suitable. The society took-up a project for wall hives modification , under Ajeevika project in district Almora supported by IFAD .

Name: KARTABYA
Major_Activities1: Background “KARTABYA” is a group of new generations who spontaneously donate their leisure and labour for the cause of those who spend their every moment of live through appetite, insanitation, illiteracy, ignorance and poverty. The organization has got its establishment to materialize the dedicated and volunteer attitude of development professionals for the cause of society. Areas of Action ► Socio – economic upliftment of street and slum children. ► Capacity building and empowering the tribal and rural poor. ► Women empowerment ► Rural healthy and sanitation ► Revival of traditional health system. ► Environment protection. ► Self-employment training programme in tribal and rural areas. ► Impact assessment on development interventions COMPOSITE CENTER FOR THE SLUM AND WORKING CHILDREN Community sharing • Entire project activity shared among the slum people so that they became aware on the objectives and expected outcome of the project. • Inputs from the community and the target parents are taken for the sustainability of the project. • It was suggested in the community sharing that the targeted slum children need to be enumerated to know the overall status of the slum children. Formation of committee • A parent committee is being formed in the community. The committee sits once in a month to discuss the underlying problems and possible solutions of checking the slum children from child labour. • Discussions are also made on the issues of street children and what are the step scan be undertaken to check the vulnerability of the street children. It was also discussed in the meeting that part of the activity of the composite center of the slum children should be made for the street children. Education and Main streaming • A community school is running in the slum where 100 children are getting education. Each child is being facilitated for continuation of education. Efforts are being undertaken to mainstream the slum children into the formal education system. Vocational training programme • The vocational need and capacity is identified among the targeted children. Those are eligible to get the vocational training; they are given training on tailoring and appliqué. • Some of the children are also given training on plumbing and carpentry. • Counseling are provided to the parents of the targeted children through a psychologist/counselor of the organization regarding exploitation of children and not to engage them in the wage related activities. Health check up • Regular health checks up camps are being organized for the slum and street children in the target area. Primary treatments are provided to the children during the camp. CAPACITY BUILDING PROGRAMME FOR THE PRIS It is evident that Panchayati Raj Institutions (PRIs) are the key stakeholders in the development process of the state as well as the country. They are placed in an important place which relates the community needs with the government development programmes. Due to lack of capacity of the PRI members and interest on the part of Government officials, PRI functionaries are not able to exercise their power to a great extent. This was the finding from the workshop on PRI, which was conducted in project locations of Keonhar and Nuapara District. The participants of the workshop were the PRI functionaries, community leader and Govt. officials who provided valuable opinions on effective functioning of Panchayats in the state. TRAINING AND CAPACITY BUILDING OF WOMEN In our recent modern society women find little or no space to assert their rights. Their situation is also more vulnerable in the context of globalization. They always fall back in realizing the ultimate outcome of every socio-economic development initiatives undertaken by different agencies. Apart from that there are number of taboos exists in the society which prevents them participate in every sphere of work and also they are not prioritized in compared to male counterparts. Looking into this background the organization has organized a mass community awareness programme on empowerment. The resource persons of the programme conveyed the message on the available entitlements for the women groups and how they can access those benefits without any sort of hurdles. Apart from this they were also oriented on the official procedure on getting those benefits. The outcome of the activity helped the women group to access the schemes implemented by different agencies. Already formed 52 Self-help groups were invited into different phases. They got trained on the book keeping mechanism and they also got the knowledge on the vocational training. There were also subjects covering the marking of the available local products. BRIDGE COURSE PROGRAMME FOR OUT-OF-SCHOOL CHILDREN With an objective to provide education to the out-of-school children, the organization has been assigned by the Govt of orissa to conduct bridge course programme in the slum areas of Bhubaneswar city. In this process, the targeted children are identified with the help of existing education committees of the slum. Thus, the organization has tried to bring the street children into limelight by providing them education, which will enhance their mental ability. At the same time awareness was created among the parents to create demand for education so that they can access basic rights of life. SOCIO-ECONOMIC SURVEY OF THE DISPLACED PERSONS The organization has undertaken a survey of the displaced persons in the nearby areas of the Dhamara port. The objective was to identify the project affected persons to get the compensation amount. The survey questions were prepared by the Dhamara Port Authority, which contained the socio-economic background of the families, their occupational status, land and other details of the target households. Thus based on this survey the authority of the Dhamara port is planning to provide identity cards for the project affected persons so that in future there will be no confusion in receiving compensation amount. CAMPAIGN ON ENVIRONMENT AWARENESS It was felt that environment protection would make the society towards sustainable development. Looking into this the organization has organized a environment awareness campaign with the school students of Bhubaneswar. Students participated in the rally organized by the organization. Leaflets were distributed to create a mass awareness among the general people. There was also a general meeting with the slum community where local resource persons delivered their views on the need for environment protection and how this will save our future generation in the context of growing industrialization. There were also representation of community level leaders, key persons such as teachers and other community members in the general meeting

Name: MAJMAU SSAQUAFATHIL ISLAMIYYA
Major_Activities1: The major obstacle before them is educational backwardness and lack of awareness of pure Maximum number of English schools was established by missionaries in and around Nilambur with mercantile point of view and also to blast out Islamic cultural heritages and its meritorious continuities. MSI English School is a product of deeper thoughts to refute this situation. It aims at educating youngsters and teenagers following the central syllabus itself along with Islamic Studies which is the most effective cotemporary educational network. This institution assures smart classes, well equipped and efficient science and computer labs for every learners from L.K.G to XII. With every swiftness and easiness above 1000 students find out their resort to education Since technical and vocational training is boon Technological application of science is leading every county to its front lore.we aim at moldings a generation of youngesters who are committed experts, technologists coped with values and virtues. It offers course of Architectural Assistantd, Health sanitary inspector, Draughtsman civil. Which are the traders from this engineering non engineering circuit. Students have successfully completed their courses and have achieved high ranks including All India level examination Initially, started with an enrolment of a few Orphans and the destitute , over the years it has grown as a destination of a large number of aspirants for higher education and care for the weaker sections deprived of parents, and close relatives. This Orphans cum Destitute Home addresses all the problems of the inmates food, accommodation, treatment, clothes and education and even placement, etc . The people in the surroundings do support to the noble cause initiated by Majm’a in order to make this institution with more facilities to accommodate more inmates form the state and outside. The children are given value-based education in an conducive cultural ambiance. They are protected from the negative influence of unhealthy and un-Islamic practices inflicted on a major chunk of new generation.

Name: GNANAJYOTHI SAMSTHE Reg
Major_Activities1: We are witnessing hundreds of instances of various types of exploitation of women in the patriarchal society of India, where women are compared respectfully to Goddesses and worshipped. Women are forced to struggle at every step to retain her professional freedom, self-respect and equality with males socially and domestically. In such circumstances this organisation is like an oasis for the downtrodden women (women’s health education and cultural development organisation). This organisation, which was started in 2003-2004 has initiated action in the direction of rescuing and developing the cultural bedrock of law and order of our country. It has formed programmes to deliver the benefit of the Government schemes for backward and downtrodden lot of all communities. It is really a tragedy that a section of the society has to supress their pains and pleasures and struggle for a morsel of food and a piece of cloth. When the founder Secretary and the office bearers of this society started searching for the cause for this, they discovered that it would definitely be possible to bring about a change in their life, if the fundamental facilities like education, employment and privileges provided by the Government. S.J.S.RY.M.C.C. Mysore is the first organisation, in collaborating with J.S.S ShramikVidyapeetha, which provided training to women who were below the poverty line in beautician course, candle making, soap oil, Phenol, preparing different food products in collaboration with CFTRI - which later became MysoreMahilaSamsthe. With the cange of name the area of activity also expanded. Going a step ahead the activities encompassed Adult Education, Tailoring training, Embroidery, Zari work, Mehendi training which inspired way for the self sufficiency of women. Change is not stagnant water. It is like a coursing river. In 2006 – 2007, as per the decision of the executive committee, and after realising that only through imparting knowledge it will be possible to bring changes in the lower strata of the society it was decided to rename the organisation as GnanaJyothiSamsthe. Through this organisation it has been creating awareness to women and men in the 65 wards laying stress on Legal education, health, domestic system, nursing and nourishing children, solid waste management, comfort centre and economic reforms of women. In recognition of this Nehru Yuva Kendra organisation has honoured this organisation by giving award. Later in 2008-2009 the Kitturu Rani Chennamma award of Karnataka Government, which is given to those who have served in the field of women’s upliftment, was given to our founder Secretary SmtHemavathi in recognition of her service. The award was conferred by the Chief Minister Sri.Yediyurappa and Sri Narendraswamy who was the Minister of Women and children development along with the cabinet members in the banquet hall of Vidhanasoudha. After this increased responsibility, the president of our organisation and other office bearers delegated the responsibility of getting the benefits given by the Government offices and expanding the field of work to the Secretary. Many politicians who watched the popularity among the masses, especially women, from close quarters tried to involve her in politics. But she chose social service over politics. Instead she formed many programmes like information about Government scheme to people, counselling, leadership awareness counselling, distribution of tailoring machine to widows, free legal aid to victims of atrocities against women, women related workshops, family counselling etc., and made GnanaJyothiSamsthe synonymous with comfort for the downtrodden women of all the 65 wards, belonging to all communities. It has given solace, avareness, aid, protest and achievement of goal which is recognised by the Suddikaigannadi newspaper which conferred ‘MysoreRatna’ and ‘MysoreNakshatra’ awards. This and the award given by Women and children welfare social welfare departments of Mysore Corporation has helped our organisation create its footprints in the city and towns. ShrimatiHemavathi was chosen as the president of Mysore District Strishakti organisation. This helped her to increase her field of opertions resulting in more stress to monetary empowerment of women, free tuition classes to failed students of SSLC with the collaboration of MysoreCity Corporation, beautician, fashion designing, Spoken English, finding market for the articles produced by women. Recognising the planning and efficiency of our secretary, she was appointed as member of the complaint redressal committee which was formed as per the order of the Supreme Court of India, by the Deputy Commissioner Sri Manivannan. The additional Magistrate Sri Betsurmat provided NanjarajaBahaddurChoultry for 7 days free of cost for creating market for the articles created by the members of the organisation. This helped to inspire women in finding market for their produce. Sri Sureshkumar Law Minister who participated in this program praised that this organisation was a role model for all organisations in the state. As a result of this many eatables were supplied to the canteens of BEML and L&T, and market was provided for the Jariwork and Jariworksarees. Loan schemes from different banks were provided. In this way GnanaJyothiSamsthe has given solace to the backward poor communities, men and women in the districts of Karnataka. This endeavour of providing solace, inspiration is inspired by many officials of the corporation, Corporation commissioner Raikar, Additional District Magistrate Sri Naganayak, several intellectuals, elders, notables and politicians. We request the continuance of their cooperation and assistance for expanding our operation of providing from the affluent to the needy in future. Likewise our organization forwards, in 2010 district welfare center coordinately Mysore allotted places to conduct spoken englingh to these place located students, and conducted about waste management awareness program in bannur town municipal council area on 2012.in the year 2013-14 got an work order about various skill development trainings from VTP Karnataka government implemented and successfully completed. And also conducted thikshna coordinately awareness about mutual funds and banking in Mysore urban areas. In the year 2015 Mysore city corporation coordinately conducted health awareness, sanitation awareness and legal awareness in Mysore sixty five wards. And AIMS coordinately our organization conducted NSDC training related programs. In the year 2016 KVTSDC government of Karnataka various skill development programs conducted by our organization. At the end of year 2016 our organization survey conducted about child labour find out district labour department coordinately. Likewise our organization various department co operatively conducted various social works and providing service to the people honorably. In this way our organization gowned and we gave complete details about our organization.

Name: AMAN TRUST
Major_Activities1: AMAN School is a Well Known Minority Institution in the education hub city Sikar. It is led by the AMAN TRUST, set up in 2006 by the profound educationalists. In 2006-2007 “ AMAN - An English medium Co-educational School” Started with the hope to im-part quality education along with the moral education. It is a center of modern education giving computer education to the utmost care. Lots of Muslims girls and boys take education advantage of each and every government education policy here. In 2007-2008 the government Recognisation was taken in the upper primary section by the education department After it was recogniged in secondary section in 2010-2011. Aman school is now affiliated to the Board of Secondary education Rajasthan. In the year 2016-17 Aman school is raised to the senior secondary school (Art, Science). And of course, it has now been a milestone in the long way of journey. The guardians as well as the children behold this lovely school with keen desire amid placid atmosphere. It has acquired reputation in the following Fields:- (1) Academic Performance The Students of this school gave splendid result in the secondary Board examinations held by the Board of secondary education Rajasthan. Specially, in Sikar, in Muslim Community the students deserve a gallant result so for. Sadiya Khan in 10th Board Obtained 88% and was given the Gargi Award by The Rajasthan Government. Musab Rangrez 88.67% In the National Programmes:- The students of Aman school take part in the cultural Programmes too our National festivals are celebrated with great Pomp and show. A long rally by the students is held every year in support of the mission “Save the Girl – Teach the Girl“ (Beti Bachao - Beti Padhao ) (c) In performing the social duties:- Different seminars, debates free medical camps, distribution of books, woolen clothes etc to the needs students. “Programmes Parindas“ water bowls for the thirsty birds are held by this school. (f) In Functions:- Aman School is known for its remarkable annual function lots of people visit it and admire the hidden talents of students main esteem guest are invited. Special programmes of the patriotic songs and dances folk-dance, rhymes are presented by the students. They are given awards. This Institute has presently gained the minority educational Institute status from Rajasthan Government.

Name: Parvathi Mahabala Shetty Charitable Trust
Major_Activities1: We introduce ourselves as the not for profit Public Charitable Trust set up solely for serving the needy people in the rural area. As a first step we have set up an eye care hospital at Shiroor Village of Udupi Tq and Dist. Karnataka State. Our eye hospital has a floor area of about 8000sq feet spread over two floors with spacious well equipped consultation rooms out patient department, laboratory, 30 bed ward, spacious OT, optical and medicine dispensing counters etc.The setting up of this full-fledged eye care hospital costed us about Rs.3.00crore and we have sourced this fund from the trustees, patrons, family and extended family members and a couple of well-wishers. The hospital was inaugurated on 02/02/2014 and since then we are functioning by extending the following services to the needy people of the surrounding villages. 1) Outpatient services and optical 2) Inpatient and operation service 3) Medical retina service 4) Glaucoma service 5) Outreach programmes a) Screening for cataract operation b) Diabetic retinopathy screening c) School children screening d) Eye health education and awareness programme We would like to state that the entire package of service is totally free to the patients and their attendants. Our work has been appreciated by the District Health Department, Local Bodies, NGOS and above all by the beneficiaries. This has encouraged us to perform better in the days to come. Further, we are fortunate to have the services of Dr. Sundar Ram Shetty, a veteran in Eye Surgery who has so far performed over 1lakh cataract eye operations, as the chief surgeon at our Hospital.

Name: Pravara Rural Education Societys Padmashri Vikhe Patil College of Arts Science and Commerce Loni
Major_Activities1: Ours is the first college in Maharashtra, established at Grampanchayat level in 1971to provide the opportunity of higher education to rural youth. At present the college has 2870 students (1402 boys and 1468 girls) with qualified and experienced teaching staff. The college offers 19 Under Graduate, 17 Post Graduate courses including Biotechnology and Computer Science, 7 recognized research centers in Chemistry, Botany, Zoology, Environmental Sciences, Commerce, Physics and Economics. Besides 11 Career Oriented and 3 Open University Courses are also offered. Awards and recognitions received • Best Rural College Award twice from University of Pune (2002 & 2010) • Re-accredited at ‘A’ Grade with a CGPA of 3.61 from NAAC (2012) • ISO 9001:2008 Certification (2009) • Status of College with Potential for Excellence by UGC (2008) • Star College recognition from DBT New Delhi (2010) • DST-FIST Sponsored Department of Chemistry and Life Sciences (2005 & 2008) • Best NSS Unit award from University of Pune • Best College Magazine award from University of Pune • Best College Student welfare award from Savitribai Phule Pune University (2014-15) • College of Excellence (2014) • Community College (2014-15) This is the unique college in Maharashtra implementing restructuring programme at undergraduate level. The college has Earn and Learn scheme for poor and needy students, active Placement and Career Guidance Cell. The college has provided excellent infrastructure facilities and maintained good academic ambiance from its inception. • Green and serene campus with area of 32 Hectares 5R. • 34 classrooms, 51 well-equipped laboratories, 4 seminar halls, along with conference hall. • Virtual Learning Centre and free Internet facility. • Central Research Laboratory and Computerized Central Library. • Separate carpentry, workshop and civil department for repairs and maintenance. • Excellent Hostels and sports facilities. • Computer Literacy programme for new entrants of the college.

Name: Natanakairali
Major_Activities1: Founded in 1975 by G. Venu with the idea of reviving and rejuvenating traditional art forms of Kerala that were on the verge of decline. An internationally renowned centre for performing arts with uncompromising standards of performance based on a rigorous training system following the Gurukula tradition. Natanakairalis troupes of Kutiyattam (Sanskrit theatre), Mohiniyattam and Pavakathakali (Glove puppetry) have performed all over India in National festivals and several International festivals in Asian, European countries and in United States several times. Natanakairali is documenting and publishing the Mudras in the classical dance and theatre forms of Kerala through the medium of dance notation. Several volumes of documented mudras have been published and disseminated through publications in Malayalam as well as in English. Natanakairali publication wing has brought out 16 books based on research conducted on subjects related to the art forms of Kerala. Natanakairali is managed by a core team of peforming artistes and masters whose main pre-occupation is teaching and performing traditional arts of Kerala.

Name: Green Hills Trust
Major_Activities1: Green Hills Trust was established in 2014 by a group of concerned citizens of Almora District to protect the environment so that present and future generations can enjoy the natural beauty, wonderful climate and abundant resources of the foothills of the Himalayas. We are trying to limit the damage to Nature caused by people. We are concerned about the disappearance of forests, the depleting biodiversity, the loss of natural habitats for wild animals, the drying up of mountain springs, the pollution of rivers with sewage, non-biodegradable waste being dumped on hillsides and along pathways, the chemicals used to grow our food, public health, the loss of traditional, sustainable livelihoods and about climate change. We believe that concerted and far-sighted action is required by government and citizens together to save the Himalayan region and that youth should be the motor of that change. Our priorities are:  Organizing environment-friendly waste management;  Preventing pollution of mountain springs, streams and rivers;  Protecting bio-diversity and encouraging reforestation; and  Promoting organic farming. MANAGING WASTE We have been raising awareness and developing systems for environment-friendly solid waste management by applying the three ‘R’s - Reduce, Reuse, Recycle. We are promoting segregation of waste at source, door-to-door collection of it, indoor composting of green waste, recycling of inert materials and controlled incineration of hospital and insanitary waste. We want to put a stop to littering, dumping and open burning of waste through creating awareness, offering community-based alternatives and demanding the imposition of fines on those who violate the rules. PREVENTING POLLUTION OF WATER SOURCES We have helped to clear the waste thrown into naulas, the mountain springs with which Almora was doted. With help from those who depend on these water sources, we intend to build a structure around them that keeps the water clean and makes it easily accessible. Our clean-up operations concentrate on removing waste from slopes near streams and rivers so that garbage does not wash into them during the monsoons. We demand strict enforcement of rules concerning sewage and waste water treatment and promote cost-effective ways of cleaning waste water before it enters ponds, lakes or streams. PROTECTING BIODIVERSITY We are investigating the nutritional and medicinal value of various mountain herbs and plants such as nettle with a view to multiplying and processing them as a source of livelihood for our farmers. With the help of the Department of Forests and the Indian Army Eco-Battalion, we are doing tree planting of local, broad-leafed species like oak that retain underground water and trees like kafal that provide food for birds and wild animals. PROMOTING ORGANIC FARMING We are raising awareness about the long-term negative effects on the soil and on health of using chemical inputs for food crops. We are also working on the wild plants that can be used to tackle the problem of malnutrition and generate sustainable livelihoods. We provide technical expertise for organic farming and an alternative to chemical fertilisers through the composting of green waste.

Besides, Basic computer classes ( free of cost ) were started at our office premises and 40 students of Sishu Bharati Vidyalaya attended in computer classes in the day from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. in a batch of 6/7 students class-wise daily (except holidays) as per school routine for the fiscal 2014-15. Nutrition program was considered with a view to take care of the pregnant Mothers of the BPL & Poverty-stricken families in the society as the 50% of the baby born in India with malnutrition due to malnutrition of the pregnant Mothers. Our NGO arranged to provide Nutritious food , drinks and vitamin tablets to the pregnant mothers (5) @ Rs.200.00 per pregnant mother totaling Ra.1000.00 for the fiscal year 2014-15. The organization is working in the rural and urban areas of Pithoragarh district for last many years. One of the major objectives of the organization is working towards the rural women and especially the youths and trains them on income generation activities for making them self sustain. Few of the activities of the organization carried include Education, Health, Nutrition, Road Safety Awareness, Consumer Awareness and Income generation programmes. Major focus of the organization is on SC/ST and economically backward classes of the society. Currently the organization has focused on awareness generation programmes which apart from the above list also include computer education for the minority people, environmental awareness programmes and various development activities for the people of the area. The organization has well trained professionals having vast experience or rural development activities and is equipped with versatile expertise. The organization worked with NABARD under the SHGs formation programme and made 20 groups mostly consists of women. Each group having about 8 members all having women representation. These groups were formed in Sanghar, Bans, Jajurali, Baste and Kalshin Katia villages of Bin block of Pitthoragarh. The present proposal would help in providing them with an alternative and innovative training and help in increasing their social status.
