Name: Noorul Uloom Education Society
Major_Activities1: The rural population in the neighbourhood of Hathras town especially minorities suffer from the persistent problems of extreme poverty low levels of education including children failing to complete even school education poor health care and limited employment opportunities Problems are cyclical the lack of a good education limits employment prospects and the acquisition of new skills trapping them in low paid traditional jobs This leads to a lifetime of low wages making it difficult to pay their childrens school fees or health care As a result those children who start school often fail to complete it and then face the same challenges as their parents Thus poverty pervades across generations As an obvious fall out of poverty and illiteracy these communities get trapped in various social evils such as dowry system in marriages gambling drinking drug addiction tobacco chewing superstitions and child labour etc creating thereby further complications in the efforts for their uplift Scenario of women education and health conditions is even worse Illiteracy among Muslim women is substantially higher in the north Indian villages than in the entire country More than 85 percent are illiterate according to survey reports Less than 15 percent of Muslim women have completed Grade-8 and less than 10 percent have completed Grade 10 The NUES is trying to address this complex situation through the medium of education The NUES has so far successfully established twelve schools of Primary and Senior Secondary levels 10 plus 2 affiliated to CBSE imparting quality education NUES organizes medical camps free of charges for these poor and downtrodden communities every year for eye check up treatment and cataract surgery dentistry general medicine awareness against HIV tuberculosis malaria dengue and cancer especially breast cancer among women NUES is also providing vocational training to boys and girls in sewing & embroidery house keeping for girls computer applications electrician plumber and fitter for boys for empowerment of less educated youth IMPACT Parents who earlier sent their children to work in private homes farms tea shops and factories to earn their daily bread are now sending them to schools and a visible spirit among them for educating their wards is a most welcome achievement Due to the growing number of educated children illiteracy is fading out from these communities The number of girl students in our schools is steadily increasing so much so that the strength of the girls has gone up in some of our schools from zero to 42 percent A number of students after their Secondary Senior Secondary opt for higher education both professional and non professional courses etc Many students have got good jobs which is improving their social status This educational movement has boosted morale of the poor oppressed and illiterate communities in the area which is historical As a result this weaker section is now finding direction confidence aspirations and hope for a better future and is becoming productive and useful participant in Indias development

Name: LEGAL CELL FOR HUMAN RIGHTS
Major_Activities1: LCHR activities vary from litigations inside court-rooms to legal capacity building programmes in remote villages where it accompanied the poor and the needy in their fight for justice and human rights. LCHR has conducted scores of “Legal Awareness Programmes” among the rural people of Assam and has covered 16 districts in which 52,526 villagers have benefited for the last 6 years. Covering 314 tea gardens with 564 legal awareness programme LCHR has enhanced legal capacity of 14,435 tea plantation labourers in Assam. More than 483 Para-legal personnel have been trained on advocacy skills, to amplify the voice of the voiceless. LCHR has organized workshops, trainings and consultation programmes on various rights of the people. LCHR has provided legal consultancy, settled cases of poor and has assisted women in litigations to restore justice to the needy. Through PIL, LCHR assisted to restore right of 10,000 forest dwellers in Karbi Anglong district. LCHR in collaboration with Assam State Legal Services Authority organized International Human Rights Day and legal awareness programmes on anti-ragging laws, mediation, different welfare and social security schemes, PC-PNDT Act, PWDV Act, human rights and legal rights of persons affected with HIV/AIDS etc. in various places of Assam. LCHR trained 125 minority women in five villages under the programme, “NAI ROSHNI”, a programme sponsored by the Ministry of Minority Affairs, Govt. of India. LCHR in association with District Legal Services Authority, Kamrup organized awareness programmes on availability of health care schemes and PC-PNDT Act in 15 villages under Kamrup district of Assam. 686 participants benefited from this programme. LCHR has created and strengthened advocacy capacity of over 40 voluntary organizations in Northeast India to employ rights based approach to development. Publication of legal awareness series of LCHR has educated masses in different ways. In collaboration with the Guwahati High Court Legal Services Committee & District Legal Services Authority and UNICEF, LCHR spread legal awareness among rural people especially on RTE, RTI and others. LCHR in collaboration with North Eastern Social Research Centre organized a consultation programme on the Armed Forces (Special Power) Act. LCHR organized many seminars and workshops on Human Trafficking and Public Distribution System. LCHR had facilitated 3 public hearings in Assam in collaboration with Assam State Commission for Protection of Child Rights. LCHR assisted 300 educational institutions to obtain Minority Status Certificate from National Commission for Minority Educational Institutions. LCHR in collaboration with Department of Justice, Govt. of India has been “Training and sensitizing of 400 lawyers empanelled with Legal Services Authorities of 8 States of North East including Sikkim”.

Name: Yenepoya University
Major_Activities1: Yenepoya University is a unitary campus having all its facility like colleges, hospitals, hostels, playground, sports complex, library and hostels in a single location. Yenepoya University is located in an eco-friendly lush green campus with ample opportunity for experiencing the splendor of natural surroundings making it a place highly conducive for learning. The student support facility like hostels, library, play ground, Gymnasium, auditorium, cafeteria etc are spacious and well planned. There are several best practices like, rain water harvesting, establishment of medicinal plant garden, which are unique. Certain attractive academic programs like Post graduate Diploma in Medical Ethics and Clinical Ethics are first of their in this country. A large teaching hospital with 1250 beds giving excellent health care at a absolutely no cost to the patients providing abundant clinical material for student learning. A favored destination for female students and employees because of the safety and security in the campus and zero tolerance for sexual harassment. Extension activities involving rural community providing unique practices like Door to Door Health Care Delivery, Health Care on Wheels and Yen Health Cards covering over a population of 50000. Establishment of specialized center: Center for Ethics, Center for Rural Health Care and Development, Center for Substance abuse prevention, Center for Craniofacial Anomalies and so on actively involved in service, education, research and outreach activates. Establishment of a state of the art Multidisciplinary research center with a facilities for Stem Cell and Regenerative Medicine, Cell Culture, Systems Biology, Molecular Biology, Nano- medicine alike. Establishment of Collaboration for academic and research pursuits with many reputed institution in India and aboard encouraging student and faculty exchange, providing ample opportunity for global exposure. Establishment of Skills and Simulations Center, providing additional clinical training through Mannequins ensuring hands on experience. Establishment of a fully mechanized central kitchen providing hygienic and wholesome diet to students and diet, free of the cost to the latter. Recognition of Minority educational Institution by Government of India. Recruitment and retention of highly qualified, talented an skilled faculty capable of training students through innovative curriculum. Establishment of standalone center for health profession education imparting training in personal and professional development for teachers Starting of E-Learning as a mode of interactive learning and provision for students, interns, and residents to train in Hospital Information system. Opening of a Super Specialty wind of the hospital ensuring comprehensive tertiary health care under one roof. Demonstrated Research output in the form of number of research publications, attraction of extramural research funds and registration of patents by faculty members. Implementation of an efficient solid waste management system, commissioning of a vermicomposting unit and waste water recycling. Implementation of credit system, semester based credit system, OSPE-OSCE, Wi-Fi facility, E-learning, Conduct of online tests, Card system for viva etc.

Name: CENTRAL INDIA INSTITUTE OF MEDICAL SCIENCES
Major_Activities1: Central India Institute of Medical Sciences (CIIMS), Nagpur, is a registered society (Maharashtra/215/83) and a Public Charitable Trust (F-3592) a dream 1966 of Dr. G.M. Taori, the founder Director, came true in July 1984. It is a medical research institute with a medical service wing (hospital) as part of infrastructure for research. At present it is a 114 bedded hospital cum basic life sciences research center. Research Centre has been recognized as a Research Institute by Department of Scientific and Industrial Research, Government of India since its inception. The major aim was to undertake research activity in clinical and basic sciences related to human illness. For the same purpose, CIIMS established a Research centre in 2000. CIIMS has well well-equipped Research centre, with all the modern amenities including microbiology lab, Cell culture and immunological and proteomics lab and animal house facility etc. Research Centre has elaborated 17 years research experience in the field of various infectious diseases like tuberculosis, including tuberculous meningitis, HIV, Neuroinfections, Chikungunya, Viral infections of CNS like HSV, CMV, Chandipura etc. and noninfectious disorders stroke and thrombosis. Research Centre, has developed around 20 advanced molecular and immunological methods for rapid and early diagnosis of bacterial and viral neuroinfections and identified novel prognostic marker for stroke. Published 100 publications related to various aspects of disease including diagnosis, pathogenesis, vaccine development, and new biomarkers for various diseases. More than 150 papers have been presented in different National and International Conferences. Adhoc research grants have been sanctioned for eleven of our research projects, five by Department of Biotechnology, two by Department of Science and Technology, Government of India, two by Indian Council of Medical Research, one by Council of Scientific and Industrial Research and one by Central Mine Planning and Design Institute Etc. The Institute has been granted two Indian patents for the development of diagnostic kits, one for the diagnosis of tuberculous meningitis and second for the diagnosis of extra CNS tuberculosis infection. A complete specification for a third Indian patent for the development of a thrombolytic composition using an herbal preparation for the lysis of human blood clot has been submitted. Research Centre has also been recognized for the Ph.D. program in Biochemistry and Microbiology in Science Faculty by RTM, Nagpur University and in Clinical Biochemistry, Clinical Microbiology and Medical Biotechnology in Medicine faculty by Datta Meghe Institute of Medical Sciences University, Nagpur. Total thirteen research scholars have already been awarded their Ph.D Degree (Eight by RTM Nagpur University and Five by Datta Meghe Institute of Medical Sciences University) in different subjects such as Biochemistry, Microbiology, Clinical Biochemistry, Clinical Microbiology and Medical Biotechnology. Research Centre, CIIMS time to time also conduct hands on training workshops in Immunological, Molecular and Animal Cell Cultural techniques for graduate and postgraduate students, researchers and teachers in life sciences and provide research services to research scholar in and around the Nagpur. Research Centre has collaborated with more than 50 National and International Institutions.

Name: WEST BENGAL MINORITY DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL
Major_Activities1: The objects for this trust is established are: (a) To establish, develop, maintain and grant aid in cash or in kind to hospitals, medical,schools, medical colleges, nursing institutions, dispensaries, maternity homes, child welfare centres and/or such other similar charitable institutions in India for the benefit and use of the general public. (b) To establish, run, support and grant aid or other financial assistance to schools,colleges, libraries, reading rooms, universities, laboratories, research and other institutions of the like nature in India, for use of the students and the staff and also for the development and advancement of education and diffusion of knowledge amongst the public in general. (c) To establish, maintain and run studentships, scholarships and render other kind of aid to students including supply of books, stipends, medals and other incentives to study, without any distinction as to caste, colour, race,creed or sex. (d) To promote, establish, support, maintain or grant aid to institutions for the promotion of science, literature, music, drama and fine arts,for the preservation of historical monuments and for the research and other institutions, in India, having similar objects for the benefit of the public in general. (e) To establish, maintain or grant aid for the establishment and/or maintenance of parks, gardens, gymnasiums, sports clubs, dharamshalas and rest houses, for use by public in general. (f) To establish, maintain or grant aid to homes for the aged, orphanages or other establishments for the relief and help to the poor, needy and destitute people, orphans, widows and aged persons. (g) To establish and develop institutions for the physically handicapped and disabled or mentally retarded persons and to provide them education, food, clothing or other help. (h) To grant relief and assistance to the needy victims during natural calamities such as famine, earth quake, flood, fire, pestilence, etc.and to give donations and other assistance to institutions, establishments or persons engaged in such relief work.

Name: Sense International India
Major_Activities1: Among its many achievements, Sense International India has 1. Consultative status with United Nations on disability issues 2. Increased the number of deafblind people receiving support from just 23 in 1997 to more than 71,000 today. 3.Developed a network of 57 partners across the country to sustain the movement to support deafblindness. Strengthened this further by a unique mentorship programme and instituting Regional and state learning Centres. 4.Strategically aligned with the Government of India in their flagship- education programme- Sarva Shiksha Abhiyaan SSA for inclusion of deafblind children in its mandate. 5.Facilitated inclusion of deafblindness in Disability Policy of Chhattisgarh state. We are now working in Bihar, Meghalaya and Kerala on similar lines. 6.Designed and initiated a two year diploma course in Special Education on Deafblindness recognised by Rehabilitation Council of India and certified by the National Institute for the Visually Handicapped NIVH. 7.Ensured the incorporation of deafblindness in various training programmes and curriculums such as those of National Institutes NIVH, NIMH, NIEPMD, and AYJNIHH, primary and secondary mainstream school teachers, resource teachers and coordinators working in the Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan SSA, educators of single category disability, doctors, Caregivers etc. 8. Facilitated the inclusion of deafblindness into National Trust Act for the Welfare of Persons with Autism, Cerebral Palsy, Mental Retardation and Multiple Disabilities. 9. Deafblindness is now included under the assistance to disabled persons for Purchase Fitting of Aids & Appliances scheme of Government of India. 10. Our Advocacy Officer Zamir Dhale has been elected as a board member in the prestigious National Trust for the Welfare of Persons with Autism, Cerebral Palsy, Mental Retardation & Multiple Disabilities Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment Government of India. 11. Contributed as member of drafting committee for the "Rights of People With Disabilities Bill".

Name: Pujya Kanshi Ram Jain Girls High School Managing Committee Ambala City
Major_Activities1: A Trust named after the revered Jain Acharya Pujya Kanshi Ram Ji Maharaj was established in the year 1950 as P.K.R. Jain Girls High School Managing Committee. Initially a school namely P.K.R. Jain Girls High School was started with a handful of girl students which at present caters to more than 2500 girls of the Ambala region, affiliated to H.B.S.E, Haryana. Encouraged by the response, the harbingers of this pious institution established another co-educational Public School, affiliated with C.B.S.E having a strength of app. 3200 students. Again our trust established one more co-educational day boarding school also affiliated with C.B.S.E having app. 1600 students and a College of Education which is a very well-known nursery of future educators in B.Ed. and M.Ed. courses. The trust works and follows the age old doctrines given by our revered Maharaj ji, “Kam Khao, Gam Khao Nam Jao”. It diligently strives to work for weakest members of the society and stresses on value education, character building and integrity in the pupils to produce complete citizens for a strong and developed nation. The group’s various achievements include many State Level as well as National Awards for the Principals & Faculty Members. This inculcates the feeling of pride in personal and group achievements. It plans the academia in such a way that the students and pupil teachers get exposure to activities that develop self-esteem and encourage lateral and creative thinking. Our institution is a perfect combination of enlightenment of soul, spiritual guidance and modern education in the present context of digitalized education. We take pride in the nationalistic spirit and instill feelings of nationalism, patriotism and work for the building up of a caring society. Along with the implementation of the education system as prescribed by the authorities, small learning communities, career academics, team teaching etc. are used for multi-disciplinary learning. It celebrates different cultural backgrounds and create systems to allow all members to showcase their potential by a plethora of activities like folk songs and folk dances, theatrics, literary quizzes and debates, cultural and annual functions etc. We also take initiatives at various levels so that various schemes being introduced by the state are intimated to all the sections of society and they get maximum benefits from them. We encourage strategies to increase academic engagement by ensuring proper teacher training, in-service opportunities and various assessment methods to meet the needs of our students. From time to time, instructional improvement workshops for faculty development in which teachers learn how to give positive instructions. The trust has completed large scale infra-structure improvement projects well in time and has very recently taken up a new project namely Charitable Medical Diagnostic Center for X-ray, Digital X-ray, MRI, Cat Scan etc. along-with modernized laboratory equipped with state-of-the-art Machinery, procured from internationally acclaimed Companies. The Building and other Infrastructure is on the verge of completion and most of the Medical equipment and Machinery have been installed and we hope to inaugurate it with in a short time.

Name: SIDDAGANGA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY
Major_Activities1: Siddaganga Institute of Technology, Tumkur popularly known as SIT established in the year 1963, is one among 125 institutions run by Sree Siddaganga Education Society, headed by His Holiness Dr. Sree Sree Sivakumara Swamiji, a centenarian. Sree Sree Swamiji is shouldering the onerous responsibility of providing free food, shelter and education to over 9000 children drawn from the poor sections of the society without discrimination on the basis of caste, creed or community at Sree Siddaganga Gurukula. In addition to this, Swamiji receives thousands of pilgrims and devotees everyday. He looks after the affairs of more than 125 educational institutions and even at the age of 110 years, Swamiji works 18 hours a day. SIT campus is spread over 50 acres and the whole area is landscaped and is lush green. Tumkur enjoys the same salubrious climate as that of Bangalore. At the time of inception, the institute was offering only 3 branches namely Civil, Electrical and Mechanical Engineering with a total annual intake of 120. The institute is now offering 12 UG programmes with a total annual intake of 950 and 16 PG Programmes with a total annual intake of 432. 16 departments of the institute are recognised as research centres by Visvesvaraya Technological University, Belgaum, where students can register for Ph.D programme and M.Sc. by Research. 186 research scholars are pursuing their Ph.D degree in our research centres and so far 31 research scholars have obtained Ph.D degree from our research centres. All the departments in the institute have well equipped laboratories. The institute has over 2200 computers and are located in 29 Computer Centres which are all networked with fibre optic backbone. Round the clock internet facility is provided to all the Computer Laboratories, Faculty Chambers, Hostels, Class Rooms, through 100 Mbps leased line.

Name: MARINE BIOLOGICAL ASSOCIATION OF INDIA
Major_Activities1: The Marine Biological Association of India was established in the year1958 to serve the cause of promotion of research on marine sciences in the Asia-Pacific region. The association carries out this objective by organising lectures, symposia and seminars on specific subjects, offering requisite information to research workers and students, undertaking research in marine biological sciences publishing the Journal of the Marine Biological Association of India (JMBAI), publishing occasional Memoirs, Monographs and Bibliographies on topics of current interest in marine biology, instituting fellowships and studentships to research workers at various recognized institutions, sponsoring and aiding expeditions in Indian Seas, and institution of prizes in recognition of outstanding contributions towards advancement of marine biological sciences. During the past 50 years, the Association has conducted a number of international symposia focusing attention on specific areas of topical interest in marine biology. These were on Scombroid fishes (1962); Crustacea (1965); Mollusca (1968); Corals and Corel Reefs (1969); Indian Ocean and Adjacent Seas (1971); Coastal Aquaculture (1980); Endangered Marin Animals and Marine Parks (1985); Tropical Marine Living Resources (1988): and Eco-friendly Mariculture Technologies (2000), Mecos-1 (2009), CIMCAR(2011) and Mecos-2 (2014). The papers presented in the symposia have been published as proceedings which have been well received in different parts of the world. The monographs, memoirs and bibliographies published by the MBAI are widely used by the scientific community. The official organ of the Association, the Journal of the Marine Biological Association of India is being published from 1959. The Journal publishes original contributions dealing with the following fields of investigations. Phytoplankton, marine algae, zooplankton, nekton, benthos, corals and coral reefs; ecology, zoogeography and systematics; primary production and experimental work on ecosystem including energy flow at different trophic levels; population dynamics and theoretical models; recycling of matter, influence of environmental factors on metabolic activity; marine microbiology; mariculture and experimental work on propagation of cultivable species; biology of fishes, marine reptiles, sea birds and mammals; physical, chemical, geological and meteorological features of the environments related to marine biology, marine environmental damage caused by pollution and engineering works; underwater observations; conservation of living resources, modifications in methodology and techniques and development of new apparatus related to marine sciences. Apart from this, Marine Biological Association of India (MBAI) recognized the importance of science communication and offered workshops on Communicating Science Effectively in association with the Bay of Bengal Large Marine Ecosystem (BOBLME) Project. These workshops were designed exclusively for fishery researchers from India seeking to improve their delivery of scientific and technical information/advice, and to be better equipped with the skills needed to communicate their work clearly and confidently to a wide range of audiences.

Name: BHARATPUR CONIJA HANDICAP SCHOOL
Major_Activities1: A.Legal Awareness Programme organised with financial assistance from the National Commission from Women. Legal Awareness Programme was organised in Murshidabad District in West Bengal with financial assistance from the National Commission from Women in 2014-15. NCW provided a financial assistance of Rs. 200000. Organised at Venue: Talgram on 14th and 15th February 2015. The objective of the Legal Awareness Programme (LAP) was to empower women and girls with the knowledge of the laws related to women, legal rights and duties, to enable them, to share power equally, gain full access to the means of development, and to inspire a whole generation of women to work together towards achieving equality and justice. B. Food Packet Distribution to Widows with Donation from Orphans in Need. Food Packets were distributed to widows with donation from Orphans in Need. In the year 2014-15, Orphans in Need provided a donation of Rs. 210000 to Bharatpur Conija Handicap School. C. Mid Day Meal Expenditure. Mid Day Meal is provided at Bharatpur Conija Handicap School. Education facility is provided to approx 100 Disabled Children. Bharatpur Conija Handicap School is working for the Disabled Children and very poor people of the community. We started a School for Physically Handicapped Children and we are also working for mentally retired children, who are mentally challenged and handicapped. An expenditure of Rs. 119300 was made on Mid Day Meal in 2014-15. D. Find Out Disabled Children Program Every year, we organise Disabled Children Programme. Through Community Survey, every year our organization finds 25 disabled children. We provide Education facility to approx 100 Disabled Children. Bharatpur Conija Handicap School is working for the Disabled Children and very poor people of the community. We started a School for Physically Handicapped Children and we are also working for mentally retired children, who are mentally challenged and handicapped. Student assessments are implemented throughout the year to evaluate continued enrolment in this program.

Name: BHARTIYA SANSKRITI DARSHAN TRUST
Major_Activities1: Bharatiya Sanskriti Darshan Trust (BSDT) is a public charitable trust, mainly working in the field of healthcare and education. The trust is conducting Ayurved Hospital and Research Center since 1984, where patients of all types of diseases are treated with Ayurvedic medicines in medicine, gynaecology, paediatrics, surgery, ENT, Ophthalmology departments. It has a facility of well-equipped Panchakarma center. The trust is also conducting a unique Integrated Cancer Treatment and Research Center (ICTRC) since 1994. The center is recognized as Center of Excellence by Department of AYUSH and supported by Department of Atomic Energy, Government of India and Tata Trust. It is affiliated to Indian Cancer Society. The center has its branches at Mumbai, Solapur, Kolhapur, Nasik, New Delhi – Gurgaon. Cancer patients of all types are diagnosed and treated in the center with surgery, chemotherapy and radiotherapy along with Ayurvedic treatment in affordable charges. Integrated cancer treatment is effective in improving quality of life, minimizing side-effects of chemotherapy and radiotherapy and increasing disease free survival. The center organizes free cancer detection, consultation and awareness camps, exhibitions on cancer, lectures for social awareness. Scientific results about efficacy of Ayurvedic treatment on various types of cancer are presented and published in various national – international conferences, workshops and journals. The trust has a medicinal plantation department where herbs are cultivated using natural manure. Medicines used for patients are prepared in Atharva Nature Healthcare Pvt. Ltd., which is GMP certified and FDA approved pharmacy and a sister concern of BSDT. Cattle breeding and vermin compost projects are also carried out at Wagholi. Ayurved Hospital and Research Center is carrying out various research projects on HIV/AIDS, Delayed Bone Healing, Arthritis, Psoriasis, Diabetes, Mother and Child welfare. The trust is conducting Ayurved College at Wagholi for B.A.M.S., M.D. and Ph.D. in Ayurved since 1998. The trust has published various books on cancer and Ayurved. The trust is conduction English medium primary and secondary school at Tadwal, a remote place of Solapur. The motto of trust is to propagate rich Indian knowledge of 4 Vedas, 6 Shastras, 18 Puranas, 14 Vidyas and 64 Kalas worldwide.

Name: FOUNDATION FOR KRISHNA KALA AND EDUCATION SOCIETY
Major_Activities1: Founded in the year 2001 with great passion by Ms Anu Sinha, the Foundation for Kirshna Kala and Education society is a temple of dance and music. The Society provides a platform to learn, perform, teach and gain education in all forms of performing arts. It is well equipped with experienced resources and associations with accredited institutions for certification courses. Focus on mentoring, training, guiding young disciples across age groups. Acclaimed for building confidence of disciples through sincere practice and dedication to deliver enthralling performances. Consistent efforts to establish new opportunities in diverse fields of dance and music. Ms Anu Sinha is very passionate about promoting self reliance among women. The Academy promotes yoga courses, which facilitates high mobility for performing arts. The Academy works as a multi-dimensional learning facility to promote art and culture through different art forms. To encourage talent, students are given several on stage performance opportunities to showcase their talent and learning. To materialize the vision of bringing dance and music to the reach of common and deserving people of the society and help the underprivileged. To provide vocational education to children and adults. To form an old age home for the destitute parents who are driven out by their children. To form a Yoga and Meditation centre for helping today generation in their pursuit of self-realization. To establish libraries with all types of books for all people of all ages. All the incomes, earnings, movable or immovable properties of the society shall be utilized and applied towards the promotion of its aim and objectives only. No profit shall be paid transferred directly, indirectly to any member of the foundation. To entertain, develop an interest and educate the upcoming generation about our multi ethnic heritage. To bring forth enhanced exposure, awareness and appreciation to the rich legacy of Indias ancient and diverse culture. In the ever westernizing ethos that our younger generation is dithering, we have the responsibility to inculcate, sustain and keep alive our glorious past. To organize at least four cultural events in a year. To organize global workshops to take India to the worlds. To provide stage and promote talent from all over the country and world.

Name: SAHANIVASA
Major_Activities1: Mobilised 100 to 150 days employment in each of the year for the rural poor workers. Approximately 18600 workers are able to get the employment under NREGA ( National Rural Employment Guarantee Act) and stopped 85% of distress migration. Stopped 1620 child labour from both agriculture and non agriculture areas and enrolled them into the schools and monitor their regularity. Landless Dalit youth are educated and engaged in campaign for land. In the last one decade, 12620 acres of land is identified and distributed 5200 landless Dalit women who are intern in the process of converting the waste land into cultivable and also take up biodiversity based agriculture. So far, 1613 acres of land is brought under sustainable agriculture establishing seed banks in 18 villages. BDA involving methodology of: land levelling – Vermi-compost production - soil enrichment through tank silt application – pest management. Centralized service support through 18 seed banks with stock of drought resisted traditional seeds 860 rural Dalit families are consistently engaged in sustainable agriculture in dry lands and are able to produce minor millets & lentils and got out of the hunger and poverty. 3650 Dalit and Adivasi women are identified as most vulnerable single women in the project area living in inhuman conditions. Majority of them are shelterless and live at the mercy of brothers or brother-in-law houses working as bonded and unpaid workers. United them as association and campaign for their basic amenities viz. Housing, PDS cards, pension cards, health cards and development schemes from the government. SO far 1248 single women got access to Govt. housing program , 65% got PDS cards recognisieng them as separate family unit. 2935 out of 3650 single women are able to get NREGA cards and engaging in 100 days employment. 715 single women got house plots from government , 310 women got housing program, 1860 single women recognised as a family unit and got PDS cards, health cards, and also pensions. Mobilised income generation schemes from government and also from citizens. So far 1200 women got support as small shop keepers, vegetable vendors, own milk animals and goats. Campaign against female feticides among Dalits and backward castes led to closure of 6 illegal scanning centres and women associations in 40 villages are monitoring violence against women on dowry, minor girl child marriages, child labour and proper functioning of mid day meal in the schools. Identify and support destitute children and enrolled them into government free boarding schools. 30 children are supported.

Name: SHED  SOCIETY FOR HEALTH EDUCATION AND DEVELOPMENT
Major_Activities1: 45 Community Leaders and SHG members Capacity Building was done. Among them one SHG tribal woman became the Block Chairperson, One tribal woman became Sarpanch and 3 more as PRI leaders. Staff regularly visit all households to find their problem and provide health education and awareness on different topics. Proper distribution of water within the farmer field. Made the Diasil and other villagers to raise check dams for construction. Promotion and development of Agriculture Productivity is done in all 30 villages with the organic farming and compost pits. Horticultural Development is done with the cashew plantation and other fruit tree 60000 saplings were raised and distributed. Provide health services both mobile and clinic based. Treated 27568 patients in the five years by having mobile clinic and 2780 patients were treated in the SHED clinics. In the recent Cholera outbreak Toyaput clinic was one of the base clinics and treated more than 200 patients in that period. 250 biogas plants were erected and 10 masons were given biogas construction trainings. 76 biogas beneficiaries attended users training. 200 smokeless chulla were constructed to avoid heavy deforestation. Maintenance of hand pumps is done by enabling the villagers to contact the concerned department. Empowerment of Panchayati raj is done with periodic PRI and Block level meetings at Toyaput SHED campus. More than 26 trades vocational trainings were organized such as cycle repair, black smithy, sisal fibre products etc and 50% of them are now self employed. Enabled the community to get government schemes and to the tune of more than 7 crore worth of schemes were introduced in this area. 248 SHGs were promoted, supported in running their groups and enabled them to get necessary linkages. Women empowerment is done through the 25 different training programmes specially organsied for women. One Federation of SHGs is active in each project area All 258 SHGs could linked with banks for several times loan support for their income generation programmes to the tune of Rs. 90,00,000 in total. 130 Grain Seed Banks were promoted to store more than 15000KGs of grain seeds to avoid exploitation from middlemen and they are made self supportive in the cultivation seasons. All 210 villagers were given awareness on programmes NREGS, people’s rights etc. Land Entitlement moves are made to get people to get land pattas. Involvement of Youth in the development work is done. The Nehru Youth Association could run a High School, Konapadi Youth Association could run a rice mill and dal processing unit. At Bogaipadar village sisal fibre product training was done and people could extract fibre and generated employment as per the local resources More than 120000 nursery seedlings were raised and distributed among the villagers. Community Based organizations such as Gramya Sanghas, Mahila Mandals, Yubak Sanghas, Village Forest Committees were formed and people were enabled to have their fruitful participation for village development. More than 900 Antenatal cases and 840 Post natal cases were given support and institutional deliveries at SHED Clinis as well as safe deliveries through trained Dais were provided. 730 Mosquito nets were distributed to the beneficiaries 2200 persons have adopted both temporary and permanent Family Planning methods. School health programmes were conducted regularly in seventeen schools. More than 150 children were dewormed and 150 cases of scabbies treatment were provided. Promoted TWO central Herbal garden Old age care was done at their home level and three cataract surgeries camps were organized by benefiting 55 old persons. Cultural Activities for effective awareness was organized in each village through Puppetry, Music and Songs in all 210 villages. Micro plan for village developments was done through PRA method in all 210 villages.

Name: ATTAKKALARI PUBLIC CHARITABLE TRUST OF CONTEMPORARY  PERFORMING ARTS
Major_Activities1: ATTAKKALARI PUBLIC CHARITABLE TRUST HO: 39_3525, KAUSTHUBHAM, MANIKKATH ROAD, RAVIPURAM, KOCHI, ERNAKULAM _ 682 016 PROJECT OFFICE: ATTAKKALARI CENTRE FOR MOVEMENT ARTS, 24-04, BTS BUS DEPOT ROAD, WILSON GARDEN, BANGALORE – 27 Attakkalari Public Charitable Trust of Contemporary Performing Arts is the only umbrella organization of its kind in India, creating a context for contemporary cultural expressions through many distinct but interlinked programs. 1. Launched in 2006, the DIPLOMA IN MOVEMENT ARTS AND MIXED MEDIA is the only programme in India that offers a full-time professional training in Contemporary Dance and allied disciplines. Currently offered as a one-year intensive, graduates may choose to continue to train and earn for a further period of two years with Attakkalari. 2. An interdisciplinary choreography lab FACETS was held in 2002, 2004 and 2006. Over the duration of the three-week residential laboratory, dancers and choreographers work with different contemporary movement techniques and Indian physical traditions and utilize existing and emerging technologies as creative tools for artistic expression. 3. Attakkalari set up the Education Outreach Programme (EOP) over six years ago to integrate the movement arts into the mainstream curriculum in schools to facilitate the holistic development of the child. Offering dance education on an unprecedented scale, Attakkalari facilitators have taught in approximately 60 schools across the economic divide and reached over 6000 children. Attakkalari conducts community dance classes every evening and also on weekends, as well as, workshops and classes for corporates and others. 4. Over the years, Attakkalari has undertaken in-depth research into the teaching methodologies in Indian performing arts traditions. The knowledge of these independent projects led to a major research project, NAGARIKA an Integrated Information System on Indian Physical Expressions through Technology. The project compiles and categorizes movement sequences of two specific Indian movement traditions –Bharatanatyam and Kalarippayattu. The interactive DVD on Bharatanatyam is ready. 5. Attakkalari’s Repertory Company has given young boys and girls, many of who are from underprivileged sections of society, a chance to earn a sustainable livelihood while pursuing their passion in the arts. Attakkalari’s productions are at the forefront of the contemporary Indian dance scene and incorporate cutting-edge digital arts, imaginative lighting and innovative music. In the last three years productions include CHRONOTOPIA, CITY ON THE MOVE, NAGARANTHARA and PURUSHARTHA. Attakkalari has performed across India, at several major European festivals, UK, Japan and is scheduled to perform in Korea also. 6. TransMedia Technologies aims to provide much needed training for designers, technicians, choreographers, dancers and actors in stage technologies. Since its inception in Bangalore, this division of Attakkalari has earned a name for itself for providing quality, cost effective services in light and sound solutions for performance groups. 8. Attakkalari India Biennial celebrates the combined visions of artists in dance, sound, digital arts and design from all over India and abroad. The recently concluded festival held from February 6th -15th brought together 300 artistes from more than 20 countries in a series of performances and related events.

Name: ECO CLUB
Major_Activities1: ECO-CLUB is a Registered Voluntary Organization Registered Under the Registration Act of 1350 FASLI in 1995. We are working mainly in the fields of Environment, Educationa, Health, Climate Change, Sustainable Agriculture, Natural Resource Management (NRM) and Disabled in Mahabubnagar District, Andhra Pradesh since 1995. ENVIRONMENT : We are creating awareness on environmental protection. And also we are organizing the many Tinings, Wrkshops and Seminars in the District. We mobilize the people based on local environmental issues. EDUCATION: Our organization is running a Bridge Course Centers for Child labour and Orphans in the district. To main stream these children in regular schools. We are running a Special School for the Mentally Handicapped" in Mahabubnagar District. We are providing Special Education for the Mentally Challenged children. We are providing vocational training for adult MR children the age group of above 16 years. CLIMATE CHANGE : Vulnerability Assessment and Enhancing Adaptive Capacity to Climate change in Semi Arid Areas of India. The object of this programme is to Secure the Livelihoods of the rural poor and Vulnerable communities affected by the climate related tresses. Enhance the adaptive capacity of the local communities, Improve delivery systems and General Awareness to Climate Related Impacts. We are implementing this programme in two villages of our district. SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE : Our organization is working with small and marginal farmers in rural areas. We formed the groups of sustainable agriculture in villages. We are organizing the Farmers Field Schools (FFS), trainings, exposure visits and awareness among the sustainable agriculture practices. NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT : Mainly our organization activities are Natural Resource Management like Awareness Generation, Capacity Building, Exposure Visits are organized for the Rural Farming Community. Under the watershed management some of the activities are covered like Soil & Moisture Conservation, Water Harvesting Structure, Aforestation and Water Utilization & Management Practices, Tank Management. DIFFERENTIALLY DISABLED: This community are neglected in the society lack of awareness among the disability and their lives. Our organization is dare to take a step to give the services for the Persons With the Disabilities. We create awareness generation among th disability and their Acts and Issues. We form the village level Vikalangula Sanghas. And giving the Capacity Building Training Programmes to PWDs. Our organization running a Special School for the Mentally Challenged Children in Mahabubnagar District. We are providing the Special Education and Vocational Training to the Adult Mentally Challenged Children. HEALTH: Our organization is mainly taking of health cares for rural women and child health care services with trained women health worker in villages. We are organizing the different health camps in different villages of district. We are creating awarenss among the health. WATER : We are creating awareness and capacity building training programmes on Water Management and Utilization for farming communities and village functionaries in the District. And also we are working in Ground Water Recharging and Roof Top Rain Water Harvesting Structures in rural areas.

Name: ANJALI
Major_Activities1: Anjali was founded by a doctor & his microbiologist wife with intentions of utilising their skills & capabalities for the poor & needy. The activities of Anjali started in 1989 in a rented two room clinic which took shape of a 30 bed rural hospital within four years in a 3.5 acre land donated by a local resident. Staff quarters & Center for community based development action were added in phases and hospital extended to 50 beds with new operation theatres including a seperate ophthalmic operation theatre. The organisation was given Ashok Gondhia Award for medical services by Young Mens Gandhian Association in year in the year 1996.Presently along with 50 bed Anjali Hospital in village Ranasan a womens programm is another major activity in 42 surrounding interior villages. Anjali was appointed service NGO ( SNGO) under service NGO scheme of Ministry of Health & Family Welfare. Water conservation in form of developing water bodies is under taken since last seven years. Tree plantation is another programm which was added five years back. Youth & children activities including education, sports , vocational guidance ,tutorials ,awareness generation and making them competitive etc.

Name: Community Development Programme Centre
Major_Activities1: Brief Achievements of the Community Development Programme Centre, M.I. Road, Thoubal achouba, Thoubal, Manipur are briefly stated below on some special sectors viz, 1. The CDPC is implementing a shcme on “Prevention of Alcoholism and substance Abuse (Drugs)” since 2000-2001 hitherto under the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt. of India, New Delhi (DP – I Section). Th output & credentials of the centre are commendable. All the staffs are trained by the NISD (MoSJE) and R.R.T.C.-N.E.-I, Imphal. 2. The programme of Home for Destitute Women & Children due to the Social problems and HIV/AIDS are implementing under the Ministry of Women and Child Development, Government of India, New Delhi since 2005 – 2006 hitherto. The capacity of the Home is 50 (25 women and 25 children). All the infrastructure are well equipped with spacious areas and well trained staffs for management of the scheme are available. 3. The Shihu Greh (Child Adoption centre) scheme are implementing for 10(Ten) nos. of children since 2005-06 hitherto under the Ministry of women and child development, Govt. of India, New Delhi (CARA) successfully under the guidance of the Department of Social Welfare, Govt. of Manipur and nodal agency (Manipur branch). The staffs and infrastructure of the centre are well equipped and spacious and adoption reports are submitted in timely for further necessary action. 4. The Centre is running a day care centre (Aspiration) for person with Disabilities (PWD) with cerebral palsy, Autism, mental retarded with multiple Disabilities of children (0-7yrs) for capacity of 20 nos. under the National Trust, (MoSJE, Govt. of India, New Delhi) during the year 2009 – 2010. The scheme is implementing properly and supervised by the District Administration, Thoubal, Manipur. 5. The Organization is running Coaching centre for different professional courses as Residential for outsiders and non-residential for local students specially for SC/ST/OBC/Minorities etc. without charges of Fees. Trained staffs, recreation room, class rooms, library are available. 6. Vocational Training for self income generating based to the traditional and non-traditional trades are functioning by forming of SHGs of Destitute Women including SC/ST/OBC/Minorities. The products are sole and benefitted to the Beneficiaries. 7. The Organization conducted Awareness on Gender issues, RCH, Insurance for PWD persons, Traffic Rule for Disabled persons, computer application, distribution of teaching and learning materials of disable children, drinking of filter water (hygienic) and sanitary system, on culture topics, regarding sports activities, preservation of water-shades and wasteland, climate change in the global etc. in different places, schools, colleges, Rural areas for the development and welfare of the people of Manipur. Lastly, the Organization is registered member of National Trust (MoSJE, GoI, New Delhi) since 2001 and Registration No. is 1401/MD/2001. And also partnership with Care-n-cure charitable society, New Delhi, Registered Member of India-CCM etc. The above stated are brief activities and achievements of the organization (CDPC), Thoubal, Manipur.

Name: Nishkam Sewa Ashram Trust
Major_Activities1: "Project Running By Nishkam Sewa Ashram for Poor & Needy People of Society." Nishkam Sewa Ashram a prominent N.G.O working from 35 years for the poor and needy people of the society at Vill.Daad, Pakhowal Road, Ludhiana, Punjab. Now this organization running many projects for different social problems like TB, Cancer, Child Abuse, Vridh Ashram, Anath Ashrams, Home for Mentally Challenged females, Education like Schools, Computer Centres , Stitching specially for girls so that they can be self dependent in future. Nishkam also help people like giving Ration, Clothes, Medicines and also spreading public awareness like in Divorce cases Govt. refer many cases for the settlement between husband & wife. Nishkam is also approved child adoption agency by CARA. Old Age Home has the capacity for more than 60 inmates. They are provided all facilities like rooms with attached bathroom, geyser, dining room, common room, regular visits by doctors. In Shishu Sewa Sadan (Ananth Ashram) all children are studying in English Medium School, having rooms with all facilities, separate playground, dining room, common room etc. There are many dispensaries in the city where medicines are given free after charging nominal fee of rs.10. They are having advance machines for X-ray, tests etc with well qualified staff. Computer Centres especially for females are opened in several parts of city to make them self dependent. All basic and advance job oriented courses are being taught and stipends are also given to needy candidates. Job helpline is opened to provide assistance in jobs. Several Schools for the slum children are also opened with computer lab and library. Food and dresses are also provided to them. Some schools are having more than 800 students. Other vocational courses like sewing, embroidery, beautician, candle and chalk making etc are running. Mass Marriages are solemnizing every year according to the religion of couples. Every couple is provided with goods to start a new life. Matri Shakti Sewa Sadan , a home for mentally challenged females is opened in 7000 sq. yards campus. Apart from that clothes etc are distributed amongst the needy, citizens are helped by providing assistance in pensions, helping patients to get treatment, helping poor students in their studies. Nishkam Sewa Ashram is started a new mission to urge people to plant Fruitful Trees in their areas, homes & sides of roads. Fruit Trees provides shelter, food, oxygen, vitamins which can solve the problem of starvation (Bhookmari) amongst the poor up to some extent. So we request every one to spread this message in People of State & Country as it will result in the better environment, low pollution levels & upliftment of poor people.

Name: REHAB FOUNDATION
Major_Activities1: Rehab foundation is a registered voluntary organization under Indian societiesRegistration Act xx1 of 1860 No 10116/91 dated 4th December 1991 as a registered charitable society with an objective of moral educational and vocational upliftment of the poor handicapped persons in the society.For the attainment of these goals,the foundation has maintaining special school namely Good Hope School for the Mentally Handicapped.The foundation has completed its 18th year of service In the year 2009 with a proud welfare activities for the handicapped. During the year under report the foundation has made a commendable progress in the area of education and rehabilitation service to those who need special care and attention.The foundation has organized Identification camps at various panchayaths and municipalities in the district,to find out the disabled pupils and make necessary steps to rehabilitate them.Awareness classess in the form of seminars symposium etc. Which are aimed at the parents of the disabled children. Survey also conducted to reach out the children from their environment. The special schools for the Mentally Handicapped,started functioning in the year 1991.It was humble beginning with 3 mentally retarded children. At present at the school provides educational service at 4 stages viz,pre-primary,primary,secondary and vocational level at the school and admit, the children under age group of 5to18 years.At persent there are 60 children studying at school Amoungthem 25 children are hostel inmates. The school curriculum emphasized on functional Academic, developing self help skills,pre-vocational skill and co-curricular activities such as vocal music, dance,art,sports and games etc are included in the course of studies. From the last three years Rehab Foundation is the District Local Level Commettee member of National Trust at Malappuram.

Name: Arsha Bharathi Social Welfare Society
Major_Activities1: This Arsha Bharathi Social Welfare Society was established as a voluntary organization during 1999. Our main aim is to serve the poorest human beings and children by promoting social awareness and removing stigma of poverty. Besides taking up several family welfare activities, conducting medical and health camps in rural areas since past Ten years, the society is striving its best to educate women and small farmers on income generation programmes. We are making efforts to establish residential instructions with vocational courses, adult education centers, libraries for girls of rural and slum areas to sensitize the downtrodden sections of society. This could be possible due to having good rapport with government departments and local community. This organization is planning to foster secularism and harmony among people through development programmes. Our endeavour is to ensure sustainable development, harmony, peace, and make the people self-reliant. We mainly focused on awareness programme on different local issues, few are illustrated here under • Consumer awareness camp • HIV/AIDS awareness camp • Income generation training • Special camp for adolescent girls of tribal areas. • Free tailoring training • Organic farming to small farmers • Adult education programme • Literacy awareness programme • Anti Arrack campaign • Pulse Polio camp • Health and Blood camp • Nutrition food to child labour • General awareness camp • Seminar against dowry, child and widow marriages • Shields to merit students • Clean and green programme at Medaram • Free eye and medical Camp • Chickengunya prevention programme • Cultural programmes for rural youth • Note books to poor students of SC & BC hostels. This society consists of mainly social workers, small land owners and philanthropists engaged in upliftment of rural weaker sections of this mandal. The objective of protecting the just born kids thrown in dustbins, railways and bus stations etc., Freed those neglected kids by curbing education will be fulfilled if the proposed institutions are built, for which land is being procured from government. Already necessary help is extending to physically handicapped, widows, orphans and senior citizens. As a part of our aims, we are celebrating national festivals like Independence day, Republic day, Birthday celebrations of great leaders who sacrificed their lives to nation like Rajiv Gandhi and celebrated Hindidiwas fortnight pakwara on 25.09.06 and distributed prizes to the winners in examination conducted in Hindi to students of local high school. This Society has organized 150 years First War of Indian Independence celebration. The beneficiaries of our training programmes are encouraging this society to conduct such income generation courses for some other rural youth. In our training programmes, local officials and resourceful persons were assisting and delivering their valuable suggestions to participants. In a year, the society is making efforts to construct own educational institutions at Abdullapue village, R.R dist to commence full-fledged orphan center, old aged home, vocational training institute and research institute to serve more voluntarily.

Name: Sahyadri Nisarga Mitra
Major_Activities1: Sahyadri Nisarga Mitra (SNM) is a leading non-governmental organization (NGO) of Maharashtra, engaged in nature conservation, education and research. SNM started its work in Maharashtra’s Konkan region in 1992, and despite limited manpower and resources, successfully organized various types of conservation projects. Of the7 species of marine turtles found throughout the world, 5 are found on the Indian coast, all 5 being listed in Schedule I of the Indian Wildlife (Protection) Act, 1972. Marine turtles are also included in the Red List of IUCN. In 2002, SNM started a Marine Turtle Conservation Project for the first time in Maharashtra, in Velas in Ratnagiri district, protecting 50 Olive Ridley Turtle nests and releasing 2734 hatchlings into the sea. Over the next three years, we expanded this work to cover the entire 720 km coastline of Maharashtra. In course of the last seven years, 530 nests have been protected and over 25,000 hatchlings released into the sea. SNM has also kept up a sustained awareness campaign in Maharashtra’s coastal villages. From 2004, we have instituted the Turtle Friend Award given to individuals or organizations doing outstanding work in turtle conservation. The award includes Rs. 5000/-, a trophy and a certificate. In 2006, a booklet written by Ram Mone and Bhau Katdare, was published. This booklet was distributed free of charge to volunteers all over the coast of Maharashtra. The booklet has also been translated into Gujarati by Mr. Parthiv Sanghavi, and published in March, 2008. Marine Turtle Conservation and Awareness through Community Participation in Maharashtra, this project has been implemented in 5 coastal villages in Ratnagiri district, Maharashtra. The project was aimed at increasing community participation in marine turtle conservation, as well as developing related livelihood activities. In March 2009, a DVD in Marathi, titled Kasava Tuzyach Sathi was published. It covers the entire lifecycle of the Olive Ridley Turtle (Lepidochelys olivacea)and measures for its conservation. A group of villagers in Velas have formed the Kasav Mitra Mandal to provide lodging and boarding facilities to Turtle Tourists. A small percentage of the profits derived from such Turtle Tourism is donated to a Marine Turtle Conservation Fund. This fund is utilized for Marine Turtle conservation activities in the village. Having proved to be a success at Velas, this activity is now being promoted at other Turtle Villages. Marine Turtle Knowledge Information Centre (MTKIC) An information centre focused on Marine turtles has been developed at Velas. It is housed in a 20’ x 20’ shed where the entire lifecycle of Marine Turtles has been displayed on panels using photographs and detailed information. The Centre may be visited free of charge. Study of the White-rumped Vulture The White-rumped Vulture (Gyps bengalensis), classified as critically endangered by IUCN, has suffered a 95 % population decline in India. Use of Diclofenac in the veterinary sector, low breeding success and food scarcity have been identified as the main causes. While monitoring a nesting colony over a 3 year period, we observed many instances of false incubation, possibly resulting from food shortage. We also found that the relatively new practice of burying livestock carcasses was leading to unavailability of an important source of carrion for the vultures. We arranged to feed the vultures in the nesting colony at Anjarla in an attempt to overcome both these threats. This experiment yielded positive results, with false incubation declining from 45 % to 13 % while the breeding success increased from 16 % to 40 %. Prevention of Indian Swiftlet Nest Robbery in India In 2001, SNM uncovered an international smuggling racket involving nests of the Indian Swiftlet (Collocalia unicolor) from Vengurla Rocks, an island about 20 km off the shore of Vengurla in Sindhudurg district. The nest robbery was stopped with the help of the Forest Department. Our sustained efforts thereafter led to the species being included in Schedule I of the Indian Wildlife (Protection) Act. Vengurla Rocks is also a breeding ground for Terns. Overcoming various difficulties in accessing the island in monsoon, the breeding season of the terns, we managed to reach the site in June, 2001 and report authentic records regarding Tern breeding. Study of the White-bellied Sea Eagle From 1996, SNM began documentation of the endangered White-bellied Sea Eagle (Haliaeetus leucogaster ) and completed a status survey in two districts of Maharashtra, discovering a total of 105 nests. Between 1996 and 2000, nests of the bird were monitored in every breeding season. In 2000, the breeding biology of this eagle was studied in detail using closed circuit cameras, this being the first time in India that such data was obtained on this species. SNM continues to work on the conservation of the White-bellied Sea Eagle. Bird Studies Realising that very little scientific data is available on most local species, we have started scientific studies of some local bird species. Valuable information on the breeding biology of 22 bird species has been collected and published. Project Mangrove (with BNHS) Mangroves, an important part of the coastal ecosystem, are under threat everywhere. This led us to start Mangrove Conservation activities. We have begun an awareness campaign on the Konkan coast with the help of the BNHS. A film show, a slide show, a photo exhibition and lectures have been organized to make coastal communities aware of the importance of mangrove forests.

Name: Gramin Vikas evam Paryavarn Sanstha
Major_Activities1: 1.VISION -: GVEPS envision a society that is self sufficient and empowered enough to take care of its development needs thereby maintaining a fine balance between the human and environment needs, where each member of the society is equipped with leadership traits and enjoy equal opportunity of participations and continuous growth & development. 2. Mission statement(s) • To identify the poor and marginalized population of the area • To keep a close watch on socio- economic disparities and its impact on partner communities • To take necessary action for environmental conservation through involving local communities and better management of common property resources • To involve specific strategies to mainstream the disadvantaged groups such as women, dalits and other marginalized groups, in the development processes 3. Our Strategies • Awareness Generation on issues of common interest • Institutional Building • Capacity Enhancement • Enhancing knowledge Base of local communities • Public Advocacy • Development Action 4. Our Developmental Objectives • To raise socio-economic status of partner communities through facilitating participatory processes for better management of natural resources and building capacities of community to sustain such processes. • To design and implement programs aiming at enhancement of livelihood opportunities. • Facilitating women empowerment processes through gender sensitization and income generation initiatives. • To undertake specific interventions for promotion and protection of common property resources. • To adapt popular knowledge in our thoughts and actions. • Building capacities of local communities to empower them to participate in the initiatives related to management of natural resource management • Providing leadership training and other capacity building inputs to the rural women, for building their capacities in the direction of decision making and self sufficiency • Involve appropriate actions towards raising the educational and health status of women and children so that they are well placed in development processes • To develop community based institutions. Present Time Working Area- Dausa, Jaipur, Sikar and Bikaner District of Rajasthan state. Area of Development Work. 1. Natural Resources Management. 2. Agriculture Development 3. Health 4. Women Empowerment 5. Education 6. Advocacy 1. Natural Resources Management -.  Soil & water conservation  Sustainable Agriculture Development Initiative  Conservation and cultivation of medicinal plants  National Environmental awareness campaign  Campaign for Bio-pesticide and Bio-fertilizer promotion  Eco Club Program  Eastern Rajasthan Package Program ( Soil and water conservation& Human Resources Development)  Drought Relief Program 2. Agriculture Development  Sustainable Agriculture Development  Eco-Development Agriculture Training program.  Horticulture Development 3. HEALTH  Community Care Centre- Bikaner for PLHWA  Targeted Intervention with FSW & MSM in Sikar district.  Targeted Intervention with Migrants in Jaipur district.  Reproductive Health Program.  Mother & Child Health program. 4. WOMEN EMPOWERMENT  Formation and Strengthening of SHG  Capacity Building of Women groups  Public Advocacy 5. EDUCATION  Primary Education Program.  Non Formal Education Program for Labour Girl child 6. ADVOCACY  Make Trade Fair  Campaign Against Female Foeticide

Name: Shelter for Her Empowerment
Major_Activities1: Shelter for Her Empowerment is formed by a group of professional, qualified social workers. They have keen interest in social work and they are committed to uplift women. They had understood gender inequality in society. Though legal system is trying hard to introduce various legal provisions to eradicate woes of women, yet women themselves do not know about the legal weapons they have for their safeguard. Shelter for Her Empowerment detect that awareness is power. The very name of the society refers that it is for the strength and power of women. Therefore, the society aims to educate the women and instil knowledge in to them. SHE is earnest in educating the women. The veteran teachers are toiling hard for that purpose. Slum girls and all the girls of under privilege class of society are being regularly taught. More than two hundred girls have attended our classes. English, Mathematics, Bengali and History taught. We take special care to prepare girls for career oriented course. We trained them in English conversation, computer. It has developed their communication skill. This skill is so successfully developed that already some girls have got jobs. Our girls already had trained the Potuas of Midnapore in spoken English. With the help of SHE girls, a section of Potuas are communicating in English with foreigner customers and therefore their business has shot up. SHE has assisted Girls to take up nursing training. These girls are already in employment. SHE has been performing street theatres for last five years in various places including interior slums and district. Street drama is a medium to reach out the folk in the easiest way. Our theaters deal with the social vices and their legal riddance. Dowry system, 498A, Bigamy, Female foetcide, Minor marriage etc. are few examples. Our street theatres are easily understandable, full of fun and are readily acceptable. Marginalized SHE girls are performing in the drama. Reality in their family gets expression in theatrical acts. A girl, victim of bigamy, acts in the drama. It is interesting. SHE is hugely keen to spread awareness in women. Knowledge is power. Under the influence of our street theatres, the poverty struck and socially handicapped women folk wake up to resist social vices. They protested to dowry or to surrender to social injustices and are ready to snatch their rights. We have a long list of alike case history. SHE is also a legal counseling centre. It looks after family, properly and marital problem. We have handled approximately 129 cases. On 19th March 2012 SHE has successfully organised a programme on Tagore’s Short Stories-a search for gender equality through a combination of lectures, drama, dance and song performance at Madhusudan Manch for the target audience of about 350 mostly women. The programme was highly appreciated by print and TV media. This programme was sponsored by govt. of India under TCGS to commemorate 150 years of Tagore.

Name: Shree Ramkrishna charitable Trust
Major_Activities1: Shree Ramkrishna Charitable Trust is registered trust. It registered in 1988 and registration number is E/2673/SURAT. Trustees are owner of Diamond Units. Basically it has been registered to help the poor people and especially to the diamond workers. Trust is working on education, health and social field. Trust is more interested to work on education, Health and Social field and HIV/AIDS field. Trust had organized advocacy meeting with industrialist and private practicenar of Surat city in previous years. Trust had also organized Bhagvat BHAGIRITHI SAPTAH to raise local fund for the benefit of PLWHA. We have been working with diamond workers under Partnership for Sexual Health Project since Nov-01 in Katargam and Ved Road area. There are 130000 diamond workers are working in Katargam and Ved road area. Diamond workers are migrated from all over the country but most of them (80%) is migrated from Saurashtra. Most of the diamond workers (68.8%) are young and the age group is 15 years to 30 years. Age group of female diamond workers is 14 years to 30 years but majority are belongs to 14 to 22 years. 60000 (46.2%) of the diamond workers are living with peer. Living with peer diamond workers are living either in KHOLI or in diamond units. Approximate 2000 are commuters. 70000 diamond workers are living with family. Due to the more profit in diamond cutting business more and more people attract towards this work. Diamond workers living far from their family so family has no control over the diamond workers and friends influence is very high and they belong to the young age group. In diamond cutting work they are working for 10 to 12 hours per day and concentration is must needed so by end of the day they look out entertainment and loving support from some one else. Due to this reason they are indulge in HRB activity. Other factors are addiction of liquor, more income, few diamond workers are unmarried and they pass the marriage age so they indulge in high risk activity to satisfy their sexual needs. Similarly, there are watchmen, boys working in video parlor and workers working in the ambrodary work who are living alone and are indulge in HRB activity. Till January 2008 we have implemented targeted intervention project under NACP-II guideline. As per the guideline of NACP – III migrant projects were stopped by GSACS from April 2008. Looking at the need of intervention with migrants we would like to request for the intervention with single male migrant under NAPC - III. Vision, Mission and Goals of the Organization:- VISION Increase the social status of the poor people by providing economic, health and other social help to different kind of people. GOALS 1. To improve the health of the poor people by accessing health related services. 2. To promote education 3. To provide other need base services to the community.

Name: watgunge adolescent improvement association
Major_Activities1: WAIA, as the organization is known, consists of a diverse group of members, who have come together with a common motive of creating an improved and better society. The organization thrives to motivate and educate the most deprived members of society through its various social awareness activities.Objectives of WAIA: - The members of WAIA strongly believe that society and its future can be greatly benefited by improving the adolescents’, education, health and social environment. The youth of today are the pillar of tomorrow’s society and by providing a healthy and safe atmosphere, we, at WAIA can help to create a better world.WAIA Educate India Project- This educational based program targets both school and non-school going children. Under the Non-School Going category, children from very poor background and Our other mentoring program, which falls under the ‘School Going Category’, aims to assist school going children in preparing for subjects like Science, English and Math before their board exams. WAIA Educate India also focuses on providing healthcare to its students, who would be evaluated when joining the “Educate India Project” and during its term. This project is a “time bound” activity, with the sole purpose to take students a step forward in achieving their academic or educational goal. Under this project, WAIA aims at providing free education through mentoring, vocational training, computer training, distribution of books, providing free stationery and through sponsorship of both needful and academically excelling students. To create a positive environment, WAIA has organized mass awareness activities that focused on youth related issues like “Adolescent Awareness”. We have been conducting quiz and debate competitions which primarily targeted the youth, who are the future of tomorrow. Another focus area of our NGO (non governmental organization) is in the primary healthcare sector where the members of WAIA intend to provide increased access to healthcare facilities. We plan to educate the masses about adopting prevention measures from contagious diseases like tuberculosis, seasonal diseases like malaria, diarrhea etc. This would be conducted during the free check up clinics organized for the needy. For this, we would be utilizing mobile medical units, which is basically a fully equipped ambulance that would handle patients’ needs. Name: Howrah South Point
Major_Activities1: HOWRAH SOUTH POINT was founded in 1976 by a French Father to help handicapped children from the slums and provide a medical support to the most deprived in Howrah, the industrial suburb of Calcutta. Over the years the association has responded to the various and urgent needs of the poor people from Howrah, Calcutta and the Northern part of West Bengal. Today, Howrah South Point is completely run by Indian administrators and social workers. Its activities are divided into 4 main programmes: -Rehabilitation of the Handicapped -Health Care -Education For The Deprived, and -Housing For The Poor Besides those main projects, 4 other programmes are run to help the aged and destitute people, to respond to the S.O.S. calls of distressed populations of West Bengal during floods or cyclones, or to provide money to HSP. For HSP, those 26 years of existence have been a fruitful co-operation with local institutions, other NGO’s, government instances, foreign donors and many well wishers. Today the organisation runs 3 formal schools, 3 non-formal schools and 3 special schools with a total strength of about 2010 students. At present we are running 8 Homes in 2 districts of West Bengal. We also run Vocational Trainings, Day Centre, Orthopaedic Workshop and a Restaurant called Aaram Kutir.
