Name: Urivi Vikram Charitable Trust
Major_Activities1: Urivi Vikram Charitable Trust (UVCT) - a national level NGO having functional chapters in five states in India – Andhra Pradesh, Delhi, Haryana, Karnataka and Maharashtra. Headed by Dr UNB Rao, PhD, IPS (R), it is working for economical and social empowerment of adolescents and young adults in age group 11to 25 years. UVCT is deeply involved in all aspects relating to development of adolescents - from direct intervention by running programs to highlighting issues at policy making levels.The ‘National Centre for Adolescents’, a first of its kind in the country, established by the Trust in Dwarka, New Delhi, focuses solely on cares and concerns of adolescents. It already meets the pressing needs of adolescents by providing Psychological Counseling & Career Guidance /Workshops & Talk-shows/Seminars/ Competitions, all oriented at empowering and enabling them. Other Centers of UVCT routinely run our acclaimed programs – Shakti, Sahara, Parivartan, and Prerna etc.Project Prerna takes care of the needs of Career Guidance and Shakti provides Life Skills Eduction to underacheivers and marginalized. Shakti program was also accepted by the UN Inter Agencies Working Group July 2003 as basis for their program on Life Skills for Health Promotion of out-of-school adolescents. During the last 15 years, the Trust succeeded in counseling more than 60,000 schooled children, and assisting about 6000 out of school children, out of which about 60 percent could be put into gainful employment. The ‘National Centre for Adolescents’ is fast becoming a hub of activities related to adolescents. The National Centre played host to Dr APJ Abdul Kalam, Hon’ble Former President, who participated in our ‘Foundation Day’ celebrations on 09 September 2008. Another eventful happening was the 2nd ‘Hum Kishore Festival’ - a five day Annual Meet at UVNAC in Dwarka, which we organized from 14-18 Jan 2009. The festival provided competitions in 13 disciplines participated by 19 schools. Winning Schools were awarded glittering Memorial Rolling Trophies and children got a Replica or Gold Medal and Runners-up received Silver Medals. The Trust held a National Meet in July 1999, on the theme ‘Towards a Policy for Young Adults’. The outcome of the meet was brought-out into an advocacy document for ‘National Policy for Young Adults’, which prompted the Planning Commission of India to constitute a Study Group that brought out a ‘Report on Adolescents’ (June 2001). The Min. of Youth Affairs and Sports has since launched the ‘Scheme for Development and empowerment of Adolescents’ during the current 10th Five Year Plan. UVCT deserves to be credited for finding a due place to ‘Adolescents’ in the scheme of Indian Planning. The Trust held yet another National Meet in July, 2005, on theme‘ Adolescents : Vision 2020’ in order draw the attention of the policy makers and relevant segments of the society about the challenges being faced by and opportunities available for the adolescents , in our endeavors to make India a Super Power by year 2020. The Trust brought out books titled “Teenage Blues”(in English) and “Kishoron Key Komal Duniya”(in Hindi) for the guidance of Parents, Teachers and Counselors to have a proper understanding of teenagers and their actions. Yet another publication of the Trust is “Adolescent Concerns through Own Eyes”.

Name: Shri Ram Centre for Industrial Relations and Human Resources
Major_Activities1: Shri Ram Centre for Industrial Relations and Human Resources (SRC), as you probably know, is a premier organisation engaged in Research, Training, Consultancy, Seminars and Management Education. It was founded in 1963 as an autonomous, non-profit Society registered under the Societies Act. Over the years, it has completed 172 research projects, published 69 books, organised over 3000 training programmes besides undertaking a large number of consultancy assignments. The Research projects have been funded by various Ministries of the Central and State Governments, Planning Commission, ICSSR and various international agencies like the World Bank, UNDP, Ford Foundation, ILO, FES, Germany, British Council, International Development Research Centre, Canada etc. The Centre is recognised by the Government of India as a Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation. SRC has a rich tradition of conducting research, training and seminars with a national and international perspective. During the recent years, SRC has organized national seminars on “ Creating a Spirit of Working Together”, “Developing Positive Work Culture”, “Creating a Culture of High Performance” and “Developing Values and Ethics in Indian Organizations”. These seminars are meant for Indian and Multinational corporate sector. SRC has also organized a new series of International Seminars with distinguished persons like Prof. Amartya Sen (Nobel Laureate) on his book Development As Freedom, Lord Meghnad Desai (Professor, London School of Economics) on his book Development and Nationhood, Prof. Jagdish Bhagwati (Columbia University) on his book In Defense of Globalization, Prof. Joseph Stiglitz (Nobel Laureate) on his book Making Globalization Work, Prof. Edmund Phelps (Nobel Laureate) on his book Development and Justice, Prof. Avinash Dixit (Nobel Laureate) on his book “Economics, Lawlessness and Justice in India”. Shri Ram Institute Of Management (SRIM): As a natural extension to its academic activities and in line with its objective of preparing young men and women to occupy managerial roles in work organisations, the Centre has set up in 2003 a division, Shri Ram Institute of Management (SRIM), to offer a long-term programme in Management for fresh entrants and practicing executives. Currently the 6th batch/programme is being conducted. The seventh full-time Post Graduate Programme in Management (PGPM) has commenced in August 2009. Some of the special features of the Programme are • Programme designed to address practical needs of national and international business • Pedagogy of Action learning, business games, case discussion, simulation and role plays • Application of industry based research and consultancy experience in problem diagnosis, problem solving and decision making. • Strong student-industry interaction and exposure to live problems. The students of the two years Post Graduate Programme of SRIM can simultaneously obtain an additional degree of a deemed University of UGC. The Shri Ram Centre also has an institutional arrangement with IIT, Delhi whereby students of PGPM can study some papers there. SRIM helps students to get placement in industry. Most of the students of the earlier batches have been successfully placed in reputed companies.

Name: Society For Integrated Development
Major_Activities1: We took Floricuture as income generation activity for rural BPL families in Dhanbad District of Jharkhand state under flagship of Gobindpur Flower Producer Co. Ltd. which is registered co. of SHG members. This has become one of most successful poverty alleviation program in area. With the influence of this program more and more villagers are joining this project. Under Jharkhand Tribal Development Program (JTDP) which is funded by International Fund for Agriculture Development (IFAD) and World Food Program (WFP), we revived production of Lac in Bundu block, Ranchi, Jharkhand. Bundu is famous for production of world class lac but due to various reasons there were crop failure happening in recent year but due to our extensive effort now again production of lac is happening. We are working with 700 female sex workers (FSWs) in Targeted Intervention (TI) project supported by National Aids Control Organization (NACO) and Jharkhand State Aids Control Society (JSACS) in Lohardaga Dist. of Jharkhand. Lohardaga is one of highly naxal affected area. Working upon issue like Aids and sexuality very risky here but due to our effort and local support we are working successfully.

Name: PADATIK DANCE CENTRE
Major_Activities1: We are seriously involved in imparting training in Kathak and encouraging creativity under the supervision of its Director, Smt Chetna Jalan who is a renowned Kathak exponent. The teaching facility of Padatik Dance Centre is affiliated to Nalanda Dance Research Centre (Mumbai) which runs a diploma course at the centre. The legendary Kathak maestro Pt. Birju Maharaj has been associated with Padatik Dance Centre from 1998 and since then he has been grooming our students by conducting workshops. The centre has its own music recording studio. Some of its best productions can be mentioned as milestones of Padatik Dance Centre . Ramkatha Ramkahani, Ardhashati,Kshudito Pashan,Shrishti, apart from many other productions like Ullas, Vishad,Mand,Swa Chhand,Aboni Bari Aachho,Sufi Experience Padatik Dance Centre is supported by a regular grant for salary from the Department of Culture, Government of India. It also receives grants from the Sangeet Natak Akademi, New Delhi. Padatik Dance Centre has been invited to many major festivals like the Imphal Mahotsav by Sangeet Natak Akademi, New Delhi, Kathak Mahotsav by Kathak Kendra, New Delhi, Khajuraho Festival, Taj Festival. Padatik Dance Centre has also given shows abroad. Through ICCR, Padatik Dance Centre director Chetna Jalan along with her Kathak troupe was invited to perform a full length show at the prestigious Kuopio Dance Festival in Finland held in 1989 at Kuopio. They performed in Kuopio, Lappenranta and Helsinki. Later the troupe performed at Oslo (Norway). Finally Chetna Jalan gave a solo performance in Birmingham (UK) and West Berlin. Later, Padatik Dance Centre troupe was also invited to perform at Seol, Korea, Hongkong and Bangkok. Padatik Dance Centre can boast that in 1984 it organized Kathak Mahotsav to explore the Contemporary Kathak scenario at the national level. Padatik Dance Centre has been approved as the Accredited Centre of Kathak Kendra, New Delhi from May’09 at Kolkata and Gurgaon.

Name: Ahiritola Punascha Kala Kendra
Major_Activities1: AHIRITOLA PUNASCHA NRITYA KALA KENDRA HAS BEEN WORKING FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND SPREADING THE INDIAN CULTURE SINCE 97. SINCE THEN THE ORGANISATION HAS TAKEN UP THE RESPONSIBILITY OF INSTRUCTING THE STUDENTS AS WELL AS THE PERSONS INTERESTED IN THE ART OF DANCE AND MUSIC. IT HAS PROVIDED NECCESARY TRAINING TO THE STUDENTS OF THE SOCIETY ON VARIOUS TYPES OF DANCES, MUSIC. BOTH IN THEORATICAL AND PRACTICAL.THEY ARRANGE AND ORGANISE LECTURES, DEBATES, DISCUSSIONS OR SEMINARS ON THE COURSES OF THE SOCIETY FOR THE DIFFUSION OF KNOWLEDGE AND CULTIVATED THE SPIRIT OF CULTURE AMONG THE MEMBERS OF THE SOCIETY BY HOLDING DANCE, DANCE DRAMA, CULTURAL FUNCTIONS, ALSO TO DO ALL SUCH OTHER THINGS AS MAY BE DEEMED INCIDENTAL OR CONDUCIVE TO THE ATTAINMENT OF HE FORGOING OBJECTS. SINCE ITS ESTABLISHMENT THE ORGANISATION HAS BEEN PERFORMING IN SEVERAL OCCASIONS, PRESENTING DANCE DRAMA AND STAY ITEMS WITH STUDENTS OF THE INSTITUTION, SCHOOLS AND OTHER CLUBS. THEY ORGANISE WORKSHOPS, SEMINARS, LECTURES, AND PERFORMANCES FOR SCHOOL STUDENTS. BEING A REGULAR WORKER WITH RAJARHATS SOB PEYECHIR ASAR THEY HAVE WORKED FOR THE UPLIFTMENT OF THE SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGES PEOPLE, AND ALSO LENT OUT THIR HANDS FOR THE SOCIAL SERVICES ORGANISED BY THIS NGO.THEY HAVE ORGANISED SHOWS FOR SLUM CHILDREN, HELD TRAINING FOR THEM AND ALSO LAUNCHED SEVERAL DANCE DRAMAS AND STAY ITEMS WITH THEM, IN HOPE OF PROVIDING THEM WITH THE OPPERTUNITIES WHICH ONLY THE PRIVILEDGED ONES ACHIEVE. THEY HAVE WORKED TO STOP DRUG ADDICTION AND HELP THEM. THEY HAVE ORGANISED SHOWS ON 15TH AUGUST AND 26TH JANUARY WITH THE AIM OF SPREADING NATIONALITY, ORGANISED PERFORMANCES WITH SPIRITUAL TOPICS WITH AIM OF SPREADING INDIAN CULTURE. PERFORMED IN SOCIAL SERVICE CAMPS SUCH AS BLOOD DONATION CAMPS. IN EVERY OCCASION PERFORMED MANY PARTICIPANTS TURNED OUT AND ALL OF THESE EVENTS WAS A SUCCESS. THE ORGANISATION NOW AIMS AT ACHIEVING INTERNATIONAL RECOGNITION BY SERVING THE SOCIALLY UNDERPRIVILEDGED GROUPS AND THE HANDICAPPED SUCH AS THE BLIND.

Name: Lucknow Mahila Sewa Trust
Major_Activities1: Craft Development Centre This centre was setup by LMST to help the members to find markets for their products and to increase their bargaining power. The centre aims to promote and sustain artisan’s welfare and to do away with economic and social exploitation is help them in producing high quality work. o Provide managerial support. o The centre provides its members with information pertaining to raw material procurement. o Training programmes and design trends to enable the former to upgrade their products and enhance their receptivity in the market. Women workers are also imparted training to augment their managerial and financial skills through participation in various workshops and conferences. Institution building -SEWU SEWU itself is promoted and formed by LMST in as much as the women beneficiaries of various programmes of LMST are invariably the members of SEWU which is a Trade Union of unorganized workers. Under the banner of SEWU, the cause of unorganized workers has been highlighted in various parts of the State for achievement of their demand such as elimination of exploitation, payment of proper wages, coverage under social security schemes, protection of rights and entitlement and elimination of other social evils from the society. The unity created under the institution of SEWU achieved commendable results and the struggle will continue in future also. Wehandicrafts & Craft net Foundation Wehandicrafts is particularly active in the areas of Chikan and Zardozi craft development. Amongst the workers of informal economy, women are the poorest and most exploited. Artisans Identity Cards The women workers get visible status and are able to get the advantage of Office of the Development Commissioner Handicraft, in one cluster of Barabanki, nine Mohalla of Lucknow District and two blocks of Hardoi Districts (Sursa and Ahirori) It offers them to participate in various Central govt. schemes for welfare of the artisans and also sell their products at various exhibitions around the country. Marketing o Saebaan an market outlet helps the women in marketing as with the market, with traditional crafts like Chikan, Zardozi, Kundan Jewellery, appliqué etc. becoming more and more competitive. Saebaan allows the women to directly sell their hand-made and traditional products in the open market of finished goods through exhibition. o LMST endorsed its presence in the craft exhibitions held in Delhi, Bombay, and Kanpur and in few other cities, through its Zari Chikan women artisan members. It also took part in Lucknow Festival. o We link our artisan’s members to different boutiques of metropolitan cities like Bangalore, Chennai, Mumbai and Delhi. From these boutiques they are getting sustainable employment throughout the year. Construction Worker Welfare programmes LMST organized Camps, Melas, Puppet Shows at brick kilns, Labour Adda, Labour Basti to aware its member about benefit of registering under welfare Board for Construction workers and assisted in registration process and facilitated benefits to them through networking with Labour department.5200 construction workers got registered. Domestic Workers Federation: LMST Set up Samman Sewa, which strive to make a livelihood for domestic workers and for their families. It provides a common platform for women of self employed sector. And create awareness on the deeper problems in their sectors. Under SAMMAN SEWA Service Women have been trained to provide care for the sick and elderly at home or in hospital. Service includes Total are of the patients, i.e. sponge bath, bed pan and toilet assistance, massage and physiotherapy when necessary, laundering patients diet and cleanliness of patients room. Women empowerment programmes ‘Sunehara Kal - ITC – LMST Project’ Lucknow Mahila Sewa Trust initiated a project for ‘women’s economic empowerment for sustainable livelihood’ in collaboration with ITC Limited in the year 2004. Under this project women were mobilized to form Self Help Groups and were educated about the ways and means for savings. The project has since successfully completed four years of implementation and entered 5th year of operation. The organization had undertaken various activities comprising Self Help Group formation, Micro finance/Micro enterprises, Capacity building training & Employment generation. The organization formed 195 SHGs consisting of total 2703 members. The group members were provided necessary training for Micro enterprises for production and marketing of Chikankari, Agarbatti and FMCG. The members were also provided with training for capacity building which included Group management, savings, micro credit, forward and backward linkages, marketing techniques etc. Self help group formation and capacity building The organization has formed more than 500 women self help groups in the districts of Barabanki & Lucknow with the aim to increase the self-confidence, self-esteem and autonomy among women; increase their ability to articulate needs; make demands and enforce rights both as an individual and in groups; increase access to and control over economic & social resources & the political processes; improve quality of life; participation in planning and decision making processes at family and community level. LMST is running a project for imparting Handicraft training on Chikan Zari Zardosi craft in the district Lucknow with the support of ART-VENTURE, Singapore. The initial period of one year will be completed on 31st December, 2009. The project aims support and upgrade skills of the artisans in requirement with the market trend. Handicaraft development programme (under AHVY) The organization has successfully completed a project for training on Chikan & Zari Embroidery under Ambedkar Hastshilp Vikas Yojana (AHVY) for 120 women artisans of the block Nindura, Barabanki with the support of Development Commissioner (H), Ministry of Textiles, Government of India. In addition to the above programme, with the help of the above Department, about 500 artisans are monetarily gaining by means of developing Artisan Cards, etc. They are also getting Bank Loans for establishing their own ventures and are also insured with LIC of India. Other Activities The organization has also been working in co-ordination with various development agencies and corporate sectors, some of which are cited below: • A study conducted for home-based artisans engaged in Zari and Chikan embroidery to ascertain their present socio-economic status. • An in-depth study “Footpath Abhiyan” was conducted to ascertain the living condition of street-vendors of Lucknow. • A study was done on “Languishing Craft” in the making of artificial jewellery from locally available resources by women artisans of Lucknow. • A study on home-based women workers in Lucknow under National Council for Applied Economic Research, New Delhi with the support of UNICEF Lucknow. • A study conducted for Applique artisans based on their economic condition at Rampur and a study on Zari artisans at district, Bareilly. In addition to the above, the organization has been working in co-ordination with various agencies for empowering and improving living condition of women and children in the various project areas. Some of agencies involved are SEWA Bharat, Sewa Academy, NABARD, SSK-Lucknow, Upvan Lucknow, Home net-India, Nasvi, STFC and State Central Labour Commissioner Labour Commissioner, Uttar Pradesh. It will not be out of place to mention that the organization has been instrumental in developing saving/banking habits among the poorer sections of the society in some parts of Lucknow. To this end, it made a dialogue with ICICI Bank who has opened a special business correspondent branch at Vikas Nagar, Lucknow. This branch is being run by LMST where the poor sections of the society like artisans, daily wagers, rickshaw pullers, domestic helps etc. are the customers. They can open their account with zero balance. Apart from the above, the resources of the organization have been utilized from time to time for the promotion of health & family welfare, literacy & education, welfare activities for destitute street children, hawkers, venders & older/handicapped persons and for conservation of environment.

Name: SUNAINA
Major_Activities1: SUNAINA Society for the Upliftment of National Arts of India has been dedicatedly working for the propagation of our culture through education, training, presentations and research in the therapeutic and beneficial effects of India Classical Dances on the Mind and the Body of the Learner. In this Direction: •SUNAINA was registered in 4th April 1994 under the Societies Registration Act 1860. •The first book Indian Classical Dances its Therapeutic Advantages was released by Sahitya Kala Parishad in a grand function at Triveni Kala Sangam which was lauded by press and media. Encouraging reviews came in TOI, Hindustan Times, Statesman etc. •Many lecture demonstrations were conducted in schools and institutions like IGNCA IIC Delhi Tamil Sangam etc in and all over India. •SUNAINA WHICH WAS REGISTERED WITH THE song AND Drama Division has presented with its talented artistes about 300 performances in the JJ colonies on social issues like prohibition, terrorism child labor etc. •The training wing of SUNAINA Sudhakar many dance dramas Krishna Leela Tarangini Silapatikarama Rama Nataka Keertanas Nasha hi Nasha Swarasangam, Ashtalakshmi the Woman Nrityabharati is affiliated as a full fledged examination centre and conducts examinations upto degree level and trains upto M.A. level . Every year about 300 candidates both external and internal appear for the practical and theory exams. •Nritybharati run by SUNAINA has also presented dance dramas choreographed by the President Guru Smt Kanaka Bala Ramayanam etc. •Every year Nrityabharati students participate in the National level competitions at Cuttack Pune and Dehradun and have won 23 to 22 trophies every time. •Every year SUNAINA presents the Annual Functions presenting seminars Annual programs etc. •Every year in January 15 to 17 SUNAINA presents INDRADHANUSH Festival for young professional artistes . •Every year SUNAINA presents CONFLUENCE a merging of Traditions in which Manipuri Kathak and Bharatanatyam were merged •SUNAINA runs an education wing BMSCAC for the poor children of daily wagers and Afghanistan refugees etc. which is and innovative English medium school. AIMS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE SOCIETY •To promote young and deserving artists in the field of dance and music •To run programs of dance and music curriculum to make the learners sand on their own legs as performers choreographers and artistes. •To create awareness among the pubic through lecture demonstrations and seminars on the benefits and treasures of dance. •To present dance and music performances all over India and abroad on various themes to spread awareness among the masses on the greatness of these art forms. •To publish write and distribute books journals magazines that enlighten the mass on the greatness of the arts. •To make programs on social themes using classical dance •To approach the Govt. for grants to present festivals conferences and seminars on dance and music and other art forms. •To set an education system where art culture and spiritualism is part and parcel of the education system.

Name: Umar Alisha Rural Development Trust
Major_Activities1: Education: Umar Alisha Akshara Jyothi – A programme for eradication of illiteracy , has made 10,300 illiterates to literates Presently running six Continuous Education Centers Joined 138 Child labour to Residential Bridge Schools Regularly giving Scholarships & Free Education to Poor Students. Organizing Umar Alisha Akshara Jyothi Rallies on 4th April every year to create awareness on literacy. Health : Running four Dr Umar Alisha Charitable Clinics , Dr Umar Alisha First Aid Clinic Free Homoeopathic services are offered to the poor at Mohiddin Badusha Memorial Multispecialty Homoeo Clinic Organising Mega Medical Camps at Rajahmundry every year in the month of December with nearly 25 specialist Doctors since 2007. Project for Prevention of Chikungunya and Organised 47 Chikungunya Homoeo Treatment and Preventive Medicine distribution camps and 2 Chikungunya Awareness Rallies and served nearly 1,51,119 people in the year 2006 . Project for Prevention of Swine Flu we have organized 141 Swine Flu Awareness Camps and Free Swine Flu Preventive Medicine Distribution Camps and distributed preventive doses to nearly 17 lakh people. Organized Free Homoeopathic Medical Camps – 110 ,Organized Free Allopathic Medical Camps – 15 , Organized Free Surgical Eye Camps – 10 , Organized Free Dental Camps – 6 , Organized Blood Donation Camps - donated 575 units of blood Sponsoring gifts for encouraging Family Planning operations - 450 people. Participating in Pulse Polio Program Women Welfare: Running 5 Tailoring Training Centers for women at Ramanakkapeta, viravada, Rajavommangi( Agency Area) , Kannapuram (Agency Area), Gummuluru and trained more than 2200 women. Distributed Sewing Machines to 47 Poor Women. Under the guidance and motivation of the trust so far formed – 197- Self Help Groups. Taking care of Women Health and Women Literacy Environment Protection: Free Distribution of Saplings and encouraging people for tree plantation. Regularly Organizing Awareness Programs on Environment Protection for healthy living So far more than 1, 00,000 saplings are planted. Participated in the One Day One Lakh Plantation Program Organized by Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation and planted 20, 000 plants by trust volunteers. Charity: Regularly organizes Free Distribution of Rice and Clothes to Poor on Auspicious occasions. Relief activities during Natural Calamities. Organizing free Milk Distribution Camps for children below 5 years during auspicious occasions. Free Distribution of Aids for Physically Handicapped people. Pensions for the Old Aged Poor. Organizing Free Water Distribution Camps during summer.

Name: Academy Theatre
Major_Activities1: Set up in 1984 the activities of Academy Theatre centre round one primary objective: to make a research into the history of the stage, particularly its music, in a term Natyasangeet, along with allied performing arts and try to revive the interest of the masses in this fond remembrance through productions, publications and preservations. With the objective, Academy Theatre has regularly manifested the research based concepts pertaining to the stage and its songs. Nearly 40 productions have been performed with high reputation and appreciation till date. Seminars, workshops and exhibitions on music, theatre, jatra, puppetry and paintings are being held regularly. Academy Theatre has presented educative as well as entertaining programmes on the several regional channels and also on the national network of Doordarshan. Academy Theatre has participated with its varied presentations in the national and international festivals in and outside the country. Moreover, Academy Theatre has published a biographical compilation in Bengali on Vincent Van Gogh and with its archival preservations, has enriched a number of definitive publications in the field of performing arts and literature. To be specific, the archival preservations of Academy Theatre include a wide range of materials: manuscripts date back to 1779, slide and photographs date back to 1869 , musical instruments date back to 18th century , and audio-video discs as also cassettes of live recordings of the performing personalities and events related to stage and music, not only of Bengal, but also of, all over India and abroad. While published materials date back to 1816, the library has over 8000 books and issues of over 800 periodicals in its stock. A large number of holdings are novel, rare and hardly available anywhere else. These things apart, the respective performers of theatrical and musical companies of yore are provided with financial and other required assistance, to the best of its ability, by Academy Theatre.

Name: Adarsh Saraswati Shiksha Samiti
Major_Activities1: ADARSH SARASWATI SHIKSHA SAMITI “Upliftment of India can only be achieved with upliftment of all section of society” Taking this phase of in consideration Adarsh Saraswati Shiksha Samiti has devoted its parts 24 Years for the development of poor and needy peoples through different schemes and projects sponsored by Govt. of India and Pvt. Donors. To uplift the status of poor peoples of the society, the Adarsh Saraswati Shiksha Samiti, Sonepat (Haryana) contributed its efforts in the fields of self employment training, Social services, Environment Protection, Agriculture etc. Through different programmes & Schemes during 2008-09 for the benefits of rural people, women, youth & childs. The main objects of Adarsh Saraswati Shiksha Samiti is- 1 Skill development & Human resources development. 2 To adopt destitute aged persons & to cater their basic needs. 3 Sustainable development through application of science & technology. 4 To implement various social welfare schemes for the benefits of the backward sections. 5 To provide qualitative health services & basic education. 6 Development & empowerment of women, Adolescents, Youth & Aged. 7 Working on stoping female feticide & AIDS etc. CHIEF ACHIEVEMENTS: a. The poorest specially S.C./S.T/Backward BPL population benefited from all the programmes. b. Destitute aged & women have been the major beneficiaries c. Health gains have reached the weaker sections through RCH prog., AIDS awareness among high risk groups, Drug de-addiction programme & settlement of Family Dispute matter out of court. d. Uplifted the life conditioned aged persons & created a sense of security about their remaining life. e. Economic empowerment of the BPL families have taken place through IGP training and organizing self-employment/gainful employment schemes. f. Government and private resources have been consistently tapped for providing welfare services to the weaker sections. The main activities carried out by the organisation during the year are as under :- SPONSOR A GRAND PARENTS PROGRAMME DRUG DE-ADDICTION REATMENT - CUM –REHABILITATION CENTRE DEVELOPMENT & EMPOWERMENT OF ADOLESCENTS PROGRAMME A) LIFE SKILL EDUCATION PROGRAMME B) RURAL COUNSELORS PROGRAMME HIV/AIDS AWARENESS SEMINAR TI PROJECT FOR MIGRANT POPULATION FOR AIDS PREVENTION OF FEMALE FOETICIDE HAPPY MARRIED LIFE SKILL EDUCATION WORKSHOP INTEGRATION OF HIV/AIDS ACTIVITIES IN TO ON GOING SCHEME OF PREVENTION OF ALCOHALISM & SUBSTANCE (Drug Abuse) FAMILY COUNSELING SERVICES:- NON RESIDENTIAL SCHOOL FOR SC BOY AND GIRLS (PRIMARY LEVEL) : MULTI SERVICE CENTER FOR OLDER PERSON VOCATIONAL TRAINING :- A Craft Centre for OBC (Cutting Tailoring & Embroidery): B Beautician Training : ENVIRONMENT BUILDING AGAINST FEMALE FOETICIDE REPRODUCTIVE CHILD HEALTH PROGRAMME: RAJIV GANDHI NATIONAL CREACHE UNITS-11 JANNI SWIDHA YOJANA: CULATURAL EXCHANGE PROGRAMME LEGAL AID CAMPS:- CONSUMERCAMPAIGN AGAINST POLLUTION CONSUMER AWARENESS COMPAIGNS :- CELEBRATION OF IMPORTANT DAYS :- Aged Welfare Activity OTHER ACTIVITIES: During the year the organisation successfully organized as below several programme:- 1.Female Feticide Awareness Rally - 2 2. Name: INSTITUTION FOR CULTURE AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT
Major_Activities1: MAIN ACTIVITIES OF I-CARD The main activities of I-CARD consist of empowering tribal communities to discover their identities and achieve recognition through a sustainable and replicable model of development. 1. Leadership training of tribal youth – since 2003, 20 youth (boys and girls) are being trained in our Leadership Training Centre at Sadiya, Tinsukia Dist. It is a ten month campus course, focusing on personal, social, cultural, spiritual and community development, transforming them into agents of change and transformation. 2. Probation – after the intensive training course, the youth leaders in four groups of five members each spread into 40 villages, each group covering 10 villages to complete their six-month probation period. During this field-placement the youth leaders (now known as Takars, meaning Stars) interact, eat and sleep in the villages, undertaking awareness campaigns on various social issues through street-plays, cultural songs and dances at the same time assisting formation of SHGs, JLGs , dissemination of right-based personal and social problems, organization of the village Youth Groups who are to initiate and take forward the actual work of transformation and change. This stage is followed by their vocational training, after which they are given free tools to start a business enterprise in their villages. 3. ARDA Committees – towards end of the probation period, Agency for Rural Development Action (ARDA) Committees are formed in every 10 village circle for continuity, sustainable and culturally-rooted development in areas of Agriculture, Livestock, Weaving, Health, Hygiene, Education & literature, Culture, Women & Youth and SHG. Most of their activities are related to women empowerment. It is an on-going process since 2002 such that as of date 280 villages in the 8 districts of upper Assam and 3 districts of south-east Arunachal Pradesh are under the coverage of I-CARDs developmental programmes and projects. 160 trained youth leaders–the Takars, 280 village Youth Groups, a network of TakarNets, 28 ARDA Committees and numerous village sub-groups constitute a formidable movement and unique agents of transformation that is dynamic, life-giving, sustainable and above all replicable. 4. I-CARDs well tested strategies have been internationally acclaimed by the ASHOKA FOUNDATION, based in Washington, USA – guaranteeing its ethical fiber, replicability, innovative and potency to create NATIONAL IMPACT. 5. I-CARD is one model NGO in the North East that has adequate physical infrastructure, professional manpower and vibrant presence in 11districts (8 in Assam and 3 in Arnchl Pradesh) for implementation of State /Central Govt Welfare Schemes. Students from foreign Universities are being encouraged to undertake research work on the replicability model of the developmental programmes of I-CARD. 6. Future Plans: Mobile Theatre – to effect internal transformation of the indigenous tribes in North East India. Computer Literacy Training Centre – self-employment oriented course for graduates. Paramedics Training Centre – a two-month course for placement of a health-worker in ARDA village circle. Teacher Training Institute – to train village teachers to teach in ARDA Public Schools. Human Rights Watch Cell – to deal with problems from within and outside the tribal communities.

Name: NANDIKAR
Major_Activities1: NANDIKAR A bunch of young persons, under the leadership of Ajitesh Bandyapadhyay, on June 29, 1960, founded Nandikar. ACTIVITIES: 1) Production and Performance of Plays: • During last 50 years, Nandikar mounted about 8o productions of plays from the West and our own, from the ancient to contemporary. These productions have been performed more than 7,500 times all over the country and abroad. • Nandikar also catalyzed about 36 Youth Theatre productions and also 100 Children Theatre Productions. 2) Nandikar has repeatedly performed in Bangladesh, Scotland, England, USA Canada, Sweden, Norway, Germany, Oman and China by presentation of plays, conducting Workshops and Dialogues. 3) National and International Theatre Festivals . • Nandikar organized 25 Theatre Festivals with National and Occasional participation. • Organized 2 National Women’s Theatre Festivals. • Also organized 26 Children Theatre Festivals 4) Theater - In - Education (TIE): Nandikar has been successfully engaged in Undertaking consistent programme on Theatre in Education among the students of schools, college, teachers and guardians for last 20 years, in 250 schools. 5) Theatre among variously challenged children and young persons. 6) SUPPORTED by Government Departments/National Organizations • It has worked with the Ministries of Culture; Youth Affairs and Sports; Women and Child welfare; and Human Resource Development (Department of Education); and • With the Sangeet Natak Akademi, Sahitya Akademi, National School of Drama, Indian Council for Cultural Relations and the Indian Council for Social Science Research, to name a few. 7) WORK WITH CHILDREN AND THE YOUNG • Nandikar, at the initiative of Department of Education HRD, began its “Theatre for the Motivation & Liberation of Student Community in Schools” since 1989. While continuing this pioneering works, Nandikar began Children’s Theatre on a larger and professional scale with support from Foreign Agencies: • Nandikar began its Project “In Search of Children’s Theatre” in the early nineties with support from the Ford Foundation. This seven-year project involved work with Variously-Deprived Children (e.g. Slum/Pavement-Dwelling and the Visually Handicapped Children). • The work with Children resumed in 2004 when Sida/Swedish ITI (International Theatre Institute), impressed with the group’s continuing work for and by the Children, offered funds for a three-year project. 8) NANDIKAR the Collaborator: Nandikar believed in seeking to find and in giving to receive. Hence it variously collaborated with Deptt. of Culture, Deptt. of Education, Deptt. of Women and Child Development, Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, Sangeet Natak Akademi, National School of Drama, Zonal Cultural Centres etc. and Banga Sammelans in the USA, Tagoreans, Nehru Centre UK, Brecht Zentrum, The British Council, Harvard University, The Ford Foundation, Rupantar and Rakhal of Bangladesh and Swedish ITI,Teater Pero, Dock Teatern Tittut, Marten Hedman’s Teater, Backa Theatre, Theatre with the Deaf & Dumb from Silent Teater and Sida – all from Sweden. 9) Theatre in promotion of National Integration among the youth: Nandikar organizes week-long National Integration Camp for about 150 youth from various states. 10) Theatre as Aid to the Professionals; Nandikar undertakes various programme and activities using Theatre as a tool for developing and enriching the art of communication among the Teachers of Schools/ Colleges/ University, Corporate Executives and also future Managers (with IIM, IIT, XLRI) ACHIEVEMENTS: ACCOLADES/AWARDS • Two of its directors – the late Ajitesh Bandyopadhyay and Rudraprasad Sengupta – are recipients of the National Award; • Swatilekha Sengupta was chosen by Satyajit Ray as the leading lady for his film ‘Home and the World’; • Sohini Sengupta won the President’s award as Best Actress in both Film and Stage; • Gautam Haldar won the AV Birla award for best Indian Young Theatre Person; • It has won numerous State Awards on various counts.

Name: Millennium india education foundation MIEF
Major_Activities1: • The ‘Millennium India Education Foundation’ (http://mief-india.blogspot.com) is an apex organization working for promotion, encouragement and conduction of research in all aspects of education for promoting science & technology • It is an All India Voluntary Organization equipped with specialized people from all walks of life. And in past five years MIEF has gained good experience and has been able to understand the issues related to development more keenly. Organizing Drama/Cultural Programme supported by Dte.of Prohibition, GNCT Delhi • The foundation has already successfully handled following govt.supported projects namely: o Nature Study Workshop for teachers August 2006 o Interactive Workshop For Science Teachers Using Low Cost No Cost Teaching Aids organized in July-Dec.2003 and o Science Caravan organized in Oct-Nov.2004. o Auo Mil Jhul Ke Science Ko Jaane aur Apanaye 2007 o To create a repository of all the available data on the women & adolescent girl child health issues with specific reference to anemia and Nutrition. 2007 Sensitization of Working women about their work related occupational hazards and about Do’s & Don’ts for its prevention- supported by DST • Besides, the other major project handled by the foundation has been: o Working with schoolchildren and teachers by organizing teacher training workshops and different competitions/ seminars/ workshops for students. o Organized Inter School competitions on the eve of World Earth Day on 22nd April 2008. More than 200 students attended it from 33 schools. The event was held in Noida. o Working in association with other NGOs by providing help in execution of their projects. (At present, the foundation is providing voluntary teachers for a school of underprivileged children run by an NGO in Noida.) o Sponsoring at least one poor student to pursue his/her education for at least one academic year (two students have been provided financial assistance till now.) o Helping professionals particularly doctor community, by educating them on management of personal finances (two annual conferences for doctors on portfolio management have been organized till date.) o Facilitating proper networking within the community by preparing database (one such directory has been prepared for Kashmiri Pandit community residing in Noida, U.P.) o Facilitating proper health care to people through MIEF Health Cards.

Major_Activities1: ACHIEVEMENTS OF THE ASSOCIATION Lalit Kala Sangam is one of the leading State Level Cultural Organizations of Manipur dealing with Music, Dance, Drama and Visual arts. Since its inception in 1989 it has been functioning as the apex body with patronage of Performing Art Lovers & its Members of the State, for preserving and promoting the vast intangible heritage of the diverse culture expressed in the form of performing arts. In furtherance of its objectives the Association tries to afford and encourage better education in performing arts by establishing institutions and by organizing concerts, conferences, plays, competitions, workshop and also publishing periodicals & books. Moreover to harbour a spirit of unity in the sphere of performing arts and to keep relation and friendship with other organizations of similar aims & objects of the state and beyond. The main activities of the Sangam are carried out through various means 1) Teacher Training cum Orientation Programme conducted with an objective of effective teaching since 2003. Participants are given course completion certificates and prizes annually. 2) So far the Lalit Kala Sangam has open and run six Music Institutions of Hindustani Classical Music at four Districts of Manipur State at different Districts : Imphal East, Imphal West, Thoubal and Bishnupur. Lalit Kala Sangam Music Institute is affilliated to the Indira Kala Sangeet Vishwa- Vidyalaya, (IKSVV) Khairagarh (C.G.) and students are appearing annual Examinations conducted by the said University since 2010. 3) With a view to promote cultural activities, the Lalit Kala Sangam has also initiated Lecture cum Demonstration Programme of Indian Classical Music as well as Traditional & Folk Music at several places of the State since 1990. These types of programme were held successfully at Andro, Imphal East District, at Shamurou, Thoubal District and at Nambol, Bishnupur District etc. 4) Vadyabrinda of the Association also performed at many State Level Festivals organized by Govt of Manipur. Other multi-cultural programmes had also given in various places of Imphal and other towns of the state. 5) Regular performances of Sugam Sangeet is also giving in the A.I.R. Imphal & DDK, Imphal. Students of Lalit Kala Sangam Music Institute has also performed Group & Individual Songs at AIR & DDK, Imphal. The performing Group of the Association performing rregularly at the AIR and DDK Imphal 6) Sankirtana Group of this Association initiated in the year 1999 with a formal function at KAINA Govindajee Temple and giving regular performances in various ritual ceremonies and functions held at different parts of the State. 7) Published (a) books on Manoharsai Kirtana in 2004 and thereafter revised editions (b) Sheishak Sheidam Vol I, a text book on Folk Song, Devotional & Patriotic Songs with Sargam Notation in 2008. 8) Music Competitions & Music Workshops are arranged annually since 1990.

Name: Kolkata Creative Art Performers
Major_Activities1: Facilitating the pulse-polio movement : kcap has played an instrumental role in facilitating the implementation of UNICEF’s pulse polio program aimed at eradication of polio. We got the assignment of executing an issue-based publicity campaign in three districts of West Bengal viz. Birbhum, Murshidabad and Purba Medinipur. Children development workshop : We have always emanated our proclivity towards the health and environmental issues. in jharkhand and maheshtala of deoghar, we have conducted a series of workshops with the basic objective of improving the health status of the local children and adolescents. The primary segment encapsulated the children and the adolescents the secondary segment encompassed the parents of the children. Through the workshops the members of the secondary group were sensitized regarding the scientific techniques of child rearing which can play an important role in fostering the cognitive development, emotional maturity and physical well being of their offspring. Workshop for attitudinal engineering : We have executed customized workshops for the sex workers of Bangaon, Bashirhat and Matiya all in West Bengal with the basic objective of levitating their self-esteem. Experimental training on creativity : We are being driven by our indomitable spirit of engineering productive changes within the most impoverished human populace. In this process we have always endeavored to increase the potential elements within the young participants in different field of activities. Workshop on anti-trafficking : While conducting a workshop on strategies of trafficking prevention, at Bongohn, Swarupnagar, Sandeshkhali, Gaighata at North 24th Pargana and Mekhliguange at Kooch Bihar district all in West Bengal. The target audience encompassed the members of the local clubs. They requested us to float a theatrical production on trafficking, to make the common people sensitized regarding this delicate and sensitive social problem. Workshop against alcohol & drug abuse : Now let us enunciate another effort delivered by us to deploy the indomitable spirit of the poverty stricken people in the rural milieu. We took the initiative of executing an exhaustive and incisive awareness campaign against drug-abuse amidst different places including remote rural areas of West Bengal. Grants received : Received Production & Equipment Grant from Ministry of Culture, Govt. of India. Seminar & awareness programme on Legal rights for women supported by national commission for women. Our other achievements : We participated in awareness campaign through theatre on AIDS with WBSAPCS, NACO, PSI, and other social organization. Besides we performed awareness shows on the occasion of World AIDS Day since 2002. We design awareness campaign through theatre on RCH, Food adulteration, Malaria with IEC Division. We are involved in the programme with West Bengal Pollution Control Board. Campaign on child protection & rights with Save the children, Don Bosco, Child Line, Grouppe Developpement. We are working with slum children of ‘Nabodisha’, a Kolkata Police project on children. We have since received a few prominent awards. It is our aim to achieve all-out social development including understanding the value of life, education with cultural upliftment that will ultimately make people happy and prosperous.

Name: NILGIRIS ADIVASI WELFARE ASSOCIATION
Major_Activities1: One 60 bedded hospital, 2 10 bedded hospitals, 2 daily dispensaries, 1 mobile medical units are running in interior settlements in Nilgiris and a medical unit functioning in B.R. Hills, Karnataka and these units are grant aided by Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Govt. of India. One Mobile medical outreach unit operating in Kotagiri block aided by Tamil Nadu Health System project. Sickle Cell Anaemia screening and councelling project aided by Tamil Nadu Health System Project. 18 Balwadis in tribal settlements out of these 11 units grant aided by Tamil Nadu Social Welfare Board. Education and economic development through sponsorship programmes covering 1500 families and assisting 3000 tribal children with education in schools, universities and professional courses aided by ChildFund India. A Rehabilitation Farm colony for families from the Paniya tribal community - Farming Tea, Pepper and other spices on 104 acres of land donated by Tamil Nadu Government. Financial assistance to 600 tribal families to develop tribal waste lands with tea, coffee, spices and other suitable crops. Empowerment of tribal women through support to self help groups (SHGs) and training men and women in entrepreneurship and capacity development. 180 tribal SHGs are promoted by NAWA. Sports activities and leadership capability development among tribal youth. Documenting, preserving and promoting tribal lore, wisdom, folk skills, arts and crafts.

Name: Indian Centre for Integrated Development
Major_Activities1: ICID strives to empower the vulnerable and weaker sections of the society and enable them to lead a dignified life. ICID promotes integral human growth through services to the needy and vulnerable in the society. The present focus of the organization is on the integral development of children with a special emphasis on the children in difficult situation who need special care and protection. It aims to create awareness among the street children on various social issues that affect them, to enable the children to access better health care and services and to promote child rights especially of survival, development and participation. The organization organizes various programs on health, hygiene, education, values and human rights with a special focus on children. • Yuvajyothi Care and Support centre provides basic facilities and mainstreams them through constant care, acceptance and special supportive environment. The centre is unique in its nature as it is located in a community which enables the children to interact with their peers as well as the elders in the community and be positively influenced. Over 500 children have accessed facilities till date. • Nirmal Jyothi Program is implemented at Gittikhadan among children in beggary and rag picking for a dignified living. Approximately 170 children access basic facilities, non formal education, recreational activities and 65 children are involved in small saving through bank accounts. Hygiene education, tuition classes, vocational training such as beauty culture, tailoring, embroidery and craft has been initiated are part of the program. • Asha Program include non formal education and capacity building of children from slum community. A centre is established at Hazaripahad where about 40 adolescent girls from slum communities are trained in embroidery, beauty culture, craft and tailoring. The Balwadi (kindergarten) focuses on the development of young children and prepare them for schooling. A playroom and a library has been provided at the centre. • Deepshika Program is implemented in Tulsi Nagar, near the dumping yard in Lakhad Ganj Zone of Nagpur city with the children in rag picking. The programme includes hygiene and life skill education for adolescents. The balwadi and toy centre prepares the pre school children for schooling and divert their attention from rag picking. Over 100 children benefit from the programme. • Regular summer camps on life skills are organized with the objective of building self confidence and providing opportunities for creative expression in children aged between 8-16 years from slum communities. Over 300 children participate in different camps every year. • Janya – A project for reducing vulnerability towards HIV/AIDS and building life skills among the children in difficult situation supported by Avert Society Mumbai: 3021 children were given right information on Human Sexuality, STI, HIV/AIDS, 808 children were equipped with adequate life skills, 837 children in High Risk Behaviour were provided counselling, 3308 significant others were sensitized, more than 400 children participated in Bal Melas.

Name: Blind People Association India
Major_Activities1: With the mission of promoting comprehensive rehabilitation of persons with all categories of disabilities through education, training, employment, community based rehabilitation, integrated education and other innovative means, the organization has emerged the most leading comprehensive NGO in the field. Initiated by a group of blind persons during 1954 as a Recreation Club, it is now a large multi-faceted Agency providing a wide range of services to persons with disabilities. The turning top however came during 1976 when the organization decided to professionalize its services. Today the BPA is one of the largest organizations of its kind in Asia. Apart from a variety of regular activities, its innovative approaches include a state wise community based rehabilitation project, integrated education, services for special need children including those with deafblind, multiple disabilities, cerebral palsy, mental retardation, autism and low vision. It has a developed a variety of products and devices under the auspices of the Science & Technology Mission for Persons with Disabilities. It has also established a language lab for teaching of Braille, media electronic Braille literacy project, limb fitting centre, vision stimulation room, world class recording studio, ultra modern Braille production unit, low vision centre, comprehensive eye care unit, Kutch Comprehensive Rehabilitation Centre for providing services to earthquake affected people, a well equipped resource centre and research & development unit. Encouraged from performance of organization, the National Trust has established the State Nodal Agency Centre; the Rehabilitation Council of India has established as headquarter of the Zonal Advisory Committee (Western Region). It has also been established as Nodal Agency for State level coordination in the disability sector by the Rehabilitation Council of India as well as by the Department of Social Justice & Empowerment for the implementation of State Level Community Based Rehabilitation Programme. The Director of Voluntary Agencies, Govt. of Gujarat, has recognized it as relief organization. It has also applied for renewal of recognitions as a Scientific and Industrial Research Organization by the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research (DSIR); as a training institute by the Rehabilitation Council of India for the training of the teachers and conducting orientation of the PHC Medical Officers, promoting continuing rehabilitation education. It has already received a number of Award for its meritorious performance including Federation of Chamber of Commerce and Industries (FICCI) Award for Outstanding Placement of the Disabled; State Award for the Placement of Persons with Mental Retardation; National Award for Outstanding Performance in the field of Handicapped Welfare; International Golden Award for Community Development Services Overseas from the Help the Aged International It has a very ambitious expansions plan, its forthcoming activities include a well equipped training institute, CBR Project for Persons with Psychiatric Disabilities, and a Day care centre for persons with multiple disabilities. It has also established an eye hospital, an orthopaedic hospital, ENT Hospital, a number of physiotherapy centres and inclusive schools. It has recently introduced early intervention, day care services and residential services for children with multiple disabilities. BPA is thus known for developing and promoting multifarious activities for persons with different disabilities with the target of ensuring comprehensive development of persons with all categories of disabilities.

Name: youthclubofbejjipuram
Major_Activities1: Promoted six Sakrushi Thrift and Credit Societies with an enrollment of 2820 rural women and registered under MACS Act 199. They are self reliant. Imparted Vocational Skills to 6175 Women and Youth with the support of NABARD, CAPART, FVTRS and Ministry of Youth Affairs and promoted them as rural entrepreneurs. We have mainstreamed 8400 out of School Children, Child Labour and migrant children into Formal Schools by enhancing their competencies with the support of SSA,NCLP and MHRD. Provided skills to 3000 + Farmers in organic Farming and sustainable Agriculture with the support of MISEREOR- Germany, NABARD, ICRISAT-Hyderabad and Department of Agriculture, GOAP. Created demand for individual Household latrines in 20 GPs of Srikakulam District and facilitated 10000 Families to construct IHHLs under SBM with the support of UNICEF under AASRA Project. Identified 1440 HRGs{940 FSWs + 500 MSMs and TGs } and providing them behavior change communication, condom services, STI treatment services and referral services with the support of APSACS-Vijayawada under Target Intervention Project. Care and Support was extended to 1112 HIV effected and infected Children and their families in 7 Revenue Mandals of Srikakulam District and mainstreamed them with Govt.Schemes/NGO s with the support of Global Fund 6th round/Alliance India HIV/AIDS. Capacitated 150 Tribal farmers in Vana Samrakshana samitis in Tribal sub-plan area of Visakhapatnam with the support of CEFNARM, Deptt. of Forests and Environment. Capacitated 2025 farmers in 11 WUAs in 11 villages to make better use of Irrigation tanks and promoted livelihoods after renovated irrigation tanks with the support of Irrigation and CAD Dept. and CAPART. Implementing CHILDLINE Project with the support of CHILDLINE India Foundation supported by Ministry of WCD for providing Care & protection to Childtren at Risk in Srikakulam District under Collab.Scheme. Promoted Producers Organization for 500 Jute Farmers with the support of NABARD. Promoted 2 Handicrafts Clusters in Jute and leather Puppet Crafts in Srikakulam and East Godavari Districts under AHVY Scheme with the support of O/o the DC(Handicrafts),Ministry of Textiles, GOI.

Name: Vikram A Sarabhai Community Science Centre
Major_Activities1: Vikram A Sarabhai Community Science Centre is a pioneering community science centre which aims to nurture young minds and mould them towards scientific thinking The techniques adopted by the Centre help in making the process of enquiry and earning an enjoyable and lasting experience Origin of the Centre One of Indias most renowned scientists Dr Vikram A Sarabhai had laid the foundation of the institute in the year 1966 to foster scientific temper thinking and innovative science teaching Facilities at the Centre The Centre has well equipped science maths and computer laboratories library workshop science playground quadrangle and auditorium VASCSC is the proud recipient of National Award for Outstanding Efforts in Science and Technology Communication 2008 awarded by Rashtriya Vigyan Evam Prodyogiki Sanchar Parishad Department of Science and Technology Glimpses of VASCSCs activities The Centre has been unique in combining non formal and formal techniques to ensure better understanding of science and mathematics It plays an active role in education and reaches to communities through inquiry experiment media etc Besides it has pioneered several concepts in India such as open and maths laboratory interactive exhibition space science playground and served as a role model for the foundation of other science centers in the country The centre develops teaching learning aids kits publications science communication materials interactive exhibits It also helps in setting up laboratories and science activity centres in schools In the past it has been instrumental in curricular development for schools in science School Science programme Schools and students all over Gujarat and other parts visit the Centre They are initiated into activity based learning through science shows demonstrations science hands on science and maths labs for better understanding Guidance for Projects & Practicals The Centre guides students to prepare syllabus based projects and perform practicals under the guidance of our experts Annual Programmes Spread over an academic session Centre offers several interesting science programmes for children to pursue their interest in science Summer Programmes Offered during summer vacation these are designed in a manner to initiate children into different streams of science maths and computers Outreach Programmes The Centre conducts several activities trainings workshops exhibitions events for schools and communities in all parts of the country to explain the science and mathematics concepts through our own TLMs and publications Capacity Building Centre conducts teachers trainings & workshops in science hands on and maths lab It also organizes workshops for the students in Model Rocketry etc Sciencexpress Sciencexpress with four national records is a state of the art science exhibition on a unique train traveling across India A joint Indo German pathway to discovery the Sciencexpress was launched by the Department of Science & Technology Govt of India and Max Planck society Germany and is managed by the Centre all over the country During its journey so far the Sciencexpress has traveled over 32000 km in 400 days covering over 100 cities and has received over 35 lakh visitors More details on www sciencexpress in

Name: Sanchetana Community Health and Research Centre
Major_Activities1: Sanchetana beginning from a small clinic in an Ahmedabad slum-Sanchetana has evolved as a human rights body that rallies the urban poor for the common cause of social justice-education-gender equity- women empowerment and secularism-Sanchetana calls for social justice in health so as to transform the nature and practice of state accountability in ensuring adequate conditions where all persons irrespective of their class caste or age can be healthy. The urban slum dwellers of Ahmedabad city who are victims of economic stress and impoverishment- exploitation-communal violence and are subjected to the denial of their rights through various modes of oppression and segregation-Raising awareness levels among the ill informed to facilitate the acceptance of healthy behaviors-Building and strengthening community organization to call on collective action-Supporting peoples initiatives to ensure peoples participation in decision-making-Initiating and joining campaigns and movements to protect human rights-Demanding the establishment of people-centric public health systems to guarantee Right to Health Care-Training of health activists to enhance their skills in effectively reaching out to the communities-Developing informative materials to increase the awareness levels-Collecting and disseminating relevant information to bring constructive change-Analyzing the multi-farious causes of human rights violations to promote and protect human dignity-Through multi-pronged mainstream, as well as alternative communication mediums like Street-plays Exhibitions (Community level City level) Folk Songs-Dance-Campaigns-Puppet-shows-Television shows-Games-Workshops-Training programs-Celebration of festivals-Institutionalized days etc-Women Health Through Reproductive Health Program efforts are made to build an understanding among men and women to see women reproductive and sexual rights as human rights-whereby she has ability to make decisions regarding her reproduction and sexuality and is in a position to implement those decisions-Adolescent Health-Adolescents are highly vulnerable to changes in social conditions and the socio-cultural context in which adolescent development takes place has an overwhelming impact on their health. Our Adolescent Health Program seeks to enhance the capacities of adolescents so that they are in a position to take wiser decisions for their future and achieve self-respect and sense of worth. Adolescent girls in the age group of 10 to 13 and 14 to 18 are given necessary skills to deal with physical and psychological changes that they undergo as well how to make responsible decisions regarding their sexual behavior-Research Studies on-Health Care Delivery System of Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation Angst Theirs and Ours Domestic Violence-An epidemic on the upsurge-Why some men beat their wives A report about perpetrators of Domestic Violence-Audio-Visual Productions - Basti Se Basti Tak. Hindi(Genesis and Evolution of Sanchetana) Wind in their sails. Eng-Hindi subtitles.( Sanchetana in the 20) - Stree tu Jagati Raheje- Gujarati-Hindi subtitles-(Domestic Violence-Socio-medical concerns)Agaaz–Hindi (evolution of IFIE)-Educational brochures(Gujarati)-Worms infestation-Sexually Transmitted Diseases-Tuberculosis-Anemia-Breast and Cervical Cancer-World Health Day (April 7)-International Women Day (March 8)-World Peace Day-World AIDS Day-We stand for-Equality–social-economic-cultural-Gender equality-Mutual respect-Faith in people Secularism-Belief in democratic-eclectic and plural society
issues_working_db: Education & Literacy,Health & Family Welfare,HIV/AIDS,Human Rights,Minority Issues,Women's Development & Empowerment,

Name: BHARAT LOKHIT SEVA SAMITI
Major_Activities1: Bharat Lokhit Seva Samiti was set up on April 19, 1994 with the aim to serve the society. Various activities are carried out for overall social welfare, which includes education for mentally retarded and physically handicapped, organising Shibirs, seminars and short term courses for children and women welfare and employment in backward rural areas. CHINMAY Resident Institute For Mentally Retarded was established in 1998 under the auspices of Bharat Lokhit Seva Samiti. The major aim of the institute is to rehabilitate the mentally challenged children by providing a conducive environment for their overall development. It aims at providing all kind of support to the mentally challenged children for their own development, for making them self-reliant and socially acceptable.

The nature of the Activity is running of Special School and Vocational Training Center for the mentally Handicapped Children of Poor Families belongs to Rural Areas. i.e. Vanguru ,Duggirala ,Sanivarapu Peta, Vatluru, kotthuru,Thonangi, Madepalli,Chataparru and Jalipudi. This Organisation is Participating in Multipurpose identification Camps for the Disabled Conducted by the Asst. Director Disable Welfare, Eluru,West Godavari Dist every year and identifying MR Children for their Rehabilitation. The Special Teachers of this Organisation are attending home guidence program every week end for giving guidence to the parents of Disabled Children in addition to their regular duties. This Organisation is following the guidelines of NIMH ,Hyderabad for the Rehabilitation of MR Children. This Organisation is conducting medical Camps and Awareness Camps for the benefit of Disabled and their Parents Periodically. this Organisation is also conducting meetings,cultural programs Occassionally every year. Name: Kathakriti
Major_Activities1: Kathakriti, a renowned theatrical group of Kolkata, took its birth nearly twenty years back, in the year 1989. It was established by some talented the enthusiastic young theatre workers and appeared in limelite at Bijan Theatre of Kolkata on 10th March 1989, with some programmes on theatre. Thereafter it has been travelling many a path in the field of theatre and culture with glorious success. In such journey, Kathakriti has been supported by Sangeet Natak Akademi, Deptt. of Culture, Govt. of India, Paschim Banga Natya Akademi, I&CA Deptt. Govt. of West Bengal, National School of Drama and other theatre organizations and persons of different fields. Since inception Kathakriti has in its bag, so many successful productions amongst them mentionable are SonarChabi, Kanamama(awarded Dishari Puraskar for best direction), Chhutir Khela(awarded Hritwik Ghatak Memorial award for best direction and production), Ayudh(Awarded Dishari Puraskar for best direction), Mononiketan, Shattru Samppati(Awarded best play wirte by Paschim Banga Natya Akademi), Amrita Atit, Jambo, Octopas Limited, Sei to Tomar Alo, Chandroloke Agnikando, Shraman, Shankranti etc. Kathariti presented their productions on different stages in Kolkata and other districts of West Bengal and some provinces of the coutnry, went to Bangladesh also with the troupe. Kathakriti participated in different drama festivals being organized by themselves and other theatrical groups and Paschim Banga Natya Akademi and National School of Drama. All these performences are wide applause from all cross section of the audience, which is the most staple force that kept Kathakriti going ahead without any break. Besides productions of plays Kathakriti has been publishing Smarak Natya Patra every year besides special issues on Ajitesh Bandopadhyay and Mamata Chattopadhyay wherein the articles are being written by the eminent theatre personalities in their fields. The seminars are being arranged regularly on different topics of theatre every year. Ajitesh Smarak Baktrita have been arranged thirteen times till March 2009. Kathakriti believes that theatre and threatre only can add such zest to life and humanity which is divine in our mortal environment.

Name: NATARAJ EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE TRUST
Major_Activities1: We are happy to explain our activities towards the upliftment of rural educated youth through “Nataraj Educational and Charitable Trust”. We started our programme during 2006. The major aim of this Trust is providing education facilities to the children hailing from rural and urban areas. Also we are looking to extend our services in the areas of agricultural development, animal husbandry, IT enablement in rural areas. Communicative English: We conducted communicative English course for the past three years in Kattumannar Koil Taluk, Cuddalore district, Tamil Nadu State. Students of this area were facing difficulty in spoken English. So the authorities of the trust organized a free coaching class for the benefit of the school going children and +2 completed students. Average of 35 students participates in the training every year for 21 days. Well trained and experienced staffs have been working as trainers. The training has been conducted during May, which is typically summer holidays and also the students wait to join colleges in this period. Practical training in spoken English is also provided. The objective of training the students in the age group of 14 to 18 in English language is successfully implemented in the project area. It is also proposed to introduce similar courses in other areas of rural background. At the headquarters it is planned to organize spoken English course for the benefit of the working employees and businessmen during weekend while the trainings for students is continuing. Access to Higher Education: To provide access to University Education to the rural youth the trust made tie up with the Directorate of Distance Education, Tamil University, Thanjavur. A study centre of the university has been started in 2007. More than twenty candidates have been enrolled through our centre. We have our own academic experts to guide the students. We have sufficient infrastructure facilities. The students enrolled are mostly unemployed and unaware of the available facility in continuing their education and enhancing their employment opportunities. The University department of Distance Education Offers, UG, PG, Professional, Diploma and Certificate courses. Providing Computer Education: The Trust has obtained franchisee with ISO 9001 certified Sysway Software Solutions Pvt. Ltd., Chennai in 2009. The students of this locality mostly women candidates avail this opportunity. More than 35 students have enrolled in learning computer education. The school going students are charged with a nominal fee. Priority is given to socially and economically poor children. SC/ST and minority candidates are offered free computer education. The courses offered are COTT, HDSD, DCA, DDE, DTP, DAP and DBP. Out of school children: Yet another area we concentrate is school children who discontinue their education due to various reasons like failure and discontinuous of the regular course. These out of school children are availing this opportunity. Educational Consultancy and Employment cell: The trust offers free coaching classes for the prospective candidates appearing for the competitive examinations for state and central government jobs.

Name: Sanga Mithra Development Association
Major_Activities1: Aims and Objectives of the organization: 1. To promote awareness of Educational opportunities and assist materially to get educated. 2. To support financially by providing hostels, accommodation facilities for study and give educational support for getting employment. 3. Multipurpose activities like promoting education among weaker sections like schedule caste, schedule tribe and economically weaker sections of people from all background. 4. To establish/ start self – managed student’s messes at colleges/High schools etc., and hostel facilities at all areas in the state. 5. To start examination support coaching centers, and create self – employment awareness camps and opportunities and also promote awareness of opportunities for weaker sections on various central state schemes for betterment. 6. To work among the needy and weaker sections of people among the society and also promote voluntary leadership among the educated youth. 7. To start and run educational institutions in general , professional vocational and other subjects for the benefit of all youngsters to impart education at all stages for the promotion of literature, arts and sciences, sanitation, medical nursing and all other subjects that may be decided from time to time. 8. To encourage games, sports, and athletics and inculcate among the students the value for education, education for life, life for love, love for man, man for services, service for society. 9. To do all such things as will help the attainment of the objects of the society 10. To organize, undertake relief measures, rehabilitation and reconstruction programmes aimed at total development of people and areas affected by natural calamities 11. To promote self – help economic development programmes, sanitation maternity, child health and women welfare programmes with the co – operation of national and international agencies. 12. To create awareness in tribal Rural and urban areas by conducting cultural programmes. 13. Regarding various sectors like health and hygiene, utilization of science and technology in Agricultural, literacy and various development programmes sponsored by the govt 14. To promote social housing with a view to inculcate community understanding and social living among the tribal, rural and urban areas. 15. To promote develop; implement the programmes which seek to organize the poor around vital socio, economic subjects. 16. To conduct medical camps, eye camps, immunization and vaccination camps in rural and tribal areas, and also provide preventive medicines in remote areas 17. Generally to do all such other things as will help the attainment of the objects of the society. 18. To sensitize the larger community, especially youth on relevant social issues. 19. To organize activities to mobilize the youth women and disadvantaged sections like schedule caste, scheduled tribe of the population for social development. 20. To make efforts to ensure capacity building among the marginalized sections of the society. 21. To enlighten the youth regarding ecological protection, conservation or water resources, social justice, affirmative action, empowerment, gender equity and rights. 22. To promote the sprit of secularism and disseminate the message or pluralist tradition across the society. 23. To organize micro credit and thrift societies to foster the sprit of self – help; and import technical vocational training to unemployed youth. 24. To identify and promote local talent, enhancement of indigenous resources, handicrafts, arts and sports and encourage serious pursuits among youth. 25. To organize community development activities in backward areas and strong partnership between people and community based organizations. 26. To promote the sprit of group living, brotherhood and fraternity and to provide free legal aid to socially, economically backward and oppressed sections of the community 27. To start old age homes and to provide accommodation, shelter, food etc., senior citizens or either sex. 28. To develop spiritual knowledge among people as a charity during festivals to perform poor feeding and distribution of clothes to the poor. 29. To promote the tests in fine arts and historic talent among the young people. 30. To develop plantation 31. To promote art, culture, literature, music under aesthetics to felicitate and honor eminent personalities in their respective fields. 32. To uplift the poor and the down trodden people by organizing self- help economic development programmes. 33. To establish maintain run develop extent grant, donate for , to aid hospitals, clinics, dispensaries, medical laboratories, free medical camps and other medical relief and aid to the physically handicapped, aged and mentally retarded poor. 34. To establish, maintain, run, develop, improve, extend grant contributions for homes to the destitute women and disabled persons, orphanages and other social welfare centers, libraries, reading rooms etc., and to provide counseling and training to the family members of the disabled persons and for the welfare and upliftment of the general public with special attention to rural areas. 35. To promote the system of Ayurveda, the proud and prestigious legacy of India to nurture the medicinal plantations, social forestry, industries and training of necessary personnel particularly of disabled section and also of general public to eradicate poverty and unemployment. 36. To form, maintain, run, develop, improve, extend and grant donations for establishing community halls, recreation centers for facilitating and encouraging cultural activity in Andhra Pradesh and serve the needy public in whatsoever manner it is deemed fit and appropriate. 37. To establish, maintain, run, develop, improve, extend grant contributions and to aid and assist in the establishment, maintenance, running, development, improvement and extension of any other types of such charitable institutions. 38. To Print, publish and distribute gratuitously or otherwise journals, periodicals, books, handouts or leaflets that the society; may think desirable for the promotion of its objectives. 39. To conduct such other programmes which promote the objectives of the society more in particular to rural population and to extend any other such activity incidental to objects of the aforesaid society. 40. To organize community health programs, sanitations, maternity, child health, women welfare programsmes and constructions of houses and latrines for the downtrodden poor people and to conduct such other welfare programmes with the cooperation of national and international agency.

Name: SRI DAKSHINYA BHAVA SAMITHI
