Name: Ramakrishna Mission Rajahmundry
Major_Activities1: Achievements of our Mobile Dispensary for Tribals We are operating a Mobile Dispensary for Tribals since 1985. At present we are maintaining two vehicles, two doctors and 8 medical and non-medical staff. It is also equipped with X-Ray, ECG, Semi Auto Analyser, Ultra Sound Scanner, and Clinical Lab. The medical team visits the various tribal areas weakly four times from Thursday to Sunday. They stay in the base camp provided by the Integrated Tribal Development Agency (local government body) at Rampachodavaram, a place 53 km from Rajahmundry. Nearly 1,600 patients are visiting our camps weekly. We have treated nearly 3,00,000 cases from April 2008 to March 2009, giving free medicines. Education about TB and Diabetics Apart from giving free medicines, we educate the tribal people about the dreaded diseases like T.B., Diabetics etc. through CD shows. This education will help them to know about the disease and the use of medicines. Consultation by Specialists – Multi Specialists Medical Camps In addition to the regular weekly camps mentioned above we conduct Special Medical Camps once in three months. In these Special Camps specialist doctors from Rajahmundry render free service to nearly 1000 patients in one day. Specialists check the progress of the TB cases and prescribe the medicines accordingly. Eye Care for Tribals Eye camps are conducted along with Special Medical Camps. Patients are screened for eye defects and needy cases are brought to Rajahmundry and operated in a private clinic free of charge. They and their assistants are provided with free food during their operation periods. We provide IOL and glasses to patients free of charge.
issues_working_db: Health & Family Welfare,Tribal Affairs,

Name: RANGAPRABHATH
Major_Activities1: The Rangaprabhath Childrens Theatre perhaps the first Childrens Theatre in India which has completed 40 years of active and creative service in developing a highly satisfactory support system of educational strategies to the formal schooling system has been in the forefront of organizing appropriate programs involving children teachers and parents The experiment which began under the general guidance and support of the doyen of the Malayalam Theatre Prof G Sankara Pillai was ably sustained with necessary zeal and dedication by its founder president Sri K Kochunarayana Pillai himself a distinguished teacher actor and artist of great repute In recognition of the experience of Rangaprabhath in the field of education and innovative approaches to Childrens education reputed organization such as the IGNCA CCRT Gandhi Smriti and Darsan Samiti Sangeeth Natak Akademi and the Department of Culture and National Balbhavan NewDelhi etc Recognized the Rangaprabhath as a Resource and Training Centre The Rangaprabhath during its 40 years of work for Children’s holistic development through performing arts has won several awards and recognition from the state and National Academies departments Government and specialized agencies which promote art education and culture The conferment of Rama Chandran Ikeda Award to Rangaprabhath in 1999 is a great recognition of the significant role played by Rangaprabhath in Childrens education through performing arts particularly Childrens Drama and awareness creation both in surrounding community and in the Schools in Trivandrum and elsewhere in the state Rangaprabhath also got very prestigious International GDBirla award for the year 2005 introduced by the Birla Academi of Art and Culture for preserving the Indian Cultural and Spiritual Heritage The senior fellowship from Government of India was awarded to Kochunarayana Pillai the president of Rangaprabhath Since the recognition of National Balbhavan the activities related to children are monitored and encouraged under the guidance of the National Balbhavan New Delhi The aim and scope of the work consist of a comprehensive and composite approach to inculcate in socially economically backward children habits attitudes and values and offer a serious of opportunities to involve themselves creatively in any or more of the following activities which the organizers are hopeful of using them as a useful educational tools and aids Childrens Plays Folk Arts Dance Music and Instrumental Music Theatre Games Story Telling Creative Dramatics Puppetry Choral Music Painting Drawing Book Binding and Making

Name: KALYANI NATYACHARCHA KENDRA
Major_Activities1: Kalyani Natyacharcha Kendra has been formally constituted in 1996 and later it has become a full-fledged Theatre Organization in 1997. Since its inception it has been absolutely engaged in promoting theatre appreciation in and around Kalyani-a University city some 48 kms away from Kolkata. The organization beleives that GOOD THEATRE IS ESSENTIAL FOR GOOD LIVING. Initially it has organized 6 annual Multilingual theatre festivals in the month of November and December till 2001 in collaboration with EZCC and NANDIKAR-a Kolkata based Theatre Group. From 2002 onwards the organization has been holding a 10 day theatre festival from 17 to 26 December every year in Ritwik Sadan- a well equipped theatre auditorium in Kalyani having 994 seats. The 15th theatre festival has taken place during 17 to 26 December 2009. In the festivals- each year- a number of 15 renowned Theatre Groups from Kolkata and Districts participate.This Non-Kolkata based Theatre Festival is only of its kind in West Bengal-where not a single ticket is PUSH-SOLD. And it is also a pride to mention that almost all the shows become HOUSEFULL in this festival. That means approximately 12 to 14 thousand spectators come to the auditorium willingly during the festival days to witness 14 to 15 plays. The organization also produces play-productions-conducts seminar on theatre related issues-organizes acting workshops with the help of eminent theatre personalities. It has 8 major play-productions in its present repertoire- CHILEKOTHAR SEPAI-NOKSHI KANTHAR MAATH-ASWACHARIT-KHOWABNAMA-DASYU KENARAM-HARIYE JAY MANUSH-BABORER PRARTHANA AND MEYETI. It has also organized 2 childrens theatre workshops so far and 2 childrens plays have come out-BHALOBASI SABUJ and SINGI DESHE BUBAI TUBAI. The group also publishes an annual theatre journal NATYAMANAN and 10 Theatre Bulletins named NATUKE in the month of December.As a regular theatre group-that has an annual average of 40 stage performances- it receives Grants under various schemes from the Ministry of Culture. The organization has started to construct its own theatre building on its own 2800 sq.ft. land for which Ministry of Culture has sanctioned building grant amounting to Rs1500000. Once the long-dreamt-of-BUILDING is constructed- the organization will start INSTITUTIONALISED THEATRE ACTIVITIES specially among the children. Eminent theatre personalities like Tapas Sen-Khaled Choudhury-Rudraprasad and Swatilekha Sengupta-Goutam and Debsankar Halder-Suman Mukhopadhyay-Bratya Basu have worked in some of our play-productions. The group has travelled in all major cities in our country with its productions. It has also participated in various theatre festivals with its productions including NSD festival and Mumbai Neheru Centre festival. Almost all the performers of the group generally spend 7 hours daily for rehearsals, training and other theatre related activities. The group has 9 WHOLETIME THEATRE WORKERS. It has also a rich LIBRARY of 600+ books on THEATRE. Kalyani Natyacharcha Kendra aspires to be a professional Theatre Group in near future.

Major_Activities1: Calcutta Bahari is a well known leading theatre & cultural, social development organization. Name: Andhjan Kalyan Trust
Major_Activities1: Andhjan Kalyan Trust is a non-profiting and non governmental organization working for the all round development and welfare of the disabled since 1992. This organization though works in the semi developed area of Saurashtra region of Gujarat State of India. It functions nationally and internationally when and where any necessity arises in the cause of the disabled. Initially though Andhjan Kalyan Trust was setup for the welfare of the blind, it felt a great need to undertake educational and rehabilitation programmes for the welfare of the other categories of disabled and hence its started functioning for all the categories of the disabled including Visually Impaired, Hearing Impaired, Mentally Retarded, Orthopaedically Handicapped as well as Multi Handicapped and Cerebral Palsy-Stricken people. To materialize our concerns for all these people, the organization has been running several projects including: 1. Computer Education Centre for the Visually Impaired. Name: Community Theatre Workshop
Major_Activities1: The crux of CTW’s work lies in the facilitation of dialogue within the community thru Community Theatre. The search has been for alternatives to the traditional frontal methods of communication in theatre as well as out side of it. For this purpose we have used community theater, films, the audio-visual, organized activities in community and public spaces, and used other formal and non-formal communication media to reach out to people. Theatre in Chandigarh has obviously come of age. It started as a genteel social activity and remained for long confined to schools, colleges and clubs. The pillars of society patronized it as some sort of a pretence for their `culturedness’. Through its own inner impulses, however, it evolved into a variety of forms both academic and experimental. Theatre activity remained by and large a transplanted species which refused for all the efforts and labour to get acclimatized to the environment of the synthetic city of babus and bearers, bureaucrats and liaison agents and of forbidding and cold architectural designs and cleverly segregated and dissocialized habitation. In the background of the insipid philistinism which is the hallmark of social life of Chandigarh the arrival of Community Theatre Workshop (CTW) was some sort of a happening both theatrical and social. The whole idea of a theatre which has “no time for poetry or ornate expression”, and no use of curtain sets, props, lighting or even seating arrangements was shocking. CTW believes only in the human material to crystallize the vision of “pure theatre” in which the action itself emerges as the real fact both as an image of the reality and a symbol of its under lying meaning of lack of it, our main endeavor is to break through the four walls of conventional theatre and bring the performance directly into the streets right amidst the common folk. Through this be aspire for establishing an “organic bond between the performers and the audience” so that both could join into the awaken into the social relevance of entertainment. Community Theatre Community Theatre takes theatre to a much broader plane. It is very different from the formalised theatre that we are used to seeing in the theatre halls. The accent is on free expression. We believe that every person has infinite potential and possibilities as well as a reservoir of experience within themselves. This potential and experience is a valuable learning resource. The processes of community theatre create spaces and opportunities for participants to articulate their perceptions and experience freely. Theatre activity becomes a psychological space for participants to renew and revise their self-image and to re-define for themselves, their existing roles.

Name: Ravan Chhaya Natya Sansada odash
Major_Activities1: Ravan Chhaya , the shadow puppet theater of Orissa survives only i one village i.e Odash in the district of Angul. The tradition is being maintained by the Ravan Chhaya Natya Sansada Odash which is a registered cultural society and it has devoted itself for the preservation and promotion of the rare act of Orssa . it maintains a full repertory grup of performances and imparts training to youngsters in puppet making, manipulation techniques and music. the repertory group now performance with two sets of puppets, the first which are designed and cut according to the old traditional style and the second with puppets designed and cut on the model of traditional patta painting of Puri.    Besides imparting training , the sansad is also undertaking new productions at lest two productions every year and putting them of all over the state of Orissa cities like New Delhi, Kolkata , Bangalor , Pondicherry , Mumbai, Luckhnow , Bhubaneswar ,Udayapur (Rajasthan) , Dharamastala , Karnataka , where performances have been highly acclaimed.   The sansada has also put up performances abroad in South Korea, Malaysia and Indonesia being sponsored by the Indian Council for cultural relations , New Delhi in 2003. The sansada has been regularly taking part in the National puppet festival in organised by "Sangita Nataka Akademi" , New Dehli, the work shops organised by centre of cultural resources and training New Delhi and the programmes organised by EZCC, Kolkata. The two pioneer gurus of the sansad have been bestowed with central sangeet nataka Academy award for outstanding contribution to the Indian culture specially for the improvement of Ravan chhaya of Orissa. Guru Kathinanda Das has been bested with the central academi award in 1978 and Guru Kolha Chara Sahoo has been bestowed with Orissa Sangeeta Nataka Accademy award in 1997 and the central Sangeet Nataka Academy award in 1999. The sansada has a number of themes for presentation of shadow puppet show.The important themes among them are The Ramayan, Pranaya Ballari, Living in the bad company , tuan and tuin upakhayan , Kanchi Avijana , Karna Badha, Menance of wine addiction and trees plantation .   The sansad has framed courses of suites for imparting training the youngsters. it has created cultural milieu for creative interaction of the artists.  The sansada has not only taken steps to sustain the rare traditional art but also has also created and launched several steps to uplift the folk and tribal art of Orissa.

Name: ASSOCIATIATION FOR SOCIAL AND HEALTH ADVANCEMENT
Major_Activities1: Education: At 3066Primary and Upper Primary Schools of Komana& Nuapada Block of Nuapada &220 Schools of Bargarh & Sohela Block of Bargarh District facilitating Aflatoun Child Social and Financial Programme.The Aflatoon progromme envisage poverty reduction by equipping children with the knowledge, Skills and Confidence to become self reliant citizen whose sense of social and financial responsibility propel them to create more equitable society in future with following objectives: To make the children aware of child Rights & to develop in children, a sense of responsibility To make children understand what their needs are & learn to prioritize them and look for ways to be able to fulfil necessities in their life. To instil in children, a sense of pride at their ability to intervene in their own world. To inculcate the habit of savings among children. To develop in children, the ability to handle money. To encourage children to think their own, identify right from wrong and to look at things from a scientific perspective. To give children the opportunities to think and plan for their future and take related decision. To provide exposure to banking operation and financial education. The banking activity and the issue based work; linking day-to-day realities of life of the children will motivate children to come to school. COMMUNITY HEALTH: Strengthening existing child health services Essential newborn care (Breast feeding, warmth, Hygiene, cord care and recognition of danger signs) Immunization Skilled care at and after birth Control of diarrhoeal diseases and ARI Breastfeeding and complementary feeding Micronutrient supplementation (Vitamin A, Iron) Besides above stated micro monitoring and counselling we also work for Facilitating Village Health Plan Organizing School Health Programe Organizing & Facilitating Community Monitoring on Routine Immunization Counselling for at least 3 Antenatal Check up and Institutional delivery Monitoring Pulse Polio Programme at Nuapada and Bolangir District with the support of NPSP- WHO AGRICULTURE: ASHA supports village communities in undertaking sustainable management of natural resources through a variety of interventions and bringing change in the cultivation Practices also by promoting community forestry and horticulture, land and water conservation and development. Our specific interventions are as follows: Promoting Land based crop cultivation -34 acre Facilitating Soil testing & Soil Health Promotional Measures-100 farmers Facilitating Mix Cropping-15 farmers Training on Dry land farming, Mix cropping,- 20 farmers Training on Land, water & Soil Management-40 farmers Promoting Organic farming & Vegetable cultivation- 23 farmers Community Organization: The premise is that the engagement with the development process initiated by ASHA is a springboard to enable the community to tackle all other development issues that it faces in a holistic manner by using Village Planning as a tool. Community Forestry: ASHA motivates communities to collectively manage their forests and horticulture plantations. Communities have been motivated to regenerate common and private wastelands by growing trees for fuel, fruit, fodder and timber and also develop horticulture patches. These community forests and horticultural plots help to protect the local environment. The process of management and sharing benefits enhances cohesiveness of the communities and also yields substantial incomes.

Name: Howrah Central Supravat
Major_Activities1: We started our journey with 3 vocational training center in Munshirhat Ghoradah and Chunavati for empowering women and youth specially who are out of school for long time and due age they are not interested to back in school so we engaged them in this Vocational Training Centers through making soft toys,jute,Zari work etc. This year we also added some extra training like Mushroom farming and Vermi Composting. We also conducted AIDS awareness program under Howrah Network of People Living With in Chunavati Panchpara targeting the youth, Rickshaw puller, truck drivers, and couple who are engaged in daily work We run a formal school in Our organization realize the root of this problem and we try to overcome from it with our limited efforts so, we distributed many books, copy, pen etc throughout this financial year and we give some support to school out children like school admission fees and coaching support to very poor students of our Chunavati Community. Some of them passed from school with good results. Munshirhat one of our target areas is a remote village where huge numbers of people are earning from farming & here we introduced SRI farming for upgrading their farming experiences. SRI farming is a newly developed technology of farming of rice-with this technology farmers grows more than 3 times rice from one seed and it is cheep also. We provide training to farmers of Munshirhat to adopt this technology and distributed SRI seeds for experiment with the help of Ambuja Cement Foundation, and we got good result from it. Treatment Camp in Sultanpur a village of Howrah, besides Andul road where maximum number of population living in Below Poverty Line and they struggling for their livelihood needs, our organization given the responsibilities to one of the renown medical team of Disha Eye Care hospital. Success Story Tamanna Khatun is very progressive in education but due to financial condition she stopped her education when she was in class VII. Her father is a rickshaw puller so education is luxury for her family but after one year Tamanna inform us and we again admitted her in school and also provide education materials, necessary support for education this year she passed with good result and stand in her class

Name: Yuva Gram Vikas Mandal
Major_Activities1: • Brief History of the Organisation: The organization emerged in 1985 with the objective of overall development of society and started its activities from own ‘Warapgaon’ village as chief functionary of the organization belongs to the village. Since his childhood, he had a dream to develop at least his own village as a model, which can be replicated in surrounding villages. The period 1985 to 1995 remained most struggling period for the organization. The constructive community development process ware enhanced after 1995 at the organizational level. In due course of the time the organization contributed significantly towards the socio-economic development of the poor and underprivileged. As a token of its contribution the organization ‘Yuva Gram’ honored with ‘National Youth Award’ in the year of 2001 for its contribution towards youth development in Beed district of Maharashtra. Today, it is a well-recognized organization in the fields of women & child empowerment, youth development, agriculture, sanitation, watershed development, environment management, awareness, training, resource mobilization and education. It posses the team of trained staff, well equipped training center, reference library and healthy relations with Govt. officials, like- minded organizations and target groups. Vision: Yuva Gram strives to reform unique structure of society that will create ample opportunities for development and provide space and raise access to mainstreams without discrimination of cast, creed, language, race and religion. We believe a society where in the poor, the marginalized and the under privileged enjoy equal opportunities to take part in developmental process. Mission: Yuva Gram aims at building capacities of poor and needy people in general and youth, women, dalits, tribes and small and marginal farmers with a view furthering their socio- economic conditions with special reference to health, natural resource management and constitutional rights Aims and objectives: • To attempt for the overall development of Dalit, tribal, de-notified tribes, farmers, land laborers, marginalized farmers as well as women and children from all the categories. • To undertake studies and conduct research on different social, economical, cultural, and educational and health issues prevailing in the society. • To use available information and the innovations and create awareness at society level utilizing various campaign mediums as well as creating occasional and in-occasional material required for such campaigns. • To conduct and impart trainings to the activists at various levels engaged in social development. • To achieve the tasks of rural development through the science, technologies and the informal education as well as initiating activities to solve the basic problems like education, health and culture faced by the deprived lives in urban areas. • To organize, conduct and participate in the discussions, conversations, trainings, people’s collective programmes and the meets that could be helpful to achieve / fulfill above aims. • To receive and even extend all the possible support and help from and to the individuals and organizations to implement and conduct the expected programmes according to the aims and the objectives of the organization.

Name: AGENCY FOR SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVES
Major_Activities1: Agency for Sustainable Development Initiatives is non-profit, secular, registered, social and charitable Society under the Certificate of Registration of Societies Act 21 of 1860 under the Government of Meghalaya, Shillong, with a mission to improve the quality of life of the most vulnerable sections of society, particularly those residing in remote rural communities. Major Achievements/ Activities 1. MAIRANG VIDYAJYOTI INCLUSIVE SCHOOL, MAIRANG– One of the important areas of empowerment of persons with disabilities is their education. Inclusive education means that all students in a school, regardless of their strengths or weaknesses in any area become part of the school community. They are included in the feeling of belonging among other students and support staff.Therefore the agency has started a school for the welfare of the Persons with Disability, known as Mairang Vidyajyoti Inclusive School. At present there are 173students in this school and 20 teaching and non-teaching staff. This is the first and the only type of school in the whole District of West Khasi Hills. 2. Rev.AMIRKHA SCHOOL FOR DISABLED-Education is such a powerful instrument without which there cannot be any progress or development in the society and its social structure. Hence, it plays a key role for the future of the society. This school was started in the year 2012 only. It is located at Mawlai, Shillong. The aim of the school is to provide opportunities for Children with disabilities as well as adults to avail of formal and non-formal educational services and vocational training programmes leading to their socio-economic independence and the enrichment of their self-esteem as human beings 3. HEALTH CARE SERVICES- The Agency organizes Health Awareness Programmes every year, where health preventive measures and proper sanitary were taught to the people. And also Free Medical Camp after the programme.The Agency has planned to have a mobile clinic for the rural areas in the Mairang and Mawthadraishan C and RD Blocks in the coming year. 4. SYNOD SEPNGI TRAINING INSTITUTE CUM PRODUCTION CENTRE- This Centre is running well,the trainees who have trained in this Centre and some of them were accommodated in the Centrewhile some have started their own Entrepreneurship. At present there are 3 units in this institute-1. Printing and Binding, 2. Exercise book making and Paper Bag Making.On 25 February, 2015 inaugurates the building at Shillong Industrial Estate, Lumjingshai by Rev.S.S. Majaw, Moderator K.J.P Synod Sepngi in the presence of Smti. Roshan Warjri, Honorable Home Minister, as a Special Guest, Smt. Dikkanshi .D. Shira, Guest of Honour, Pastors and the representatives of the different Presbytery. 5. COMMUNITY BASED REHABILITATION PROGRAMME, MAIRANG- Community Based Rehabilitation Programme (CBR) was started on 1 April 2009, covering 30 villages under Mairang Block. This programme works among Personswith Disability (PWDs) under six areas, that is, Staffing and Management, Needs Assessment, Education, Health, Social, Livelihoods and Advocacy and Empowerment. There are 210 beneficiariesunder this programme. 6. Rev. S. WOLINGTON CHILDREN’S HOME- The agency has started a children’s home at Nongpyndeng, Nongstoin in the West Khasi Hills District. At the initial stage the home is being in a rented building with 58 inmates who stay there and 11 staffs. The land measuring about 6 acres has been acquired and the organization is in the process to mobilize fund for construction of a permanent building. This home consists of school and vocational training and also counseling center. 7. Child Development Centre-The Agency for Sustainable Development Initiatives (AFSDI) in partnership with Compassion East India setup the Child Development Centre (CDC) at the heart of Sohiong village.The children at the centre will be equipped in the following ways (a) Spiritual- strong in faith and deed (b) Social- be responsible member of their families, churches and communities (c) Economic- support them-selves (self-sufficient) and share with others in need. (d) Physical- maintain the physical well-being At present there are 157 children in this centre.

Name: SAMASTHARU
Major_Activities1: Samastharu an institute for Theatre Research is being found by Sri Gopalakrishna Nairy an alumni from National School of Drama and since the very inception who has been directing the research curriculum of the institute. Samastharu got inaugurated by Padmashri awardee Sri.B.V.Karanth under the shelter of internationally reckon KEN School of Arts, chaired by renowned artist Sri.R.M.Hadapad who also happened to be the ex-chairman of Karnataka Chitrakala Akademy. Samastharu, with predominantly cultural profile, got registered in the Government of Karnataka during 1986 under the Karnataka State Societies Registration Act 1960. Samastharu, aiming on theatrical research has been working, on all genres of performing arts activities since the very day of its inception in order to innovate and foster the National level as well as the rural level theatre activities on the lines of towards regional theatre aesthetics. Samastharu has been practicing many plays regularly on the innovative motifs and began to give performance only since 1992. Duthavaakya, Dutha Ghatothkacha, Madhyama Vyaayoga, Oorubhanga, Bhagavadajjukiyam, Seekarne Saavithri, Gathi, Haadiyaata, Kelu Janamejaya, Veeragaase Karnabhaara, Kundapura Karnabhaara, Haadiyaata Karnabhaara, Samaala Karnabhaara, Halage Karnabhaara, Veeragaase Maththavilaasa, Kalla Bekku, Baalamadhyama Vyayoga, Kailasada Haadiyalli, Pancharaathri, Ondu Neera Prasanga, Ondu Henna Prasanga, Rishiyaata, Yakhsa Janamejaya, Thaalamaddale Pancharaathra, Baasiyaata Duthavaakya, Haddi Thappadiru, Hadihareya, Ayurveda Dashadisha, SDMC Prathapa, Kannad Bhagavadajjukiyam, Thathapada, Sayo Aata are major innovations and got highly acclaimed by one and all. Samastharu is the institute in Karnataka state having its own regional pockets for its research activities namely at Chitradurga in Chitradurga district, Saligrama in Udupi district, Harapanahally in Davanagere district in addition to Bangalore in Bangalore city District. Samastharu finds no other institute in the country like self which is exploring the classical Indian lays imbibing the past, present and future to bloom the Aesthetics of modern Indian Theatre. Samastharu, apart from its regular activities has conducted workshops on acting and theatre in general. Samastharu is the institute which has a laudable name for its Rural-theatre activities especially in the villages of Karavali and Bayaluseeme belts of Karnataka State. Samastharu is very grateful to the alumnies of National School of Drama namely Sri.B.V.Karanth, Shri.V.Ramamurthy, Shri.G.V.Shivananda, Late Shri.N.S.Venkataram, Shri.Raghunandan, Shri.Suresh Shetty, Shri. Walter Desouza, Shri.Jayarama Thatachar, Shri.Sambashiva Dalavayi, Shri Suresh Anagally, Shri.P.D.Saxena, Shri.D.R.Ankur, Savitha.B and others who have rendered their immense services to us. We have also availed services of retired HOD’s of Department of Performing Arts of Bangaloreuniversities nalemy Late Prof.B.Chandrashekhar and Prof.K.V.Rajagopal. Samastharu , who are Theatre artists not just professionals but research oriented performing artists.

Name: NATAKAMANE
Major_Activities1: Natakamane – A Centre for performing Arts Natakamane, a group of dedicated theatre activists, took its birth with the collective participation of rural artists an theatre organizers. It was Mr. Mahalingu, who created this association with the advice of Padmashree B.V.Karanth, veteran V.Ramamurthy and experimental Drama specialist Gopalakrishna Nairy. It was registered as a trust at the instance of Sri.B.V.Karanth. Since its inception, Natakamane is being engaged in experimental theatre and folk theatre activities with an objective of developing a new horizon in Kannada Ranga Bhoomi. We have been very fortunate to have services of the professionally senior stage specialists like Mr. B.V.Karanth, V.Ramamurthy, Gopalakrishna Nairy, Suresh Anagalli, Jayaram Tatachar, Sambashiva Dalawayi, Omkar, Dr. Raju, Walter D’Souza, Tulsidhar Kurup, Pankaj Saxena and others from National School of Drama, New Delhi who have really, contributed for the development of our organization and to the Indian Theatre. Natakamane from the very beginning had the perspective of developing experimental and innovative theatre with the modern outlook along with the rich tradition of our land, language, customs and culture. This is very clear in our workshops, dialogues, symposium, conventions, festivals, demonstrations, lectures and performances those have been placed on this perspective in different times. The following are some of our celebrated productions with the high reputed play writes; Mahakavi Bhasa, Dootha Vakya, Madhyama Vyayoga, Dutha Ghatothchacha, Bhoodhayana, Matta Vilas, Bhagavadujjkeeyam, T P Kailasam, Seekarne Savithri Sri Ranga, Kelu Janamejaya, Gorur Ramaswamy Iyengar, Halliya Chitragalu- Jodidaararu P.Lankesh, Teregalu, Chandrashekhar Patil: Appa, Kunta Kunta Kuruvanthi Jayanthi Kaikini, Sevanthi Prasanga, Chi.Srinivas Raju, Beegada Kai, Idu Kaarana, Vyasa Deshpande, Yaarigoo Helonu Byada, Mandodari Ravanayaba, Gopalakrishna Nairy, Pathra Thapatra, Ganga Kaveri, Ondu Neera Prasanga, B M Sri, Ashwanthaman, Horeyala Doreswamy: Bhakkathaan Bheemange Satiyee, Dhundira ,Adhvanapura These and many more significant plays staged so far and we have established as a group of theatre specialists in country. Besides the senior theatre specialists we have also developed young directors like Melehalli Devaraj, M.S.Umesh, Shivakumar Thimmalapur, Dakshayani Bhatt, Sowmya Parveen, Savitha.B and few others have all blossomed as young directors and actors in Kannada theatre. Natakamane Mahalingu who has master minded the entire organization is being successful in availing the services of great personalities of Kannada theatre world too like H.V.Venkatasubbaiah, Prof. Ka.Vem Rajagopal, a puppetry expert Belagallu Veeranna was some of the people who are continuously associated with Natakamane. All these reputed stage specialists including Mr.Mahalingu had been awarded by Karnataka Nataka Academy as experts in respective field. Natakamane has distinguishing by providing momentum to theatre by energizing thinkers and theatre workers, bringing them together and developing a national and professional theatre topics. Natakamane likes to develop as a professionally engaged theatre organization dedicated to research, staging of the plays an to find out a fruitful meaning of theatre aesthetics.

Name: NAYENATUA
Major_Activities1: The troupe Naye Natua is laden with as many as 30 young talented actors including casual and regular who are working tirelessly throughout the year. Naye Natua, a new fledged theatre troupe of Kolkata aspires to take its flight with many ambitious productions ranging from fairy tales to the modern immortal fictions of Bengal and India at large. Geared with a determination to explore the untrodden region of Indian Theatre with newer perceptions of our Time and Space, Naye Natua sets forth with a batch of real fresher guided by the able veterans to stage its performances. The troupe has already performed and wholeheartedly praised by connoisseurs in Kolkata, West Bengal, Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore, Assam, Hyderabad, Toronto and many other places. Presently Naye Natua is performing Michael Madhusudan Dutt’s ‘Meghnad Bodh Kabya’, Famous Indian story writer Premchand’s Bare Bhai Sahab as ‘Borda Borda’ along with contemporary theatre like ‘Missed Call’ written by Debshankar Halder. The themes encompass varied subjects from modern social tribulations to deep rooted family values, epic and undying pain. Under the direction of our house director Goutam Halder we can produce three new productions this year. We have great interest in producing theatre for children too. New productions: This year the troupe has decided to stage three productions under the direction of our house director Goutam Halder. Extensive discussions are going on regarding Bengali author Shirshendu Mukherjee’s Jaal, Amake Dekhun, Jama Kharoch; Rabindranath Tagore’s poems like Horikhela,Dui Pakhi; play Baikunther Khata etc. We have started planning regarding a musical production emerging from poems. A theatrical performance suffused with the poetry as text of theatre, and of acting with idioms of movement, dance, songs and music – in short, a production with coexistence of physicality, visuality and musicality. We are in search of a new performance style of theatre which is far from conventional forms of theatre; a theatre with the vibrant presence of actors with great potential for dance and music. The text will be a composite a bunch of lyrics in a composite bouquet chosen from popular folk songs, poems from Rabindranath Tagore, Satyajit Ray, Joy Goswami, Satyendranath Dutta, Buddhadeb Basu, Shakti Chottopadhyay, Premendra Mitra and others. The participants of the in-house training programme will be included in these productions. The troupe is organizing workshops in association with other organizations like Minerva, Anyo theatre, Jadavpur University, Cultivation of Science, Happenings, Canada Bengali Club and many others. These workshops encompass all aspects regarding in-depth study and intense theatre training. Exploration of new theatre language for enriching the style of production along with the meaningful application of other allied art forms and its vitality and viability in present day situation.
issues_working_db: Art & Culture,

Name: Awishkar
Major_Activities1: Awishkar founded in 1971, is a group of serious theatre minded people formed to give free expression to the ideas and thoughts which are sacred to us in theatre. Awishkar a theatre institution known for its sincere and dedicated approach towards production of many plays has always functioned with various other purposes. Awishkar has time and proved that stage plays have always been an instrument in reaching different destinations, which has in mind right from its birth. It has always been a platform for performers from all faculties of art (adults and children alike) where their talents can be unraveled and further channeled in a proper direction. Awishkar takes great pleasure while mentioning about the 168 odd plays which it has produced and staged more than 4100 preformances. This creative treasure includes 30 children plays and dance dramas including 3 puppet plays. Awishkar has organized 23 theatre festivals, which offered more than 195 preformances to the theatre lovers. This includes a theatre festival of Tendulkar’s 15 young directors. In addition, more than 50 experimental theatre Groups have staged more than 2000 performances at the Chhabildas Experimental Theatre, with the active co-operation of Awishkar from 1974 to 1992. Awishkar is known as the mother theatre institution and remained in forfront in leading the parallel theatre movement. Awishkar’s contribution to Chhabildas theatre movement is very well known. After leaving Chhabildas in 1992, Awishkar explored three more spaces in Mumbai suburbs. At present Awishkar continues its theatre mission in a small hall of New Mahim Municipal school with the kind of co- operation of Mumbai Municipal Corporation. Awishkar Sanskritik Kendra organizes 6 performances of its plays in this small hall every month. These performances including plays by other theatre group also. For the last three year, Documentaries and short films by young and talented directors also are regularly screened in the hall. Creativity if rightly pampered and moulded can reach its epitome. This particular perception pre- empted Awishkar to organize more than 62 training Workshop for young and talented artists. Further, to divulge the different aspect of Musical plays, puppet shows and group singing it organize 66 Workshops for children with active participation of all the concerned technical experts. In addition Awishkar has conducted eight group discussions on different topics of the theatrical revelation.
issues_working_db: Art & Culture,

Name: KUSUMA KALA SANGHA
Major_Activities1: KUSUMA KALA SANGHA is located in a remote village, which is at a distance of just twenty three kilometers from Taluk Head Quarters namely Gubbi, the latter is a big and non-erasable name in history of Kannada Theatre, especially in Parsi Company style traditions. The inception of this cultural idiom i.e. KUSUMA KALA SANGHA emerged out of real zeal pertaining to protect and develop the rural aesthetic cense of Performing Arts. KUSUMA KALA SANGHA has "been working with the aforesaid motto since 1996 with multi-facet programmes namely proscenium performances, street-plays, children performances, sponsored perfo¬rmance of high repute, besides our regular modern theatre perfor¬mances inevitably such as proto .literacy movement, environment movement, anti-dowry movement etc.50th Independence Day got celebrated throughout the District with special attention to enrich the patriotism among rural-folks, youngsters and children. SUGGI SAMSKRUTHIKA UTSAV and also titled SUGGI RANGA SAMBRAMA is also significant regular programme and turned into mass-appraised and District of annual in nature, has got a cultural demand in the We are proud of giving coastal YAKSHAGANA performances to our audience and also the unique performances of HAADIYAATA, Directed by an alumni of Nat ional School of Drama, New Delhi, who. also happens to be Aesthetic Adviser of us. We are with the feather of recognisation of the Department of Culture, Government of India through the Salary grant given to the Professional organisation under of Financial Assistance to the Cultural Orqanisations. Besides to our regular performance we are giving Street-Plays throughout the District and collecting contribution from village-folk, so as to handover the purse with an amount of Rs.10,000 to the Deputy Commissioner of Tumkur District for the GUJARAT EARTHQUAKE RELIEF FUND. We are accredited with resource personalities from every walk of theatre-culture namely Sri.V.Rama Murthy, Sri.K.V. Karanth, Sri.Nairy and others from National School of Drama: Sri.H.V. Venkata Subbaiah, Sri Tumkur Shiva Kumar,Prof. K.V. Rajagopal, Dr.J.S.Murthy, Sri. Channabasaiah Gubbi and other awardees of Kannada Nataka ACademy: Sri.Mahalingu, Sri Mysore Ramanand, Smt.Renuka Bali Udaya Kumar, Sri.Yakshadegula Mohan, Sri Kote Nagabhushan and other renowned Theatre expertisers. We are from the theatre urge and committed and deeply involved to the field of Theatre by the performances of Theatre programmes.

Name: Bhartiya Gramotthan Sanstha
Major_Activities1: Bhartiya gramotthan sanstha is a registered organization working since 20 years in the field of social and rural development. Employment generation is the main objective of the organization. For achieving its target the organization emphasizes on local raw material based employment. Apart from this, the other working areas of the organization is handicraft, handloom(wool, cotton, jute), jute carpet, giving commercial training to the women self help group (SHG) for income generation, helping SHG in marketing of their products, imparting technical knowledge, forestation, environment related programme, cultivating medicinal plants, implementing various health programme based on Indian medical system with the participation of the mob is the major objective of the organization. A highlight on various projects and programme being run by the organization are as follows: This project is sponsored by Ambedkar Hastashilp Vikas Yojna (A.H.V.Y), Ministry of Textiles, Govt. of India. Under this project all the artisans especially bamboo craftsmen and artistic woolen weavers were given training for designing of handicrafts and provided with raw material and the organization helps them in promoting and marketing of their products for their income generation by organizing various exhibitions for exhibiting the products made by these craftsmen. 1) JUTE SERVICE CENTRE(J.S.C) This project is sponsored by National Centre for Jute Diversification (N.C.J.D), Kolkata, Ministry of Textiles, Govt. of India. The organization has been working in this area for more than 10 years. Previously the artisans used to make products with local fibers only whose market was very limited. Apart from this the organization is recently running its ownJute Service Centre, which is running many projects for thediversification of jute products and generating employment for the artisans of this area 2) TRAINING OF SELF HELP GROUP To empower the rural and urban women, the organization has made women self help group which emphasizes on their awareness, small savings, various vocational trainings, providing loans, self employment generation. The organization is devoted for empowering women. TOTAL SANITATION CAMPAIGN (T.S.C) PROGRAMME Under this programme the organization along with Uttrakhand Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project (SWAJAL) assisted by Govt. of Uttrakhand and Jal Nigam, has encouraged A.P.L. and B.P.L. families of 103 gram sabha in 4 districts namely Haridwar, Uttarkashi, Dehradun and Tehri Garhwal for construction of toilets and has organized sanitation related programme. 3) EXHIBITIONS The Organisation, for the welfare of the artisans, purchases the handicraft and handloom items prepared by the local craftsmen and artisans and exhibits them in the organizations own showroom and various exhibitions organized by the Govt. so that it gives a platform where the products of the local artisans are recognized. 4) VOCATIONAL COURSES FOR SELF EMPLOYMENT The organization also sponsors various vocational courses for empowering various sects of the society. A few are listed below: • Stitching Training • Beautician course Organizing various competitions for the skill development of children and women. Promoting Micro LIC among the masses.

Name: Circle Theatre
Major_Activities1: “Theatre is a continuous process”. Formed in 2002, Circle Theatre is meant for theatre of strength, courage and substance. Having the honour of venue opening and premired in ‘Bharat Rang Mahotsav’ (the International Theatre Festival of NSD), the USP of the organization is the volume of research oriented work of diverse subject incorporates in its productions which lead to an unique record for this organization within brief span of time in the country that, at a row all of its productions stand at par excellence in terms of its ‘artistic quality’, ‘expression’ and ‘message’ of these diverse subjects of plays produced by the organization which concerns the greater public interest (see the production list below), which result many times as ‘Best Production’ of the year of Sahitya Kala Parishad, Govt of NCT Delhi, participated in NSD’S International Theatre Festival – ‘Bharat Rang Mahotsav’ and its Satellite Theatre Festival’ including other festival of national importance etc. and finally comes to this that in the year of 2009-2010, Circle Theatre, New Delhi is given a Salary Grant (of 10+1) by the Dept. of Culture, Govt. of India. Apart from the main course of activities the circle theatre organizes symposiums and workshops for its actors by inviting resource person from out side for various facets of theatre from time to time which is related to the productions or the individual growth of actors vis-a- vis a systematic practice and training which the organization runs on its own. Circle Theatre offers workshops for others on various subjects of theatre and being invited especially its Artistic Director Mr. Bapi Bose by the various organizations across the country. The organization attends and participates in various theatre festivals, with the objective of using theatre as an instrument for reaching out to people and creating social awareness while simultaneously educating, entertaining and inspiring the masses. Circle Theatre initiates to promote ‘Young Director’ for new idea of production. The organization provides the ‘Technical Support’ with their excellent technical team to other organizations whenever it is needed. Circle Theatre is a collaborator and an architect of reviving the city’s Bengali theatre culture by involving Sangeet Natak Akademy, New Delhi with New Delhi Kali Bari, Mandir Marg for organizing the National Theatre Festival of Short Plays – All India Bengali Short Drama Competition in 2008 onwards which is become a ‘National Event’, a regular cultural feature of city’s cultural life in the month of February after ‘Bharat Rang Mahotsav’ of NSD. For this ‘National event’ apart from organizing the festival, Circle Theatre has its sharing of responsibilities, introduced the ‘Best Production Award’ and ‘People Choice Award’ along with the ‘Exhibition on Theatre’, ‘Book Shop’ for Theatre periodicals and Theatre Books, ‘Ambience Design’ of the Festival and a ‘Gala Show’ for Prize Distribution ceremony. The organization does humanitarian work for theatre artistes and others in distress. It brings together actors, writers, set-designers, technicians, singers, puppeteers, graphic, designers, video artistes, film producers, cartoonists and musicians, all of whom comprise its core creative team. In spite of its penetrating appeal to the audience, it has always been difficult to run a professional theatre group like ours. However, with our limited resources we have managed to collect 2000 books on theatre, some of which are really rare. These will be useful for a resource centre on theatre with collection of Books, CDs, Photographs, Interviews etc., which we dream to build with assistance from govt. and other interested agency. THE PRODUCTIONS :- The organization is having a unique record of having five productions which have been judged as Best Productions by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi or participated in various festivals including NSD’s International Theatre Festival, called Bharat Rang Mahotsav or International Satellite Theatre Festival of NSD. Socrates (2002) - It is based on Socrates, the great philosopher. It’s a contemporary assessment of Autocracy, Freedom of Thought, Freedom of Expression and again upholding the sanctity of Democracy, law & judiciary, communal harmony and national integration. It had the honour of having the premier as the Venue Opening production at 4th ‘Bharat Rang Mahotsav’, 2002 etc. Julius Caesar Ke Aakhri Saat Din (2003) & revival in 2008 - A play against Autocracy, War in comparison to the sanctity of Democracy, based on the Great dictator Julius Caesar. It questions about the defence of the country, the society, the culture, the religion, the democracy, the independence and the human rights. But upon establishing in the power the leaders forget the welfare of the people and the society – the human rights are killed first instead. Then what is the way out of such predicament for human society? In the last 2000 years all ‘Caesars’ are busy building their ‘personal property much than anything else. Participated in international theatre festival, 10th ‘Bharat Rang Mahotsav’, 2008 etc. Ekla Chalo Re (2004) - A play on partition, Gandhi’s assassination and following incidents. Now half a century after that eventful moment we are once again at the arc of a dramatic historical moment where the divisive forces are raising their heads all over again. Introspection of those events in this dramatic work acts as a reminder for those who cares fort the unity of the country and for those who do not care. It talks about the communal harmony and the national integration. Best Production by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi, participated in international theatre festival, 7th ‘Bharat Rang Mahotsav’, 2005, participated in ‘Best Plays of the Year’, 2005 organized by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi etc.. Pratham Parth (2006) - – Based on dexterous episode of Mahabharat and a subaltern introspection of Karn, the Great warrior. If Karn’s childhood would have been normal, well nurtured, the story of Mahabharat would have been different. The premise is it’s a case of lost childhood so take care of your little child don’t push them away. Best Production by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi, participated in international theatre festival - 9th ‘Bharat Rang Mahotsav’, 2007 and its ‘Satellite Theatre Festival’ participated in Best Plays of the Year, 2007 organized by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi etc. Parampurush (2008) - A contemporary introspection of Sri Ramakrishna Paramhamsadev, the embodiment of the harmony of world religions and Swami Vivekananda. The play looks into the man who could transform the mutual hatred to mutual love with the philosophy of Shiv Gyan Me Jeev Seva. Nothing could resist him to preach that Lord Shiva is living in the souls of the every human being. Now despite of Ramakrishna’s unique message after ‘Mumbai blast’ the message of the play becomes so relevant to the Indian society especially and as well as the Global terrorism too. Best Production by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi, honour of having the premier at ‘Mohan Rakesh Natya Samaroh’, organized by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi, 2009, and honour of having the premier of Venue Opening production at 12th ‘Bharat Rang Mahotsav’, 2010 etc.

Name: United Social Welfare Association Belgaum
Major_Activities1: United Social Welfare Association (USWA) Belgaum, a secular, non profit, non political, voluntary organization was established in 1992 registered under the Karnataka Societies Registration Act, 1960 on 12th August 1998 Reg. No. DR / SOR / 49 / 1992-93. United Social Welfare Association is a Non Government Voluntary Social Service & Development Organization working with vulnerable, rural poor people by organizing and involving them in their development activities. Rural poor artisans in the field of Integrated Rural Development, in the most backward and interior, drought affected villages. The range of programmes implemented is People’s Participation and Community Development activities in STEP, SJSY, and Nagara Streeshakthi Project. It is also implementing Awareness Generation Programmes on Women Development, Income Generation Programme, Gender discrimination, Credit Management, Capacity Building, Legal Rights awareness, Mobile Health Clinic and Health Sanitation and Hygiene Education, Educational & Socio-economic activities. The organization has under taken its all activities by following “Participatory Methodology” for promotion of People’s Participation, Development of Social, Economical, Educational, Environmental, Cultural & Health Sector, for Their Self reliance and sustainability. By adopting this methodology it has found its great success in every activity.

Name: Aneka
Major_Activities1: ANEKA which denote the plurality of our culture has got conceptualized by Sri Suresh Anagalli, Regional Director of National School of Drama Regional Centre, Bangalore, is founded in the month of June 1991 aiming to flourish in the field of theatrical performing Arts by making the theatre to happen. Aneka got inaugurated on the auspicious event by Padmashree Awardee Late B V Karanth following a formal key note address, in which the tunement of the advanced information technology and science to the cultural heritage of our country through the newly founded Aneka. Aneka, since 1991 has been giving a new stage productions every year and reached to the number 15 of New Productions in the voyage of 15 years of the performances. It is to celebrate the 15 years, having embibing the new economical dimension to the troupe by aspiring for the government grants. Aneka, after the 12 years of theatre practice got registered as a Trust in the Government of Karnataka during the year 2004, with predominantly cultural profile. Aneka has been working on all genres of Performing Arts activities inorder to Innovate and Foster the National Level as well as Rural Level theatre activities on the lines of embibing our traditional elements with advanced information technology and Science to happen theatre. Aneka has been practicing theatre with many plays regularly on the motifs to be invoked and enacted masterly the plays like Poster, Mattobba Drona, Ekalavya, chora Charan Das, Keregehara, Beli Mattu Hola, Taayi, Dharmapuriya Devadasi, Andger Nagarai Chaupat Raja, Pratibimagalu, Othello, Mr B B S, Meghadooth, Mrichakatika, and Maduve Hennu. Aneka has given a earmarked performances on the prestigious National Theatre Festivals like Bharath Rangmahotsav of NSD , New Delhi (twice), National Theatre festival held at Ahmedabad, West zone cultural center, Udaipur , Mysore Association , Bombay, Bahuroopi National Festival, Mysore (twice), Ranga Shankara National Theatre festival, Bangalore (twice), Hampi Utsav, and other many rural level varied festivals. Aneka which has a laudable name for conducting 30 theatre workshops and 15 National Seminars on theatrical topics. Aneka has selfefficed with the immense services of alumni of National School of Drama, New Delhi like Prof.D.R.Ankur, V Ramamurthy, N.S.Venkataram, G.V.Shivanand, B.V.Karanth, Gopalakrishna Nairy, Walter D’Souza, Suresh Anagalli under the Guruship of Jayaram Tatachar. Aneka is incepted intending to bridge up the gap occurred between heritageous practice of ancient peoples theatre and de-routed modern theatre performances. Aneka, who are Theatre Artistes not just Performers but with aspiration of imbibing the advanced technology blending with the rich traditional aesthetics of Indian National Theatre to happen Modern Indian Theatre.

Name: Sri Ramanjaneya Togalu Gombe Mela Trust
Major_Activities1: The Sri Ramanjaneya togalu gombe mela, Trust, Bellary. Striving hard for upliftment of leather puppetry farm of folk art for the last thirty years. This ancient art was confined to the plays of mythology only, but the institution ventured to perform this art farm availing the historical and social themes like 1857 Indian independence movement, Mahatma gandhiji, Prophet, Basaveshwar, kitturu Rani Chennamma and so on. Amazingly the leather puppet shows are welcomed in rural and urban areas. When the social themes exhibited like National Rural Development health care, Nutritious food, Pulse Polio immunisation, AIDS awareness, Affect of Tobacco, Irradiation of Malaria, and such other programmes. This institution has given has given performances all round the country the prestigious festivals like, Apna-Utsav, New Delhi, Dakshinotsavam, Trivandrum, National Festival, Nagpur, fe-te-de- Pondicherry, Putul Yaatra, New Delhi, Inter culture exchange festivals, throughout the state of kerala and Bihaar, Bapu Shows at Rastrpathi Bhavan and various places of New Delhi. Recently our institution has been visited Zurich, Switzerland, participating as part of art exhibition which was related on Ramayan exhibition title Rama and SIta, there we gave more than fifteen shows Panchavati Prasanga i.e., seetas abduction. The exhibition organised by the Riet berg Museum Zurich, due to the event of 60th anniversary of Indo Swiss friendship, the festival name titled BHARATOTSAV. It is a new and enthralling experience of the troupe artists of the institute, not only gave the performances and also conducted a workshop on puppetry how to prepare the puppets with miniature work and painting and manipulating puppets and perform the puppet show. The institution has produced many shows in this folk art which are telecasted in Doordarshan New Delhi, and Bangalore. The tele serial based on mahatma gandhiji’s achievement of life titled BAAPU. Thus we have been working for this ancient folk art farm, and successfully carrying on the largest activities and giving programme. Not only supporting this ancient stage art farm, but also some families of puppeteers are depending this art farm by the institution efforts which a hope continues to make alive this rare kind of art farm.

Name: ANANT  An Association for Nascent art and Natural Theatre
Major_Activities1: ANANT or An Association for Nascent Art and Natural Theatre was registered on 3 January, 1989. In the last twenty one years, ANANT has many achievements to its credit. First and foremost, it has established itself as a leading exponent of children’s theatre in Delhi—producing plays by and for children; conducting workshops for young, teachers and educators both in schools and communities; working in villages, slums and resettlement colonies; and linking theatre and arts to education and pedagogy. Plays created by ANANT are unique, using culture friendly traditions like play-rhymes, folk narrative traditions like kathavachan and kissa-goi, visual communication through puppetry and pat-katha; and the techniques of storytelling. Some of its well known plays in Hindi are Gadbadjhala (Topsy Turvy), Raja ki Khoj (In Search of a King), Kisse (A Tale of Tales), Chhutti (Freedom), Gopi Gawaiya Bagha Bajaiya (Gopi the Singer Bagha the Drummer) and Liyaram Diyaram. Most of these are original plays, created through workshops with ANANT actors. Many of these plays have participated in numerous festivals in India and abroad. Gadbadjhala, based on collection of rhymes from the Hindi belt, was published by education department of the University of Delhi as resource book with audio support in the form of a cassette. ANANT is in the process of editing some of its original plays for publication. ANANT has conducted innovative school projects by way of using theatre for theme exploration, and subsequent theatrical presentations involving the entire school. The school projects of Presentation Convent and Swai Man Singh School of Jaipur are worth mentioning. ANANT has also conducted an experimental project called Heritage Theatre in the National Museum wherein Harrapa Gallary was explored by educationally marginalised street children with a production and exhibition as the end result. ANANT has also produced adult plays from time to time. Two such productions in Bengali are considered by many critics as unique contributions—Kathokatay Agomani (Homecoming) and Manasa Katha (Legend of Manasa). Whether in children theatre or adult plays, ANANT puts lot of emphasis on research and originality. ANANT has participated in national and international festivals, exchange programmes, and had conducted workshops and submitted papers for seminar all over. Some of these are: Jashne Bachpan and Bharat Rang Mahotsav organised by the National School of Drama in New Delhi, Folk Festival of Eastern Zonal Cultural Centre, Surya Festival in Cochin, DALA Festival in Seoul, and AYA Exchange programme in Kuala Lumpur. ANANT is one of the founding members of ASSITEJ India, the gateway national centre of ASSITEJ International which is spread over 80 countries, connecting thousands of theatre groups and persons working in the specialised area of theatre for children and young people. Following the establishment of ASSITEJ India in 2004, ANANT’s director, Dr. Ashish Ghosh, has been invited to participate in ASSITEJ World Congress in Montreal, International Directors’ Seminar in Hamburg, and as International Observer in NEW VOICE/NEW VISION project in Kennedy Center of Washington DC. ANANT is poised for major events, both national and international, in 2011.

Name: THE PERFORMERS CULTURAL SOCIETY
Major_Activities1: The Performers Udaipur is the prominent theatre group of Rajasthan working in the field of theatre from last 28 years. We have organised Gawari theatre workshops, Gawari festival, Padam Shri Devilal Samar Theatre Festival from last Six years, Silver Jubilee theatre festival, theatre competitions and many theatre workshops with children and young theatre lovers. We have participated in many National theatre festivals such as BAHUROOPI-07 at Mysore, Aadharshila theatre festival Allahabad, Nehru Centre theatre festival organised by Nehru centre Mumbai, Bharat Rang Mahotsava organised by N.S.D New Delhi, Nandikar theatre Festival organised by Nandikar Kolkata, Swarn Mahotsava ad Young Directors Theatre Festival organised by Sangeet Natak Academy New Delhi, Multi-Lingual Theatre festival organised by NCZCC and N.S.D New Delhi, other National Theatre Festival organised by Zonal Cultural Centeres ZCC, Om Shiv Puri Smriti theatre festival organised by Rajasthan Sangeet Natak Academy Jodhpur(Raj.), Vivechana theatre festival organised by Vivechana Jabalpur, Experimental theatre festival organised by WZCC and Jawahar Kala Kendra Jaipur, etc. The main objective of the group is to create the atmosphere of the theatre movement and to educate the people through theatre activities. To fulfill the objectives the group is producing plays in Mewari and Hindi dialect and to appeal the rural masses. The group is working with BHEEL TRIBES of Rajasthan and Urban upcoming dedicated theatre workers.THE PERFORMERS has produced many plays in Traditional Gawari Folk Theatre form of the above mentioned BHEEL TRIBES of Mewar Region of Rajasthan.

Name: Project Swarajya
Major_Activities1: The following activities so far done by Project Swarajya: 1- Project Swarajya has started its activities with a campaign programme on Right to Employment in Orissa in the year of 1989. 2- The organisation has pioneered in the field of drug abuse prevention and Anti liquore movement in 1992 when liquor tragedy took place in Cuttack City. As a result the then Chief Minister stopped country liquor during that period. Presently our organisation running two nos of Integrated Rehabilitation Centre for Addicts in Orissa. 3-Our organisation has initiated a campaign to prevent and protect the Olive Redly Sea Turtle, Horse Shoe Crab and Mangrove forest in Orissa Coast. A nos of books. reports have been published by the organisation as well the agencies like Wild Life Institute, NIO including GOI refer that books and reports. In this regard a advocacy work for implementation of a policy to use Trawl Guard (An indigenous device for Turtle conservation) has been done by the organisation. 4- Project Swarajya has intiated a campaign against the trafficking of women and children in Orissa in 2001. Now the organisation is managing a Short Stay Home for distress women. The organisation running two nos of special school for child labour. Besides, the organisation has a good net work in the state. The organisation also serving as the official members of various department of district administration.For detail pl visit the website: www.projectswarajya.coml

Name: BLANK VERSE
Major_Activities1: Blank Verse, though younger in age and experience, feels that the present Youth is by and large trapped in a paradoxical situation as he finds himself increasingly engulfed by the dark forces of Obscurantism, Disintegration and Violence. Pathetically true, he is somehow confused without idealism, traumatized with terror, and listless about his responsibility. On the one hand, he is being continuously misled to understand his own Origin, thanks to the open sky ‘mass culture’; he is being robbed off his own creative passion by the overwhelming panic of terrorism. On the other, scientific and technological openings are challenging him to take up the cudgel and a creative leap into the 21st century. In more specific cultural terms, the Youth is confronted with the choice between re-discovery of his tradition and identity in the modern context and a passive surrender to this present socio-political milieu. In this circumstance, it is our pious task to help the Youth believe in themselves, to help them analyze and understand the world around and its changeability, to help them achieve some creative passion, to help them reach some awareness about our age old Culture, Art & Philosophy, to bring back their confidence that they can really control their own lives and are capable of changing their environment, to help them become the AGENTS OF THE FUTURE. Blank Verse is working regularly with children & elders, coming from various lifestyles, for a couple of years. Then the dream of practicing Theatre has cropped up. Our first production, FURRUT, based on a story by Upendra Kishore Roychowdhury, premiered in the Odeon’06 by Hutchison Telecom Ltd., the play has taken part in Jasnebachpan, 2006 by the T. I. E. Company of National School of Drama, Banga Sanskriti Utsav by the Presidency College Alumni Association, Mumbai, Nandikar’s National Theatre Festival’06, Natyamela ’06 of the Govt. of West Bengal and also in the every major theatre festival in West Bengal. Everywhere the play stole the show and collected an immense audience support. The second play, Kanaichand Palowan allows us to form a new kind of theatre on the square of proscenium. Running regularly at Kolkata successfully, the play has also partaken in Jasnebachpan, 2008, by the T. I. E. Company of National School of Drama, New Delhi, and various children theatre fests around the state. Bhootum Bhagaban, the third play basically emphasizes on the power of truth and belief. The play has been premiered in Jasnebachpan, 2009, by the T. I. E. Company of National School of Drama, New Delhi and also locally at Kolkata in Odeon’09, organized by Vodafone Essar East Limited. The play also has partaken in Visva Bharati Theatre Festival, Shantiniketan in last spring and collected rare applause. The play, Aal Izz Well is on the issue of Juvenile Offence, where we are trying to find our responsibility of being elder and importance of being earnest. We are trying hard to communicate the pangs and agony of Children of some obscure darkness. The play has also partaken in Jashnebachpan2010.

Name: Nori Art and Puppetry Centre
Major_Activities1: Giving puppet performances Conducting training programs for social activists,teachers,educationists and children to utilize effectively the medium of puppetry to motivate, inform, educate and entertain on subjects relevant to science with special reference to nutrition, preservation of the environment, adult education, literacy and other present day issues facing society. To encourage creativity and promote talent in children through art and puppetry(which is seen as an integrated approach to all the arts-both performing and visual) by conducting workshops and giving performances both for the priviledged and underpriviledged children. To work towards a further understanding of the medium by doing research,undergoing training,and documentation. Achievements; Ugadi Purashkar award for innovative use of puppetry-1998 conferred by the Madras Telugu Academy NCERT Award for educational toy-Puppet-given to the director,Ratnamala Nori Nandi Award for TV programme -Maya oka Japan Katha telecast on Hyderabad Doordarshan. Name: ST JOHN AMBULANCE ASSOCIATION RAIGANJ CENTRE
Major_Activities1: St. John Ambulance Association, Uttar Dinajpur District Centre is governed, managed and controlled by the Executive Committee consisting of 13 Members. The organization also has been registered with Person with disability. Government of India has chosen the organization as MNGO for Uttar Dinajpur District in the field of Reproductive and Child Health. St. John Ambulance Association is working in the area on Community bases ASHA (NRHM) Programme. Besides these activities St. John Ambulance Association works on ICDS Workers Training Centre since 1984. The organization also promotes Self Help Group (SHGs) and conducts many NGO training on SHG promotion with the help of NABARD. The organization is implementing Anti Human Trafficking specially case management with the help of Groupe Developpment. Protection and prevention of vulnerable women and children from trafficking has been a critical cornerstone of St. Johns activities since the organization feels that trafficking is not only a heinous violation of human rights but a significant organized crime. With this guiding philosophy, the organization first made its foray in the social sector of Anti-trafficking and safe Migration in the year 2005 with the support of Sanlaap. The project Sanjog - I was implemented in chosen three Gram Panchayats under Raiganj sub-division. St. John Ambulance Association is working on anti trafficking for last four years to establish child rights. This work is implemented through sanitization and capacity building of the adolescent peer group, women self help groups and local self government. Now few cases of trafficking also are managed with the help of District Administration. Therefore, we have experiences on involvement of community and government mechanism with our activities. These working experiences on prevention of child trafficking & exploitation will supportive to implement the proposed plan to establish the right to protection among the vulnerable community. In all the blocks of Uttar Dinajpur district various projects are in action where 130 paid staffs are working. Besides these paid workers we have hundreds of dedicated volunteers throughout the district. Our organization has own vehicles (2) which is used project purpose as per need and Organization have three permanent well equipped residential training centres. By virtue of post District Magistrate is the President of our Organization. Two membership of the district JJB and DCPS and One membership of CWC represented from our Organization

Name: DOLLS THEATRE
Major_Activities1: DOLLS THEATRE started in the year 1990 with the form of puppetry. The group engaged with the research work on puppetry to apply new Techniques in the contemporary puppet world, their presentations carry a new idea, a creation of medium to reach and relate to mankind and nature. Dolls Theatre has travelled widely in India and abroad, participating in governmental and non-governmental festivals & other cultural programmes . The group has earned munificent appreciation at the prestigious International Puppet Theatre Festival in Tehran, Israel, Spain respectively. During the course of their journey they have worked in mass medias like Doordarshan, Films. Furthermore, attended workshops and performed their plays at various parts of the world. The Theatre has earned active participation on platforms like Sangeet Natak Academy, EZCC, NZCC, ICCR, U.P. Sangeet Natak Academy, IGNCA, SPICMACAY among others.

Name: kinkini Sanskratik Sanstha
Major_Activities1: Kinkini is primarily a cultural organization with great potential to promote, propagate and dissemination of Indian art, culture in its different facets.the organization organizes large number of quality programmes, involving the classical artists, puppeteers, Dramatists but tribal and folk artist too. the main activities of the organization is to produce production, cultural studies, research, conduct workshops, performances, organize seminars, training on classical and folk art, music, dance, theatre, puppetry, etc. to revive vanishing art forms. Kinkini embarked on objects of organizing rich tradition of GURU SHISHYA Parampara. The organization organizes workshops for special children and brings them to the main stream. Kinkini conducts art in education programme in rural areas to create interest for formal education. Kinkini regularly perform street theatre on social issues. To achieve all these objects the organization conducting every year workshops, dance ballets, folk dance production, seminars, research on tribal musical instruments, children theatre and also regularly working to revive vanishing art forms since 1993. so far the organization worked on several projects, art in education programme in 40 villages, 15, kathak dance workshops, several dance performance, ballets, puppetry, workshops on puppetry,folk dances , drama, folk singing,etc.Conducted seminars and performances tribal art form like Gavri,Pabu ji ki Phad, puppetry, tribal music etc. Research on tribal musical instruments of Rajasthan and many many shows of street theatre. kinkini has performed all over India. above all the organizations aim is to develop ways and means through which the basic cultural and aesthetic sensibilities of the people remain active and dynamic.

Name: Aakhyan
Major_Activities1: Aakhyan was set up in 1999 and registered in 2002-2003. the organization is basically working on theatre. it is non profitable organization working on different issues through theatre. Aakhyan under takes extension workshops in rural areas, schools and collages to initiate theatre awareness among aspiring artists and art lovers under the able guidence secretary, Ravi Jhankal a graduate of national School of Drama. Aakhyan dreams the emergence of village theatre culture with immence energy rooted in Indian ethos and tradition depicting Indian realities. Aakhyan has group of talented and trained artists in its repertory with rich experience in performing. it includes folk performers, dancers, artists, musicians, singers, tribal artists puppeteers and theatre trainers. they ensemble work of these talents creates the ambiance characteristic of the aakhyan productions. The organization is conducting various types of the work shops including rare folk theatre. It is conducting Art in education programme , a non conventional education system and street theatre it as cause , bringing about a social and political awareness. theatre relevance is very much keeping with traditional Indian folk forms like Gavri, Maach, Tamasha, Phad, Khyal and Kathputli that reached out to the people with the sense of purpose and devotion, besides entertaining them and touching upon issues of social significance. Every year Aakhan is conducting thease workshops, research and Drama productions too.

Name: raaga an association of art education and social welfare
Major_Activities1: “raaga” a Group of Young Theatre Practitioners, Writers, Designer, Musicians and Visual & Fine Art Artist, was Formed in 2007. In the age of Multidisciplinary and Multicultural world “raaga” aim’s is to collaborate with young & enthusiastic artist of varied field, Kinds and nature to come together, So that the sonorous amalgam could happen resulting a fine tune art work and practices which is the need of our modern but disturb society. As a nation state, we are at the critical junction, where the opposite has become the common feature in walk of life. We are at the helm of political, social, religious, regional and ethnic contamination and contractions regularly into violence in various part of the country. We as a group, “raaga” are firm that only cultural interaction between all this fractions of the society can lead us to a harmonious society and nation state. Facing various challenging of our time, our art practice should not be aloof of the difficulties of our time. Our art practice will try to intrigue, converse and communicate with the people in their language and so we will be using the popular forms of the country heavily. We hope that the young and energetic artist of the country with their own modernist approach will create a huge different in the contemporary art practice scenario with hug investment of people’s culture. The rest would be the history. Akkarmashi is a First production of “raaga”.
