Name: INDIAN MIME THEATRE
Major_Activities1: Indian Mime Theatre is a leading mime group in India working for the promotion, development and propagation of Bharatiya Mukabhinaya ( Indian Pantomime ) in India as well as abroad. It is founded by Shri Niranjan Goswami internationally known mime artiste and director in the year 1976 in Kolkata. Shri Goswami has been awarded Sangeet Natak Akademi award in 2002 & a recipient of Padma Shri award in 2009 and national and International awards. Indian Mime Theatre has different wings for different activities like Training & Workshop, Research & Documentation, Repertory, Festival, Children Theatre Workshop, Hridaya Akash - a welfare project for child development and Nakshigram - women and children development project. It is a registered society under the Society Registration Act of 1961. The organisation is registered under Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA). The organisation is eligible to provide tax exemption to its donors under section 80G of Income Tax Act. It is recognised by the Sangeet Natak Akademi (SNA), New Delhi; Indian Council for Cultural Relations (ICCR), New Delhi; Paschim Banga Natya Akademi, Kolkata and Bharatiya Natya Sangha, New Delhi - the Indian chapter of International Theatre Institute, UNESCO, Paris, France. Indian Mime Theatre is empanelled with Indian Council for Cultural Relations (ICCR) to work as a cultural ambassador of India. Its activities under different wings includes Workshop in Mime, Acting, Puppet, Mask, Dance, Seminar, Exhibition, Lecture-Demonstration, Festival, Poster Design, Light Design, Costume Design, Set Design, Make-up, Effect Music, Magic, Mimicry, Vocational Training Programme for Youth, Projects for Special Children, Social Awareness Programme etc. Hriday Akash is an aspiring project of Indian Mime Theatre that presently deals with the children of slum areas and desire to establish a village where orphans & senior artistes will be provided accommodation with full facilities for education, cultural training and a platform to showcase their talents in different field of Art & Culture. Indian Mime Theatre has received a plot of land from Government of West Bengal at Salt Lake City, Kolkata and construction work is going on where it will be able to continue with its various activities and set up a National Mime Institute. It has visited abroad to perform in countries Like East and West Germany; USA; U.S.S.R.; England; France; Afghanistan etc. It also participated in International Festivals held in Pyong Yong in North Korea; Sanghai in China; Chuncheon in South Korea; Bogota & Medellin in Columbia etc. Different projects & activities that it has taken up so far as part of its socio-cultural & social welfare activities are : Mime training programme for the hearing challenge persons ; Culture and Values in Education through Performing & Allied Arts and Games; Non Formal Education through Performing & Allied Arts and Games; National Mime Festival for National Integration; National Cultural Camp for National Integration; Exhibition for Youth; Development of adlescent through Theatre; Vocational training for Youths; Vocational Training for Women; Vocational Training for children who left school; Developments of Adolescents & Girl Children through education, cultural therapy and computer training etc. Awareness programmes through street mime performances on Drug Abuses, Atrocities on women & girl children, AIDS, Literacy, Environment etc.

Name: SHRI SADGURU SEVA SANGH TRUST
Major_Activities1: Foundation of Shri Sadguru Seva Sangh Trust (SSSST) was laid in the early 1950’s. It was our founding father Param Pujya Gurudev – Shri Rachhoddasji Maharaj who realized the problem of blindness as a major public health concern and organized the mega surgical camp at Chitrakoot in the year 1950 and successfully performed 950 cataract surgeries with the help of his disciples (ophthalmologists) from Mumbai. Since then eye care is at the heart of trust activities and today it is known as Rural Eye Care Model. The Trust was formally registered as public charitable Trust in 1968 in Dhar, Indore, State of Madhya Pradesh in India. The primary activity of the Trust is EYE CARE. We are the largest NGO in the field for Eradication of Blindness, situated in the rural part of central India. Eye care Hospital is fully equipped to take care of all eye related cases like Cataract, Glaucoma, Vitreo Retina, Cornea, Refractive Surgery to Occuloplasty and various other eye surgeries. Our services are accessable to more than 700,000 people & performed 1, 50,000 surgeries last year. The Trust has set up two Eye Hospitals, project one is SADGURU NETRA CHIKITSALAYA at Chitrakoot, District Satna, (M.P) with over 2000 bed hospital, in 250 acre Campus & other one is SADGURU SANKALP NETRA CHIKITSALAYA at Anandpur, District Vidisha,(M.P.). with a 250 bed hospital in 62 acre campus. Currently we are working in the rural part of three states of Northern India i.e. in Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh & Rajasthan. We are also providing a primary eye care services in 31 locations of M.P, U.P & Rajasthan through our vision centre program. We also conduct more than 2000 outreach eye camp in remote rural village.

Name: Satyadeep Mahila Mandal
Major_Activities1: Satyadeep Mahila mandal was established in 1993. The organization has implemented many Social and Educational programmes. Following are some of the programmes undertaken and implemented successfully by the organization. 1.Jal Swaraj Project Worked as a Chairman and Group leader in Jalswaraj project. Organized a workshop on Water as a prime subject. 2.Chidren Welfare SMM runs a creche for children of age up to 6 years. We take efforts to build child’s personality through sanskar, play and value education. 3.Civil Issues The organization registered condemnation of an incidence of Rape and violence against a 6 year old girl in Jalna city. The organization implemented a campaign against violence on girls including a programme called as Daughter not a daughter in Law. 4.Activities for Backward classes The organization successfully implemented Rights of Backward communities campaign in Jalna, Ambad and Ghansavangi. Flag hoisting was done by the hands of a lady from backward community in Jijamata Primary School. 5.Education and Literacy Programme Primary school education for childrens 1st to 7th standard. Savitri Adult education and Training. Children education through Creche. Adult literacy education class, through which 50 ladies were educated, appeared for and passed 4th std examination. 6.Environment programme Organized a workshop conjointly with Samajik Vanikaran department on Plant a tree and Save a Tree. Organized a Vruksh Dindi, A plant rally. Distribution of plants was done and Plantation programmes were organized. 7.Fruit processing Workshop The organization organized a Fruit processing workshop. The ladies of Self help groups participated in Fruit processing workshop of 10 days duration organized by Food and Fruit processing unit of Agriculture department and also in workshop organized by Krishi Vidyan Kendra. 8.Health programmes Family welfare programme by promotion of family planning operations. Pulse polio programme Blood group and Haemoglobin testing. Blood donation Health problems after age of 40 years. 9.Sports Activities The organization undertakes sports activities like Yuvati workshop for self defence, Sports Week, Karate training etc on regular basis. 10.Information and Technology Implemented following programmes for development of Information and technology knowledge The school students appeared for examination of Gandhi Vichar Dharana through MKCL on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti Week celebration. 60 ladies of self help group appeared for pre computer examination to gain primary introduction of computer knowledge. 11.Mahila Parivarik Lokadalat Implemented following programmes for creating awareness about Law in Women. In 2006,Mahila Parivarik Lokadalat was organized. In 2010-2011 and 2011-2012, Law awareness generation camps were organized in 50 villages under guidance of District Court, Jalna, on the guidelines given by Rashtriya Vidhi Sewa Pradhikaran, New Delhi. Participated in Lok Nyayalaya Established a woman and Family counselling centre in 2008. 75 families have been saved from breaking since then. 12.Self Help Groups collectivization The organization, through establishment of 120 Self Help Groups, reached and collectivised 1400 ladies. The self help groups thus formed successfully implemented Internal loan giving SHG-Bank linkages Bank loans Establishment of Small scale Business and employment generation through same. 13.Work for Minority group of people The organization, keeping an aim of bringing the women and children belonging to Minority such as Muslim, Schedule caste, tribes and Christians in the main stream of development, organized and implemented following various programmes since 1997. Training of 6 months certificate course in fashion designing. Training courses in cutting and tailoring, and Embroidary. 14.Panchayat Raj Activities Panchayat Raj course for awareness of duties and responsibilities of Sarpanch and elected members of Grampanchayat was undertaken for lady Sarpanches and elected members in the district. Enabled participation of lady deputy sarpanch in the Sarpanch Parishad held at Delhi. Sobat Shiku Abhiyan, workshop for Elected members of Gram Panchayat and Zilla Parishad of District Jalna were organized by the association. 15.Rural Development Activities Formation of Self help groups of ladies from Rural area. Study Tour organization. Vocational training for self employment. Workshop on Women Empowerment. 16.Urban Development activities Activities including Education, Self Help Group formation, Women empowerment workshop, and Counselling centre were undertaken. 17.Vocational Training Since 1997, the organization runs training courses on regular basis for following trades. Many of the successful trainees thus trained have started their own business. Tailoring Fashion designing Embroidery. 18.Women Empowerment Following activities are undertaken on regular basis for women empowerment. Organization of Mahila Melava twice in year. Celebration of Savitribai Phule and Jijabai Jayanti Week through various innovative programmes. Celebration of World Women’s Day by organizing various programmes in urban as well as rural areas. Personality development camp was organised for women in conjunction with Abhivyakti Sanstha, Nasik. 19.Activities for Youth: Organization works closely with Nehru Yuva Kendra and implements all the programmes with the same. The organization has been felicitated with 2 District level prizes for two years by Nehru Yuva Kendra.

Name: PARENTS ASSOCIATON FOR THE MENTALLY HANDICAPPED PERSONS KARIMNAGAR
Major_Activities1: Parents Association for Mentally Handicapped Persons (PAMENCAP) was formed by group of parents of Karimnagar area in April, 1988. The Association was registered in the same year under A.P. (Telangana Area) Societies Registration Act 1310 (Fasli) Technical guidance was provided by National Institute for Mentally Handicapped (NIMH) Secunderabad an apex body under the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt. of India with the objective of human resources development, research and developing services models in the field of mental retardation. • Brought social awareness and improved the strength to more than 108 • As many as 10 types of products are produced by our students through VTC. • 27 Qualified & experienced staff members providing quality Rehabilitation&Training. • Procured half an acre government land at nominal market value and constructed two floors of school building admeasuring 1210 sq.mt. The building comprises of 12class rooms, office room, halls for vocational activity, physiotherapy and speech therapy. 75% of the building is completed besides leveling of the ground and completion of compound. We have shifted the school VTC and Early intervention center into the new building. The entire construction was met from the donation received from individuals NRIs and Corporate sector. • Purchased 25 seater Mahindra make bus from ANDRA BANK funds and seven seater TATA magic van for transporting students and staff. • Actively participating in rights movement, as we are executive members in confederation of parents association (PARIVAAR). • Sri R. Satish, 25 years age who was trained in our school and VTC is presently working in a coffee shop. • Sri B. Sadanandam, 35 years age is also now leading independent life. • Sri. Manoj a well trained boy in the school has got married and leading a normal life. He is employed in a Medical Shop.

Name: Prabhata Sindhuri Educational Society
Major_Activities1: We have received all the material sanctioned under MPLADS and these units were inaugurated on 10th Nov 2015. We have invited our Honorable MLA Sri Modugula Venugopala Reddy garu (Guntur West) and our Honorable Speaker Dr Kodela Siva Prasada Rao garu for the inaugural ceremony. Physiotherapy Unit was inaugurated by our Speaker Sir and Occupational Therapy Unit was inaugurated by Sri Peddi Venkateswara Rao (Senior Lawyer), Early Intervention and Sensory Unit by Sri Modugula garu and Special Education Department by Sri N.Tirupataiah garu (President – Senior Citizens Welfare Association). One special child by name Deepa D is having problem with speech at the time of joining and after doing the hearing evaluation we could successfully support her by providing Hearing Aids for both ears with the help of a Donor and now she is able to speak within 8 months. One Special Child (Autism) Master Manish Y appeared for 10th class through APOSS and cleared 4 papers out of 5. On the occasion of Helen Keller Jayanthi conducted by SAKSHAM 3 children got prizes in Drawing Competition.

Name: World Development Foundation
Major_Activities1: World Development Foundation (WDF) is a knowledge-based, global foundation with a commitment to enrich and sustain the lives and livelihoods of poor and excluded people throughout the world. WDF strives to empower the poor by providing education and training with the use of Radio, TV and the Internet. It also conducts research and seminars on social and economic issues. All these efforts are aimed at one goal, namely, Life Enrichment of the Poor and Socially Challenged. WDF is implementing a number of projects and providing consultancy for use of ICT for sharing knowledge, removal of poverty, improving health, increasing food production, empowerment of poor and under privileged, propagating the rights of women and children etc. Towards this end, WDF is implementing or has implemented schemes of Community Radio Stations in Birsa Agriculture University Ranchi, Narendra Deva University, Kumarganj, UP, Indira Gandhi Krishi Vishwavidyalaya, Raipur, Tamilnadu Agricultural University, Coimbatore, CSS University Hissar, CMS Lucknow, Allahabad Agricultural University, Siyasat Hyderabad, KVK Karda & Ghazipur, and many more. In fact 80% of the CRSs in the country were established with our guidance and advice. We are also working with Media Lab Asia (MLAsia) under Ministry of IT, Govt. of India towards dissemination of innovations and technology that benefit the greatest number of the underprivileged population. WDF and MLAsia, have joined hand to use the CRS and ICT for the help of farmers through broadcast of improved methods of agriculture in various regions of the Country. Capacity building is very important. We are running training programmes at a number of places in the country to train the youth from poor families and to make them employable. We have already conducted training courses jointly with the Universities. Other activities are: • Research and Innovation of new modes of use of Radio media with ICT for improving the livelihood of poor and underprivileged. • Holding Seminars, Workshops, Tutorials to interact with professionals, communities, stake holders. • Developing portal for content on Health & Hygiene, Livelihood Generation, Farming and agriculture, Entrepreneurship etc. which could be shared by various users. • Deployment of the ICT solution in Agriculture and other Universities and rural areas. • Imparting training for hardware maintenance, content production, broadcast ethics, rules and regulation, broadcasting and IT. • Development of multimedia content and documentary film in various language and dialect. • Conducting Surveys and assessing the impact. • Developing Broadcast and Communication infrastructure

Name: NAMAN FOUNDATION
Major_Activities1: Naman Foundation is a group of dedicated young professionals, to bring human dignity and self‐sustained empowered community. The injustice, social discrimination and the tough life struggle of tribal inspired us to start the organization, since the inception of this organization we serve vulnerable communities irrespective of sex, caste and creed, religion to create a just society by empowering people to face the challenges and solution. The organization encourages women, children and youth to build leadership qualities to remove inequality and injustice from society and to play a major role in the process of social changes. They shall be a role model to create classless, oppression‐free society based on nonviolence and universal brotherhood. We do believes that women are the creator of new life, children are the future of nation and youth are the nation builders, so their contribution to society is enormous. We believe that sustainability and ownership of development interventions by communities is possible only after organizing and empower the vulnerable groups through community mobilization and encourages them to utilize the available resources. We have large youth (expert and toppers ) from top universities of India like Delhi university, Jawaharlal Nehru university Delhi , Tata institute of social service Mumbai , central university Jharkhand , Banaras Hindu University, National law university etc. We are working in the field of child education and women education and empowerment in Ranchi (ratu ,mander,chano,etc),Hazaribag ,Giridih etc...

Currently we have 125 numbers of students in different courses like Basic computer course, computer account, Desktop publishing, Diploma in computer teacher training We are running the Hindi /English typewriter training course along with shorthand training and from last two years we are teaching URDU language to the student on free of cost through our experienced Urdu teacher Also we have authorized registered study center with National Early childhood care & education to conduct open/correspondence teachers training courses Like Nursery teacher training, primary teacher training computer training We are properly giving the education to handicapped/poor student on free of cost basis and support for getting the scholarship to poor & needed students On compilation of course from our institute we help to student for getting the job & employment We manage complete institute with our experienced & qualified team There are total 7 teachers just two for computer education, two for URDU Language, one for NECCE (Nursery/ Primary teachers training course), and two teachers for CCC & BCC computer courses We have separate toilet to girls student & boys student We have fresh drinking water arrangement on our institute The facility for our institute is our first priority like nonstop electricity supply, Fan, lighting, Black & white board in every classrooms.

Name: National Adventure Foundation
Major_Activities1: 1. National Adventure Foundation was founded by Late Brig Gyan Singh former Principal HMI Darjeeling and NIM Uttarkashi and leader of Indian expedition to Mt Everest in 1960. National Adventure Foundation is a socially oriented philanthropic NGO dedicated to promotion of Adventure Activities & Sports as a growth and development oriented positive activity among the youth of country. NAF has the privilege being accorded the status of All India Organisation under the new scheme for National Programme for Youth and Adonescents Development by the Ministry of YAS Govt of India. NAF executes its charter through its 31 Chapters and a number of affiliates. 2. NAF happens to be the only NGO dealing with Adventure in all its myraid forms i.e. on land in water and in air A Land Trekking Rock Climbing Rappeling Camping Cycle Safari Desert Trekking Snow Skiing B Water White water Rafting Kayaking & Canoeing Sea Awareness Wind Surfing Water Skiing C Air Para Sailing Para Gliding Powered Hang Gliding Micro Lite Flying Hot Air Balloning 3 Since 1979 NAF has given exposure to over 1 million Youth in Adventure Sports and Activities. Focus of NAF has been on Youth belonging to weaker section of society and women. 4 NAF has been conducting Adventure Programmes for Ministry of YAS Govt of India for last 12 years it also conducts Adventure Programmes for UGC KV Sangthan and other Educational Institutions. 5 NAF also conducts outdoor trainning and leadership and team building programmes through Adventure Sports for Schools and Collages as also for Corporate Entitites.

Name: Centre For Holistic Development CHD
Major_Activities1: In 2011, Centre for Holistic Development-CHD emerged in Delhi as one of the few ‘on the street’ workers working with the homeless Citizen’s with an emphasis on leadership and capacity building within the homeless community. Prior experience of anchoring the UNDP survey on homeless people in Delhi in 2010 equipped the now formed CHD to take its work forward. Though based in Delhi CHD aspires to work all over India in the coming future. CHD aims to build a self sustainable environment of community care and social inclusion for Homeless Citizens through a rights based approach ensuring a better quality of life. It works towards building safe, community care giving spaces for the homeless citizens through increased participation by establishing their identity as citizens and ensuring access to shelter, food, health, hygiene, safety, privacy, legal powers and freedom from oppression and violence. Scope of work: We have managed, in our short term, to work in all 11 revenue districts in Delhi touching a population of over 80,000 people approximately of the 1.5 lakh homeless population of the city. This includes all areas of public transactions like railways, bus stops and markets. We also work with 5000 porters all over Delhi, in their work and living areas and plan to scale this work to porters all over India. Presently CHD is involved with ‘on street’ night vigilance accompanied with aid and emergency services. These interventions span over the following themes while engaging with urban poverty. A crucial aspect of CHD’s work is the night vigilance that it does to ensure security of and aid provision to the homeless citizens. Aid can be in terms of provision of immediate food and shelter, medical aid, legal aid, intervention with the police or emergency aid depending on the situation. At the present moment CHD reaches out to three emergency interventions per day. Since December 2013, 10 pregnant and lactating women have been provided with shelter, 10 children have been put under shelter care through the CWC and 5 homeless women have been repatriated with their families. Given the nature of work being situational CHD maintains a network with 80,000 homeless citizens and works towards their day to day needs. Need for Night Vigil: Going by government records there are many seasonal deaths and the number tolls higher every year. CHD in collaboration with SAM-BKS took out a report on the basis of the night vigils conducted which estimated the death toll on Delhi streets as follows: - Between 1st September 2013 to 23rd January 2014 to be 1113, most of whom were homeless. - Between 1st April 2013 to 30th June 2013 to be 835 which has risen to 935 deaths during the same time frame in 2014. The report elucidating winter deaths compelled the NHRC to send out a notice to the Delhi Government. At the time the Delhi Government erected 70 more shelters in response during the winter. However, the number of shelters are not even close to addressing the issue of homelessness or the needs of the homeless citizens.

Name: Blue Cross of India
Major_Activities1: We are one of India’s largest Animal Welfare Organisations and the oldest one running on private and public donations, We have 3 facilities in and around Chennai which include 2 Hospitals and Shelters and one shelter. We are equipped with 6 working ambulances, 8 doctors and 4 drivers and over 40 animal care givers who operate round the clock services for the treatment of animals. We also are driven by a group of passionate individuals who devote their time purely on an honorary voluntary basis towards running the organization and have a large base of dedicated volunteers and a phenomenal volunteer led Humane Education team. In addition to the above we are equipped with a one of its kind Humane Education Centre

Name: AAROGYA CHARITABLE FOUNDATION TRUST
Major_Activities1: (a) To establish, maintain or grant aid to homes for the aged, orphanages, or other establishments for the relief and help to the poor, needy and destitute people, orphans and vulnerable children, widows and aged persons. (b) To establish and develop institutions for the physically handicapped and disabled or mentally retarded persons and to provide them education, food, clothing or other help. (c) To grant relief and assistance to the needy victims during natural calamities such as famine, earth quake, flood, fire etc and to give donations and other assistance to institutions, establishments, or persons engaged in such relief work. (d) To take up programmes sponsored by the State and Central Governments and local bodies for the welfare and development of the people. (e) To engage in activities that lead to the uplift of the poor and destitute. (f) To conduct programmes for the enhancement of health, sanitation, nutrition, education and welfare of women and children. (g) To conduct programmes for the enhancement of health, sanitation, nutrition, education and welfare of scheduled casts and scheduled tribes. (h) To take steps and measures to make social development in India meaningful to the people and improve their economic and social standards; (i) To print and publish books, periodicals and leaflets for the promotion of the above objects without any profit motive; (j) To arrange for lectures, conduct of seminars, training programmes, camps, educational programmes and in other way disseminate the ideals for the propagation of which this Trust has been founded; (k) To establish and manage emotional support centers and help lines for youth, children, men, women and aged who are emotionally challenged and depressed; (l) To collaborate with and /or assist financially or otherwise support other Institutions having objects similar to all or any of the foregoing which enjoy recognition under Income tax act 1961.

Name: Saheed Shibsankar Seba Samity
Major_Activities1: Saheed Shibsankar Seba Samity (SSSS) is a Martyr’s memorial erected to the memory of Shibsankar Chowdhury, who laid his life while upholding human values. Shibsankar fought for the freedom of his mother land, suffered in jail for years and in his life time became a legendary figure through his social, humanitarian and philanthropic services to the people in distress. To carry forward the glorious heritage that he left before us, Saheed Shibsankar Seba Samity has its foundation on May 23, 1978. Objects: SSSS is not another hospital or a V.O where curative health care is usually offered to ailing people. It is an institution where preventive health awareness actions are encouraged, health education is offered with a view to make people conscious about healthy living. That is why SSSS is striving to evolve all the constituents of a comprehensive health care delivery where the main emphasis is on unleashing popular initiative for social action. It also attempts to act as an inter-face-agency between the ailing people and the curative centers. The meager curative services SSSS provides help also to develop a bondage with the people in distress. The preventive health programs that SSSS adheres to are basically a three way scheme-(i) Early Detection of illness in a particular community and Identification of the underlying causes (ii) Immunization against some recognized diseases which take a great toll of life and (iii) Health Education. SSSS Strives to: Assist and Co-operate with the Central and State Govt. in all its health care efforts:  Provide minimum curative services to the ailing people.  Organize awareness campaign on AIDS, TB, Thalassaemia , Cancer, Blindness control  Running a NACO Assisted Licensed Blood Bank as per rules and specifications to provide safe blood to the needy.  Running MNGO Scheme in Burdwan District under RCH-II to provide Mother& Child care program in the remote rural areas.  Awareness campaign, identifying causes of common diseases like malaria, encephalitis, gastro-enteritis , Dengue, Viral Hepatitis, Bird flu, Swine flu & other viral diseases , Leprosy  Organize seminars, workshops with help of posters, models, LCD projectors, OHP, on air and water pollution, safe drinking water, sanitation, nutrition, drug addiction, personal & area cleanliness, healthy habits, against superstition & promotion of scientific attitudes.  Organize Health checkup Camps for Primary, Nursery & Adolescents girls in secondary schools. SSSS with its limited infrastructure provides: • OPD with general medicine, G&O, Pediatrics, Cardiology, Dermatology, Nephrology, Neurology, Chest, Surgery, Orthopedics, Dental, E.N.T & Eye in different days of the week. Poorer section is provided with free medicine for 3 days. • Well equipped laboratory with all types of pathology, Histopathology, Biochemical tests at a moderate cost. • Ambulance Service, Physiotherapy, E.C.G at affordable cost. • Publish a quarterly journal on health related problems, scientific awareness • Running a public library with more than 8500 books & journals to cater the need of all cross section of people.

Name: Sevakiran Charitable Society
Major_Activities1: Sevakiran Charitable Society was established in 2011 at Kothamangalam Thaluk, Ernakulam District and registered under the Travancore – Cochin Literacy Scientific ad Societies Act XII of 1955. Sevakiran Charitable Society is a voluntary organization taking initiatives, responsibilities, and leadership for implementing various Social Projects and rendering services to the society and individuals with a holistic approach for the “Self-Empowerment” in the areas of Education, Health, and Self-Employment, agriculture etc. Various initiatives of Sevakiran; CHILD DEVELOPMENT(Pragathi Balabavan) - A project to Empower Students from socially /financially Marginalized, by supporting and facilitating them for education and other basic Needs. Sanjeevani Blood Bank - Sanjeevani blood bank is forum volunteered by citizens and donating blood to all those required Disaster Management Team Fully equipped and trained and experienced team to handle Disaster recovery. Preparedness for Immediate relief, Disaster Risk reduction measure, Awareness programs, Rehabilitation, Health care management and Reconstruction of House and other facilities Individual Skill Development and Entrepreneurship promotion. Mentoring and providing trainings ad support for Individual development. Training and consultation for Entrepreneurship Development Asakiran Counseling Center - Asha Kiran counseling centre is providing free counseling services in various fields like Empowering individuals to solve their own problems By tuning up their relationship with self & others Premarital Counseling Family Relationship Issues Academic Performance Psychopathological Issues Tribal Empowerment Initiatives and Projects for the empowerment for Tribal. Promotion of Organic Farming - Projects and Initiatives for promoting and supporting Organic farming, Group Farming and live stock.

Name: NRITYARANJANI FINE ARTS ACADEMY
Major_Activities1: Dance is a devotion which acclaimed Performer Choreographer Guru and Bharatanatyam danseuse Revathi Srinivasraghavan inherited from her guru Smt. Komalavalli Krishnamani After initial tutelage under her she acquired further knowledge from the renowned Indian nattuvanar Guru Kalaimamani Kadirvelu Pillai She gained deeper insights in Abhinaya from Padma Vibhushan Smt. Kalanidhi Narayanan She gained knowledge of Konnakkol under Guru T. S. Nandakumar and currently continues to learn under Satish Krishnamurthy A Nritya Alankar from Akhil Bharatiya Gandharva Mahavidyalaya Mandal she holds a Masters Degree in Fine Arts from Nagpur University She is the Founder Director of Nrityaranjani Fine Arts Academy a leading institute of Bharatnatyam training in Mumbai since last 25 years. Revathi a versatile dancer incorporates a lot of knowledge into her dance choreographies and hence her performances appeal to diverse audiences. A unique collaboration of Traditional Bharatnatyam with Mridangam has been started by her with multi faceted Mridangam playeri Satish Krishnamurthy. Together they have conceptualized, produced and performed Nritya Laya a unique presentation of Bharatnatyam on Mridangam jathis at coveted platforms such as NCPA Mumbai. Titles conferred : Shiledar Rashtriyanirmitiche- Contributors in Nation Building 2014 by Prasar Bharati- Doordarshan. “Shivali Nritya Shiromani” Shivali Cultural Trust, “Natya Ratna” Rasikaranjani Sabha “ Nritya Shiromani “ Cuttack International DanceFest, “Nritya Vilasini” Nrithanrityathi DanceFest, “Girnar Ratna” Girnar Festival. Revathi’s performance displays creativity and freshness in abhinaya and rhythmic nuance Some of her students are scholarshiprecipients of the CCRT Govt of India. Gallery of Performances: Smt Revathi has directed several solo and group Bharatanatyam presentations. Using her knowledge of music, she fuses complicated rhythms and cross rhythms within her dances. Revathi has composed many varied AllarippuJaathis. Her proficiency as a Nattuvanaar is acclaimed across the fine art enthusiasts. Her recent performances include: Experimental Theater, NCPA NRITYA LAYA festival Pamona Temple New York USA Guruvayurappan Temple NJ USA Bridgewater Temple USA BrahanNatyanjali Natyanjali Kumbakonam Natyanjali Tiruvarur Mayura Natyanjali Marudha Natyanjali Natyanjali, Salem Thematic presentation on Rhythm Mulund Fine Arts. Cuttack International DanceFest Karur Natyanjali Festival Smitavach, Pune Girnar Festival, Junagadh Nrithanrithyathi Festival, Bhilai Kalabharthi, Mumbai Ambadevi Temple Vidyavihar, Bombay Ayyappa Seva Sangam, Goregaon, Navarathri Festival Bhagavathi Amman Temple, Pudukode Angamali, Thrisur, Vadakancheri, Mookambika Kerala Bappanadu, Kateel, Mangaladevi Temple, Mangalore. Annual Music and DanceFest,Salem Guruvayur Temple, Kerala Uttar Chidambaram Nataraja Temple, Satara Isai Natya VizhaFest, Chennai ShivaliFest, Mumbai. Vishwabharati, Morrappur SrishtiFest, Bengaluru Aashraya, NaviMumbai GSB Navarathri Cultural Programme, Dahisar Ayyappa Samaj, Vasai DasyamFest, Chennai Dakshina ChitraFest, Chennai Dombivili Fine Arts AnnualFest SriSathya SaiAradhana Mahotsav, Mumbai As a choreographer, Revathi has experimented with a variety of themes and directed several dance ballets like: NrithyaLaya RudraNatyam BhaktiVaibhavam DeviBhakti Ganesha Pancharatnam DruvaCharitam GopikaGeetam Shivastuti Ramayana Rabigeetika ValliTirumanam BhaktaAndal Dashavataram KrishnamVande Jagatgurum Om SharavanaBhava ShivaShakthi KrishnaKrishnaa Shiva Priya The students of Nrityaranjani participate in prestigious festivals, conferences, and competitions and serve society by performing for fundraising events. Revathi is a regular examiner for the Alankar and Visharadh Examination conducted by the Akhil Bharatiya Gandharva Mahavidyalaya Mandala. As a guest lecturer invited by several institutes she has conducted workshops in Bharatanatyam.

Name: Economic Rural Development Society
Major_Activities1: Achievement: This strong association between the functionaries of ERDS and the local youth club members was based on a common zeal and understanding to improve the quality of life in the villages. This association clicked so effectively every where that the local youth became the ‘Torch – bearer’ for the functionaries. In fact, most of the difficulties faced by the functionaries’ at the initial stages were sorted out with the help of local youth club members only. The most effective and meaningful role in involving the community in the process of bringing about improved quality of life was played by none other than the children of the project areas. ERDS, undoubtedly, has been able to attract the attention of all types of community leaders – the Panchayet members, traditional caste/community leaders, religious leaders, political leaders, school teachers, women groups, youth club etc. to the sponsorship program and its benefits. ……………As a sequel to the efforts made by one and all as stated above, there now exits a sense of togetherness among the villagers, their readiness to change and their conscious efforts to take up collective action on such issues which affect their lives. This has been the most crucial achievement of the sponsorship program as well as ERDS. There is no doubt that this is the beginning of the community empowerment process and the beginning has been well initiated. The rest is naturally assured. For ERDS, the concept of community participation is never a ‘borrowed’ or ‘imposed’ concept; rather it is ingrained in the organizational building process. The Chief Functionary who has established and nurtured ERDS as an organization for ‘working with the people’ has, because of his praise – worthy personal characteristics and tremendous leadership skills, emerged as a role model for voluntary workers. The forms and strategies of communication adopted by the functionaries in communicating with the people have proved to be very effective and meaningful in motivating the people. Judicious use of folk media such as plays, puppet-shows etc. has attractive the attention of the people in a very encouraging way. In addition, the personality traits showed by the functionaries such as simplicity, cordiality, personal touch, displaying respect and dignity to the people, taking people into confidence, listening to their problems etc. have played a crucial role in facilitating community participation. The mechanism for supervision as followed by ERDS disserves all praise as it is absolutely based on mutual trust and respect – not the one which is normally found in an organizational set up. ERDS Activities: Campaign Against Child Trafficking, Child Sponsorship Programme, Read To Lead Programme, Sanitary Mart, Sponsor a Grand parent Project, Jhilmil School, Educate A Child Programme, Creche & State Govt. Name: Mukti Rural Socio Economic Development Organisatio
Major_Activities1: Legal Identity Mukti Rural Socio Economic Development Organization has been registered under Societies Registration Act XXI of 1860 before the Additional Registrar of Societies, Nabarangpur, Orissa, India. The head office of the organization is situated at Khatiguda, 37 K. M. far from the district head quarter, Nabarangpur. The organization has been registered under section 12AA (2) of the Income Tax Act 1961. The Organization has also been registered under the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act, 1976. The Aims & Objects of the society 1. Striving for Social justice and Civil rights of women, youths, children, Indigenous people and Indian minority in religion and other weaker section people and work for their holistic development. 2. Promotion of welfare of destitute or handicapped children, youths, women and old age people through orphanages, Hostels and Homes; Imparting vocational training and helping for self-employment and organizing social rehabilitation. 3. Providing relief during natural calamities and emergencies. 4. Awareness on Health, Natural Resources Management, Responsible Citizenship, Self-employment and Income Generation through advance Technologies creating more opportunity for Research and Development. 5. Educational Development by formal, Non-formal Technical and Adult Educations, Diffusion of useful, scientific and trade and commercial knowledge and Development Education. 6. Economic Development of the Weaker Section by improvement of Agricultural productivity, by improvement of occupational and vocational skills, by promotion of poultry, Animal Husbandry, Sericulture, Pisciculture, Handicraft and appropriate cottage and Agro based Industries and by organizing co-operative societies. 7. Building up of healthy natural Environment, Development of forest, orchards, assist people to acquire low cost house and appropriate substitute to fire wood. 8. To record and give expression to the material opinion of the educated class on important and pressing socio, economic issues through discussions and deliberation. 9. Spiritual Development of Souls teaching good manner of life and responsible citizenship. 10. Organizing Rural Knowledge Centers and providing useful database of different Resources to bridge the information gap on rural development. 11. It shall organize meetings, work-shops, conventions and seminars to fulfill the aims and objects of the Organization. 12. Encourage Youth participation on different Games, Sports, Athletics, and their involvement in the development process conducted by the government, semi-government, and non-government organizations 13. It can make credit, thrift, insurance and deposit mobilization of rural poor and unemployed youth. 14. It shall co-operate to or receive co-operation form any individual, government organization or non-government organization within India or abroad for welfare and awareness of the people and the region.’ Moreover, we are working on Environment, Micro Finance, Women Empowerment, Right to Information, Water and Sanitation, Health, Education, Self Employment, and Socio Economic Issues of the weaker section people and the youth. Last year we have successfully completed the projects in collaboration with the ‘Khadi and Village Industrial Commission’, Ministry of MSME, ‘Centre for Environmental Studies’, Department of Forest and Environment, ‘MAITRI’: supported by Rajiv Gandhi Foundation, Social Welfare Board, Orissa, Bhubaneswar. We are eager to co-operate in all programs of the government, Non-Government Organizations and individuals similar to our aims and objects above. Chairman

Name: Ramakrishna Mission Tuberculosis Sanatorium
Major_Activities1: Ramakrishna Miision Tuberculosis Sanatorium, P.O. RK Sanatorium, Ranchi-835221 is one of the branch centres of the Ramakrishna Mission having its headquarters at Belur Math, Howrah-711202(W.B.). The Ramakrishna Mission was registered on the 4th May, 1909 under ACT XXI of 1860, Registration no. 1917/3for 1909-10. Revised according to West Bengal ACT XXVI of 1961. The objectives of the Association as per the extracts from the memorandum of association of the Ramakrishna Mission are: (a)To ompart and promote the study of Vedanta and its principles as propounded by Sri Ramakrishna and practically illustratedby his own life and Comparative Theology in its widest form (b)To establish, maintain, carry on and assist schools, colleges, universities, research institutions, libraries, auditoriums, orphanages, workshops, laboratories, hospitals, dispensaries, houses for the aged, infirm, the invalid and the afflicted, relief and rehabilitation works, and any other educational, medical, cultural and social welfare service activities and training institutions and charitable works and institutions of a like nature (c)To take up development and general welfare actvities for the benefit for underprivileged,backward,tribal people of the society without any discrimination. Activities: At a time when there was hardly any scope for treatment of Tuberculosis in our country, the Ramakrishna Mission Tuberculosis Sanatorium, Ranchi came into being in 1951 rurally in the Ranchi district of Jharkhand with the initiative of Dr Rajendra Prasad, the first President of Republic India. Since its inception the institution has been dedicated to the service of the tribal/adivasi people from more than 600 surrounding villages. 150-beds hospital exclusively for TB patients under the concepts of Sanatorium & method of treatment for Tuberculosis:Since its inception the institution has been serving tuberculosis patients all across the country. The method of treatment here is based on Anti-tuberculosis treatment (ATT) which includes ensuring properand weight-related drug intake to avoid MDR TB, daily monitoring of all physical & bio-chemical parameters to exclude side effects as well as ensuring their effectiveness for each patient & providing balanced nutritious diet. 50-beds hospital for general patients & OPD: OPD offers treatment for TB as well as other ailments with departments of: general medicine,pulmonology,radiology, ultra-sonography,pathology,gynecology & obstetrics,minor surgery,eye, orthopedics,pediatric,dentistry with general & cosmetic surgery, ENT, dermatology,physiotherapy,homeopathy and ayurveda. Number of patients treated on an average per year are TB-7500, Non-TB-25,000, Homeopathy-3600 & Ayurvedic-250. Mobile Medical Unit(MMU): The centre runs a Mobile Medical Unit thrice a weekthriughout the year covering 600 villages. The OPD & MMU together have been extending medical coverage, in addition to treatment of tuberculosis, to more than half a million people over the last decade. In addition, the centre regularly organises a number of free sopecial medical camps, in the remote villages throughout the year and other rural developmental works.

Name: Aastha Foundation Aurangabad
Major_Activities1: Aastha Foundation Aurangabad is a NGO working to provide a much needed attention, and care, love, dignity and respect to the Senior Citizens and make the golden years of their life more comfortable. ‘Aastha’ believes that ‘Ageing with Dignity’ is possible. Aastha Foundation, Aurangabad is registered under Bombay public Trust Act and Societies Act and is established in 2008 by a group of young, dynamic, socially aware people with a dream of making positive changes in various areas of our Society. Aastha Foundation, Aurangabad proposes to establish `Basant Prabha-Visawa’ a residential housing and assisted living for the Senior Citizens. The NGO organizes various activities for Senior Citizens regarding their health, safety, security & entertainment. Aastha Foudnation Aurangabad has launched a certificate course in `Geriatric Care` in association with TATA Institute of Social Sciences (TISS) Mumbai and is run with the help from doctors of Hedgewar Hospital Aurangabad at Hedgewar Hospital. The participants who have completed this course are fully equipped to serve senior citizens who are suffering from any short or long term illness. Their approach towards service is qualitatively different due to the quality learning process that they have undergone for 16 weeks. Their services are helpful to senior citizens a lot. Name: THEATRE IN EDUCATION
Major_Activities1: TIE refers to a coordinated set of theatre-based educational activities that are generally centered on a subject that has relevance to both the children’s lives as well as the school curriculum. An array of studies have demonstrated the benefits of TIE in positively improving young people’s knowledge, attitudes and behavior in relation to various life skills and health topics, including: health risk behaviors such as AIDS/HIV and smoking; nutrition and healthy eating; financial literacy; social issues, and; bullying. A review of the literature of TIE reveals a wide variety of program characteristics, including: the use of puppets or actors; inclusion of follow-up classroom activities; the use of music; participatory techniques such as role playing, and; research/theory based performances. The effectiveness of TIE programs will be discussed according to these criteria, to determine how the different program characteristics may contribute to the success or otherwise of such programs.

Name: Padatik Cultural Centre
Major_Activities1: Padatik Cultural Centre has presented and has been involved in various unique activities to upgrade and promote dance theatre. It also presented different programmes of other dance forms at our own Padatik Cultural Centre Auditorium and elsewhere. It presented its programmes at various venues in Kolkata and other cities too. April 2013 to June 2013 • We have carried forward our production “Mukta Mon” from last year. It bears a vital message of Tagore, the man, rarest of rare who has sought freedom of the human heart so passionately that his free spirit as a liberated human mind ever enriched our heart. This year “Mukta Mon” was staged on 5th May 2013 at our auditorium. • On 30th June 2013, we had staged our new production “Some Dots”. • On 2013 “Khudito Pashan” had staged in Satayajit Ray auditorium Kolkata. It is the form of a truly lavish musical which has been performed all over India as part of prominent festivals, cooperative events, etc. This enigmatic story was first brought to the silver screen as a Bengali movie and then as “Lekin” by Gulzar, starring Vinod Khanna & Dimple Kapadia. October 2013 to December 2013 On 14th December 2013, Padatik Cultural Centre presented two dance pieces “Flight of Birds” and “Scarlett of Love” organised by West Bengal State Music Academy at Uday Shankar Dance Festival at Rabindra Sadan Auditorium, Kolkata. • “Flight of Birds”, a musical piece of 20 minutes duration is a story of a family of birds; father, mother and their four children. Changes of their lives are depicted with the changing of seasons like spring, summer, autumn and winter. It is choreographed by Dietmar Seyffert of Germany and its music is given by Pt. Vijai Shankar. The innovative choreography has been recently revived and it features different dance movements of Kathak, Chhau and Ballet. • Our new production, “Scarlett of Love” whose music was given by Mr. Mayukh Bhowmick explores the mystery of love. Mr. Mayukh Bhowmick is a renowned composer for experimental films as well as music compositions. He has been commissioned to work on a music piece which is appealing to our present day audience yet keeping our tradition alive. The Repertory dancers worked hard for this fusion piece taking out each note in the music with subtle movements. January 2014 to March 2014 Two new most important productions of PCC this year include “Angvinyasam” and “Ityalam” presented on 29thJanuary 2014 at Kamani Auditorium, New Delhi. It was presented by our North-east students. All our north-east dancers are excellently trained in Ballet and Classical Jazz Techniques. They have also been trained in Kathak by Chetna Jalan since the last 4 years.

Name: Narayan Sewa Sansthan
Major_Activities1: SERVICES: Narayan Sewa Sansthan (Trust) rendering services in the field of treatment and rehabilitation of polio affected persons of the society at large, without any discrimination on the ground of religion, region, caste, sex etc.The organization has also engaged itself in different educational, social and medical services for the poor as well as the needy, especially from the tribal belt. It is maintaining an orphan children hostel and a residential school for the blind, deaf-dumb and mentally retarded children. In order to make them self dependant Sansthan is providing training of sewing, carpentry, bamboo work etc. and also has vocational training centers providing courses on computer servicing, T.V. / V.C.R. repairing etc.The Sansthan has frequently been organizing service camps to distribute food grains, medicines and basic utility items to poor tribals, pulse polio drive, environmental awareness camps, distribution of aids & appliance as calipers, crutches, tricycle & wheelchair free of cost etc. Besides these it also arranges “Parichay Sammelan” (Introduction Ceremony) for the disabled boys and girls and organizezs a ceremony to get them married. AWARDS: 1) Padamshri Award to Shri kailash Chandra Agrawal from her excellency President of India Smt. Pratibha Devi Singh Patil for his excellent social services. 2) National Awrad to Shri Kailash Chandra Agrwal by Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam then the President of India. 3) Godfrey Philips Bravery Award from Shri Bhairon Singh Shekhawat then the Vice President of India. 4) Rashtriya Ratan Award. 5) National Awrd By Smt. Menaka Gandhi to Sansthan for being the best recognition for its outstanding performance in the field of welfare of disable persons. 6) Gem of India Award for outstanding Social Services. 7) Rajiv Gandhi Shiromani Award. 8) State level Award for best Social worker. 9) State level best institute award along with cash award of Rs. Fifty thousand from governer of rajasthan. 10) Pride of India award for excellent work of welfare.

Name: HOPE  Society for Handicapped Orientation Programme and Education
Major_Activities1: HOPE Durgapur is catering to the needs of the differently able children. Starting with just 6 children and two special educators, the organisation has grown to near about 275 children and adults distributed over three centres. The children and adult with mental retardation, cerebral palsy, autistic and hearing deficiency from main body of the students. HOPEs goal, providing quality special education with a holistic approach, providing vocational training, helping the trainee adults to get employed, self employed, extending the services to rural population by organising CBR programme. Disseminating knowledge to the parents about preventive measures, creating awareness in the society to accept the persons with special needs. Creating a barrier free environment, persistent effort towards inclusive education. Activities- Educating children in an environment free from competition to be self reliant and self respecting. Teaching children basic and social skills, language, number work and functional academics, offering pre-vocational, vocational training to enable children to become self supporting. Councelling parents, integrating children in the mainstream, helping children to live a normal life in the family and in society. Developing creating potential of each child to holistic approach in the school curriculum with emphasis on creative as well as re-creative activities. Curricula- children between 2 to 18 years are trained individually or in groups depending on their needs. Adults above 18 years irrespective of their degree of disability are placed in the vocational training unit to prepare them for suitable employment, self employment.

Name: NATYASHALA CHARITY TRUST
Major_Activities1: Natyashala Charity Trust (Natyashala), is a pioneering cultural and educational institution implementing various schemes and projects for children with disabilities and their teachers all over India since 1981. Natyashala has been a mentor to the disabled and their teachers in the field of music, dance, puppetry and educational drama. It has trained about 7500 children, 7000 teachers and has so far staged over 1200 shows of 72 plays in all over India. Natyashala’s use of performing arts as a therapy, as a means of rehabilitation and it’s dedicated services have been applauded and appreciated by stalwarts in the field of education and culture. The result oriented projects implemented in urban, suburban and rural areas during last 34 years:- 1) Play Productions : Over 1200 performances of 72 plays in Marathi, Hindi & English (children’s & adult’s plays, street plays, mime skits). All these play productions are of high standards with rich production on value based themes. 2) Bharatiya Vadya Zankar : Music ensembles 3) Creative Dramatics Workshops : 4) Teacher-Training Programmes in theatre arts : 5) State level music, dance, drama competitions involving about 100 special schools, 2000 child artists, 500 teachers and 13,000 audience members every year. 6) Festivals : Participation in state and national cultural festivals giving disabled artists a platform along with other national level artists and providing expertise guidance and technical assistance for organisation. 7) Rang Tarang : Two week’s multidimensional presentation oriented training camp-cum-cultural meet of the disabled involving over 150 children in each programme. 8) Natyashala has its unique theatre repertoire consisting of hearing and visually impaired artists along with other regular artists. These artists perform plays on social and educational themes at theatres, schools, rural areas and in theatre festivals. The repertoire artists also visit schools to impart training in creative dramatics and demonstrations of educational plays. Natyashala’s repertory artists’ theatre movement has created a strong base for expanding its network in rural areas. 9) Publication : 1) Gosht Tumchi Aamchi - Marathi play based on Std III History Syllabus 2) Life on Earth - English play based on Std III History Syllabus 3) Maharashtra Amucha - Marathi play based on Std III and IVth Geography Syllabi Compilation of 13 volumes of 188 one act plays (Hindi, Marathi, Konkani & Gujarati) contributed by school teachers trained in Natyashala’s training programmes and competitions, based on school text and moral values. Natyashala’s child-centric multifarious social, cultural and educational activities have brought miraculous changes in the participating children and teachers and have empowered them in social, educational and economic fields Natyashala Charity Trust’s mission of therapeutic and educational use of Performing Arts has amazingly contributed to integration and rehabilitation of children with special needs. Natyashala has given them confidence to face the challenges of today and share the hopes of tomorrow. The commendable work of Natyashala Charity Trust has been highly acclaimed and supported by many renowned state and national level cultural and social organizations.

Name: Vivekananda Kendra Institute of Culture
Major_Activities1: The VKIC aims to peruse, preserve, and promote the indigenous cultures of India’s North East. It concentrates on the precious knowledge and values contained within the native cultures of the region, revealing the unifying elements which create the magnificent mosaic of people and their ways of life, their beliefs, traditions, and customs. VKIC carries out this work through research and documentation of different communities, bringing to light the social and anthropological issues in them. Its activities support communities to strengthen their cultural roots, appreciate, and sustain their timeless traditional knowledge and belief systems. To achieve its aims VKIC organizes lectures, seminars, workshops in its own complex and also in others parts of the Northeast. Apart from its centre in Guwahati, its New Delhi and Arunachal Pradesh Chapters also play host to similar activities. It has successfully carried out field investigations, collected significant facts and information, some of which have been published in books and journals. Research and documentation has focused on Kamakhya, Adi, Rabha, Nyishi, Theravadi Buddhism, Dimasa, Sattra institution of Assam, to name a few. Due to its path breaking work in Northeast India, the institute has emerged as a major think tank in the sphere of cultural studies. It has built and sustained ties with intellectuals, researchers and organisations, which have resulted in a better appreciation of the ancient communities and cultures of the region.

Name: PARENTS ASSOCIATION FOR THE MENTALLY HANDICAPPED PERSONS SECUNDERABAD
Major_Activities1: Our organisation is the first association formed by the parents in the state of Andhra Pradesh in the year 1986. We are having two projectss ie. special school for the differently abled below aged of 18 years and for 18 years and above we have vocational training centre. In special school we impart training in special education, physiotherapy yoga, occupational therapy , psychological assessment, counseling and guidance, speech therapy, music and dance, behavour modication apart from basic training right brushing of teeth to taking bath etc. we want them to be independent. In vocational training centre we impart training , candle making, paper bag making and also sale them. We have 30 staff members thats include special educators, paramedical staff , vocational instructor, and other administrative staff. we have successfully completed 29 years. We have our own building and two vehicle for transport. In the month of july 2015 we had opportunity to meet H E President of India during his visit to R.P.Nilayam, Hyderabad on 6.07.2015.

Name: Educational Cum Vocational Association for the Disabled
Major_Activities1: Ours is an organization dedicated to the welfare of the handicapped section of the handicapped section of the society. This association established in 1995 has ceaselessly been working for the uplift of the impaired and the downtrodden. The EVAD has engaged itself in the activities which spread from cradle to the grave. Apart from major activities different personalized services related to the mentally retarded, the hearing challenged, visually impaired and the orthopedically handicapped prominently figure amongst others The organization has been running school for the deaf-dumb, mentally retarded and blind since 1995. Regular classes up to 5th standard are held except Sundays and festival holidays. To accomplish this task of educating the disabled special educators, teachers, speech therapist, physiotherapist has been appointed. The students who complete their education up to the 5th standard from this school are admitted to some nearby normal schools to continue their studies without any interruption. In this connection requisite help or assistance of trained teachers are available to other normal schools also. Speech therapy to remove the deficiency in speech, Speech Therapists has been appointed. They attend the mentally retarded, blind and deaf-dumb to correct or rectify any problem. With the help of different equipments and techniques the speech problem is sorted out and corrected. The students learn to pronouns from the alphabet to words and sentences fluently. Physiotherapy has also been introduced in addition to other activities with the expertise and assistance of physiotherapist different defects in holding grips, movements, touch and others are set right. There is a provision of hostel for the handicapped children who cannot come to school to attend the classes regularly. At present 25 handicapped students are enjoying the hostel. Poverty stricken children shoes parents are unable to afford for smooth education, food and transport are given priority in admission to the hostel. These students are provided with all the requisite facilities such as- reading-writing materials, school uniforms, opportunities for picnics/excursions to holy places and historical monuments. Services of library, tutorial classes at evening besides accommodation and food. A Tailoring Unit has been established for handicapped women. Trade/diploma holder’s ladies are appointed to teach the handicapped women tailoring. They themselves prepared lady suits, blouse etc. with all the necessary activities of stitching. This unit has proved helpful for the women after completing the training they also earn their livelihood and take care of their families and dependents. Apart from the activities mentioned above we are also giving computer training to the handicapped students. Elementary knowledge of handling computer and different uses of computer are imparted. The students play games, solve different problems do various exercises on computers. This has been an entertaining programme for the children.
issues_working_db: Differently Abled,
nr_add: EVAD, Chawla Colony, Ballabgarh
nr_orgName: Educational Cum Vocational Association for the Disabled

Name: CHHOTO JHILPAR NICWON CENTRE FOR PERFORMING ARTS
Major_Activities1: We are working on the folk art of India for the last two decades. Along with it we are also working on the Classical and creative dances and music of our country. For the last 11 years Nicwon is organising a cultural fair in Bally, Howrah, West Bengal. The main aim of the fair is to highlight the glorious culture of our nation. So in that fair Nicwon invites different cultural groups and organisations from all over the country to perform. The dances like Sangi Mukhota from Maharashtra, Bhawai from Rajasthan, Rauf from Kashmir, Holi and Peacock Dances from Uttar Pradesh, Jumur and Karam from Jharkhand, Rava and Boirathi from Assam, Kathakali and Mohiniattam from Kerala, Odishi from Odisha, Bharatnatyam from Tamil Nadu, Gouriya Nritya and the different folk dances like Chhou, Ravankata, Manabputul, Raibeshe, Gambhira, Puppet Dance, Gajan, Santal Dance of West Bengal performed in this fair. Every year the fair is based on a particular theme like The Role of Flute in the Folk Culture (2015),The Role of Boat in the Folk Culture (2014) etc . The students of local schools organises an exhibition on the theme of the fair. There are stalls of handicrafts from different parts of West Bengal. Many eminent persons like freedom fighter Brindaban Chandra Ghosh, poet Sankha Ghosh, filmmaker Sandip Ray, singer Amar Pal and many more celebrities and scholars of West Bengal are members of this organisation. Sahitya Akademy award winning writer Shirshendu Mukhopadhyay, Dadasaheb Falke winning actor Soumitra Chattopadhyay, Sabitri Chattopadhyay who recently got Padmashree Samman, eminent Bharatnatyam dance Guru Thankumani Kutty, Manipuri dance guru Kalavati Devi, eminent theatre personality Rudraprasad Sengupta also came to the fair and praised Nicwon. Sahitya Akademy and Eastern Zonal Cultural Centre also financially assisted us to do this fair. Nicwon is also publishing a monthly printed wall magazine on the Bally Railway station for the last 11 years. Moreover we are also doing passenger awareness programmes regularly with Eastern Railway. Nicwon also organises a Morning Procession on the birthday of our national poet Rabindranath Tagore for the last 17 years. The members sing songs, dances and perform street theatre on that procession. On that procession Nicwon arranges Raksha Bandhan, to celebrate the national integrity of the nation. Nicwon also arranges different workshops on dance, theatre and craft. Like Kanchan Roy from Purulia had done a workshop on Chhou and Nandikar had done a workshop on theatre. Artists from Avibekti of Bankura West Bengal had done a workshop on craft. Nicwon also made documentaries and film. The documentaries are made on Flute (Banshi Kahini), Boats (Nouka Katha) and many more items. The short film Sir Sabdhan is on a teacher and his pupils. The members of Nicwon have also written and performed many dance dramas like Nouko Yatra, Ful Futuk, Basuria and Chandragrahan. They are Nicwons own production.

Name: HELEN KELLERS SCHOOL FOR THE DEAF
Major_Activities1: Helen Keller’s High School for the Deaf and Rehabilitation Centre, Kadapa is a voluntary organization run by the Educational Society namely, “Helen Keller’s School for the Deaf, Kadapa” in Andhra Pradesh State. This organization is working for Education, Rehabilitation and Manpower Development for the cause of Hearing Impaired Children. Helen Keller’s School for the Deaf and Rehabilitation Centre, Kadapa started on 27.06.1984. This school is became Upper Primary School from the academic year 1989-90 and High School from the academic year 1991-92 and Higher Secondary School (Intermediate) from the academic year 2006-07. At present in this school 137 Hearing Impaired Children are studying from Pre-school to XII th Class (Intermediate). All the Hearing Impaired Children are providing with Free Education. We are thankful to the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, Govt. of India for sanctioned and released Grant-in-Aid to our Helen Keller’s School for the Deaf, Kadapa from the year 1991-92. Our Educational Society has been conducting Free Speech and Hearing Medical Camps and awareness exhibitions on Hearing Impairment in different places in several times in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana States and distributed Hearing Aids free of cost to many Hearing Impaired persons. Under Manpower Development at Head Office, Kadapa our society is also conducting D.Ed. Spl. Edu. (DHH) Course from the academic year 1997-98, B.Ed. (SE-DE) HI Distance Mode Course from the academic year 2002-2003 and B.Ed. Spl. Edu. (HI) Regular Course from the academic year 2006-2007. At that time in 1991-1992 there is no English Medium Special School for Hearing Impaired and Mentally Retarded Children in Secunderabad and Hyderabad (Twin Cities). To provide English Medium Education to Hearing Impaired and Mentally Retarded Children in the year 1991-92 our Organization has started a Branch in Secunderabad namely “Helen Keller’s School for the Deaf and M.R. Children, Secunderabad”. We are thankful to the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt. of India for sanctioned and released Grant-in-Aid to this branch from the year 1998-99. In this branch Free Education has been providing from Pre-School to Graduation to Hearing Impaired and M.R. Children. At present 643 Hearing Impaired and 33 M.R. & Multiple Disabled Children are studying in this branch. Under the Manpower Development this branch is also conducting B.Ed. Spl. Edu. (HI), B.Sc. (ASLP) and M.Sc. (ASLP) courses. In recognition of our Organization’s Best Services Govt. of Andhra Pradesh has awarded “State Government Best Institution Award” on 03.12.2005 in Hyderabad and Government of India has awarded “National Award for Child Welfare” on 14.11.2007 in New Delhi to Helen Keller’s High School for the Deaf and Rehabilitation Centre, Kadapa. Several times with many Kadapa District Collectors Helen Keller’s High School for the Deaf and Rehabilitation Centre, Kadapa has received “Prasamsa Pathrams” on the occasion of Independence and Republic Day Celebrations. Every year our Institutions Hearing Impaired Students are getting 100% result in 10th Class and above 80% results in Intermediate Public Examinations.

Name: Jalpaiguri Women And Child Welfare Society
Major_Activities1: Jalpaiguri Women & Child Welfare Society is a non-government Organization, established in 2007 with a mandate to improve the lives of women and children belonging to marginalized community in West Bengal. The main focus of JWCWS is primarily on education and health. The organization is dedicated to create a better place for children belonging to marginalized community by creating friendly platform for overall development of a child. Following activities are being carried out by the organization at their coverage areas: • Health Awareness Camp. • Awareness on Environment (save our planet). • Awareness generation programme on Child Labour. • Relief Programme. • Vocational training for Women. • Non Formal educational Center at Tea Gardens, Jalpaiguri District. Bringing Changes drastically is not so easy as we deal with humans from diversified backgrounds but lots of changes happened due to our presence at grassroots levels. Sensitization at community level happened to some extent. Parents showing interests and working as volunteer. A long way to go and we are dedicated to work for the betterment of women and Children in our Society.
