Name: janeni foundation
Major_Activities1: To create awareness of pro-poor, rights-focused government programs and policies and to ensure benefit of these. The organization is formed aiming to develop the socio-economic condition of the distressed Feticide, deserted widowed discover women, Since inception the organization has been involved in various welfare activities for the women and child handicapped old aged for the vulnerable class of the society and the neglected group of the society, who are deprived of physical educational, economical social development . The organization is working for the enlistment of the down trodden to create general awareness for the eradication of untouchables drug abuse dowry system. Blind faith atrocities upon women etc. In development of that vulnerable class of the society various ventures have been implemented by the organization. All the programmers and ventures are running smoothly and gaining a sound momentum in the Society. The organization is having a well built experience in the field’s welfare activities and programmers for the aliment and betterment of the distressed divorced widowed women who are the victims of exploitation and injustice and the organization has achieved a remarkable target in this fields. Female infanticide is not uncommon in Indian society, and is still prevalent in certain parts of the country .With the advancement of modern technology is practice, however, has taken a different shape. Now it is possible to detect the sex of the baby when it is still in the womb of the mother. This has made it possible to abort the female fetus, if is unwanted. Even in economically prosperous states like Orissa the sex ratio has dramatically declined, it is 875 in Orissa , down from 800 in 1991, of the 10 district in the country where the sex ration has fallen below 850, three belong to Orissa . A declining sex ratio is an alarming social signal. In the natural order of things, the number of females born should slightly exceed that of males. Female’s infanticide whether by underfeeding, poisoning or suffocating contributes to a skewed sex ratio? The availability of sex determination tests makes the situation worse. Couples normally hesitant to carry out infanticide (after a child is born) find it easier to opt for medical termination of pregnancy (MTP) which is legal. To aware and educate the people about objectives and activities of proposed project To empower women by developing their social, mental, educational and intellectual capabilities. To organize women artisans of the deprived community and work for their economic and social development and removal of imbalances at all possible levels. To provide facilities for better training, networking and institutional support and motivate them to contest elections and bring about gender equity in local self-governance. To promote awareness of health, hygiene and nutrition among rural masses. To facilitate holistic well-being and development of women and children. To educate women about their rights and reduce gender inequalities. To promote agriculture activities for food and livelihood security. To develop entrepreneurial skills for youth self-employment.
nr_add: vill.- paigumber pur, p.o.- mohammad pur rajauri, distt.- bijnor - 246747

Name: SUNAADA CULTURAL CENTRE TRUST
Major_Activities1: Sunaada Cultural Center, the brain child of Prof. Mysore Nagamani Srinath established in the year 1985 and celebrated its Silver Jubilee in 2010. Dr. Nagamani Srinath, Founder & Director of SUNAADA CULTURAL CENTRE is the nucleus of this center for classical arts imparting quality carnatic Classical music to their students and also helps in assimilating Indian Culture. Dr.Nagamani Srinath is a teacher par excellence and has more than four decades of experience in the art of teaching, worked as professor and Head of the department of music in Govt. Maharanis Arts College, Mysore and Bangalore for 30 years, and worked as visiting professor in both Bangalore and Mahaveer jain universities for post graduation. She is a multifaceted personality, a combination of a teacher, organizer, composer, administrator and a concert musician of international repute and ‘A’ top artist of All India Radio and Dooradarshan. The gold medals, Titles, Appreciations, Citations and laurels awards have followed throughout her carrier including – * Central sangeeth Natak academy puraskar from government of India, (The first lady artist of Karnataka State received this award for carnatic music) * “Rajyothsava Prashasti”, * Best Teacher Award, * Karnataka Kalashree- from Karnataka Government. * Chowdaiah national Award and Prestigious Sangeetha Kalacharya and many more.. Nagamani belongs to an exclusive and elite group of musicians who have held center stage in the field of Carnatic music for over 5 decades. As a rare gem among contemporary musicians, Nagamani is an astute grammarian with deep insight into the facets of the enthralling medium of music. Her musical articulation has a magnetic appeal, charm, emotional richness strikes a chord with both the elite and the common man. Paper Reviews - Nagamani sings like a nightingale. What a voice! What a range! What melody! What About Sunaada Cultural Centre purpose and commitment. Nagamani started teaching Carnatic Music from basic to masters through this center in typical “Gurukula” style. She catered to the needs of both beginners as well as Senior students. AIMS & OBJECTIVES OF SCC Gurukula and Sangeetha Saadhane: Music is a banyan tree, so that each and every one should share and enjoy the shade. To keep these roots alive by taking the best advantage of available advanced technology means: a humble effort is made by SCC to preserve and propagate the great treasure of Indian culture and art by conventional methods. The globally well received project conceived by Prof.Nagamani to imitate the traditional gurukula style, an Audio - Visual “Gurukula” DVDs and ACDs “Sangeeta Sadhana” for Junior, Senior, Vidwath grade curriculum is brought forth. Carnatic music has been taught (practical and theory )from basics to masters in this DVDs and ACDs containing classical music Shlokas, Varnas, Kritis, Keerthanas, Vachanas, Tillaanas and Ragam-Tanam-Pallavis. Nearly 500 hours of DVDs have already been released. Sunaada - Sangeetha Title Course: SCC has launched “SUNAADA- SANGEETHA”, an academic 6 year course in USA and 3 years in India with a well-designed curriculum. It takes the responsibility to prepare potential students to give a concert by the end of the course. Workshops, Lecture Demo, Festivals & Conference: Sunaada Cultural Center arranges many festivals, conferences and programs of eminent artists. In that perspective, SCC arranges a lot of music workshops, lecture demonstration and concerts from various renowned artists, so that students those who are interested in pursuing Carnatic music academically can gain the knowledge and and acquaintance with great masters. Nagamani herself conducts various workshops in Devotional & classical music at villages to propagate Indian Art and Culture. Promoting Promising Artists & Talent Search Festival: Sunaada Cultural Centre recognizes learners who can become promising performers where in Guru Prof Nagamani Srinath herself allows and provides opportunities to sing along with her in major esteemed platforms in order to help students understand the practicalities of a concert. Group Production: SCC also focuses on thematic group multimedia productions, such as Music-Dance-Drama - Devotional features under the Direction of Prof. Nagamani. Haridasa Spandana, Purandara and Tyagaraja, Sanaatana saarathi, Bhakti Kampana, Kavi Kaavya Deepthi, Kala Tapaswi, Mysore composers and many more have been successful productions. SCC is also the producer of a 13 episode popular tele-serial “Mysore composers” that was directed by Nagamani, telecast on Doordarshan’s national network. In all the above productions, young and upcoming artists are trained to sing in synchronized harmony along with fine blend of melody. They are groomed to sing both as enhancers of group music as well as solo performers with high level manodharma sangeetha.

Name: 17000 Ft Foundation
Major_Activities1: Mrs Suhata sahu, Founder, was awarded Nari Shakti Puraskar by the President of India on 8th March 2016, for her outstanding work in remote areas of Ladakh region on improvement of schools and livelihood of people there. Important projects carried out are: 1.MapMySchool@17000ft: Geomapping all schools in Leh and Kargil to enable connect all stake holders & tourists to visit the remote schools and hamllets which were so far ignored. 2.Youtang Project:- Improving the libraries ,infrastructure and play grounds in schools. Teachers are also trained. 3.Voluntourist@17000ft: Facilitate tourist to visit and connect with schools, people in remote hamlets, thus increasing awareness about those places to tourists. This also increases exposure of local people with outside world and improves livelihood due to tourist spending. Major impact as on Dec 2015: 1. All 960 schools in Leh and Ladakh are geo mapped. 2.100 schools in Leh are on full time support and monitoring through MIS and automation. 3.Library set up in 100 schools in Leh. 4.Class room infrastructure and play ground set up in 22 schools. 5.21000 story books translated to Bhoti language distributed to 370 schools. 6.900 teachers in Leh trained in collaboration with DIET, Leh. 7. 190 voluntourists sent to visit schools and hamlets to connect with people in remote Ladakh.

Name: All India Pingalwara Charitable Society
Major_Activities1: a) Looking after 1714 inmates which include destitute children, sick, disabled, mentally challenged and old men and women. These inmates are accommodated in branches of Pingalwara at Amritsar, Pandori, Goindwal, Jalandhar, Sangrur and Palsora (Chandigarh). b) Free medicines to the poor and needy people. c) Free help (Tricycles etc) to the handicapped. d) Medical and material aid to the victims of natural calamities. e) Artificial Limbs are provided free of cost to all needy person upto August, 2015 a total of 6738 artificial limbs have been fitted. f) Physiotherapy centre for indoors Patients. g) A home for the Senior Citizen at Sangrur & Manawala. h) A well equipped Ultrasound Centre for needy patients. i) A state of Art Operation Theatre for Surgery of Ear including Cochlear Implant at Manawala Complex, Amritsar. a) Bhagat Puran Singh Adarsh School at Manawala. Free education (including uniform and books) is provided to the wards of under privileged sections of the society. It has 682 students on its rolls. b) Bhagat Puran Singh School for the Deaf Children at Manawala. It has 103 students. c) Bhagat Puran Singh School of Special Education. The school caters for the mentally and physically challenged educable inmates of the Pingalwara. 140 children get individual attention, care and love here. d) Bhagat Puran Singh Adarsh High School for the poor children of the Quadian area. This school is situated at Buttar Kalan and provides free education to 360 students. e) Provide free books and stationery to the poor and needy students. f) Two of our special children Dolly & Shallu have won medals in World Summer Special Olympics held at Los Angeles, USA during July-Aug, 2015 a) Vigorous drive to plant trees every year. b) Maintenance of a nursery to provide free saplings. Every year over 60,000 saplings are distributed as a part of the tree plantation drive. c) Distribution of free literature on various environmental issues. d) Natural Farming (Pesticide and chemical fertilizer free cultivation of crops). e) Environment March in Amritsar Town in August, 2014. a) Rights of Persons with Disabilties-2006 b) Seminar on Ill Effects of Pesticides on Health-2006 c) Workshop on Natural Farming-2006 d) Seminar on AIDS Awareness-2007 e) Bhagat Puran Singh Memorial Seminar “Ecological Challenges and Social Responsibilities”-2008 f) Gift of Sight Camp- Dec., 2008 g) CME on Rehabilitation of the Deaf & Free Check Up Camp – Oct., 2009 h) Live Cochlear Implant Surgery and CME –Nov., 2010 i) Seminar on Autism – Feb., 2012 j) CME on Rehabilitation of Deaf and Free Check-up Camp – Feb., 2013 k) Seminar on ROKO CANCER – 2nd August, 2013 and 2nd August, 2014. a) Free distribution of literature on Religious, medical, social, ethical and environmental issues. b) Printing & free distribution of literature on issues such as living habits, drugs, health, positive thinking aspects which improves quality of life.

alternatives in the following constituencies Share croppers traditional crafts women fisher women adolescent girls and girl children and women engaged in saving and credit street vendors and home based workers We were first to work with adolescent girl We have developed programmes in healthy communities reproductive and child health adolescent reproductive and sexual health and door step education for adolescent girl barefoot marketers and issues like female feticide infanticide We were first to start the concept of Balika Kishori Chetna kendra to provide life skill education to adolescent girls and boys which has several cases resulted in raising the ege of marriage weddings without dowry We have developed modules on reproductive and child health and adolescent reproductive and sexual health and for rural adolescent which has been proved very useful for the social activists working on grassroot Nari nidhi has done massive campaign on polio eradication initiative in 3 district of bihar with the support of Unicef WHO District Health Department Project concern international Nari nidhi has done a study on situational analysis of universal birth registration and child labor We are working with 500 adolescent girls and boys on family life education and prevention of HIV AIDS We are also implemented RCH and prevention of HIV AIDS activities through our SHG members and our well skilled project staffs in five district of bihar namely Jehanabad Patna Siwan Muzaffarpur and Samastipur We have also recognized by various foreign donors Project concern international Plan india Geneva Global Rural India Supporting Trust and The Hans foundation Nari Nidhi has formed 15 Kishori groups as a peer educator to spread awareness of community people and out of school youths regarding health and hygiene life skill education More than 500 SHG benefited by thrift and credit programme SHG federation established 645 children enrolled in primary schools 559 children are Childrens are thought vocational traing like card making, candle making, paper bag making, fabric printing etc. childrens are being groomed and tought so that they can be part of main stream societyin future. even childrens with minor disabilities are sent to normal schools after sucessful treament and management in Asha school. the childrens of this school has participated in punjab special olympics in recent years and has won medals in various events.

Name: ALIG Educational and Welfare Society
Major_Activities1: Under child sponsorship program, ALIG is sponsoring the education of more than 125 children. Other than that it has trained more than 1500 women in stitching, embroidery and computer literacy. Under the health project, it is catering for 2634 adolescents (boys and Girls) in seven villages of east singhbhum district. Under vocational training program, it has reached more than 400 students and trained them in English and communication skills. Other than that it is also working closely with the government schools for English Leaning Enhancement program and targeting more than 1000 children in five schools. It has well equipped training center for women and girls for Stitching, embroidery, beautician and computer classes. It also has 9 resource centers, which is meant for the girls and boys between 12-19 years.

Name: Nehru Vikas Manav Samiti
Major_Activities1: On Going Activities - Up to Secondary education for 1080 children through our one Secondary School and one upper Primary school, recognized from Rajasthan State Govt. Our organization conducts a Health and sanitation awareness programme in Twenty five villages. Under Vocational rehabilitation program for fifty women’s organization tailoring teaching cum Income generating program at own head quarter. Organise the camps for creating awareness in the field of maternal and child care. Organise the environmental conservation camps, Cycle-relies and Seminar Board and with the Health of Central Pollution control Board New Delhi. Our organization conduct a chronicle disease HIV/ AIDS, Censer, Diabetes, awareness Programme in Villages of Kaman Block. Conduct a campaign for SAFE AND CLEEAN DRINKING WATER between Rural people and explain to them importance of clean and safe drinking water and also explain the negative and bed effects of the dirty and poolside drinking Water. Previous Activities In the Field of welfare – Organize the Women Awareness camp with the financial help of Rajasthan state Social Welfare Advisory Board. For providing Women employment opportunities, organization conducted a Women sewing training cum production centre with financial help of the CAPART New Delhi under D.W.C.R.A. Scheme. In the Field of Sanitation- To improve the rural environment, the organization constructed Three Hundred Low Cost Latrines with the help of CAPART, New Delhi. In the field of Clean Drinking Water supply- For this purpose organization conducted awareness camps on safe drinking Water and installed hand Pumps with financial help of CAPART New Delhi. The organization constructed Low Cost Houses for the SC/ST Community help of CAPART.

Name: Punar Jagaran Samiti
Major_Activities1: Punarjagaran Samiti was established on 24/10/1994 under Registrar chits and funds, Allahabad, UP vide Registration no. 575/94-95. This organization worked on various social issues like Family planning, projects on upliftment of Scheduled caste and minorities, Upliftment of differently abled people, Projects related to health and sanitation, Blood donation, etc. Its major achievements and activities includes the Cultural activities including “Sanskritik Mohatsav, 1996- a Severn day cultural event”. The organization has acclaimed huge respect in the society for its pioneer step in girl’s education in the district. The organization remain in force till 24/10/2014 till it got annexed along with all its responsibilities and property by the new trust named Punar Jagaran samiti Trust (registered on 9/10/2014). Presently The organization is managing the below mentioned educational institutes in Pratapgarh district: 1½ Saket Shiksha Niketan ¼Recognized by Basic education board, UP) Est: 1996 2½ Saket Girl’s Junior High School ¼Recognized by Basic education board, UP) Est: 1997 3½ Saket Girl’s Inter College: Hindi Medium ¼Recognized by UP Intermediate Education board, Allahabad) Est: 1997 4½ Saket Girl’s Inter College: Hindi Medium ¼Recognized by UP Intermediate Education board, Allahabad) Est: 2016 5½ Saket Industrial training center ¼Recognized by NCVT, New Delhi) Est: 1998 6½ Saket Girl’s P.G. College ¼Recognized by RMLAU, Faizabad) Est: 2005 7½ Saket Girl’s Teacher’s Training Institute ¼Recognized by NCTE, Jaipur) Est: 2010 Saket Girl’s P.G. College and Institute of Teachers Training is accredited by NAAC with “B” grade. Through various thematic cultural events Saket family has been working on various social and cultural issues since 1996. The list of various themes includes “Beti Bachao, beti padhao”, “Women Empowerment”, “The development of Hindi language”, “Incarnation of Vishnu Dashavtar”, “Dances of earth”, “Origin of Ganges”. Saket got widely appraised by whole society and all major news agencies of the district for the noble initiatives it has been taking from time to time. Saket actively participated in Election awareness programs and secured first position for the same. The institute has emerged as first educational institute to come up with water conversation and preservation schemes. The vehicles owned by the institute are highly secured and monitored through the latest technology and vehicle Tracking systems. The campus is fully Wifi Enabled and CCTV camera secured. The institute is equipped with modern laboratories, e library, well equipped gymnasium and sports facilities and other modern necessities. Numerous seminars and workshops have been conducted by the institute on varied issues like target of education, Teacher’s Education, New Education policy etc. The organization has worked with its extended team named “We Want Change” in Delhi on various social and cultural issues including, women education, child education, slum area development. Some of its projects got widely acclaimed by all major news agencies and government agencies. WWC’s project on Election awareness in 2014 got awarded by various government agencies including the Election Commission.

Major_Activities1: 1. JK Samaj Kalyan Kendra was established iin May 1980 with the noble mission of helping and empowering the disabled poor children, particularly the hearing and speech impaired girls and boys of school going age through formal education and vocational training. 2. A Pre Primary School for Deaf and Dumb was inaugurated on 19 April 1981 in a small rented accomodation in a temple complex at Jammu to spearhead the main objective of the Organization. 3. This small school was raised to Secondary School level in stages in 1995-96 and Higher Secondary School level in 2012-13 and housed in a spacious 3-storey Evacuee Property Building got allotted on rent basis from J and K Govt in 1985. 4. The school is named as J&K Samaj Kalyan Kendra Higher Secondary School For Hearing Handicapped with current strength of 102 students, 40 girls and 62 boys 5. The School is recognized by Govt. Of J and K and affiliated to Board of School Education Jammu. 6. It is the only such Institute in J and K State meant exclusively for HH category of Differently Abled children. 7. Education and Vocational Training in the School is totally FREE. 8. The resources for running the School are generated mainly through public donations with some grant-in-aid received from Social Welfare Deptt of J and K Govt. 9. Till date, more than 400 pass out students of SKK School have been provided educational and vocational training in various trades for their economic rehabilitation. 5 of our ex-students have entered into the Govt. service while most of others have established their own business.Some have got jobs in private sector. 10. The Organization has distributed more than 500 hearing aids through various Medical Health Camps organized in the rural areas. Name: Asha Community Health and Development Society
Major_Activities1: Asha with its community based holistic development activities have progressively impacted the lives of slum dwellers since its inception. Today, immeasurable improvements in physical, social and socio economic conditions of slum dwellers are evident from the fact that community members are actively promoting and supporting the programmes. In its 28 years of existence, Asha has developed a comprehensive model of service delivery where Healthcare services are combined with other Social Determinants in order to bring about comprehensive transformation. Currently Asha is working in 71 slums across Delhi covering a population of more than 5 Lakhs. The Healthcare Services provided by Asha is widely recognized by institutions across the world for efficiency, impact and quality. Asha has trained women working in slums who are engaged as Community Health Volunteers. They regularly visit and monitor the health of communities particularly pregnant women, children under five, elderly and T.B. patients. Through committed efforts by Asha, almost 100% deliveries across slums have been institutional or by the help of trained professionals. Infant mortality rates and Maternal Mortality rates have reduced significantly. Asha communities are adequately manned by doctors, nurses and paramedical staff. In addition, mobile health clinics cater to areas which do not have health centres. For advanced Healthcare and Diagnostics, Asha Polyclinic is well equipped with sophisticated laboratory, X-ray, ECG, Ultrasound and other diagnostic facilities. CHVs are provided regular trainings which are time to time supplemented by Refresher trainings. Asha has developed a Comprehensive Education Programme where final year school students are chosen and provided thorough training in Academic, Behavioural and Psychological aspects so that they excel in their chosen fields and are ready to pursue higher education. There are English Literacy and Computer courses to provide these much needed skills to students. Internship programmes for Final year students and Graduates have recorded impressive growths and students across Asha slums have been placed in MNCs as well as top Indian corporates. This has been a huge boost to their careers. Moreover, Mentorship programme undertaken by Asha has been a huge success with a professional Mentor assigned to each student who provide counselling, guidance and advice to add cutting edge to the professional career of students. Empowerment programmes have been the bedrock of Ashas Development Interventions. Bal Mandal and Mahila Mandal are the forums for discussion and solving Community issues relating to Health, Sanitation, Infrastructure, Education, Public Health and also for raising Awareness and Sensitization. These forums have also increased the Collective Bargaining power of slum dwellers. Finally, Financial Inclusion programme across slums have facilitated economic independence and empowerment and have helped many slum dwellers to earn a living and support their familys needs.

Name: Tamilnadu Pengal Nala Sangam
Major_Activities1: Tamil Nadu Pengal Nala Sangam, Started in 1954 is a welfare organization working for the upliftment of disadvantaged women and children. The Sangam run by a small team of dedicated women from its inception has a number of service activities to its credit. Its aims and objectives centres around the upliftment of poor and needy girl children and deserted old women both economically and socially. Kamalamma Balakrishnan Old Age Home accommodates more than fifty elderly women, all above 60 years of age. To it is associated a well equipped hospice ready to take care of the sick poor women. Another recently added unit, adjacent to the Old Age Home is Palliative Care Unit with all modern facilities to admit terminally sick patients. The objective is to help them to live without pain in their last stage. The unit for the poor girl children, named Destitute Children Home consists of 150 inmates enjoying free boarding and lodging. They are attending either M.M. Primary School or Annai Hr.Sec.School, both units of Annai Ashram. The schools together has a strength of nearly 1000 boys and girls, children of daily wage earners. For tiny tots ranging 0-6 of below poverty line families we have Rajiv Gandhi National Crèche Scheme where 150 children have their pre-primary training. The Sangam also runs a mini computer centre with 12 computers and a tailoring unit. Children above 15 are given free coaching in these two job oriented sections. One of the projects undertaken by the Sangam was sponsored by Womankind World Wide London to bring about all round personality Development in women. The Institution has won the prestigious The Best Institution Award in 1997 from Government of Tamilnadu. In addition to the award of 1997, the Sangam won the Best Institution Award in 2008 from Tamil Nadu Government, for the best maintenance of our Old Age Home. Anyone and everyone who steps into the portals of the Sangam has only words of appreciation for the work that is going on in the Campus. The project now the Sangam envisages is to increase inmates of our Kamalamma Balakrishnan Old Age Home to one hundred.

Name: Sonchirayia Loak Sangeet Utthan Samiti
Major_Activities1: Son Chirayia is a non profit apolitical organization to propagate and preserve the folk art forms of India under the able guidance of Padmabhushan Vidushi Girija Devi ji and renowned folk singer and artist Smt Malini Awasthi. We are four years old organization and have conducted grand shows showcasing the traditional folk art forms from Awadh, Bhojpur, Banaras, Bundelkhand, Braj etc. We at Son Chirayia believe that folk music of most part of India has untapped potential which is yet to get proper exposure in the national capital. Folk art forms of India represent the social and cultural fabric of India in its original color and has numerous outstanding folk artists who need to be given proper stage and exposure. Son Chirayia has been promoting several folk art forms like ‘Birha’, ‘Alha’, ‘Dhobia’, ‘Raai’, ‘Pai-danda’, ‘Hardaul’, ‘Rasiya’, ‘Charkula’, ‘Kajari’, ‘Fagua’, ‘Nautanki’, ‘Karma’, ‘Nirgun’, and traditional wedding songs.

Name: Sports and Education Promotion Trust
Major_Activities1: Sports & Education Promotion Trust (SEPT) was established to promote sports development in India with focus on football. Started in 2004 and based in Calicut, the trust has set up football training centres called “football nurseries” spread across 13 districts and Mahe. Majority of these centres are located in rural areas, one is in a tribal region. Given the huge potential in the tribal areas of Kerala which largely goes untapped due to financial constraints and lack of adequate sports infrastructure for the people of such area to pursue the game, the thrust of the initiative is on spotting and nurturing talent in rural parts of the country. Currently, SEPT has soccer nurseries in 51 centres . These include rural region, urban region, a tribal region and coastal region. Some of the major achievements are: • 2 boys represented India (Under- 14 )at the AFC Championships 2010 in Iran. • Finished 5th in the prestigious Kokkola Cup in Finland – July 2007. ( 36 teams from various countries like England, Russia, Estonia, Finland, Sweden, Ukraine, Norway participated) • Winner of the Dalecarlia Cup , Sweden ( U-11), July 2007 • Invited twice by the All India Football Federation (AIFF) to showcase our football trainees from all centers.SEPT boys demonstrated their skills on 18/04/2005 at Calicut Stadium before the ONGC National Football League match between SBT & Mahindra United and on 28/05/2008, during interval of the ONGC Super Cup match between Sporting Goa & Dempo Sports Club • Received appreciation from the Malaysian National U-10 coach, Mr. Andy & AFC Guest Relations Officer, Mr. Nama about excellent working of the SEPT initiative • Captain & Vice-captain of Kerala State Football team (U -13) were SEPT boys, in 2009. • 7 boys represented Kerala State Football team, 2009 • Captains of Wayanad, Kozhikode & Malappuram District teams (U-13),2009 , were SEPT boys. • 26 boys represented their respective districts in the State (U-13) Football Championships 2009.

Name: NEW MAHARASHTRA SHIKSHAN SANSTHA TIKKEWADI
Major_Activities1: NEW MAHARASHTRA SHIKSHAN SANSTHA, TIKKEWADI TAL: BHUARGAD, DIST :KOLHAPUR, PIN : 416209. ABOUT US In 27 March 1996 taking reference from “Mother Teresa, Karmveer Bhaurao Patil & Helen Keler” Mr. Shivaji Rajaram Patil established New Maharashtra Shikshan Sanstha in rural area such as Bhudargud and Radhanagari Talukas and opening the door of free Education for Poor, Backword, Handicapped, Mentally Retarded & Orphan Children’s. His wife Mrs. Akkatai Patil gave a very important support in this Social & Education Work. They started Tikkewadi Highschool for the Education of 103 Poor, Backward & Orphan Children’s in 1999. After that in 4 march 2007 they started “Jeevan Shikshan Matimand Vidyalay (Nivasi)” for 55 Handicapped Mentally Retarded Children’s. Mr. Patil made his house as a hostel with free facilities for Mentally Retarded Children’s. Mentally Retarded Children’s are probably one of the most neglected sections of society. It is the first of its kind of School in Bhudargad Taluka. They were united in their belief that given proper guidance & training, their children can maximize their potential & integrate themselves with society in general. All the activities are conducted under the guidance of special educators. In this way that organizations try to work in the field of social & education.

Name: BHAVNAGAR BLOOD BANK
Major_Activities1: One of the greatest seers of the ancient India and the great Maharshi Shushtrut lays great emphasis on Blood and defines it as Life itself. He has also attributed bodys origin, sustenance and its various facets to Blood. Bhavnagar Blood Ban k is one of the major NGOs in western coast of India. The Blood Bank was established on 4th December, 1983. Bhavnagar has been known for Blood Donation movement since Second World War and Bhavnagar Blood Bank was one of the first scientifically established Blood Bank as per the guidelines framed by Food and Drugs Rules. Our mission is to have safe blood, through voluntary blood donor motivation movement. So far, we have distributed nearly 2,82,597 units of blood. About 1969 Blood Donation Mobile Camps have been organized by us. About - thalassemia children are being taken care by our voluntary Blood Donation movement. We also have blood Component Unit. We have with us dedicated team of people, who are not only committed for the cause of Blood Bank but also for intensive social service inputs. We have acquired a new premises at Sardarnagar Shopping complex at the cost of Rs. 40,000,00 and we need to have Rs.20,000,00 for further infrastructure activities. We appeal to help us to raise R. 50,000,00 for capital expenditure. We are sure that you should generously donate for this noble cause. The donation is exempted under I.T. Act 80-G. Apart form Blood Banking, our Organization is working in the area of HIV / AIDS for general public, migrant workers at Alang Ship Breaking Yard and through adolescent youth education we have covered 66 school for AIDS awareness. We are designated as Regional Blood Bank Center by Gujarat Government and we are supplying blood to Mahuva, Shihor, Dhandhuka, Palitana and Gadhada Taluka.

Name: PRAVARA INSTITUTE OF MEDICAL SCIENCES
Major_Activities1: Pravara Institute of Medical Sciences (PIMS) - established in 2001, promoted by PMT. PIMS - the only rural medical university in India, pioneered in socially meaningful, community oriented medical and allied health sciences education. PIMS attained the status of Deemed University in 2003 under section 3 of UGC Act 1956 of Govt of India. PIMS - DU was accredited by NAAC with CGPA of 2.57 on 4.00 Point Scale at B grade valid up to September 15, 2016. ACTIVITIES PIMS – Deemed University has promoted the following network of medical education & Research Organizations and Primary to Tertiary level Hospitals 1. 1250 bedded multi-specialty Pravara Rural Teaching Hospital, Loni - 1976, 2. Rural Medical College, Loni – 1984 3. School of Nursing, Loni – 1986 4. Rural Dental College & Hospital, Loni – 1989 5. College of Physiotherapy & Rehabilitation Centre, Loni -1991 6. Rural Cancer Treatment & Research Centre, Loni – 1997 7. College of Nursing, Loni - 2001 8. Centre for Biotechnology, Loni – 2001 9. Centre for Social Medicine, Loni – 2001 10. College of Ayurveda, Shevgaon – 2005 11. School of Nursing, Shevgaon – 2008 The above constituent institutions of PIMS University, currently offers 6 Bachelor’s (MBBS, BDS, BPhT, BSc (Nursing), BAMS, BSc (Med. Biotech)), 41 Master’s degree and diploma (M.D/M.S, MDS, M.Ph.T, M.Sc (Nursing), MSc (Biotech), MBA (Bioscience Mgt.), MSc (Pre-clinical & Para-clinical) MSc (Public Health), MSW (Medical)), 20 Doctoral, and 11 diploma and certificate programs in medicine, dentistry, nursing, physiotherapy, medical biotechnology, social medicine/health, bio-science management, ayurveda and other para-medical sciences. The PIMS University has three Campuses. Its main campus located in Loni village, has been developed as a self sufficient township with all modern amenities for supporting 3500 students, staff/faculty and their families, to live, work and study, on a 130 acre lush green, environmental friendly, pollution free atmosphere. The other two campuses are located in about 100 Kms away, at Sinner (Nashik District) for Bioscience Management and Shevgaon (Ahmednagar district) for Ayurved College & Nursing School. ACHIEVEMENTS The medical care, academic, research, and extension programs and projects implemented by Pravara Institute of Medical Sciences - Loni, has shown its sustainable impact, over a period of time, at local, state, national and international level in improving the health status of the people of rural and urban slums, providing well trained medical and para-medical man power to reduce the urban-rural gap, demystify medicine to bring positive behavioural changes for health promotion in the community at large and convincing people that “health is their own hands”. The health indicators like CBR (12.8 per 1000 population), CDR (4.1 per 1000 population), IMR (18 per 1000 live births), MMR (130 per 1 lakh live births), Institutional deliveries (85%) etc of the people of the remote rural, tribal and urban slum areas being served by the Model are far ahead of the District, State and National averages. The man power trained by the Model is well equipped and has been serving in both rural areas as well as super-specialty hospitals in metropolitan cities in India and abroad.

Name: Khasi Jaintia Presbyterian Assembly Socio Economic Life development Association
Major_Activities1: KHASI JAINTIA PRESBYTERIAN ASSEMBLY, SOCIO ECONOMIC LIFE DEVELOPMENT The Khasi Jaintia Presbyterian Assembly Social Life Development Association (SELDA) is an important branch of the Khasi Jaintia Presbyterian Assembly (formerly the KJP Synod) which is one of the church bodies in the North Eastern Region of India with a total membership of more than 4 lakhs. SELDA has been registered as an NGO since 1974 under the Societies Registration Act XXI of 1860. As a non profit, non-Government Organization of the KJP Assembly, working towards the all round development of the economic and social life of the People residing within the Districts of East and West Khasi Hills, Jaintia Hills and Ri Bhoi of Meghalaya. VISION’21 : That everyone, irrespective of color creed and gender shall have fullness of life through a holistic approach for Human Development which encompasses promoting the physical, spiritual, intellectual, social and emotional aspects of a person and the evolution of a personality nourished by the grace of God through Jesus Christ. MISSION ’21: Believing that the promotion of Health Education and Moral values are the sinews that shall sustain a healthy and vibrant Society, it shall be the aim of SELDA to establish the above in all spheres of activities that it undertaking. The KJP Assembly through the SELDA shall endeavor to empower and capacitate the communities it works with, especially the women of the region and to create awareness in the fields of sound healthcare and nutrition; on issues of sustainable livelihoods on the importance of basic education for all; and in the importance of people seeing themselves as equal partners and stakeholders in the process of development. It is also committees towards ushering in the awareness and understanding among the people of the Region and the State of Meghalaya that overall development must lead to just peace (shalom). OBJECTIVES To Promote a spirit of self help in in maintaining of drinking water, play grounds etc… promote thrift and temperance habits among the people to Educate the people in hygienic living and provide recreation for them, providing for holding exhibitions, conference and seminars calculated to advance the cause of education – general, professional, technical, social, religious or moral promote arts, music , literature , games and to foster love for traditions customs and cultures of the Khasi Jaintia. Acquire by purchase and to receive any gift whether money, movable or immovable property, donations, stocks shares, etc… with a view to fulfill the objects of the Associations. The Associations liaison with any Government or local Authority or other public or private bodies for the receipts of grants allowances, right concession and privileges as may be desirable to carry out the objects of the Association. The Association has take a appropriate steps for working in the field of drug abuse prevention/prohibition Work for empowering women, youth and the marginalized. ACTIVITIES OF KHASI JAINTIA PRESBYTERIAN ASSEMBLY SOCIO ECONOMIC LIFE DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION The KJP Assembly SELDA operating within a region and social milieu that is undergoing rapid social changes, SELDA has ventured into different areas of social Welfare works and economic empowerment activities 1. Child Welfare – With regards to the Child Welfare the KJP Assembly SELDA run two homes one for boys and the other for girls. The A.W Thomas Girls Home at Jaiaw Lumsyntiew, and the William Lewis Boys Home at Mawphlang East Khasi Hills District. The girls home was established in the year 1981 and boys in 2005, presently the number of boys in the home is 52 and the girls 42. The Association provide Cares and Protections to those uncared for children turned orphans for a number of reasons. These are children who have lost either one of their parents or both on account of premature death due to a number of reasons. These are also children abandoned by their parents after childbirth or whose fathers are in denial mode and without identity. The aims and objectives of this project is to come to the rescue of the girl child who is abandoned and left to starve. Secondly, the project that was launched to bring in the orphan boys & girl does not end in providing nutritious food and proper shelter. The children are imparted training and groomed to be responsible citizens As they are released from the home on attaining the age of 18, they would be able to stand on their feet and ready for gainful employment. Thirdly, the orphans are subsequently assets of the state and the nation as they attain the age of majority. They continue to live as dignified citizens having been brought up in an atmosphere of love and compassion under trained supervisors. Both these is under the supervision of the Home Superintendent. BRIEF ACCOUNT OF THE WORK DONE IN BY A.W. THOMAS GIRLS’ HOME AT JAIAW LUM SYNTIEW, SHILLONG (i) Get Together of both the Boys’ from Mawphlang and Girls’ from Jaiaw on December 2015. (ii) Participated on Pre-Christmas celebration held at St Mary’s College & at State Central Library. (iii) Outing to Don Bosco Museum, Mawlai. (iv) Health Camp organized by Paramedical in collaboration with the Medical Officers from NEIGRIHMS and KJP Jowai Staffs. (v) Cleaning Drive (vi) A Special Song given during a programmme at Shillong Club organized by Ieng Rasong Sports Social & Cultural Club. (vii) Kitchen Gardening programme by the children under the supervision of the staff (viii) Organizing Birthday Parties for every children. (ix) Life skill programme on substance abuse, cleanliness, cognitive thinking and adolescent stage. (x) Attending a Health Camp organized by the Jaiaw Urban Health Centre. (xi) Celebration of Deworming Day Organized by the Paramedical together with the Staff (xii) Celebration of Urban Health Nutrition Day. (xiii) Awareness programmes on Child Rights. (xiv) Health teachings and Demonstrations given on personal Hygiene, Exercise, Nutrition, Hand Washing. (xv) Participating in a skit on a Topic “Teens age Pregnancy”. Brief Report of The A W Thomas Girls’ Home, Jaiaw Lumsyntiew During the period the girls at the A W Thomas Girls’ Home, Jaiaw Lumsyntiew Shillong were imparted training in computer and sewing. These training programmes are sponsored by individuals as well as the Khasi Jaintia Presbyterian Assembly. The children displayed keen interest in the training programmes and are aware that these skills will enhance their employability in the future. In the field of health care, two camps have been organized by the Staff and the Urban Health Centre. A deworming day was also organized by the staff to all the girls housed at the centre. The girls showed keen interest in their studies. Their performance indicates a great improvement. A total of 15 girls cleared their school leaving examination under MBOSE. WOMEN WELFARE: - A Working Women’ Hostel established since 1986, serves the low income group who can hardly afford to pay exorbitant rent in private houses in Shillong. They come from an interior of East and west Khasi Hills, Jaintia Hills and Ri Bhoi Districts of Meghalaya besides other ethnic group from outside state , viz Mizos, Nagas etc. The Hostel which extends its services on a no profit no loss basis, i.e charging very nominal rates, can accommodate upto 85 – 90 inmates and strict discipline is maintained under the supervision of a Hostel Warden. It is located at Mission Compound. 3. PREVENTION OF DRUG ABUSE AND ALCOHOLISM: - Drug addiction has become global phenomenon. At the same time, alcoholism is also a rampant in our State. As such, to combat this menace, a Counselling Centre known as NEW HOPE DE- Addiction cum Counselling Centre at Central Ward, Shillong. The Centre has 15 beds and is giving free treatment to chemical dependent who come and register themselves for counselling, awareness and rehabilitation . The Centre also run an HIV/AIDS cell in the centre with a full Field Worker to conduct awareness programmes on the basics of HIV/AIDS and preventives measures. The centre has also a branch mainly focus to Female Sex Worker (FSW) infected with HIV/AIDS known as SAINDUR THYMMAI, at Nongpoh Ri Bhoi District. As we look to the Child welfare the girls home needs a kitchen to be extended as the old one is very congested and as for the boys need a repairing repainting of the home and many more. The New Hope De-addiction center need a building to be newly constructed. THE KJP ASSEMBLY SELDA NEED FUNDS FOR THE PROJECTS Child Care – The AW. Thomas Girls Home are in much need of a proper kitchen as the present kitchen are congested, Staff quarters the home are run by the Home Superintendent no proper staff quarter for them, proper Fencing the home are in much needs for security of the home and Extension of building. The William Lewis Boys Home need a proper drinking water storage, Extension of building Fencing. Name: NAI SOCH EK BADLAV
Major_Activities1: Mission: A society based on legitimate rights, equity, justice, honesty, social sensitivity and a culture of service in which all are self-reliant. A society focused on better management of natural resources & waste management, create public awareness about potential benefits & perceived risks of biotechnology intervention in sustainable development & utilization of natural resources, common characteristics of health system, improvement in quality of life, importance of waste disposal, water resource development, tree plantation, promote sports & cultural activities, to promote & encourage schemes for making young generation interested in adventure activity, encourage the use of unconventional source of energy, improvement in the quality of food produced & consumed, spreading awareness about benefits of education with development of sports & physical activities, creating awareness about importance of trained driving, constructing old age homes & orphanages, promoting socio-economic, educational & employment programs for the welfare & development of women, youth & children, promote training centres for human resource development, promote cottage industry, health & sanitation program, promote yoga & naturopathy, creating employment opportunity, promoting high yield agriculture in less expenditure, provide training & facilities to handicapped, finding & implementing ways of eradicating social evils. Nai soch-ek badlav focus and sole reason for existence is the child, especially the girl child, street child and disabled child. The family of the child is the medium through which the development takes place. Organisation and sensitisation of the community is the approach through which empowerment, capacity building and social transformation are attempted. Vision: We at Nai soch-ek badlav commit ourselves - To identify and work alongside the economically and socially deprived, the physically and mentally challenged - starting with children, so that they become educated, skilled and aware. Enable them to be self-reliant and enjoy a healthy, dignified and sustainable quality of life And to that end, act as a resource to and collaborate with other agencies - governmental or non-governmental, as well as suitably intervene in policy formulation.

Name: PATHWAY CENTRE FOR REHABILITATION AND EDUCATION FOR MENTALLY RETARDED A Unit of DR D M C TRUST
Major_Activities1: Dr. Dathu Rao Memorial Charitable Trust, Pathway Centre for Rehabilitation and Education of the Mentally Retarded, Chennai, India, is a voluntary, charitable, non-profit organization established in the year 1975. Its purpose is to provide comprehensive care and educational opportunities for mentally handicapped children. Pathway is founded on the philosophy that every individual should be given the opportunity to utilize their potential in order to live with dignity and self respect, regardless of mental or physical limitations. Today over 100 children receive full and FREE care at the live-in facility, while another 300 children are seen on daily basis for rehabilitation and educational programs. During the last 40 years Pathway has served more than 40000 children and adults with various problems and disabilities. Pathway has been commended by the state government as well as the union government for its services to the disabled over these years. It has received considerable awards PAMELA MARTINEZ/PATHWAY Agro farm for children named after its donor is located in a large 65 acre agro farm in Agili, Madhuranthakam Taluk, Kancheepuram District. This agro farm houses a large orphanage to house more than 200 children, a well organized and well run English medium Matriculation Residential school, recognized by the Directorate of Matriculation Schools, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The children are offered high class facilities such as swimming, yoga, music, good recreational facilities, quality education, total medical care. A HOSPITAL ON WHEELS is also run from this facility serving a large number of poor villagers around the Agro farm. SABIN CENTRE FOR EDUCATION AND REHABILITATION OF THE DISABLED was dedicated in November 2009 and has been serving children, adolescents and adults with mental retardation, cerebral palsy, autism and related dysfunctions. This centre has the services of professional and other staff. As a part of Sabin Centre for Disabled the organization has initiated outreach programme to serve disabled in a couple of locations in nearby villages.

Name: Human Welfare Organisation
Major_Activities1: Human Welfare Organisation is a social development organisation formed by like minded people engaged in the social development sector. The organisation has been established with an aim to help and supports the underprivileged and not so exposes rural people to empower them and bring into justice, equity, freedom, and solidarity so as to demands their rights. The organization has focus on various aspects to promote Rural education, vocational training, Energy security and rural electrification, EcoTourism, Health, Human rights, environment, age care and other development work of rural communities. Our Organization is one established name in Skill Development / Vocational Training in the industrial belt of eastern India dominated by economically poor, primarily tribal population. High quality teaching, personal attention on personality development, fully valid and valuable certifications and assured placement at course end at lowest possible fess is hall-mark of our delivery system. Our efforts have yielded into skill-growth and employment in organized sector for good number of youths mainly from underprivileged category. Vision To bring up a new generation of children, young women youthfully equipped with education potential to generate employment with quality and construction imagination. Our organization realizes that in all development process, women’s participation must be ensured and community involvement and active participation is essential for sustainability of the programmes and balanced development. Strategy The strategic planning for the organization is being done by the governing member. However, much earlier the organization has registered; the group has been started working with the people by visiting to the community, rural areas interacting with the people to learn more about problems exist and its cause and effect.

Name: RAJESWARY FOUNDATION
Major_Activities1: Palliative Care OP and Home Care Financial assistance is provided for- Travelling expenses to poor patients Who are under palliative care. The poor patients coming for the OP service are given travel allowance at the Rate of Rs.100 per Patient for every Visits. This is done to ensure that the continuous medication of the patients is not interrupted. Annadhaanam - is conducted as part of Out Patient service which happens on every Tuesday. The purpose is to bring ‘WE’ feeling among Patients, Volunteers and Staffmembers. All the Patients, their Family members, Volunteers and Staff members are served One Time Meals for free. Financial Assistance to Orphaned senior citizens.Financial Assistance to mentally retarded. Educational assistant to the children of poor patients and deceased patients.Financial Assistance to bed-ridden patients.Regular medical camps at various places. Awareness seminars & camps. Training to palliative care volunteers. Rehabilitation to patients and their Families. Team consisting of expert doctors, nurse, social workers and volunteers carry out daily house visits to treat the bed-ridden patients. The poor patients coming for the op are given travel allowance. This is done to ensure that the continuous medication of the patients is not interrupted. The patient requires a healthy diet along with the medicines. Hence monetary helps is also extended to patients from the under privileged strata. Student dependent on patients from poor economic background are given boom, stationary and monthly stipend. Monthly stipend extended to very old patients who cannot afford treatment from their own resources. Travel allowance provided to the patients of the palliative care OP for availing treatment facilities of Regional Cancer Centre(RCC), Sree Chitra Thirunal Institute for Medical Science & Technology, Govt. Medical college, and General hospital, Thiruvananthapuram. Monetary assistance to under privileged patients who have to spend large sums on medicines and lab tests. Monthly stipend to parents of those suffering from mental/physical deformities. Lab sample of bed-ridden patients collected from their residence if required. Nursing services like dressing and injection available to those in dire need. Rehabilitation assistance. In case of death of earning member, assistance is provided for the rehabilitation of the family as well as the education of the children Monthly medical camps, cancer detection camps and awareness campaigns are also organized with view of enhancing the physical and mental health of the society Eye check up camps organized and spectacles distributed free of cost to extreme poor sections. * Periodically seminars are organized in educational institutions with the assistance of experts, to develop sense of cleanliness, self -reliance, confidence, compassion and voluntariness amongst children. These programs also intend to lay stress on the importance of life style management in the contemporary society. Name: THE INSTITUTE OF SOCIAL RESEARCH AND APPLIED ANTHROPOLOGY
Major_Activities1: Facets of Activities of the Institute of Social Research and Applied Anthropology(ISRAA) The Institute of Social Research & Applied Anthropology had, since its inception in 1955 had been engaged in activities related to social welfare, research studies, action research, cultural promotion of indigenous population etc. in different parts of West Bengal and neighbouring states. Many great personalities like Prof. Nirmal Kumar Bose, Prof. Probodh Kumar Bhowmick, Dr. J.K. Bose, Prof. L.P. Vidyarthi, etc., to name a few, had been the principal source of inspiration and actions research in this organization. Till date it had conducted many academic research as well as action research with actual implementation concerning poverty alleviation, social awareness, capacity building and other livelihood improvement programmes. It has with its experts and staff, significant experience of evaluation and assessment related project execution in and urban development fronts. A. Action & Applied Research: 1. Since inception 8 Nos. of Research Projects on various issues related to Tribal Development livelihood programme etc. in general and Lodha, a primitive tribe West Bengal. was carried out by the staff and scholars of the institute. The projects were duly sponsored by Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Govt. of India. 2. During 2006-08 we executed a project entitled “Empowerment of Tribal Women through Batik Print: Training cum Production” sponsored by Dept. of Science & Technology, Govt. of India. New Delhi. As a part of the project we trained 90 tribal women belongs to various tribal communities in and around Bidisha. In view of their show interest we formed 9 SHG,s. Out of 9 Nos. of SHGs except 2 others are functioning. 3. One Research Fellow namely Dr. Monali Goswami who attached with our institute and carrying out her research work entitled “Nutritional Status among the mother & children of Bhumij of Orissa” funded by Indian Council of Social Science Research, New Delhi. 4. In the field of education we are running 3 Ashrama Hostels - 2 for Boys and 1 for Girls exclusively for Lodha children. Ashrama Hostel which is residential where free food and lodging facilities being provided to the inmates duly financed by BCW Dept, Govt. of West Bengal. It is to be mentioned here the first Ashrama Hostel in the state of west Bengal . 5. Our existing land and pond are being utilized for commercial purpose in view of generating our own resources for sustainability on one hand and the other it is being used for demonstration purposes by inviting the experts time to time from IIT, KGP as well as concerned Agriculture Dept, Govt. of West Bengal to transfer the need based technology to the tribal and non tribal people living side by side in and around Bidisha. 6. We organized Aloe-Vera training for the youth farmer of the locality. The training was imparted by the faculty of Agriculture and Food Engineering Dept. IIT. KGP. 7. We have installed Bio- gas unit and vermi- compost plant to impart training facilities to the local tribal youth to provide the means of sustainable livelihood to the local people in view of entrepreneur development of Tribal Folk. 8. Very recently the District Sericulture Board established a Tasar-cum-Mulberi cultivation, training-cum- Production Unit at our Institute for employment and income generation in Paschim Medinipur. B. Organising National & International Level Seminar Since inception our institute very successfully organized 36 Nos. National seminars and 3 NOs. of International Seminars duly sponsored by the agency like Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Indian Council of Social Science Science Research, New Delhi, Anthropological Survey of India, Cultural Research Institute, West Bengal etc. The 4th International Seminar will be held during December, 4th to 5th 2016. C. Publication We are publishing very regularly a journal namely “Man & Life” 2 issues Jan- June & July – Dec. We feel proud by expressing, since last 37 years this journal covering all the branches of social science being published regularly. Altogether total 20 Nos. of books are being published by our institute under the heading “Sparks from Bidisha” D. Revival of Tribal Art & Culture With the aim of revival of tribal art & culture our Institute organizes every year “ Navanna” Utsav where different tribal communities are to perform their various cultural events which aregradually decaying due to impact of modern mass- media and telecommunication causing the identity crisis among the indigenous communities. Our Institute is putting its endeavor to provide a platform where the missing tribal cultural traits are being staged and this happens to be the eye opener before younger generation of various communities as a source of motivations and challenges. E. Eco-museum is located at our institute. There is enough scope for the expansion and popularization of ecologically sensitive activities in village life in terms of promotions and rejections. F. Throughout the year, the students of Rural Development, Anthropology, Bengali, History, Sociology, Folklore etc. of different colleges and universities of West Bengal and out side the state are organizing their field camps and workshops at our institute.

Name: LIGHTS
Major_Activities1: About LIGHTS Learning in Geography, Humanities, Technology and Science (LIGHTS) is an NGO established in 2003 as a Society registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860. LIGHTS aims to work as a research unit and help create documents and relevant material useful for NGOs and community based organisations in the field of environment and development of India; to be an outreach unit to organize workshops and seminars among stakeholders in several environment and development related activities; to undertake field studies in consultation with Geography and You (G’nY) and Iris Publication, for publication in the before mentioned magazine; promoting education for the girl child living in remote and far flung areas, especially those who are unable to pursue high school education due to poor income of parents, by providing scholarships to them; providing help and assistance to rehabilitate old and retired people; create environmental awareness for better living and circulate free material towards the same; and, creation of a network of teachers/trainers all over the country/world to facilitate interaction for environment related issues. LIGHTS in collaboration with its knowledge partner Geography and You magazine has organised several seminars and conferences. The most famous event titled – ‘International Conference on Science and Geopolitics of Arctic – Antarctic – Himalaya (SaGAAH)’ has been conducted three times. Apart from SaGAAH, LIGHTS Research foundation has organised Data Users Seminar (DUS) based on Geographical Information Systems (GIS) training in Delhi, Dehradun, Ajmer, Nagpur, Tirupati, Mysore and Guwahati. Since 2011, each year LIGHTS conducts Earth Day which is sponsored by Ministry of Earth Sciences (MoES). Under this event, several schools are invited to participate in activities such as poster making, slogan making and painting competitions. Prizes are then distributed under primary, junior and senior categories. In March 2010, LIGHTS organised a conclave titled – ‘Delhi Round Table Conclave’. This programme was funded by Ministry of Earth Sciences, National Disaster Management Authority, National Institute of Ocean Technology, Port of Chennai, Indian National for Ocean Information Services and National Centre for Antarctic and Ocean Research. The conclave aimed to highlight the impact of Climate Change on Ocean & Sea Around India for a Cross Section of Intellectuals, Scientists, Media Persons, School/College Teacher and Meritorious Students. Apart from conducting such events, LIGHTS has developed Girl Child Scholarship and Old Age Rehabilitation Schemes. LIGHTS provide scholarships to girl-children in need for support to prevent them from leaving school due to poor income of parents so that they can attain a minimum educational standard. This programme has already been initiated in the government schools of Bihar. From April 2006 to March 2008, Ms. Khushboo received scholarship of INR 200 each month till she appeared for her 10th standard board examinations. From April 2008 to March 2010, Ms. Ranju Kumari received scholarship of INR 200 each month till she appeared for her 10th board examinations. Old Age Rehabilitation Scheme was propose to help old / retired people to lead a protected and better life after retirement by way of arranging employment (those who are fit to work.

Name: Indian Academy for Self Employed Women
Major_Activities1: The Indian Academy for Self Employed Women (IASEW) or SEWA Academy is a sister organisation of SEWA (Self Employed Women’s Association) based in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India. Initiated by SEWA as an activity in 1991, IASEW got registered as an autonomous charity trust in 2005 and has been since trying to make itself sustainable. IASEW is the focal point for all of training, capacity-building, research and communication efforts. IASEW functions as our members’ “university”, introducing the poor informal sector women to formal learning environment. IASEW primary objective is to take the poor informal sector women’s movement forward. It does this in four ways - through training and capacity-building, action-oriented research focusing on poor women members, and by building strong communication channels, within the organization as well as with the outside world. 1. Training; IASEW’s trainings are driven by the core belief that everyone has potential and ability. The training programmes are a collective approach to overall development of women and the capacity- building programmes cut across all the requirements. The programmes help to develop women’s self-esteem, confidence and leadership skills. The expertise from SEWA’s sister organizations, which are autonomous but integrated, enriches the training programmes and vice versa. 2. Research; IASEW has been involved in research related work since the inception of SEWA in 1972. Thus, IASEW’s Research division was setup in the year 1991. The research conducted at IASEW always had its focus on the poor self employed, on their present living conditions, challenges and struggles. Ours is an action-oriented approach to make an impact at the policy level. 3. Literacy; The women participating in trainings provided by IASEW were both literate and illiterate, from different areas of city and villages. The illiterate women said: ‘We would like to study’! The enthusiasm led to the initiation of Literacy Classes in 1992. The members sought education, which was easy to understand and which would help them in life. Mobile Van: The Mobile Van was started on 3 October 2009. Equipped with video, CDs on issues related to poor informal sector, and Megaphone, the Mobile Van visits the people in their neighbourhoods and arranges replays of video and radio. Library: Libraries have been set up in working class areas. This was initiated from February 2003. Akashganga Club: Akashganga is a magazine for young girls, initiated by IASEW. The variety of activities undertaken by the club are story-telling, hygiene education, adolescent fairs, stage shows, sports day and cultural programmes, festival related programmes, fancy dress competition, exposure trips to science city, and Gandhi ashram. Cultural Programmes: Cultural programmes are organized to present the talent of community women and girls. 4. Communication; Communication plays a very crucial role in the lives of poor women workers. There is a great need for communication, between self employed women, and between them and the public, policy planners, and other government officials. The different print media of communication are Anasooya, Akashganga, E-newsletter, and electronic media of communication are Video SEWA and Rudi no Radio.
